text: I had contact with an e-mail sexologist. He read em on the website sexologist.org.pl that you can ask an individual question to a sexologist by e-mail . After three days, he received em to explain the disturbing topics, and then for additional questions in the second e-mail . It was for one fee but not for the doctor, only the account of Anna Dymna Foundation for the disabled. We had to pay SAMEMU and send evidence to the doctor. I did not meet them on the Internet so that a sexologist would do the job and the "cash" would go to a Christian target. In view of the frequent human rapacity, this must be given. I don't need a sexologist anymore, because I've only had a few news items. The sexologist did not have the tendency to "create a patient" but reassured me. I think it is worth recommending a doctor with social characteristics, working also selflessly.

I am almost 3 weeks after the ear correction procedure. Treatment in an extremely pleasant atmosphere (I note that all kinds of knocking and picking in the body I usually hysterically endure). Mr. Doctor and the nurse are talking, not thinking at all about what's happening. The anesthesia without much excitement (the dentist is worse), you just have to get used to the strange sounds right behind your ear. After the procedure itself, you will have two days of nervous sleep in the back: ) There is something that hurts (everyone has a different tolerance for pain), but some "ordinary" painkillers are enough. It hurts a little bit, just like when you predict the ears. The Doctor answers all the questions and explains everything patiently, even after three times, if necessary, because a man under stress sometimes does not record the first message. After removing the stitches and ventilating the ears you can start a new life, which I warmly recommend. I know that for the final effect you have to wait a little bit longer (the ears a little "go away" from the head, because until then they are very glued to it, the wound will heal for several more weeks). but you can see that it's worth it. In my life I have not watched so many tutorials with hair pinning, because after 30 years I can finally tie them up and go out to people. With a clear conscience I recommend dr . Hungarians.

She noted that Polpharma is also a beneficiary of several grants awarded by the National Centre for Research and Development. "The effectiveness in reaching out in an ambitious and difficult grant procedure is also a proof that our companies will be able to compete with Western European companies" - she added. She pointed out that "Poland is increasingly often chosen by global biotechnology players due to the quality of its employees, IT specialists and biotechnologists. During the briefing the old man jokingly admitted that "it's a bit crazy, what the company is planning" . The company informed that so far, it has spent about $1.5 billion on investments in the biotechnology sector. PLN 700 million. In the following years it plans to spend on the development of products as well as research and production infrastructure. 1, 3 billion PLN . The company's total investments of PLN 2 billion in the biotechnology sector by 2022 are to enable the creation of approx. 800 jobs and contribute to the development of the Polish knowledge-based economy .

It's the second time I've come to the same place: ) great peaceful climate and breathtaking views from the balconies: ) as far as getting to Zakopane by the guest house is concerned, there is a bus stop which goes to the centre of Zakopane and about 200 m in the other direction is PKL gubałówka. Of course, the bus is much cheaper: the only disadvantage is the lack of any shop but there is a place to eat, walk. I recommend ; )

"As we know, there are still no proper drugs against neurodegenerative diseases. However, it is believed that the possible aim of these drugs would be precisely protein quality control systems," states Dr. Pokrzywa. Potential therapies could, for example, stimulate the activity of quality control systems or help them to quickly find and precisely remove damaged proteins, which should not be in the cell at a given time. However, before this happens, we first need to understand the process of protein degradation. Among other things, this is what the research group led by Wojciech Pokrywa is doing. Thanks to a grant recently awarded by the European Organisation for Molecular Biology (EMBO), they are investigating how quality control systems recognise proteins that should be degraded.

Hotel in the city center . Very tight underground parking . For larger cars there is a general parking lot in the courtyard, unfortunately, in the evening there are no places. The hotel is located on the 1st floor of the building. On the ground floor there is a restaurant . In the attic, probably on the 3rd or 4th floor there are 3 more apartments. But to luxury they are far away. The hotel room is narrow and high. The window overlooks the wall of the building and the car park. But there is no noise from the street. The decor is modest. A little sad. There is a table, a kettle, instant coffee, tea. Two chairs. Pretty comfortable bed. I lived in a 2-person room alone. When the water in the next room was turned off, the pipes were hissing terribly. Through the door to the hallway, you could hear everything from the outside. A phone call at the reception desk, guest calls at the elevator and unbearable morning loud comments from the cleaning staff. At the reception desk the ladies had a rallying point unfortunately. In the rooms next door it's terribly disturbing. Breakfast is modest but sufficient. Tasty weddings, cheese. Hot steamers, scrambled eggs, pasta with vegetables. But we got a sour vegetable salad and omelette with completely burnt black vegetable stuffing. The staff try to be very helpful. Although the arrangements with one shift at the reception are not sustained by another shift. I'll look for another hotel next time.

A couple of years ago, the doctor was treating me. Undoubtedly, she has a lot of knowledge in her field, but the approach to the patient is shameful. At first she thought that maybe the doctor has a bad day - it happens. Unfortunately, after a few meetings she convinced me that this disrespectful treatment is the norm. No respect for the patient (while doing the allergic tests she came up with the idea that this is a good time to improve her makeup - she started to paint herself with lipstick by the mirror in my presence! ) . During the visits she did not feel listened to me, but rather completely ignored. Arrogant, for a penny of feeling and culture. Apart from that she gets very easily angry with ordinary questions and answers in a malicious way. The contact with this lady was the worst meeting with a doctor in my life. I sincerely advise against it! She used the services of Medicover .

Massacre from beginning to end: 1) no cosmetics in the bathroom 2) 700 people at breakfast and 2 coffee machines ( queue for 20 minutes ) 3) reception " dead " . Nobody answers the phones, you can ask, threaten, as a result nothing works, nobody can anything 4) in the " 5 star " hotel we have an empty bar in the room. As a result you can't even drink water, which is standard for a hotel. . . 5 ) the question why this is so is only one answer: we know that it is like this. . . 6 ) the waste of time for the next point . . . To sum up, as it is emphasized at the reception desk, the prices are SHERATON from Sopot and standards from Ustka . Write out paint, Polish galimatias in the worst edition . But it all depends on what you like anyway. . . I like an honest approach to the customer. Here we got 'em service at 2 stars, and they paid us for 5 stars. The advantages are also: parking for 30 zloty a day (added to the price of the room, apartment) and a large swimming pool ; - )

The doctor is rude and seems offended. But that is the least of the problems. Misdiagnoses, treatment completely misguided . On Wednesday and Friday - according to the doctor - "nothing can be heard, nothing can be seen" - so lipomalous and patting. And on Saturday afternoon the child is taken to the hospital with high temperature of congestion and dyspnea - diagnosis: acute pneumonia, acute bronchitis with obstruction, acute bilateral ear infections with purulent exudate! ! ! The doctors in the hospital could not believe that the day before that the child was in a pediatrician! ! !

A very pleasant place worth recommending . The impression on the entrance itself is made by the hotel interior. I'll probably come back here. Near the old town where you can go for a walk and full of pubs and restaurants around. It's just a pity that the hotel bar was closed so quickly and a few guests were still sitting.

I definitely do NOT recommend it. For a period of 2 months we left more than 3 thousand zlotys for a series of completely unnecessary studies, all the time I heard that my pregnancy is in danger and that he is saving my child - quote here: before natural selection. As he told me that the bacterium that I have is deadly, something has been in my head and thanks to the help of a kind person we found another doctor - Tomasz Lipinski, who I highly recommend. Generally it's not about the money, but about all the fear and the medicine we've been through, not knowing what really happens to the little one. I recommend helpful, nice, student friendly, no problem, you can easily pass the ppl making cards (you can take a little jerk off) usually the basic concepts of the instruction nothing fancy

It's a nice hotel without a bump. The stay with 2 children was very successful. The hotel is very well located - access to the beach through the forest, close by. To the center of the town ok . 20 minutes walk. The food is very good, but not many suggestions for vegan. The swimming pool and the spa centre were very good for both children and adults. A bit of a poor playroom, but there was a pool with balls, so we do not complain. There are 2 disadvantages when leaving with the children: No outdoor playground and no lunches, you have to wait until 5 pm for lunch and you had to do some combination with the kids. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend Dr. . Ruins. . . Lured by the internet star rating from the beginning, she did not have such confidence and this awareness that she came to the doctor who will listen to me and help with my ailments. Unfortunately, my intuition worked out 100% despite my sincere desire. A visit is expensive because 200 zloty for 5 minutes of conversation is absurd for me. A quick, superficial diagnosis would seem to be the same cure for everything and everyone suffers from the same thing. At least in my eyes the diagnosis also depends largely on the initial interview with the patient. At least then you know what is going on, for example, or what has been messed up in my case. She paid m 200 zl for the drugs. . And nothing helped or even worsened my physical and mental condition. Unfortunately, I can't recommend this gentleman, but maybe it is me who is special or this situation just happened to me. . . For a wrong diagnosis, high price of the visit and the assigned drugs, not counting the white deer and for suffering for 2 weeks and worsening of the skin condition. Greetings to the Dog. Dr. is very nice - in plus .

Not looking at the price of the set is ok but the prices went very sharply. When you spill on the floor it is a Tiny handful of bricks of which 90% are standard LEGO bricks. The set is not worth the price . 80% of the cost of the bricks is a license paid for Disney . Licenses + taxes . This set in the USA $79 but already in England £99 in Poland almost £500 . This applies to all sets with LEGO STAR WARS from the new series - for a few bricks and a license we pay 350 - 600 PLN . Not too big but only for small / medium sets. The problem is that children want it . The BB8 robot figurine itself, consisting of TWO ! Bricks cost 22 pounds outside the set and in Poland 120 PLN . Paranoia . Basket of an ordinary lego figurine is about 12 . The cost of people from the old Star Wars series is about 20 - 25 PLN . And Kylo Ren from the new series is 100 PLN (small man of the lego with a sword) . I am sorry that we pay so much for the license. Full grazing large set of LEGO firehouse with two fire trucks, people and buildings costs half the price of a modest set of Star Wars from the new series.

Scientists have pointed out the effects of cannabidiol in the treatment of epilepsy. Vice President of the Polish Academy of Sciences, Pharmacologist Prof . Stanisław Czuczwar noticed that cannabidiol has practically no addictive effect and has no psychotic effects. "Spicing cannabidiol + mouth + marijuana makes no sense," he said. Czuczwar referred to studies on the use of cannabidiol as a supplement to antiepileptic drugs in children and adolescents with drug-resistant epilepsy: " 44% of the patients surveyed reacted at least by reducing the number of seizures by 50% . " . In his opinion this is a very good result . However, he pointed out that the tests that have been carried out so far were small - they were carried out on several dozen patients and the tests lasted only a few months. Meanwhile, in the case of epilepsy drugs, long-term effects are very important. And in this respect the tests have not yet been conducted. Prof . Jerzy Vetulani from the Institute of Pharmacology of the Polish Academy of Sciences in Krakow pointed out that due to social phobias, objective, large-scale research on the therapeutic effects of cannabis is very difficult to carry out. "I cannot find an ethics committee in most countries that would agree that 3,000 people could regularly receive drugs for two to three months (marijuana-based, PAP)," said the researcher.

The building is beautiful, magnificent, located on a pedestrian promenade right next to the park. Unfortunately, terribly neglected and fatally managed . Everything to renovate and replace! In the room a TV set from the eighties of the last century . The swimming pool too, and already access to it and the cloakroom complex makes you feel like in a hospital and not in a hotel. . . The only plus is the cleanliness

The main prize and first place for the representatives of the foreign medical centre was awarded by the Society of American Military Orthopaedists for the first time in its 58th year of history," stressed SOMOS chairman Lt. Mark Slabaugh at Friday's meeting. The work of the Polish people was one of the approx. The work of Poles was one of approximately 40 evaluated in the annual competition. During the press conference WIM representatives emphasized that the conference participants were mainly specialists from the USA and guests from leading orthopaedic centres in Canada, Norway, Israel and Great Britain. The participation of Poles in the conference allowed them to establish direct contacts with representatives of similar medical centres - including Walter Reed Centre in Washington, D.C., Central Air Medicine Centre in Colorado Springs (USA) and Central Military Hospital in Trondheim (Norway) .

While visiting Kazimierz Dolny decided to stay with their family not in a hotel but in a country cottage. The choice fell on Zagrodowa Osada in Uściąż (5 km from Kazimierz Dolny). Typical rural climate, away from the noise of the "town" where children can commune with nature, feed animals (rabbits, ducks), play with cats, dogs and ride a horse. I recommend learning horseback riding, the owner has a lot of patience and devotes a lot of time. prices very reasonable (25 zł / half an hour) owner, passionate, very nice and helpful woman. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Very good, nutritious country breakfast. Definitely recommend for a short trip to Kazimierz. If you stay longer, a little bored. . . . .but, well, we are in the countryside. . . . . .a happy village, a peaceful village. . . . . .

They booked us a room for a Saturday/Sunday night. Unfortunately, no one informed us that we would be having a wedding. I was. We didn't sleep the whole night. We arrived after a 300 km trip to a place about. 21 . 00, so there was no chance of us withdrawing from the accommodation proposal. The next day, the driver took part in the competition. And then another 300 kilometers home. A tragic weekend. And it was supposed to be so beautiful. Besides, a room without air conditioning. With the window closed, you can suffocate yourself, and when we opened the window, there was a car "refrigerator with catering" just below us. so some kind of aggregate would turn on and off. When we went to see the beach, we suddenly felt a terrible stink. When we went down to the beach, there was a TOYTOYE (probably not cleaned for a long time). A nightmare. And one more thing, ambiguous information about the room rate - different information from two different people working at the reception. Of course I have a lesson to learn that everything should be confirmed, at least by email.

The Polish Working Party on Human Rights . The Polish Working Group on Ethical Problems for the End of Life is a permanent team of specialists in ethics, medicine and law. The Group has been operating in a constantly changing composition since 2008 and takes initiatives aimed at introducing legal regulations and standards of conduct in the area of care for people at the end of life. Its members are experienced ethicists, philosophers, doctors, lawyers and theologians, both practitioners and academic and teaching staff of universities, who meet during regular seminars. The works presenting the project of the medical proxy institution have been published in the "Polish Archives of Internal Medicine" vol . 126 ( 2016 ) 5 , s . 313 - 320 . ) and in " Practical Medicine " No. 330 ( 2016 ) 5 . s . 102 - 111 . ) .

She used the hotel for the second time with the promotion of the price of accommodation - 39 or 49 PLN. I think that then the price is adequate to the quality. However, right from the beginning I have to mention that the whole hotel is 'squeaking'. It's like the sound of old CRT TVs or some smartphone apps that are used to produce high-frequency annoying sounds for the ears. This sound is steady with second intervals, I don't know if it's any air conditioning or any fire protection but unfortunately it's very annoying to the ears. From the plus point of view I can replace a pretty big bed, roller blinds blocking the window, so you can get some more sleep in the morning and various lights. The maids clean the room every day and change the bed linen With some worse things, as for me cushions are not cushions but something rectangular and la cushions are not sleeping, a little support is needed ; - ) The table underneath the TV is a little tiny, but it's fine. It's a shame that there's only one outlet next to the TV. There is also no bigger wardrobe or even a shelf to put things on. The shower is coeducational, i.e. transparent, completely basic but sufficient. It is also a pity that the towel is only one per person. For the price of 50 PLN it is a really affordable option not far from the center, so if I have to appear there again, I will definitely do it ; - )

The access is very poor, far from the city centre. There are no plates informing about room numbers in the building. The rooms are dirty, cobwebs, plaster falling off, stains on the walls, balcony door broken (they stick on one hinge), no hot water at night, fungal showers. In a bowling alley, slats on tracks fall off, very little space, ping-pong pallets are the same planks. . . . a billiard set is also not complete, in the pool ice water, in the jacuzzi there were only jets in 2 places, ceilings in the corridor in the recreation area glued on a grey tape! ! The restaurant is not adapted for the disabled. The owners are focused on the cash register, make the stay difficult, do not invest in the object. For everything you have to pay extra, we waited for an hour until someone comes to light a bonfire - finally came the lady who announced that she can not do it. . . . I DO NOT RECOMMEND IT!

In one fell swoop 43 hotels with 5,400 rooms operating under the Grand City Hotel brand in Germany, Belgium and the Netherlands will take over the brands belonging to the Wyndham Hotel Group ( WHG ), the largest hotel group in the world in terms of the number of facilities (not rooms!). Under the partnership agreement concluded between Grand City Hotel ( GCH ), the second largest hotel management company in Germany, and WHG, as many as 43 hotels, out of 120 GCH portico facilities, will adopt the brands of the American group. The Wyndham Grand brand will be taken over by 5 hotels, Wyndham 3 hotels, Wyndham Garden 10 hotels, TRYP by Wyndham 17 hotels and Days Inn 8 hotels. 33 hotels will be rebranded by 1 March 2013. and the rest in the next two years.

Perfectly designed and constructed object! Simply divine design and for that reason I will come here again. Besides, great food served in a beautiful restaurant, excellent spa and fantastic service. Prices for accommodation in such a place seem ridiculously low!

As for a hotel taking about 700 pln for an overnight stay in the season, the gym is neglected. Nice service, but what if a lot of the equipment "drifted" . They work, but in this class of hotel, should be better. Look at the pictures. Next note: I bought a pass for 10 entries ( weekly stay ) mainly because they started with 8. 00, unfortunately, after the weekend, I was informed that they will only be open from 9 . 00 , not nice ! Besides, there is only one air conditioning system, I think the central air conditioning system is either too expensive or not working. Such a grandfathering, and room prices, as per location, are high. No straight back muscle training bench.

When I first stopped there, I had some concerns about the quality of this facility. When you enter a room, it turns out that the rooms are not inferior to very good * * * hotels . I highly recommend Mrs. Dr. Jędrzejczak as a good professional and at the same time a nice and kind person for the patient. After several dozen years of struggling with diseases, my father accidentally came to her and finally started to be properly treated. It is only a pity that so late, because many of the lesions could not be reversed, and those sick years, the stress and struggle - sometimes for life - can no longer be erased from his memory. And it's a pity that my mother didn't live to see it anymore, because those years of worries and care for her father probably shortened her life. For almost 6 years I went to various doctors with my ailments which were becoming more and more serious and everyone was spreading their hands. She experienced a lot of annoyance and even humiliation in doctors' offices, when I was already treated as a bully or a person with mental problems, they shouted at me and got rid of me. She spent quite a lot of money on private visits, paid examinations. One visit to Dr. Jędrzejczak and a thorough interview (how important it is for the doctor to listen to the patient and, of course, to have knowledge) were enough. She was referred for a few examinations and that was enough to find the cause of my ailments. Why didn't any of the doctors think about it before? There was no willingness or knowledge? ? ? I don't know. The most important thing is that I'm finally being treated properly. That would be so much from me about Dr. Jędrzejczak. And one more thing: I don't know how the ward, which is headed by the doctor. Because I'm not interested in it and that's not what this site is about. We judge the doctor here, and I judge that very well.

The visit went quite smoothly, the doctor checked the results of the tests, made a factual interview and determined the treatment. In addition, the doctor recommended that the tests be carried out without a referral (a referral from the doctor is required to perform the test), although during the visit it was suggested to me. Currently the contact with the doctor is quite limited and I do not know if he will give me a referral for the tests he recommended me to do without an appointment for a paid visit. From this point of view it looks weak. Greetings Matthew

This facility has the best times behind it. The rooms definitely need refreshing . The cleanliness was not perfect but it was possible to survive. The hotel is worth attention because of its attractive price, but the standard leaves much to be desired. Apparently it is WiFi but I have not managed to connect. Noteworthy are very good breakfasts in this class.

It is true that she is a very nice and tactful woman who explains everything thoroughly and answers every question. In the beginning she was very pleased with me, but she stopped going to her because with each subsequent visit she felt more and more disposed of me. My visit (I will mention that always private, for which she paid me as for a normal visit) lasted 5 minutes and consisted of writing a prescription. . . The doctor didn't do anything to me and it was like that from 3 visits in a row. I don't think this is how a visit should look like even for a fund, let alone when you pay a lot of money for it. I was very disappointed with it. . . .

An ordinary seaside resort. Although the website is professionally made, the resort itself does not delight. Standard rooms, nicely furnished but very small. For two people it may be, but for a family with a child it is definitely too cramped. Once you have unfolded the armchair on which the third person sleeps, you cannot open the balcony door, so you have to fold the armchair to the balcony during the day. Smoking on balconies is forbidden - a fine of 100 PLN. The water in the warm bathroom, if someone likes it more than warm, it will simply freeze in the shower. There are no kettles in the rooms and you cannot have your own, because of the electrical installation - words of the receptionist. Room card (key) only one and you can't get another one. The food is very good, very large selection of everything. Very nice ladies waitresses and very nice cleaning ladies. Dinner consisting of two dishes, served to the table. It is not possible to exchange for another dish - if there are served, for example, offal, it is not possible to exchange for anything else. If you don't like something, you just don't eat your dinner - that's the solution of the receptionist, with whom I talked about it. Your receptionist absolutely requires training in the culture of guest service, and the importance of the reception - the business card of the hotel / facility. I recommend to the owner. A playground with modest, dirty sand in the sandbox. High stairs to the beach . To sum up - as I wrote at the beginning - an ordinary small resort. The price was overstated in relation to the quality of services provided, I will certainly not return there. Generally I do not recommend .

He only met him yesterday. My first intuition was. . : The calendar of rates and availability, as well as the methodology of their introduction have definitely changed. Interestingly, there is no longer any Booking Button functionality available, which played the role of a booking engine for the hotel website. All the more so because recently it was possible to use it without paying any commission. This is where the answer can be the Booking Suite introduced on 5 January by the giant owned by Priceline . It was created on the basis of a previously purchased interactive agency for buuteeq hotels. It provided hotels with comprehensive digtial marketing and e-commerce solutions: website, booking engine, channel manager, advertising campaigns. In a word, everything related to the presence of hotels in the Internet.

A doctor thrown into the poor framework of Polish health care . TOTAL LACK OF VOCATION ! ! ! ! LACK OF SENSITIVITY . The hotel is perfect for me and my 14-year-old son. A lot of attractions, it is hard to get bored - we visited the zoo, sealarium, rope park, Blucher bunkers in Ustka - all in a holiday package! A pleasant, quiet and clean room with a view of the park - a revelation! Excellent food. Bowling, ping-pong, unlimited access to the pool. Excellent treatments and massages. Also noteworthy is the discreet and extremely helpful service. We have not missed anything, total relaxation and wonderful time spent with the child. Recommended for families with children. But it is also an object with a rock claw - the stars performing here are world-famous, min . Santana or ZZ TOP etc. Amphitheatre is impressive. So it is worthwhile to get interested in the offer of the hotel, and even more - just go to the Charlotte Valley. I recommend it warmly, with a clear conscience: )

10 years ago, Franke bought 'em a sink. Looks almost the same. The old model has more extended chambers and the triggers are not centrally placed . After experience with the previous sink, now they bought the same sink too . Unfortunately, we were very disappointed. They do not write this in the information, but this sink has no overflow hole and it is not possible to close the second sink with a plug! ! ! There is only a strainer. The whole thing is clearly devastating compared to the previous one. One only plug also has a changed construction and I do not believe that it will last as much as the old one.

I have many reservations about Dr. Turowska. She does not devote too much time to her patients, during the visit she receives private phone calls, she is unpleasant and sometimes biting. One can get the impression that she treats women from above. In case of complications she will not give detailed information on her own, you have to ask her questions or leave her office with uncertainty and fears. The proof that she does not take her patients seriously is the fact that nobody was willing to inform me that on the day she was scheduled to visit me, Dr. Turowska would not be able to reach Yelenia on time because of the conference - supposedly she could not reach Yelenia on time because the "train was delayed" (I doubt that with such charges for a private visit Mrs. Turowska travels by train. . . ) As a result, she wasted my time unnecessarily to go twice for a visit / Well, despite everything that she wrote to me, I have to admit that, anyway, Dr. Turowska is an expert and her recommendations have always been effective. However, the discomfort she felt in her presence made her resign from her services in the 7th month of pregnancy.

The hotel should be called a failure. The room we got so terrible that I had to pay 100 euros for the change and also on the same quality but from the side of the beach with a nice garden, previously the employees lived in these rooms so it proves something, food so bad that my daughter ate all 9 days in town, the only plus is a lady smiling in the bar All Inclusiv, generally German geriatrics and Russian kindergarten, Sozopol charming, especially the old town but small and neglected, view from the terrace beautiful but medium swimming pool. If this is one of the better hotels then I wouldn't want to see the worse ones, in Sunny Beach much better standard. We've been to Sunny Beach a couple of times and it's the worst trip. I know, I know, I know someone would say cheap and in general it's only Bulgaria but in other places it's better and besides, not so cheap at all, I would rather say expensive. I guess it's okay, but it's "but." First, what I did not like: - For breakfast instead of juices, artificially sweetened drinks are served, - handling a little stiff as if someone nonstop looking at their hands, - in the windows very blowing which does not give you sleep. And now what I liked: - despite the small size of the mattress was comfortable and I slept well, - delicious food, salad Caesar world championship - very pleasant bathrooms - despite everything, service on a very good level. Will I come back? Just for the salad, but for sure.

Within a dozen or so months from the end of Euro 2012 the number of accommodation facilities put up for sale may increase by at least half. In the extreme scenario, up to 250 - 300 currently offered may be joined by the second number. It all depends on the state of the Polish economy, i.e. the domestic demand for accommodation, the pace of transactions concluded or the withdrawal of offers for sale of facilities, and then on a possible increase in the number of foreign tourists. Among the sales offers present on the market, uncategorized facilities with up to 30 rooms at a price lower than PLN 5 million dominate. An operating and fully equipped several-room guesthouse can be purchased for several hundred thousand zlotys.

I sincerely recommend ! Mrs. Kasia creates a great, warm atmosphere in which you can easily throw everything out of yourself and not be afraid to be judged or instructed. An oasis of peace, compassion and wisdom - she can listen for a dozen or so minutes just to briefly sum up the patient's outburst in two or three sentences, let her understand that she understands and "feels" what's going on, and then, in the next sentence, pay attention to things that immediately stimulate thinking and change. Similarly, based on thousands of collected data, the platform will operate. Researchers will be asking for research in a particular area, and the provider of information, i.e. medical data, can be anyone. If they want to provide them, they will be able to choose the scientific project they want to support. The platform will be connected to it via e.g. a smartphone, smartphone or smart wristband. With the user's consent and for the selected period of time, the system will record the body's work (heartbeat, number of steps taken, sleep quality, glucose level, etc.). ) and you will receive a fee for providing your data. Examples of benefits, which may be brought by the platform in a long-term perspective by its creators include e.g. prediction of asthma attack when going to a specific region (and thus taking preventive actions), detection of heart defect or prediction of sugar or other substances in the body. They also include studies of the efficacy of given drugs or therapies, e.g. by comparing health data before and after the initiation of the therapy. A potential benefit in the future could be a reduction in health care costs.

One of the few doctors who deserves a positive entry on this page. A competent cardiologist , specialist not only in his field of rhythm disorders and ablation , trustworthy and above all committed to what he does . I was referred to a doctor when I was diagnosed with a congenital electrical impulse conduction disorder "WPW" at the age of 46. She was terrified to read on the internet about the ablation which I was directed to, all the more so because my WPW was appearing and disappearing, which meant that the procedure would not bring a positive outcome. From the moment of the first visit to the procedure she did not feel any fear of performing the ablation and eliminating the defect in my heart, because the doctor with his confidence in the strength of his skills gave me a sense of security and faith that I am in good hands. I recommend the doctor to all patients who have ablation before them because every patient deserves a good, trustworthy doctor. I recommend

In addition to the typical cavities, I treated the doctor's tooth with root canal. It turned out that I had a very long one root and the task was difficult. This guy is really passionate and you can see that this is his vocation. I'm also a specialist, only in another profession, so the specialist will immediately recognize it :) You can ask for everything and even watch something under a microscope. I sincerely recommend : )

I recommend the Podklasztorze Hotel as a place for both family recreation and corporate events. On September 12th I had the pleasure to participate in a company event organized in this hotel. He bought 'em two pieces ( one for a colleague ) from an official distributor. The two new alcohol machines measured incorrectly: one or even two beers each indicated 0 . 0 . As for the condition of the hotel itself : 3 / 5 - most of the metal / chrome elements in both the room and the pool is rusty - it takes the charm away from the whole place - loudspeakers on the pool with a mushroom - fuck, but as I pointed out to 'em from the moment I entered the pool, I don't know where the eyes of the people who manage the building have - a small canteen - but it's nice, quiet and cozy As for the food : 3 / 5 - no drinks for lunch - indescribable food - found 'em food piers in cereal at breakfast . . . Planned stay in this hotel with friends was pleasant until we came to check out. They booked us in the hotel two suites, making the reservation chose 2 adults and 2 children, the number of such suites two, which gives us a total of 4 adults and 4 children, unfortunately, as it turned out that the reservation system divided people so that in one suite included two adults, in the other two children and the other people were not visible in the reservation. What's more funny, since the other people were not included in the reservation, why the price of both apartments was the same for both two and four people. The hotel manager said I was right that the system made a mistake and should include 2 adults and 2 children in each room but it happened differently and she has no influence on it and thus we have to pay 900 PLN for the lack of people in the reservation. It is also surprising that on the day of arrival no one noticed that more people arrived than in the reservation. I understand that there are errors in the room reservation systems and so it was this time, however, expected em from a 5 star hotel to do things differently and not to charge guests not a small amount of money by system error. The hotel only loses customers and I have just become one of those customers.

The hotel is not the latest, but you can see that it is well maintained and refurbished. It is located on the main street in Alanya, very close to all sorts of cafes and bars, 7 minutes to the train which takes you to the hill where the ruins of the castle are located, very popular with tourists and one of the popular caves of Damlataş. The hotel is also located on Cleopatra beach (the most popular beach on the Turkish riviera). The rooms are not too big, but everyone has air conditioning, which can be easily controlled. The rooms are cleaned daily. Balcony with sea view room . As for the meals, everything was fresh, varied products for breakfast, dinner rich in various local meals (She was there with her husband, who comes from Turkey, said that the cooks cook very regional dishes belonging to this place. ALL FURNITURE! I'm writing this because the knife in my pocket opened when she read my previous reviews of the food, I suspect the guests were expecting caviar and gold for a small price. The staff is nice, the manager at the reception desk is friendly, he will help you with advice, he will give you a hint, the gentleman taking care of the pool bar is very nice, speaking 3 languages, with great care for the guests. The hotel's swimming pool is clean, separated for smaller children. The hotel had its own sun loungers on the beach, which could be rented for only 10TL or less than 10zl for the whole day, as well as a friendly staff taking care of the loungers and guests. The only thing she could stick to is the fact that the fridge in the room cools very poorly, and finding a free deckchair by the pool in the morning borders on a miracle because some guests leave their things there to take care of the deckchair at a later time, and sometimes even by the pool do not appear, but it is rather not the fault of the hotel and the mentality of some guests. The overall rating is 6, cheap, the hotel is well looked after, the food is good, the service is nice, the location is great. WE RECOMMEND

Initially I was satisfied with the visits to the doctor's office, but the last visit makes me look for another gynaecologist. There's only one way to describe it - it was OSZUST AND STRIKE I went to him for almost two years on laser hair removal - when after that time she decided that there was no effect - he first told me to do a testosterone test (which I already thought was nonsense - to ask why she didn't start with such a test - if the result was of any importance to success - he said , that he didn't want to expose me to additional costs without the need (testosterone test - 30 - 40 PLN - each visit to him 10 times more) the test showed a result at the lower end of the norm - to which the "doctor" changed the tone - and found that I guess I'm abnormal if I thought that he would guarantee me that there would be any effect. Mrs. Marta conducted the interview very carefully and meticulously. She expected me to discuss deeply what can cause chronic pain, but she didn't live to see me. The first impression is not the best because of the surroundings. Once you cross the threshold of the hotel is only better. The hotel stopped in the mid-1990s. It doesn't care about the client, it has five problems, it's not a front to the client. Nice atmosphere, quiet and clean. Very close to the nearby office buildings, so a perfect place for people on a business trip. Also close to the airport. However, I think that you can recommend this place for those looking for a quick accommodation in the delegation or on a journey through Warsaw airport.

Clark Griswold, the inventor of food additives, is going on holiday with his wife Ellen and two children. His destination is the World theme park in California. The first trouble begins when Clark just after picking up his car from the agency causes an accident. Then an avalanche of disasters begins. On their way to the holiday they decide to visit Clark's cousin Eddie. The Griswolds leave the host with an extra passenger, Aunt Edna, to be taken to Arizona. When Aunt Edna dies, the Griswolds decide to take her to Arizona anyway. When the family arrives in California after many adventures, the park is closed. A great comedy, lots of laughter and funny moments.

Among the co-financed projects there are undertakings from the area of cardiology, oncology, neurology, as well as regenerative medicine, which gives hope for a real use of, among others, stem cells in treatment. The list of winners also includes projects in which telemedical technologies are used to diagnose remote patients. "Modern diagnostics and medical therapy are interdisciplinary in nature. The competition is an example of combining classical medicine with biotechnology and engineering . We expect that as a result of the implementation of the Strategmed programme, the international position of Poland in the field of scientific research and development works in cardiology and cardiosurgery, oncology, neurology and regenerative medicine will increase" - emphasizes the President of the NCRD Council, Prof . Jerzy Kątcki .

She was a patient of this lady for a few years. As far as one-time check-ups to a healthy person are concerned, I have no objections. It is worse if we have a problem, some ailment we have to deal with and we expect help, Dr Szymborska is not the best choice. For several months I have been struggling with a painful infection / inflammation and the visits have not brought any help, it has been a month and I have not been understood, it has not been explained to me what exactly is, what can be the cause and how the doctor can help me. At this point she changed my doctor because I still feel bad and want to be cured, and the next visit to your doctor would be a waste of time and money, not to mention your health. The atmosphere is not nice, it is not neutral either, after fasting it did not feel comfortable.

University Clinical Hospital is in good financial condition. As the director of this facility, Dr Bogusław Poniatowski, informed the hospital has no debts. However, the university and the director of the hospital are already thinking about the future financing of the hospital. It is known that after completion of the investment the current costs of its maintenance will significantly increase. The hospital hopes that the NFZ will take this into account in future contracts, because for the time being it is the Fund that is the main source of financing the hospital's activities. "For example, the new hospital building will need an annual amount of electricity equal to the needs of the approximately 20,000th district town" - emphasises Director Poniatowski . "Whereas the heating of the airstrip will cost about 150 PLN per hour" - added Vice-Rector Mariak .

As she evaluated, the project carried out in the hospital is conducive to the doctors' reflection on how to communicate with the patient. She emphasized that doctors may lack the knowledge about effective ways of communication, because in the process of education it is not a very emphasized aspect of doctor's work. "After our first meeting with linguists there was some resistance on the part of doctors to the fact that someone would call, judge what I say to the patient, maybe they were afraid of criticism. However, it is important to talk to the patient in such a way as to be satisfied, to get what he wanted out of the visit. My participation in this project has led me to be more patient, especially when dealing with the most difficult patients," she said.

The hotel is located about 150 m from the sandy and rocky beach (I recommend to take your shoes to the water), to the center of the village about. 2 km . Close to the supermarket where you can do shopping. The hotel itself is very nice and clean. Towels and bed linen changed daily, the food is very tasty and very much. Very good base for all fly fishing enthusiasts. . . .very nice people. She suggested that I have a very good opinion and signed up for a visit, unfortunately I am disappointed. It was my first visit, so she asked me to check up and tell me how to proceed with the treatment. She also mentioned to me that sometimes I feel a slight pain on one side. The doctor didn't check all my teeth, she just immediately took care of the treatment of the tooth, which according to the x-ray could hurt. At the end she made an appointment for another visit, because in her opinion the tooth next to it is suitable for quick treatment, "because you can see the caries with the naked eye". The next day I went to another dentist, where it turned out that the indicated tooth is not broken at all, only the filling is already old, but there is no caries, and possible pain may result from hypersensitivity. In addition, a general review was carried out with information on what should be cured, it was also proposed to remove the tartar, which is what Mrs. Makowska expected me to do, but she did not receive it. .

There's no green idea about hormones because I was hit by a strong medication on my thyroid, I was supposed to have hypothyroidism, now I have hyperthyroidism. I was upset with this doctor. First he complained about the fact that he had too many patients in the National Health Fund that day, then he resented me for not going to see a rheumatologist privately. Based on one result of the initial examination he told me with a smile that it is certainly a very serious disease that will in time cover all the systems in the body. He was not eager to explain in more detail or to dispel my doubts. Mr. Tomasz gave me a referral only for some of the tests, after which he ordered me to go to a POZ doctor because it does not pay off.

She stopped me in the comfort room. It's a nice room, although it's not some impressive size. The hotel is very cozy, everything is new and nicely maintained. The swimming pool is indeed tiny but well that is. The sauna and massage room is very much on top. Everything is maintained in exemplary cleanliness. There are beautiful views and tranquility all around. The service is helpful and smiling. Nice place for families and couples. I am very satisfied with my stay.

I share Dr. Agrawal's opinion that poor nutrition and stress are the greatest dangers to the body's organism, as I have found out by going on a proper diet and I can see that there are few doctors who holistically look at humans. Dr. Agrawal made a very good impression on me at the beginning because of her positive energy and peace of mind, and she was enthusiastic about her recommendations, she took care of my health because her diagnosis was very convincing. However, she convinced me once again to be sensible to treat such methods as well. Unfortunately, the doctor made a wrong diagnosis - excess estrogen, which she decided to confirm with blood tests. It turned out that my hormones are normal. If I hadn't checked it, today I would have been lubricated with ointment with progesterone written down by the Doctor, but why? I am also not convinced to recommend the so-called 'em - these are beneficial bacteria (with a mixture of herbs), and as you know, such bacteria are needed in the intestines, so they must first pass through the stomach. Drinking such a liquid with bacteria, whether they are able to survive in the stomach - rather poor chances so I prefer to take the current market symbiotics in special capsules. However, I can see very good effects after the Sunny concoction (olive oil, alocite, lemon) prescribed by the doctor. Natural methods of treatment are great - but girls, be careful, complement this knowledge with simple research and your own intuition. I guess she would be afraid to entrust me with leading the pregnancy with the Doctor, unless I have another doctor at the same time. Although I agree with many things, I think it's all too much responsibility, and most of all, the doctor, who calls himself holistic, doesn't pay enough attention to one thing. It's all too chaotic, although a noble goal.

I join the opinion of most of Dr. Bieniek's former / current clients who appreciate his craftsmanship and full professionalism. More than 2 years ago, my 7-year-old daughter had her dye marks removed by your doctor under local anesthesia. Good attitude of the doctor, professionally performed procedure, and now a nicely healed place. Today, again, my daughter was in the role of a patient, also with a mole, which was to be removed due to its progress (she did not previously have such a saturation with dye as now). As the scientist described, when the atherosclerotic plaque ruptures, a blocking blood vessel clotting occurs. "Our research has shown that oleacein effectively inhibits the inflammation that causes the breakdown of the atherosclerotic plaque. This is possible because oleacein can change the function of inflammatory macrophages - they start to secrete anti-inflammatory interleukin 10 . The plaque becomes stable - it does not crack. This is especially important for people with hypertension. Now there are about 9 million of them in Poland, in 2035 there may already be 16 million of them" - explained the professor in an interview with PAP . On 20 June this year Polish researchers received an American patent for the use of oleacein . Soon - as prof . Naruszewicz - a European and Polish patent is to be granted.

Mańka presented his achievement during the "Investing in Medical Innovations" congress in Katowice from Thursday to Friday. It is based on research conducted in Harvard in 2010. "It was a study on whether it is possible to create a model using a polymer which, if we grow lung cells on it and subject them to the forces that are actually present in the human lung, in the actual alveoli, will start behaving as if they were behaving in the human lung. It has been proven that this was the first time in history that a completely artificially designed and artificially functioning human organ was created," said the PAP during the congress.

For thousands of years the situation has changed, but insects remain on the menu of many people in the world. There are several reasons for this. "In some cases it's about a high sugar content. An example is the honey ants, which the Aborigines eat in large quantities. In addition, insects have a very high fat and protein content. Compared to meat, e.g. chicken, it is several times the value of what is found in poultry. Butterflies, beetles and even ordinary flies consist of 70 - 80% of protein," explained Dr. Jaskuła. In insects, a large concentration of various vitamins such as B and K vitamins is also important. "Imagine that e.g. in wasps there is a much higher concentration of vitamins than in some fruits. What, by the way, one of the Japanese emperors Hirohito knew very well, who ate them and had them baked in special cakes," he said.

There are two layers of microflora on the skin of the hands. The first one is the proper physiological one, which is with the human being permanently, this microflora multiplies in the folds of the skin, in the hair follicles, in the sebaceous and sweat glands and it is it that ensures the proper functioning of the skin. It should not be removed. It is different when we arrive in extreme conditions, other than average, e.g. in hospitals, then we remove it using fluids or disinfectants. The second group is the microflora, which we acquire through contact with the environment, it is for us + foreign +, if it will multiply it can cause infections. And it is this microflora that, if we do not wash our hands before preparing a meal, can lead to food poisoning.

Mirabelle fruits can be found at every step of the way - in home gardens, along highways, in ditches and also in wastelands. They contain vitamins B, E, folic acid, sugars, mineral salts and very valuable bioactive phytochemicals. However, they are the most undervalued and unused fruit in Poland. Until now, mirabelle seed oil, due to its high content of toxic cyanogenic compounds, has been used only for cosmetic purposes. However, scientists from the Department of Chemistry, Technology and Food Biotechnology at the Gdansk University of Technology have found a way to eliminate the unfavourable compounds and use the oil in the food industry. "They have developed a method to obtain from the nucleus of the seeds of this fruit food oil with a very pleasant taste and smell" - informs the Gdansk University of Technology on its website.

At the moment, the limitations of the laboratory make the method used by only 2 patients per month. Currently, a modern laboratory is being created, which is supposed to significantly increase the number of preparations. It is planned to apply a new technological line in the process of production of TREG cell preparation, which is a modification of the previous creative process. Under the so-called "fast path", financed by the National Centre for Research and Development (NCBR), researchers and entrepreneurs will check how the changed production line functions in this type of research and whether it will be possible to speed up or improve the method of preparation production. The laboratory currently under construction, with the highest possible purity class according to GMP criteria, entails the implementation of new technical solutions and the need to prepare a perfectly qualified team. The research is subsidized by NCRD and the total project budget amounts to PLN 6.9 million and PLN 9.8 million.

Since we don't like many low-calorie products, despite our sincere desire to persevere on a diet, we quickly become discouraged and as a result we don't want to eat them. Taste is the most important factor that determines our dietary choices. The team, in which Dr. Gładkowska-Balewicz works, wants to replace the fat contained in food products with gel, but in a form that will give the taste and characteristic fat texture. Such a gel "fat" would allow for real calorie savings. Its calorific value would be close to zero, while the real fat provides us with about 9 kcal per 1 gram of product. "We want to make the processed products healthier and less caloric, but we also try to ensure that the taste, texture and appearance of the product does not suffer. For example, we want to make the fat-free yoghurt taste and look the same as that with normal fat," explains the researcher.

These analyses show - claims the Polish specialist - that despite the regulation and special design of such studies, the direct benefit and risk of participating in phase I studies in paediatric oncology remains at the same level as in studies involving adults. "On average, ten out of every one hundred children participating in the study received an advantage (understood as the body's response to the drug, e.g. in the form of cancer tumour reduction). The study was carried out on the basis of the results of the Phase I study, including, in the case of solid tumors, on average only three in one hundred children included in the study, while in the case of leukaemia, almost thirty in one hundred children included in the study," emphasizes dr hab . Waligóra .

The survey - conducted by scientists from the Pomeranian Medical University in Szczecin - involved 718 patients, 84% of whom were smokers. As much as 60% of the respondents received information about bladder cancer and its correlation with smoking only from the doctor to whom they found themselves in connection with this disease. "Most smokers make big eyes when we tell them that smoking is not just a matter of lungs or heart. After all, all toxins, which are the products of tobacco burning, must be expelled from the body. They, after initial metabolism in the liver, are excreted with urine, so the same carcinogens can have mutagenic effects on our tissues in different parts of the body," - told PAP Dr. Artur Lemiński from the Department of Urology and Urological Oncology of the Pomeranian Medical University in Szczecin.

According to Maciej Ludwikowski, most of the hearing problems observed in children are time disorders associated with infections, but some of them, if untreated, lead to more permanent hearing damage. In some cases, after some time, it may even turn out that an operation or a procedure is necessary. A large group of these are untreated inflammations of the ears, another group is hearing loss caused by noise. Noise in school exceeds 100 dB - results from research conducted for 8 years in Warsaw primary schools by IFiPS. An ordinary conversation conducted outside the room, with noise around the interlocutors, is about 50 - 60 dB. We can feel comfort in the car at approx. 70 dB . Above - the volume starts to bother us.

Proteins, apart from their building function, also have a regulatory function, which means that they control all life processes. Their appropriate degradation is as important as synthesis. Not only damaged proteins are removed, but also those which are simply unnecessary after completing "their task". The process of removing proteins by means of the proteasome is extremely precise and its smallest disturbance can lead to cancer or neurodegenerative diseases. Many diseases are associated with malfunction of different protein pathways. "In every cell we deal with both synthesis and removal of proteins. Ribosomes are responsible for protein synthesis, while when it comes to their removal, we have two routes: one through lysosomes and the other through proteasomes, which I deal with" - explains Karpowicz.

Nice, contact person . He listens to patients. He explains everything. If you need an examination or a consultation, he directs. This router is a failure because it is not able to work properly with the Huawei E180 modem, despite this, with the specification on the packaging, the manufacturer assures that it is poor to work together, which proved to be untrue. The router also disconnects the Internet after a while, and the firmware updates do not help at all. Perhaps with another modem this router would work, but the manufacturer should give you a real list of compatible modems on the packaging, which is only available on his website as you look for it. I also don't recommend that you buy if you don't have a 100% compatible modem, and for it to work, the manufacturer and model of the modem and the network from which the modem comes must match the exact list available only on the manufacturer's website.

Laser discoloration removal - without reservations . She said that at most we will close the vessels afterwards. But unfortunately, during the second laser procedure, which was a correction and was to remove the scars, Mrs. Dr. Dr. "speeded up" and damaged the healthy skin, which left a large scar. Fillers: once given perfectly, the next time after the correction remained cavities, holes. Apart from that, at present, much better anaesthetics are used than Emel's ointment (which in this office is probably the only anaesthetic used). Mrs. Wiśnicka persuaded me to mesotherapy. Unfortunately, there was no effect. During the next visit Mrs. Dr. Wiśnicka was surprised how it is possible that she offered me a mezo when this procedure in my case is pointless and only a standard filler can help. She spent me unnecessarily 700 PLN, 2 weeks she was swollen and all for nothing. She decided that it doesn't make sense to continue using the services of Mrs. Dr. because one fixes and another damages and it will last forever. And moreover, it will cost a lot because the services in this office are not cheap. The issue of approach to the patient one may suit others not, I feel more comfort in the office, which I use now. The office itself and small waiting room, usually crowded as in the clinic, lack of elegance and coziness. I have always felt like one of the petitioners, and in such places where I pay a lot of money for services I expect to be treated at a higher level. In my opinion, the quality of services is inadequate to their price. In Wroclaw there are better offices with a much higher standard of service for this money .

In Poland there are currently 140 hotels operating under the brands of international chains. Although 4-5 star facilities are still predominant, economy hotels are increasing in popularity. Specialists estimate the current potential of the Polish economy hotel market at about 160 - 180 facilities. This means that if there were to be so many cheap but relatively comfortable hotels with 100 - 120 rooms each, they would have room occupancy at a level close to the national average. The appearance of such a large number of hotels does not mean that there would be a sudden increase in the number of guests in Poland, but that guests would move to these hotels from other hotels and other accommodation facilities. Therefore, the owners of new hotels would gain, above all, at the expense of facilities operating in other segments of the accommodation market.

Let's start with the pros. Clean rooms at an average level, taking into account a room price of nearly 600 PLN per night. Location of the hotel near the lake about 3 km from the center of Augustow. At breakfast there is something for everyone. This is where the advantages of staying end. Choosing Weekend SPA package for two in the hotel " Warszawa " is a complete mistake. The staff does not know what is in the package, for every element included in the package you have to ask for. When asked where to go for a "romantic dinner in candlelight with a glass of wine", an employee of the hotel said that it is best for us to go to dinner between 1 and 5 p.m. because there is a Swedish buffet and we will choose something. At dinner you can forget about candles and wine. You can choose from 2 appetizers in the form of a salad, 2 soups and 2 main dishes. The most interesting was the next day. The wedding took place in the hotel " Warszawa ". The restaurant was closed. The lady from the reception desk directed us for a romantic dinner to a drink bar. We managed to find the last free place. After 10 minutes of waiting for the staff to come, I went to the bar. The lady said that she has "a lot of work to do" and then she will come up. At the request of the staff, although she served coffee, we will wait calmly, she answered "please go, wait now I will not serve. After 25 minutes from the conversation the lady still did not come to us. We went to the reception to report it. The lady at the reception desk answered that it was not her business because it was not her responsibility. We were forced to look for a restaurant in the centre of Augustow in order to have a meal although it was included in the offer. The attitude of the staff was completely detached from the reality and standards that such a facility should meet. The whole situation took place in a three-star hotel, not a roadside motel at the border. If someone goes to a hotel and wants to spend a romantic time he should avoid this place. In conclusion, I can add that even when issuing an invoice for the stay, the lady from the reception desk made a mistake and did not take into account the discounts included in the package offer. We were shocked by the extreme incompetence of our employees. I am not mentioning the fact that the sun loungers on the beach were dirty and had to be wiped before use and that it was also impossible to meet the decision-maker on the day of departure at the hotel.

Hello, I would like to share my opinion regarding the hotel Lenart in Wieliczka, the website says that the hotel is child-friendly, there is no coverage in reality, I was there for a wedding with a 7 week old baby from September 5th / 6th, 2014, I had an apartment booked there, I was going to Wieliczka from my town for 8 hours and we were waiting for a 10 hour journey to Germany, I asked the staff to put a special sterilization bag with feeding bottles for 3 minutes into the microwave, to my misfortune the landlady heard this, how she jumped on me, that this is not a house, that she absolutely does not agree with it and all I can imagine is that she should have a supply of bottles, I did not go with one bottle I had 10 of them and that such a tiny child eats little and often so clean is over, I do not know maybe she should have 50 of them or more according to you. The bottles were not sterilized in the toilet and as a result the baby got mould. I would advise against it, the owner is too big a lady of millionaires and the truth is that the hotel is built with EU subsidies. Please publish my opinion to protect other families with children.

In order to examine how air pollution directly affects human health, the researchers considered that prolonged inhalation of dusts and gases that collect near the ground contributes significantly to respiratory diseases (such as asthma, allergies, lung diseases, coughing, rhinitis, sore throat), the cardiovascular system (atherosclerosis, heart failure) and the nervous system (Alzheimer's and Parkinson's diseases). Therefore, a group of children not yet affected by chronic or civilization diseases were selected for the study. These children are between 8 and 12 years old and study in the Sosnowiec Primary School No. 45 located several hundred meters from the seat of the Faculty of Earth Sciences of the University of Silesia (where constant air quality monitoring is conducted). Apart from allergic tests, the children underwent, among other things, spirometric tests to check lung function; together with their parents, they also filled in monthly cards with detailed questions about the observed reactions.
It is quite simple, I recommend that you make an appointment with your friends and work out all the given issues together and then learn them well. The grades are given on a "viewer and

According to the President of the FAStriga Foundation, Dr. Małgorzata Klecka, every third pregnant woman drinks alcohol. "Of these 30%, approximately one third will give birth to children who will have some kind of developmental disorders, widely understood, including fetal alcohol syndrome. It can be estimated that in Poland approx. 900 children a year are born with full-blown FAS, and 10 times more - with various disorders which - one may think - are also related to alcohol drunk by their mother during pregnancy" - she said . She added that children left on their own, without rehabilitation, much more often have secondary disorders - escapes from school, school interruptions, anti-social behaviour, breaking the law. "Such troubles are much less, if the child is taken early diagnostic and therapeutic actions" - she concluded.

Waiting for a visit in the waiting room 50 min . As the doctor explained, due to the delay of previous patients who drove from a distance (allegedly she could not refuse them and had to accept them despite being late). During the visit another doctor entered the office several times without closing the door behind her. The waiting room had the opportunity to see and hear everything that was happening in the office. The diagnosis was incorrect: the tooth treated with root canal Dr. Dagmara recommended to remove it because on the basis of the pantomogram she found that the tooth is untreated and there is an inflammation and the fact that now it does not hurt is only a matter of time. She proposed one treatment scheme consisting of removing the upper four and this tooth after root canal treatment. When asked about other solutions, she said that the others are ineffective in my case. After consultation with another doctor it turned out that the tooth after root canal treatment is well cured and there is no inflammation (which was confirmed by a spot x-ray) and that this inflammation from the pantomogram is an artifact, shading, false x-ray image (as it turns out, the pantomogram cannot be used to determine the inflammation is not a suitable diagnostic tool for this purpose) . Not wanting to decide on such radical treatment, she found another orthodontist, who proposed treatment based on microimplants without removing a single tooth. I would like to add that I am aware of the pros and cons of such a treatment as well as radical treatment, but unfortunately I found out about it from another doctor. Yes, microimplants are more expensive and the treatment takes longer, but it cannot be said that they are not effective. The decision about the method of treatment should be a conscious decision of the patient and not of the doctor after the patient has been acquainted with the disadvantages of each model of treatment. OST Gromada , the third largest hotel chain in Poland, plans to complete 2012 with revenue of PLN 128 million and a profit of 38 million. This year. Gromada will open a 4-star congress hotel in Kraków and will continue its restructuring, including the sale of unprofitable or redundant assets. The first three months of the year, despite some debt service problems, turned out to be good for Gromada. Revenue amounted to PLN 21.5 million and gross profit amounted to PLN 2.2 million. In the first quarter of the year, the Group's income amounted to PLN 21.5 million and gross profit was PLN 2.2 million. 2011 r . The Bunch recorded 19 million PLN revenue and almost one million PLN . The gross profit, which means an increase of 13 and 29% respectively . The Cooperative's Management Board forecasts that at the end of this year the Company will generate PLN 128 million in revenue and PLN 38 million in profit compared with PLN 95.4 million in revenue and PLN 1.8 million in gross profit in 2011.

In Italy, there are too many hotels, especially small ones, that bring losses. Mario Monti's government is going to carry out a thorough reform in the hospitality industry. The Italian press stresses that the statistics are inexorable for domestic tourism. While in 1995 Italy ranked first in Europe in terms of tourism revenue, it is now in third place, after France and Spain, and earns 11 billion euros less than these countries. Tourism accounts for 8.6% of GDP in Italy and 9.7% of total employment. One of the main reasons for this is that there is an excess of hotels, which are often uncompetitive, expensive and not attractive to tourists.

According to Ewa Rembiałkowska, GMOs should not be used in agriculture, but she is not against the use of GMOs in medicine or laboratory research. The hormone obtained in this way is much cheaper than if GMO technology was not resorted to. According to prof . According to Prof. Rembiałkowska, the use of genetically modified organisms in research on cancer and other diseases is also acceptable. Provided that the organisms do not escape into the environment. This is agreed by prof . Lisowska . "I myself am a molecular biologist and use GMOs in cancer research. I've been a patient of Professor Buczyłko's for a month. I'm so glad she got to him. I was going to be an allergologist for two years. . . . .the reason was a rhinitis, a constant cough and a rash. . . She was taking p / histamine drugs, which unfortunately stopped working as expected by me. First impression of the visit? - At last, I found myself in a doctor who asks questions and listens to answers! ! She did a lot of tests, which does not surprise me, because allergology is rather a field in which we rely on the results but also on what the patient says. The tests showed that I am allergic to apples and bananas, which surprised me terribly. She didn't think that a food allergy doesn't give the reaction that everyone talks about - abdominal pain, vomiting. She decided to stop eating apples and to my surprise because a few days the rhinitis stopped! There was a rash left, which I follow the advice of the Professor. I am writing down what she ate and what cosmetics she was using. . we will see if I can discover in this way what causes the rash = ) In general, I would recommend a visit to the Professor. Every doctor can prescribe antihistamines only that not everyone will ask us if e.g. we associate some vegetable or fruit from childhood that we did not like = )

Fear disorders in humans and animals can be treated with behavioural therapy. It consists in presenting a stimulus or stimuli causing fear in a safe situation. Repeated exposure to such stimuli is supposed to cause the person to stop being afraid with time. However, practice shows that suppression of fear is neither permanent nor complete. A sick person may stop reacting to a stimulus in a therapeutic office, but a change of environment, such as going out on the street, may lead to a recurrence of fear. As many as 70% to 80% of patients return to fear a few years after the end of therapy. Experiments of Polish scientists are described in the prestigious journal of the American Academy of Sciences PNAS. The research was financed by grants from the Foundation for Polish Science, the National Science Centre, the 7th Framework Programme of the European Commission and the ERA-NET NEURON programme co-financed by the National Centre for Research and Development.

The results of the research indicate many regularities related to changes in the seasons, although they can also be surprising. "In the spring, despite the fact that everything wakes up to life, most suicides are recorded. But this time of year also promotes fertility, because with the lengthening of the day, sperm production increases. Summer brings more headaches and aggravation of symptoms of multiple sclerosis" - explains the pharmacologist. In autumn, the first symptoms of so-called winter depression occur. It is also when girls have their first menstruation most often. In winter the number of diagnosed cervical and testicular cancers increases. Sudden infant deaths are more frequent . The risk of heart attacks and strokes increases, and in patients with bulimia - the frequency of overeating .

My friend and I spent a fantastic weekend at the hotel. The package includes four treatments. All of them were professionally performed and very pleasant. The wellness area is also very nice: three different saunas, a jacuzzi and a brine graduation tower. I recommend to extend your stay by one day to have time for everything. Fruit and wine to the room and a delicious dinner were included in the package. The hotel itself is beautifully located in the heart of the forest. The rooms are large and clean, equipped with bathrobes and slippers. A great place for a weekend out of town.

He was with his family in that hotel for a week. If I'm to sum it up in one word: weakness. The arguments on the plus side : - location - to the lake near, the hotel is located on the sidelines so also far from civilization . - Food (lunches only) Arguments to the minus: - attractions in the hotel - on the website you can read that there is a bowling alley, wellness and spa area, gym, bajkolandia. I will describe them briefly. Bowling alley: you can write about it that there is a bowling alley. And that's it. Out of 3 tracks one is completely out of use, 2 others are in an almost agonal state. Bowling is constantly falling down, the track is curved . Wellness and spa area: this includes: a swimming pool, namely 2 pools (a small one for children about 50cm deep and a bigger one about 170cm deep.) There is also a jacuzzi and 2 saunas. In the small pool, the water is cloudy, massacrically chlorinated, but relatively warm. In a large pool, the water is cooler and a little less chlorinated. The Jacuzzi either did not work (no possibility of manual control of the nozzles from the panel on the bathtub), or was polluted with something. The saunas even worked, although I don't know if there was such a temperament in them as was displayed on the controllers. To this I must add that the ceiling was falling off at times and it was a little dark. Gym - in the room there were: stepper (damaged in my opinion), atlas - life-threatening - broken rope rolls, wipes on the backrests and rods. Orbiter - not working . 3 bicycles, one of which is relatively efficient. The defects were reported to me already on the day of arrival - it was drenched . The solarium and whirlpool were unfortunately not checked by me, but probably their condition is similar. Bajkolandia - short - SYF . The equipment to play destroyed, the trampoline destroyed and threatening safety, balls everywhere and not in the pool, sometimes exposed tubes (should be protected with a sponge). Reported defects - defects cast! . There are also a few vending machines, but additionally paid for, so they are working. Rooms: we had the misfortune to spend the night / visit in 3 rooms: 159, 157 and 124 . Because some of the rooms are designed for colonial groups so: handles in the door fall out, windows do not close, mushroom on the walls (159) . In 157 conditions a little better, but there is no ideal. In 124, after the rain comes out a mushroom on the walls and ceiling, night lights badly screwed on, threatening life and health. The air conditioning is but not cool. WiFi is but with me on 3 phones the connection was broken. Food - lunches ok - every day a little different menu, tasty. Breakfast every day the same (scrambled eggs with flour, sausage, croutons, sausages (unfortunately the cheapest)). The problem is that the service did not keep up with the change of service, so there were no plates, cups, hot water for coffee, often and the next portions of food. The rooms were not ready at 4 p.m. - the service is not done. Another problem - colonies - noise, mess, mess. Beach - close, but neglected, little sandy, additional attractions paid for (canoes, water bikes). To sum up . If you want to rest it is not there (colonies). A beautiful place, but not used. Maybe the situation will change if there is an accident (because the equipment is very damaged). I do not recommend!
