The Renaissance Hotel, which is being built opposite Terminal 2 at Okęcie Airport in Warsaw, next to the Courtyard by Marriott Hotel, which has been operating since 2003, is now perfectly visible. From underneath the scaffolding also emerges the façade of the building, which should receive its first guests in the second half of 2013. The five-star building will have 225 rooms, 5 meeting rooms, restaurants and a bar, as well as a swimming pool, fitness centre and spa. The main investor, which will cost 141 million PLN, is P . P .

Hotel in the category of quality / price really gives you a tip - accommodation in Wroclaw for 39 PLN is something. This was your first visit to the doctor. You looked at your son very carefully from head to toe, which was a big positive surprise, but less often you focused on the skin changes themselves. A unique decoration, mixing rococo with ... . You'll see, you'll understand why she didn't finish the m. Large mirrors in gold frames in the room, in the bathroom mirrors even on the ceiling. Single room for 4 days . Small with bathroom . In the room there is a TV set, desk, bed, wardrobe, large mirror and a bathroom with shower. What the professor says may be interesting and sometimes interesting, but the downside is how he says it. Everyone enrolled in a course has a 3.0 in the index immediately without going to any lecture, if you want to have a higher grade there is a colloquium in one of the last lectures. The professor does not say what kind of issues he is going to discuss, but he does say that if someone comes to this colloquium and does not write anything, or writes complete nonsense not related to the subject, he will fail him, but in my group such a thing did not happen, maybe because the colloquium was written by some 15 people from a 70-person group. . . Cheap product . Allows for gentle stress relief and relaxation of emotional tension. Emotions are still felt during stress, however, the agent blocks the driving mechanism of the stressor, which discourages from going deeper into the stress factors, i.e. reduces susceptibility to stress. It is not a typical sedative, but a mild, herbal preparation. It will certainly help people who periodically struggle with everyday, more difficult stressful situations. It should be borne in mind that the preparation will probably not help in advanced depressive states, traumas and mental or nervous breakdowns. It makes it easier to sleep, so you can relax without feeling unsleepy. I recommend it to people who have temporary stressful situations and want to reduce their effects.

When he saw me he thought I was too young to be sick. When she showed him the slides from the CT scan showing the tumor he would see (marked with arrows just in case) he thought that she should consult me again with another radiologist. I was told to do an EUS (for a biopsy) on him - before the examination, the doctor said that he hoped the NFZ would reimburse him for the cost of the examination. The examination should last about 1 - 1 , 5h , the doctor wrapped himself in 20 minutes. He said that everything looks perfect, he took 3 pictures because there was no more sense, there is no trace of tumor. When she asked me where my pain came from, he said that the causes of the pain could be different and he made it clear that I am one of those people who apparently like to get sick of something. She was happy that the tumor had disappeared, but fortunately my doctors did not let this diagnosis fool them. After another abdominal CT, other additional examinations and months of waiting landed me on the operating table where in addition to the removal of a large, hard as concrete tumor I had to resect the digestive tract in three places. The gastrointestinal tract was stiffened. . . As it turned out, the result of the CT scan contained the exact location of the tumor, which had been able to solidly press on the pancreas, duodenum and intestine. Congratulations to the doctor on his work, and to all patients I strongly advise against this doctor.

I was also diagnosed with gestational diabetes. I made an appointment with the doctor at the ICZMP - a private visit, cost 100 PLN. I was treated as an intruder, the doctor answered my questions and did not advise me on anything (not even the diet, nor how often and at what time should I measure sugar). ...left me with the same fear and ignorance as before the visit. In the meantime, on a visit paid for by me, she answered the phone all the time. She appeared there because another diabetologist, who couldn't accept me, ordered me to go to the clinic or to go to the hospital immediately (weight loss, too much sugar). This doctor said that I could lose weight (and generally I am slim and gained little weight), and the sugar I have sometimes exceeded (as if I hadn't seen my results with a multiple meter measurement). In my notes from my diet for a few days and the value of sugar she just peeked at on the phone. When she asked me what value of sugar is supposed to bother me - answer: none, and what value of sugar means that I have to go to the hospital immediately - answer: none. All the time she felt as if she wanted to push me out of the office. I don't know what she paid me the 100 PLN for. I wish I had told her that.

The four-day stay in this hotel was the second and certainly the last. Three years ago it was very decent, but now it's a terrible experience. Shortened my stay in the hostel by two days due to the terrible conditions. Thanks to the program, guests of participating Starwood hotels in Europe, Africa and the Middle East have the opportunity to pay $1 (or equivalent in local currency) to their hotel bill as a donation to UNICEF. In addition, Starwood and UNICEF launched a fundraising campaign in 2008 called "Road to Awareness". Over the past 18 years, hotel guests and Starwood employees have collectively raised more than $30 million for UNICEF to improve the lives of children with special needs worldwide and to provide access to education. Earlier this year, Starwood introduced the Make a Green Choice program, which allows Starwood hotel guests around the world to opt out of daily cleaning services.

The research and development project "Introduction of the latest microchip technology (aCGH) to etiopathogenesis and clinical diagnosis of selected diseases with serious medical and social consequences" was carried out from 2008 to 2012 in the Department of Medical Genetics of the Institute of Mother and Child, headed by Prof. Tadeusz Mazurczak, and then by Prof . Ewa Bocian . Over 30 people participated in the research. The project was carried out in cooperation with the Department of Molecular Genetics and Human Genetics at the Baylor College of Medicine in Houston, Texas, the Department of Medical Genetics, the Department of Pediatrics and the Department of Pediatric Cardiology at the Jagiellonian University Medical College, the Department of Cardiological Pediatrics at the Children's Health Centre in Warsaw, the Faculty of Electronics and Information Technology at the Warsaw University of Technology and the Faculty of Mathematics, Computer Science and Mechanics at the University of Warsaw.

The unique advantage of the database based on the full genome of 126 healthy, long-lived ( 90 + ) Poles is the combination of clinical, biochemical and genomic data. It is a genetic pattern of a person in good health. It has the form of a database to which the genetic data of each Polish patient can be referenced in order to offer him/her a precise genome diagnosis. Life expectancy and the number of older people will increase in the near future. As dr hab . Małgorzata Mossakowska from the Institute of Cellular and Molecular Biology, people over 90 years of age, without serious problems with everyday life activities (at least 4 points out of 6 possible), without serious problems with memory and cognitive functions (at least 20 points out of 30 possible), who before the age of 80 did not have type 2 diabetes, stroke, myocardial infarction or cancer and had normal or almost abnormal biochemical test results, were selected for the study.

Chairman of the Scientific Council of the Polish National Influenza Control Programme prof . Adam Antczak said that the main reason for such a large number of cases was the extremely dangerous swine influenza AH1N1 virus and the fact that in 2015 only 3.4% of the population was vaccinated against the influenza. Poles, less than in previous influenza seasons. Most people in our country were vaccinated against influenza in 2005. - 8.6% of the population . Since then the number of these vaccinations has been decreasing . In 2007, 6.1% of the population was vaccinated. The number of Poles, and between 2012 and 2014 - only 3.7% . "This is far too little, in this respect we are in one of the last places in Europe", stressed prof . Antczak .

The study was carried out on over 200 people between 16 and 82 . years of age experiencing so-called psychotic-like symptoms. During the study, it was checked what level of social anxiety characterizes the respondents and how this anxiety may affect the formation of psychotic symptoms. As the researcher explains, by reversing the cognitive bias or modifying it - which can be done by means of special trainings - the probability of developing delusions could theoretically be significantly reduced. "We then eliminate the factor that favours them. Similar solutions are already being proposed to people who suffer from psychotic disorders. This can also be done for people at risk of psychosis, e.g. relatives of people with psychoses at risk of this type of disorder," he points out.

During the conference Prof. Maciejewski pointed out that the centre in Gliwice is a clinic for oncological and reconstructive surgery and is not a replantological centre - there are no such duty stations, no trauma facilities etc. "Therefore, in such cases, which include not only injuries to the head and neck region, requiring microvascular intervention, in this case of replantation, we are not able to provide adequate care for patients whose injuries affect a larger area and a larger range," he said . Looking for a way to counteract this and change the fate of children with nodular sclerosis, prof . Jóźwiak started ok . 5-6 years ago he started to perform frequent electroencephalography (EEG) of the brain every four weeks in newborns with the diagnosed disease. The idea was to quickly identify active changes in the EEG record heralding the beginning of epileptogenesis. The researchers also proposed antiepileptic treatment at this stage, even before the epilepsy occurred. This was a completely new approach. In 2011, the European Journal of Pediatric Neurologists published the results of a study which covered 45 children with nodular sclerosis. It showed that administering antiepileptic drugs before the onset of epileptic seizures significantly reduces the risk of mental retardation of children. In the treated group the percentage of toddlers who were diagnosed with epilepsy was 14%. In the control group, i.e. treated only when the epilepsy symptoms occur - 48%. According to prof . Jóźwiak, a new therapeutic approach completely changes the prognosis of sick children.

Where do we start here? I've been staying at the hotel, Gronie, for just four days. Negative things will dominate the review. . . The first thing is the appearance of the hotel. At first glance the object does not look bad, however, the deeper into the forest the more mushrooms, so it was also in this case. The hotel is very bland. It is outdated, wordless. So are the rooms. Scandinavian hotel chain Scandic is one of the leading companies in the accommodation industry implementing ecological solutions. The EU Ecolabel certificate can be obtained after the implementation of the environmental policy with the simultaneous, carefully implemented adjustment of product and service elements to the requirements of the European Commission, both globally and locally.

E . P . : Children's skin is built just like adults', but their immune system is not developed enough to react quickly and efficiently to external factors, so they are less protected also from the sun. When children are at the water, they often play by the shore, and that is where it is easiest to get burned. Water drops on the skin act as a lens - they concentrate the radiation. On foreign beaches we can see children by the water in T-shirts and shorts. This is reasonable, because even if they get wet, staying in wet clothes in the hot sun will not harm them, and even cools them, while protecting them from the sun. There are already clothes for children with sunscreens available on the market. It is also necessary to remember about more frequent relubrication, because while playing in the sand children can wipe off the cream. It should also be remembered that while in water we also sunbathe - up to 2.5 m deep the radiation is the same as on land.

This is what the authors of the educational campaign entitled "The future of the European Union" prove. "The answer is in your blood! ” The Commission has also been working on the development of the European Agency for the Evaluation of Medicinal Products for Human Use, organised for the early detection of blood and bone marrow diseases, including haematological cancers. According to the data of the National Cancer Register (KRN), the number of new hematopoietic and lymphatic cancers has more than doubled in Poland over the last three decades. Demographic and epidemiological prognoses are not optimistic - Polish society is ageing and in some blood and marrow diseases advanced age is a risk factor. Diagnosis in this group is hindered by the propensity of elderly people to explain their malaise in old age, and they may, for example, suffer from myelofibrosis - one of the rarest but extremely dangerous blood cancers.

"The mitral valve ring, colloquially speaking + ruptured + from the myocardium. Due to a defect in both valves, a woman's life was endangered and she could die at any time," explains the head of the Cardiac Surgery Clinic of the University Clinical Hospital in Białystok, Professor Tomasz Hirnle, quoted in a press release. The operation was performed together with a cardiologist from the Upper Silesian Medical Centre, Dr Grzegorz Smolka . Doctors operated on the patient without extensive opening of the chest - they made only a few centimeters incision on the left side of the chest. "The patient was in a severe condition and was unable to get out of bed due to dyspnea. The classic reopening of the chest by reopening the chest, in the extracorporeal circulation, was too risky. The only solution in her case was percutaneous (transcutaneous) surgery," explains a hospital spokeswoman.

It will be able to be used in the treatment of cold - hypothermia" - said PAP author of the idea, Dr. Ziemowit Ostrowski from the Silesian University of Technology. The scientist is raising money to implement his idea. Misterman, because that's how the dummy was called by its creator, will allow to keep the body at the temperature expected by the doctor and properly lower the body temperature. "The doctor knows the patient's temperature at a given moment, and the dummy will tell him what it will be like in five minutes if he keeps the patient's cooling at the current level. If he sees that the patient is too cold, he will be able to react accordingly," said Dr. Ostrowski.

Nice service, rooms, rooms, all praised. Manadzer is a nightmarish beetroot, the ladies at the reception are angry and probably bored with life. The disco is a typical landlord's shop, the coke guards are standing up, the police come regularly. I do not recommend it.

I don't recommend it. I went to your doctor with the spots that jumped out after I bathed in the lake and first I was asked rudely enough if it wasn't a venereal disease and then treated with zero interest, a quick glance, a statement that it was nothing like that, without going into the details of what it was, when it came down, when it came back etc. It is clearly worth to be nice only for the patient who comes to an expensive rejuvenating treatment.

Decent 3-star standard, good location for those interested in the Jura, small but nice SPA, great masseur - P . Grzegorz - the strongest point of this hotel. Nice service. The rooms are clean, but without madness. The biggest reservations to the kitchen. We were at a 3-day business meeting in a group of several dozen people. After two earlier lunches, everyone unanimously refused to eat the last lunch at the hotel and this probably speaks for itself. We couldn't dare to be surprised how you can make inedible mashed potatoes. . . The chef has succeeded! The next day, he improved it with "rubber" dumplings. Spices are foreign to him. The sour cream has nothing to do with the sour cream. The arrogance of the Directorate is surprising. Despite such clearly formulated dissatisfaction of customers, it decided to charge us with the full cost of the cancelled lunch, offering to refund the money for . . . . .puree and hoof. . . Ladies and Gentlemen . . . . .this is how the Teddy Bear was treated. . .

Villa Alpejska is located 1 km from the city centre, in a rather busy street. During rush hour traffic can be so heavy, it takes a few minutes to cross the street and at night it can have trouble falling asleep. So if possible, ask for a room with a view of the courtyard. The rooms are nice and very clean. Each of them has a balcony which is open to the neighbours. There is a flat-screen TV and a refrigerator, but remember to take your own soap and shampoo with you. If you want to make coffee or tea, you can do it in the hallway. Breakfast is served from 9 to 10. They serve different types of cheeses, hams, yoghurt and fresh bread in buffet form. There are at least 2 small supermarkets nearby (direction of the Vistula river centre) and a restaurant serving local cuisine the other way round. If you feel like something sweet, there is a great cafe near the restaurant.

Compared to the previous month, the biggest price drop was recorded in Sopot (PLN 334, - 24%) . Guests pay 42% less for accommodation in the Baltic spa resort than in July ( 580 PLN ) . Sopot remains the most expensive Polish destination, although the price difference between it and Warsaw (322 PLN) is only 12 PLN (July: 316 PLN) . Much cheaper tourists also spend the night in Gdansk (254 PLN, - 20 %) and Katowice (220 PLN, - 13 %) . In terms of hotel prices Poland is still one of the cheapest EU countries. Lower costs for accommodation can only be expected in Romania (PLN 271) and Bulgaria (PLN 245) . On average we will pay most for a hotel in Sweden (PLN 635), France (PLN 609) and Denmark (PLN 580).

I am not satisfied with the visit, which lasted maybe 8 minutes. . . The 3-star Mercure Cieszyn Hotel offers 78 rooms and suites with separate bedroom and living room. Business travellers can use one of four air-conditioned and professionally equipped conference rooms. There are more than 700 Mercure hotels in 49 countries worldwide, 16 of which are located in Poland together with the Cieszyn hotel. Mercure is one of the best recognized hotel brands. Hotels of this chain combine modernity with the historical character of the place. With the rebranding of a hotel in Cieszyn, the number of hotels operating under the Orbis brand has dropped to four. Such facilities are located in Bielsko-Biała, Gdańsk, Gdynia and Wrocław.

Photos of the facility super, price low as for the Spa, so we decided to go. When we get to the site the same negative surprises. I am very pleased with the mammotomic biopsy performed by Dr Bednarski . I also didn't like the rush to admit patients: after the examination, the doctor referred me with all questions to the nurses at registration. I still had the impression that the doctor was in a great hurry and that I should jump out of my bra as soon as possible and then jump into it.) I know it's just a small thing, but it's a little discomfort. I have absolutely no objections to the ladies' nurses: they have always been very nice, kind, patient and ready to help. The hotel when it comes to decorating nothing. Right by the beautiful beach with free sun loungers . The truth is that the doctor is a pretty and very well-groomed woman. And I think that's her only advantage. I'm not gonna talk about the treatment because I've only been with her once. The hotel is quite big, you have to overlap a bit, but still worth a visit. The food is excellent, a big choice for lunch or dinner, for breakfast standard. it's never been this way for everyone to be satisfied with the same doctor. Everyone has different requirements and not always a doctor who suits others suits us . With a clear conscience, I can recommend Dr. Frank. We are parents of a 3-year-old son. The whole pregnancy was led by Dr. Franik and we are very happy with it. Although he was going on vacation, he handed me over to his friend Dr. Dąbrowski (head of the gynaecology and obstetrics ward in the Railway Hospital in Katowice). Despite the fact that I am not from Katowice, I prefer to go there rather than go to doctors in my city although I have a county hospital on the spot, but what if I have high quality equipment in the hospital like doctors don't know anything about it as it is in the county hospital in Mikołów. Dr. Franik directs to all the examinations and explains everything in detail. If the pregnancy is proceeding properly visits are once a month and not like other doctors every 2 weeks. It is only a pity that good specialists have to be so dear, but sometimes it is worth to pay more and to sleep peacefully without worrying that there may be something wrong with the child. The next pregnancy will surely also be led by Dr Franik because I can trust him. THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR YOUR CARING CARE.

This is our favorite place in the Giant Mountains, so we are biased. Positive opinions after the visit to cardiology , Ms . Aneta Stachurska Przychodnia Specjalistyczna - Wrocław , ul . Legnicka 61 . I was visited by Mrs . The staff moves like flies in pitch, the customer is indifferent! I agree with the predecessors, the name has not much in common with a restaurant. I wonder why so many positive opinions (as a result of which we found ourselves here). The hotel is tastefully and modernly equipped. Great location ( 200 meters from the sea ) . Delicious and varied meals (no repeat of the soup for 10 days). I recommend it, it rested well, I felt "taken care of" . The hotel is so small that the atmosphere is very nice. I think I'll come back here again.

The lowest percentage of foreign tourists was recorded in typical holiday facilities. In the period from January to June 2012, the occupancy rate at all tourist accommodation facilities was 30.6%. . The best results were recorded in health resorts - 72% . . The lowest utilisation in these facilities was observed in January 2012 . (61.6% . ), i.e. 15.9%, 9 p . p . less than in June, when the occupancy rate of beds in health resorts was 77.5% . . The occupancy rate of beds in hotel facilities in the first half of 2012 was 31.0%. This is exactly the same as in the first half of 2011. In the case of other facilities (non-hotel facilities), this ratio decreased from 32.3% to 30.1%. . In the first half of 2012 the number of tourists using accommodation facilities increased by 3.6%. In the first half of 2012 the number of tourists using accommodation facilities increased by 3.6%, the number of nights spent by 1.1% and the number of rooms rented by 5.0% in relation to the period from January to June 2011. The study also examined guest rooms / private accommodation and agritourism farms with 10 or more beds.

According to the IŻ research, there are from about 2 to about 3 percent of trans-fatty acids in butter available on the Polish market. "In dairy products from ruminant animals, such as cows and sheep, they cannot be eliminated. Their content in butter varies depending on the feed used for feeding during the year and may vary from 1 to 8%. " explains Prof. Mojska. Larger amounts of trans isomers have been found in the so-called fat mixes, i.e. those using different types of fats, both of plant and animal origin (it can be a mixture of butter with vegetable oils or margarine with milk).

Pain doctor very nice, on a high level, however, in my case the diagnosis is not correct. The drug as well as the means to care for the skin is selected. The condition after the treatment has neither worsened nor improved. It was helped by visiting another doctor and administering another medication, after which after two applications the problem started to disappear. However, I realize that dermatology is a lottery, one drug does not work for everyone and sometimes you have to try something else, but I judge the visit by my experience.

I was tempted by this guesthouse because I needed a cheap place to stay in Poznan for three days. Even considering that I am an experienced traveler and I like Spartan lifestyle, this place was the worst I have ever stayed in. The staff did not know a single word of English and communicated with me via text messages, asking me when I was leaving and telling me where to leave my keys ... The cell I was assigned was opposite the bathroom and every time to get there I had to go through the reception. It's not very nice to take a shower or go to the toilet. The furniture was cheap Ikei style furniture and the squeaky bed didn't let me sleep a wink the first night. The next night, I put 'em on the ground. Then I realized that the broken glass had been swept under the bed - the cleaning staff didn't really care, could have been lying there for a long time and quite possibly still lying there. The worst (and most ridiculous) adventure happened when em came back after a day in town and found a big crowd in front of the building. One of the guests locked himself in. After 50 minutes, the owner showed up, went in through the back window and opened the front door. He was already quite tired then (it takes 35 minutes on foot from the market square to the hotel) and thanked 'em for the mattress on the floor. I wasn't thinking of a riot in the street (a Chinese restaurant a few houses away and a night shop) that wouldn't let me sleep for even a minute. If you're not used to sleeping in the jungle and don't feel like having a nasty adventure, avoid this place at all costs. You've been warned.

Welcome back ! 5 wonderful days . . . We came back here a second time and we will come back for sure ! Hotel on the level ! No objections! Top level service ! In the prevention of Alzheimer's disease it is important to treat atherosclerosis, atherosclerotic changes in the cerebral arteries go hand in hand with the process of Alzheimer's disease, these diseases intermingle. It has been proven that damaged vessels are an additional source of beta amyloid in the brain. The necrosis caused by ischemia and hypoxia must not be allowed. Prevention also includes treatment of hypertension, diabetes, heart rhythm disorders. Physical activity must be an essential part of our daily schedule, researchers suggest long, fast daily marches. A rich social life is a good exercise for the mind as well as intellectual activity, challenging ourselves (learning new languages is better than going back to the ones we already know). A Mediterranean diet is advisable.

Although there is no hotel operating in the Netherlands after the Hyatt brand, it has its own "room" in the Stedelijk Museum in Amsterdam. The "Hyatt Room" currently features a selection of contemporary art works, including "Femme nue devant le jardin" by Pablo Picasso "Fingermalerei - AKT" by Georg Baselitz, "Velazquez" by Franz West and "Painting , Smoking , Eating" and "The Door" by Philip Gustons. According to Paul Geertman of Aedes Real Estate, the owner of the building where the Andaz Hotel was opened, the cooperation with the museum highlights the links between the new facility and the Hyatt Hotels chain and art. Andaz is a luxury brand of boutique hotels that is part of the Hyatt Hotels and Resorts chain.

The game is as good as the previous parts of Gran Turismo. Graphics, sound, playability at a very high level. It's also not short, I went through it in a month of playing. This is not a demo, but a prologue, which is an announcement of what awaits us in the main game, Gran Turismo 5. There are about 70 cars, only the tracks are few, because 6 . There are small errors in the game, such as graphical errors while driving. Besides, the game unfortunately sometimes slows down. I hope that these minor bugs will be fixed and will not be in the full version of the game. Mandatory title for the third plebeian.

The hotel is difficult for me to judge, because on the one hand it has a very good location, it is clean, they serve delicious breakfast (nice ladies waitresses) and the price is not comfortable, but a one-hour stay in the "Piascie" will completely spoil my reception staff. The hotel staff on the phone inform that they can order a taxi for me from the airport, but they need an order by e-mail. I send out the necessary information twice, the case even goes to the management before they graciously receive the order confirmation email and an apology. By the way, all the "confusion" I have to listen to information like, "I don't know what happened 3 days ago, I'm just starting work. The taxi arrives on time, it seems to be a completely random, one-time incident. Late at night I check into the hotel, I order a wake-up call for the early morning of the next day. Luckily, by some miracle, I wake up alone because nobody at the reception desk woke me up. To the complaint I receive a nonchalant answer from the gentleman who is at the reception desk, that he didn't actually wake me up - he is sorry, but he was busy at work (!) and that if he really slept, he would pay me back for the lost connection. I do not know what to call it - total arrogance? ?

The same thing is true for parking: in some of the facilities parking is free, in others you have to pay extra. In practice, additional fees can be charged for many services. It depends mainly on what the owner promotes in his facility and the offer of the competition. The fees for Internet access or free of charge are another difference in the approach to additional services," explains Jacek Piast, hotel advisor. In his opinion, in Poland, fortunately for the guests, the character of the activity provided by the hotels is "old Polish hospitality". as well as the subconscious "Orbisian patterns". The breakthrough in this awareness is that hoteliers often use hotels abroad. Not holiday hotels, but business hotels. In these facilities, one either buys an expensive room with a package of additional services or a cheaper room, agreeing to pay extra charges for the use of "additional" services: air-conditioning, TV, internet access, minibar, mineral water, coffee set, ironers, and even services provided by the reception desk, such as waking up (waking up for free can then be set in the TV set). A fee is also sometimes charged for the order by the reception of a taxi.

I am very pleased with the rest of this hotel. The service is very nice and polite. Daily salty beds and fresh towels. Breakfast is rich and tasty (unfortunately no tomato vegetables, lettuce). Close to the metro and shopping mall. The only drawback in my case was the fact that the windows were facing a noisy street and at night they had to be closed.

It was my second and last stay in this hotel. After reading such flattering opinions, she made an appointment with her child to visit Dr. Dorota Rutkowska . And frankly, she was very disappointed in me. Meanwhile, a team from American Stanford and California Universities and the AGH University of Science and Technology (AGH University of Science and Technology in Krakow) is working to ensure that in the future the implants will allow for more accurate vision. Researchers want the implant to use much smaller electrodes, which will be densely packed - instead of a few dozen electrodes it will be possible to place several thousand of them on the retina. This will make the image more detailed. In addition, the researchers want the pulses from one electrode to be very precise and reach individual ganglion cells, not thousands at a time. Another challenge is to improve the impulses that the electrode sends to the retinal cell. "What we see at all times is a very complex scene. It is difficult for us to encode it as the eye does," says the scientist. He explains that there are up to 20 different types of ganglion cells in the retina - other cells are responsible for processing and sending information about colour to the brain and others about movement. So if the entire area of retinal cells is stimulated, different types of retinal cells are stimulated simultaneously, so that the brain can receive conflicting signals in an instant.

In the case of recreational stays, free Wi - Fi is such a factor for 34% of respondents . Whereas 66% of respondents would like free Wi Fi to become a standard in all hotels in 2013. Free Internet access is much more important for both business guests and tourists than free parking or breakfast. In total, only 11% of those surveyed said they would be willing to pay for Wi Fi during their stay in the hotel. According to Kate Hopcraftof from Hotels.com, such a strong emphasis on free Wi Fi is primarily due to the fact that guests expect the hotel to continue the approach they encounter during their travels - free Internet offers more and more airlines, airports and catering establishments.

I sincerely recommend Marcin . He's a professional in every way. The first meeting with Marcin took place after about . 1, 5 months after the injury and after that the first improvement appeared. With each subsequent meeting it was only better. The lecturer noted that almost every substance, if abused, has negative effects - the same is true of marijuana. It was found that shortly after use, it weakens motor and cognitive functions - e.g. it slows down the reflexes - so it is rightly banned in many countries to drive after cannabis is burned. The substance also impairs short-term memory - so smoking a joint, e.g. before a university exam, can have fatal consequences for students. However, data quoted by a Krakow neuropharmacologist (from the 1990s) indicate that less than 10% of cannabis smokers become permanently dependent on it. In the light of these data, nicotine, heroin, cocaine, alcohol and amphetamine have much stronger addictive effects.

If we care about Y-generation customers, we must focus on room innovations, traditional hotel bedding resting on an unusual bed, vegan meals instead of a pork chop or a range of technological innovations available at no extra cost.

Science festivals are a good place to promote proper health and hearing care behaviors. Different types of hearing disorders affect every 6 children in primary school. Some of them are noise-induced hearing loss. Hearing is physics. Two parameters are crucial to our perception of sounds - pitch and loudness. The higher the volume, the higher the energy of the waves that reach our ears. If noise exceeds 130 dB, we no longer distinguish between sounds, but feel pain. Pitch is a consequence of how fast, i.e. how many times per second the object that is the source of the sound vibrates. The number of vibrations per second is called frequency and measured in hertz. Human hearing begins to register sounds of 16 Hz, below this limit we have introsounds that can be heard by e.g. elephants. We stop hearing sounds when they exceed 20 kHz, then there are already ultrasounds heard by dogs and used for echolocation by bats and dolphins.

MATERIAL COLLECTIONS AND OTHER SURFACES The BioMed project also conducts research on endoprosthesis coatings and spinal cord repair. Stem cells are a great hope of regenerative medicine and find more and more applications in modern medicine. They can share a huge number of times and can differentiate themselves to other types, which means they can simply turn into the cells that patients need. In the BioMed project they are dealt with by dr hab . Krzysztof Marycz from Wrocław University of Life Sciences and Prof . Lidia Buzzanska from the Institute of Experimental and Clinical Medicine in Wrocław and Prof . M . Mossakowski PAS in Warsaw . The team assesses, among other things, the possibility of regenerating bone and nerve tissue damage using stem cells isolated from fat tissue and bone marrow using biomaterials .

In many cases, the low attractiveness is also determined by the construction costs which are too high in relation to the effect, non-ergonomic and low concern for economical exploitation parameters. Many such hotels have no chance of achieving profitability. Offers of good facilities, those that not only earn money but also make a profit, are few and far between, and these are not usually announced publicly. It is also worth noting that recently there have been more and more offers on the market for plots of land intended for the construction of hotel facilities, or even with ready-made projects. "The stress is certainly less, because we are aware that we are practicing in simulated conditions, but the point is that we are prepared to stand by the real patient. Thanks to such conditions it will be easier for us to deal with the problem in the hospital, where we will have to deal with a specific problem on our own" - told journalists one of the students participating in the exercises on Monday. "For us, patient safety is paramount. Some of the procedures we teach our students are either very invasive or very risky. These are things that cannot be taught directly to patients, and such centres give the opportunity to simulate the real conditions that prevail in hospital emergency departments or intensive care rooms" - said Dr Michał Nowakowski, head of the Department of Medical Didactics, responsible for the implementation of the development programme at the Jagiellonian University Medical College.

Only two or three years ago, the diagnosis of advanced melanoma, the most malignant skin cancer, was a death sentence. Nowadays, thanks to the introduction of new drugs, including immunotherapy, it is more and more often said that for many patients "it will be a chronic disease" - Wojtasiński points out. In his book he cites examples of many other cancers, in the treatment of which enormous progress has been made - chronic myeloid leukaemia, multiple myeloma, breast cancer. He describes the experiences of many patients - including people known from the front pages of the newspapers - who have either been cured of the cancer or live with it as with another chronic disease. "In the United States, there are already more than 14 million people who + survived + cancer," writes the author. 15% of them have lived for at least 20 years since the diagnosis. The journalist argues that the effects of cancer treatment are also improving in Poland, although it is still slower than in the West.

Professor is an outstanding doctor, a specialist of the highest level, faithfully committed to the Hippocratic oath, and above all, a person with a sincere desire to help and boundless empathy. After 12 years of struggling with various doctors, most often gynaecologists and endocrinologists, having had various diagnoses or most often a lack of them, having experienced the enormity of uncontrollable behaviours of my body after taking a lot of various unnecessary medications". ...being hormonally unstable and on the verge of emotional exhaustion. As a result of all the unpleasant and often dramatic experiences she lost my faith in the abilities and skills of doctors. After the visit to my office the professor believed that there are people who really want to help me and give me hope for a normal life. She referred me to another, according to her, outstanding doctor who could help me, guaranteeing the possibility of treatment by her, if I wasn't satisfied with the new specialist. Usually, after a year of treatment, she lost faith in the competence of the new attending doctor; this time it is different - I am slowly gaining confidence in his skills. I owe the possibility of treatment with this specialist to the Professor. I would like to emphasize that Professor Izabella Kozłowicz-Gudzińska is the only specialist whom I trust without limits. Whenever I need it, she is there to give me advice and support, and she does it selflessly - out of a noble and pure desire to help. I have never doubted her competence and professionalism. Thanks to her, she has regained my strength and willingness to live and to continue healing.

Researchers from the Nencki Institute stress that these numbers cannot be automatically transferred to the human population. "Although the mouse and the human being are genetically and physiologically very similar, they are nevertheless different organisms. Mice are only research models of human ailments and allow better understanding of disease processes" - says Michał Mlącki . "Today we cannot yet answer the question whether people with a damaged GRHL1 gene will develop non-uniform tumours five times more often, like mice, or whether it will be four or six times more. Research to determine the scale of this increase in human population has only just begun" - points out Dr Wilanowski .

The Marconi Restaurant is a reflection of Michał Tkaczyk's culinary passion - his excellent style, combining elements of Polish and Mediterranean cuisine, best represented by the famous duck with caramelized apples, seasoned with rosemary, garlic and cloves. The elegant Art Nouveau interiors of the restaurant, where the dark parquet floor contrasts with the soft white walls and delicate colour palette and unique details - crystal candlesticks and the best porcelain - provide a unique experience in a tasteful and romantic setting. The legendary Café Bristol is a place where tradition and the urban lifestyle are combined. Since 1901, it has been a place where guests are enchanted by its original Viennese style interiors, the aroma of freshly brewed coffee, excellent dishes and sophisticated desserts. The Luxury Collection Concierge Golden and white lamps illuminating the unique, delicate eel skin in the reception area of the Rest Area create a tranquil, unearthly atmosphere from the moment you enter.

It is recommended that the daily salt intake should not exceed 5 g when it reaches 6-8 g, the risk of stomach cancer increases by 41%. and a daily salt intake of more than 8 g increases the risk of stomach cancer by 68%. "A diet rich in fruit and vegetables has a reverse, anti-cancer effect. Consumption of 50 g of vegetables per day reduces the risk of stomach cancer by 19% . " - noted prof . Yarosha . According to specialists, the frequency of eating fruit and vegetables is also important. When we reach for them one to three times a day, the risk of cancer is reduced by 14%. Eating them three to five times a day makes it drop by 29% . And five to seven times, it decreases by 36% .
The lecture leads you to understand how you're gonna pass it all.

I'll start with the fact that I'm 17 years old and in April of this year I was diagnosed with "something" (I call it that because nobody was able to tell what exactly it was) in the right hemisphere of the brain. The only thing that was certain was an immediate operation. It is also worth mentioning that on Monday she had an MRI and on Friday a surgery. On Thursday she was transported from her city to Cracow for surgery in St. Raphael's hospital. The operation was successful without any complications. After the examination it turned out that it is a nonmalignant neoplasm Glejak grade 1. Despite that I do not have any radiotherapy or chemotherapy. More than two months have passed since the surgery. I feel good, I'm slowly getting back to myself. I would like to thank Dr. Czepko with all my heart for his professionalism and approach to the patient. I am very grateful to him for his care of me. I will recommend him to everyone because he is a trustworthy person and is in the right place ~ a grateful patient from Nowy Sącz ; )

For 50 years, the Food and Nutrition Institute has been undertaking various activities to improve the awareness of Poles about the principles of healthy nutrition. "Keep Balance" is an educational project implemented by the Food and Nutrition Institute since 2011, whose full name is: "Prevention of overweight and obesity and chronic diseases through education of the society in the field of nutrition and physical activity" . It is co-financed by Switzerland within the framework of the Swiss-Polish Cooperation Programme (SPPW) with the new European Union Member States. It is supposed to reach the society directly with knowledge. The materials are to broaden and consolidate the knowledge of Poles on how to compose a balanced daily diet, the principles of rational, healthy nutrition and the criteria for evaluating food products. PAP - Science in Poland

Whooping cough, formerly known as pertussis, is an acute, infectious airway disease caused by the bacterium Bordetella pertussis. In the first weeks the symptoms of pertussis are not different from other upper respiratory tract infections. Then typical repetitive and prolonged coughing attacks appear, especially at night, often leading to severe exhaustion. A cough of varying intensity can last for many weeks. In older people it can even lead to rib fractures. "The most typical, classic symptoms of whooping cough are found in unresistant infants and young children, and less typical, mild, in adults vaccinated against whooping cough in childhood" - said prof. Leszek Szenborn from Wrocław Medical University. He added that in more than 5% of the cases. The patients under 10 years of age who are hospitalized have serious neurological symptoms - seizures, paresis and even deafness and blindness.

For the time being, it's not so easy to show that an infected patient who comes to the doctor with a fever and a cough has the flu. Relative certainty can only be provided by tests of samples taken from the patient, which are not available to ordinary bread-eaters (mass tests or PCR). These tests are not only expensive, but also take a lot of time - you have to wait a few days for the results. Doctors, unable to immediately determine whether they are dealing with a viral or bacterial infection, sometimes - just in case - prescribe antibiotics to the patient. And this in the case of the presence of a virus, e.g. flu or rhinovirus, is completely unnecessary and contributes to the weakening of the body and the formation of strains of bacteria resistant to antibiotics.

As early as in the 18th century, astronomer Jean Jacques d \'Ortous de Mairan, studying the plant - mimosa - found that its leaves open towards the sun during the day and close at dusk. He decided to check what would happen to the plant permanently in the dark. As it turned out, even without access to sunlight, the leaves opened and closed in a constant daily rhythm, as if they were controlled by an internal clock. With time, more "clocks" of the plants were discovered - Charles Linnaeus created in Uppsala the first "flower clock" with flowers opening at certain times (its accuracy was several minutes). Biological clocks, which help to adjust physiology to the time of day, were also observed in animals and humans. This regular adaptation is referred to as a circadian rhythm.

Maybe a surgeon and a good surgeon, though I was just 'em on a consultation that wasn't without its perplexities. She had the privilege of being forced to spend time in this center. Our group rented a cottage that did not meet even the lowest standards. There was no possibility to hang a shower anywhere in the bathroom because the handle was broken. The next thing is the traces of a mushroom coming out in the corners of the walls. Unfortunately, the stains were so huge that they could not be overlooked. We bought our meals in the 'restaurant' too early. which turned out to be an ordinary table and the lowest flights. The most important thing is that the ship is not a luxury, but at least a level for people and not for animals. The canteen offered us the option for vegetarians, which I took advantage of. Regardless of the price, the conditions should meet the lowest standards. Unfortunately, this place does not meet this standard. Moulds coming out on the walls in the cottages, the lack of a shower holder (not only in our house), squeaking, wobbling beds. Food for vegetarians with cardboard values - none.

She has used the Doctor's dental aid many times during this year. The Doctor explains and explains everything calmly, clearly and at the same time she is very friendly and cheerful. How much are the ratings written a few days after starting to use ? Nothing. I'm evaluating more than two years after the purchase . During that time, the washing machine was doing great. Last time we were at the Colosseum with a boy, we decided to share our opinion. The guesthouse itself is ok . Very neat, clean, well-kept rooms. We have no objections in this respect. The climate of the restaurant, as a wonderful decoration, climatic. The only things that spoiled our trip and stay at the Coloseum in Pruhonice are the exceptional nahalism and insolence of the restaurant staff. We suspect that it is the regulation of the owner-manager of the restaurant to "bankrupt" and in a very insistent way TAKING people to order something to eat, come and buy dinner or other benefits. I understand that everyone wants to earn money, especially in a small town, but everything has its limits, which have not once been crossed. I was personally reluctant to even come to the breakfasts we paid for in advance to avoid this intrusive behavior and min when we declare that we will not order dinner. It was already rude. If it weren't for that, our romantic stay would have been sincerely successful. Personally I look at it all differently - because I work in tourism myself, I am a tourist guide. She left me to rest and spend a romantic weekend and met with a huge surprise, which despite numerous professional travels she had not met before. Both of me and my man were outraged when the staff (or maybe the boss) came up with another scam seeing that we will not order anything more from the offer than what we had in the previously purchased benefits. Namely, at breakfast we were given a card with scrambled eggs and sausages - of course ALL ADDITIONALLY PAID. Shock . In other hotels, even those with two, three or even five stars, she has never once encountered such a thing. I warn you, because the customer policy should change quickly. The customer must not feel forced to do anything. As an object - just accommodation (rooms) we recommend.

Going to visit Mrs. Alice my problems stood still and she felt worse and worse. Dr. Karachun diagnosed our son with Osgood's disease - Schlatter in his left knee. After 2 months of rehabilitation (2 - 3 times a week in a private office under the supervision of Dr. Karaczun) the knee stopped hurting and the doctor stated that the treatment is complete and the son can exercise. On the second day, the child returned from w - f lesson with the same knee pain as at the beginning of the disease. Dr. Karachun couldn't explain why the disease came back (supposedly he never had such a case) and recommended ... further rehabilitation. After another month of exercise there was no improvement and we decided to seek help elsewhere. During the first visit to a new physiotherapist we were informed that the child has a large contracture in the right knee and therefore the O-S disease in the left knee came back (because the right knee still bent weakens the left one). In fact, it was visible (it was enough to make the child stand up straight). We found out that without a cure of the right knee there is no chance to recover the left one. The new rehabilitation (once a week), which focused mainly on stretching the right knee and generally the whole body, removed the injury very quickly. We made an "oral complaint" to Dr. Karachun asking for reimbursement of the costs of the failed treatment. They told us about the course of the new rehabilitation and the reason why the disease came back. He did not agree with this opinion. He stated that the contraction of one knee has absolutely no effect on the condition of the other. They asked us to write this statement on a piece of paper - unfortunately he refused. They suggested that he should stand on a slightly bent knee in order to feel that the other knee is being put on (you don't have to be a doctor to say that). He also refused. Dr. Karachun only removed the effect of our son's left knee disease, so she came back. However, he did not remove the cause of this disease (right spasm) and therefore did not make a proper diagnosis. When we asked him why he didn't even look at the second (right) knee during the first visit, he answered that the patient didn't say anything, that he was in pain ... . Unfortunately, but the contraction does not hurt! Dr. Karachun, on the other hand, accused us that : 1) we treated our knee too shortly, 2) our son wanted to come back to the exercises so much that he lied (!!!!) after 2 meters of rehabilitation, that his knee no longer hurts, 3) once (before we started the treatment) they put a warm compress on our knee, which prolonged the treatment! We lost 3 months and about 3 thousand zlotys (4 private visits + 2 - 3 rehabilitation per week). We do not recommend visits to Dr. Karaczun at all.

The opening of the third B & B Hotels chain in Poland, in Wroclaw, is planned for the end of summer. "We hope that the hotel will open no later than September 1st this year. ” says Beatrice Bouchet, President of B & B Hotels Poland. A model room has already been built in the building, the hotel will soon be plastered and the installation of stone on the facade. In June the furnishing of rooms will start. B&B Wroclaw will offer a total of 140 rooms with air conditioning, free wireless Internet access and satellite TV. There will also be 40 parking spaces available to guests, almost half of which will be in the underground garage. On the ground floor of the building there will be a conference room. The hotel in Wroclaw will be the first B & B facility in Poland to offer such facilities.

Researchers from the Adam Mickiewicz University of Medical Sciences. Piastów Śląskich in Wrocław and the Department of Anthropology of the Polish Academy of Sciences ( Wrocław ) examined the severity of andropauzal symptoms in 232 men with NS systolic heart disease aged 40 - 80 and 362 healthy men of the same age. To assess the severity of andropauzal symptoms, the researchers used the Aging Males Symptoms Scale (AMS). In the 40-59 age group, andropauzal syndrome was much more common in men with heart failure compared to healthy men (28% and 7% respectively). In the 60 - 80 age group, on the other hand, andropauzal syndrome was equally common in men with NS and healthy men. As Wrocław researchers note, chronic heart disease probably accelerates the natural process of a man's aging, thus causing earlier occurrence of andropause symptoms.

Scientists have long known that the human brain adapts after injury or loss of vision. "The visual cortex of blind people loses its original function, but it does not remain inactive as it switches to, for example, touch reading and linguistic memory," says Dr. Szwed. Until now it has only been assumed that such reprogramming is also possible for people with disabilities, but there is no concrete evidence for this. Only simple studies have been carried out on the plasticity of the tactile cortex, during which the subjects practiced distinguishing between velvet and velour or corduroy. "For the first time ever, we are able to show that the brain of a healthy adult can be reorganised on such an enormous scale," he stresses. According to Dr . The Swede can also reorganize other parts of the brain in a similar way, not only the visual and tactile cortex. "One of the scientists showed his study a recording of the piano keys pressed, but without sound. The visual cortex, or the motor cortex, was activated by people watching the film who were not playing the piano, because they imagined what it would be like to move their fingers. Meanwhile, in the case of professional pianists, the auditory cortex was also active, even though they did not hear anything" - described Dr Szwed in an interview with PAP.

I don't recommend it if you have a complicated pregnancy. She is incompetent, she undermines the authority of other doctors, if she disagrees with something, she hovers and shouts. The first drugstores were ready already in 2011. Piotr Merks prepared them himself at home. In 2013 for the first small grant he conducted a pilot study in Radzymin near Warsaw . "He put on em nearly 9,000 of such drugstores. The effect was fantastic, because it proved that thanks to them patients make much fewer mistakes while taking medicines" - he explains . Finally, the project attracted the interest of the Gdańsk capital fund Black Pearls VC. On the basis of the idea, he created the company Piktorex, for which he obtained PLN 1 million from the BRIdge Alfa programme run by the National Centre for Research and Development. Piotr Merks became the project manager and in six months' time he wants to present the result of his work to the Ministry of Health.

Staying in this hotel is always a success. Spacious rooms, very nice service both at the reception and during meals always tasty and in sufficient choice. Among the consequences of untreated thyroid dysfunction in pregnant women, the gynaecologist mentioned heart failure and maternal hypertension, miscarriage, premature birth and higher perinatal mortality of newborns. Hyperthyroidism as much as nine times increases the risk of low body weight in a newborn, which is associated with a higher risk of metabolic disorders, such as diabetes, in the future. Untreated hypothyroidism threatens to delay the child's intrauterine development - when hypothyroidism is evident, it affects every fifth child. "Children of women who are untreated due to hypothyroidism in pregnancy are more likely to show delayed intellectual development, have greater problems with learning, speech, reading, motor development. They are four times more likely to have a low intelligence quotient, i.e. below 85" - mentioned the specialist.

In early July we visited the Charlotte Valley. They planned a visit to the zoo and then they wanted to have a tasty dinner at the restaurant (they remembered the good cuisine when they visited the place a few years ago). Unfortunately, the visit was not satisfactory to say the least. After entering and finding the table, we waited 10 minutes for anyone to come and give us the card. In vain. There were four tables occupied in the restaurant, but the waiter did not advise us to visit. He asked me for the card himself. After a while, the waiter caught up with us and said he'd serve us right away. Promises of tricks. It took another 10 minutes. When placing the order they asked us if it was possible to cook a small amount of pasta for our daughter (one year), especially since there were probably four types of paste in the menu. The Lord stated that "they do not play with such things" (literal quote). OK, not that. Normally they would have left the restaurant after such an answer, but we were hungry and the nearest restaurant was far away. After the order was placed, we waited 25 minutes to serve the soup. So we got our first course about 45 minutes after we arrived. The second dish came at a more reasonable time. As long as I could forgive the waiting time, the waiter's rudeness is not a gift. I sincerely advise against it. You can eat better and more pleasant in many places in Pomerania. There is also a curiosity - in the meantime a very famous sports commentator has entered the restaurant. He received the food earlier than we . Bravo

She treated four teeth, three of which were small, but with a tongue that could be felt. I don't know if it's a lack of precision / professionalism or rush. I didn't like it. The Euro 2012 tournament is history. There will be time for a tourist and hotel summary. The sports and hotel summary is short: the European champion for the next four years is the Spanish team, which had its accommodation base in the Mistral Sport Hotel in Gniewino. The runner-up is the Italian footballers who stayed at the Turówka Hotel in Wieliczka during the tournament. The prospects of organizing another football tournament of this or higher rank (more and more decision-makers have an appetite for the Mundial in 2022, perhaps the idea of organizing Winter Olympics together with the Slovaks will come to life) are foggy in Poland and are more in the sphere of wishes than realities. However, there are two other events "revolving" around the ball. Men's Volleyball World Cup - 2014 A four-year volleyball tournament is played every four years, which at the turn of November and December 2014 will take place in 6 Polish cities.

Holidays purchased in the Last MInute offer, I do not hide, because of a bit of compulsion due to holiday dates. Before departure, we have read the opinions of other holiday makers and I am sorry to say that many of the negative opinions were reflected during our stay. I will start from the beginning. Food . The first 4 days are a tragedy. Very small election, meals prepared from the rest of the earlier dishes. Don't be surprised by the spaghetti of kielbasa or the mixture of peas and corn. The dishes are very hard to digest, mostly with a large amount of oil. Cakes, weird, wet, poured oil. Drinks to choose from, served by the waiter - I had a strange impression that they were mixed with water. In case of ordering directly from the waiter - without reservation. Days 5 - 6 - 7 the food has improved. In general, there was a strange atmosphere during the food, both the chef and the bartender were watching the holidaymakers while putting on and eating. We felt a little confused. Hotel. From the outside it was very nice. Air conditioning paid, for 7 days - 42 euros. The Internet is supposed to be, and there is no Internet. Both in the morning and in the evening practically does not work. The slogan has changed with 16 times. For the password we go directly to the owner, who writes it to our phone or laptop. I am not able to determine the quality of the link between 9 am and 7 pm because we were not in the resort. Due to the poor sewage system, the toilet paper is not drained but thrown into the garbage. What is more, we had a terrible problem with ants in our room. The furnishings of the room's interior are very good. Modest and tasteful. The owner is very kind and helpful. The stay itself I rate well . A little attention to the purchase of tours . The bus does not drive and does not drive directly to the center . Most of the bus journeys end at the bus stop, there are 200 - 300 meters to go on foot.

After the transaction, the investors did not hide the fact that their goal is not only to restore the former glory of the hotel opened for the first time in 1857, but also to make it the most luxurious hotel in Poland. "We already have all the documents necessary to implement this project. The total cost of the renovation is estimated at 65 million euros. About one third of the costs will be covered by the new investor, Takami Holding, and the remaining two thirds will be obtained from external sources. "Trichloroethylene can reach our organisms while eating, bathing or even inhaling," says Dr. Anna Śrębowata (IPC PAS). As she adds, in small quantities this compound causes stomach pains and vomiting. However, if its concentration in water exceeds the norm for a long time, liver, heart and brain damage can occur, as well as the development of cancer, especially leukaemia, lymphoma and bladder cancer. "The methods of fast and cheap removal of trichloroethylene from the water are therefore of great social importance," he says. Speaking of research details, doctoral student Isabella I . Kamińska (IPC PAS) explains that organic chlorine compounds can be removed from water using a reaction known as hydrochlorination. "It uses small amounts of hydrogen and an appropriately selected catalyst, usually palladium. The reaction occurs where organic chlorine compounds in the water are transformed into non-toxic substances - saturated and unsaturated hydrocarbons. In the case of the reaction with trichloroethylene, these are ethane and ethylene," he says .

Disneyland visited us in June 2014 and the hotel booked us in the winter promotion half a year earlier. The price was really attractive and the stay was very successful. From the hotel you could walk to both Disney parks. We could also take a walk in the surrounding park and by an artificial lake. We stayed in the family room in one of the Sequoia Lodge Hotel buildings. The room was big enough for the four of us, clean - cleaned daily, and the children were delighted with the Mickey Mouse head-shaped soaps; ) For breakfast we went to the main building a few tens of meters away from "our" building and I must say it was a pleasant morning walk among the greenery. Breakfast was rather varied - everyone could choose something for themselves. The children liked the French croissants. The biggest attraction, however, was the visit of Disney characters, with whom you could take a picture, and for an extra charge you could have breakfast with them, but we did not use this option. We also did not use the swimming pool, although there was such a possibility. The service was very helpful and kind. We communicated without any problems in English, as our French leaves a lot to be desired, while people from all over Europe work there, so you can communicate without any problems in other languages too. We have often heard Spanish, German and Italian. To sum up - a very good hotel for a family with small children - despite its size, it maintains peace and quiet for its guests. I recommend it!

My impressions from the first visit to your doctor. The doctor interviewed me in great detail about my ailment. He analyzed the results of the research (the whole history over 5 years) and explained in detail the interpretation of these results, he also presented various possibilities of the cause of the disease. He set the course of treatment (including the possibility of modifying the medication depending on how I feel while taking it) and indicated the diet that should be used in case of my condition. He also indicated additional examinations which I should perform and regular examinations before my next visit. Over the past 5 years, I have been visited by many haematologists and all of them have acted very templates for my condition, and my condition has not improved as templates as it should. The doctor, on the other hand, considered her various causes not so obvious that other doctors did not pay attention to at all. As for the visit itself, the doctor listened to me very carefully and did not rush at all, explained in detail and made sure that everything he said was well understood, felt very well taken care of. After the first visit I think that the doctor is worth recommending.

At the Friday's press conference summarizing the cross-border project "Telemedicine in the Euroregion of Pomerania - Pomerania Network" the Rector of the Pomeranian Medical University in Szczecin prof. Przemysław Nowacki said that the cooperation in the creation of telemedicine network concerns two German regions: Mecklenburg - Vorpommern and Brandenburg and Polish West Pomerania. As Nowacki explained, "the project involves the transport of data, which will be used primarily in the diagnosis of selected areas. According to the principle: let the data travel, not the patients " . "This region, both on the Polish and German sides, is poor in people. Large agglomerations, which have a dense medical network, hardly exist here. Therefore, it will be extremely important to be able to transport data electronically, on the basis of which specialists in selected places could read them and make reliable diagnoses," he explained.

This hotel offers very good value for money. The location is good: there is a lift in the hotel which stops at the back exit of the hotel near the central part of Torremolinos. The beach can be reached in a few minutes from the front entrance of the hotel. The swimming pool is nice and I have not had any problems with renting a sunbed, although I admit that I was not there during the peak holiday season. I can't say a word about the restaurant because we didn't eat there once. They preferred to go to nearby restaurants instead, which are very different and much cheaper than 15 euros from the person that we would have to spend in the hotel restaurant (not counting drinks). It was a bit noisy here because of the large group of Scandinavians staying here, but they moved out after a few days and the hotel was quiet again. Our rooms were very clean and we didn't have any problems with cockroaches or insects, about which I read in other reviews. If you are looking for something cheap, in a positive atmosphere, this hotel is for you, but if you expect 5-star quality for little money, you will be very disappointed.

He spent 2 nights at the hotel with his family. We stayed in a suite superior room, which consists of a living room and a bedroom connected by a sliding door. The suite is very well equipped. There is a tea and coffee set, a richly stocked minibar (prices are not excessive), a shoe cleaner, a small safe, two telephone sets, bathrobes and slippers. The room is fresh and modern. The bathroom has a wide range of cosmetics and cosmetic accessories and weight. Very good breakfasts. Nice service at the reception and restaurant. The hotel has a very good location, only 20 minutes walk from the heart of the Old Town. At the hotel there is a spacious guarded car park at a reasonable price. This is a very good middle class city hotel. I will be happy to return there.

Nice design, intuitive operation, touch panel working efficiently. A very good idea is the possibility of mounting the power supply with a relay at the stove and the panel itself on the wall - so you do not have to think about where to hide the power supply. Now the downside: the temperature sensor protrudes outside the housing. I suppose that this is not how it was supposed to look in the original design. When wiping the dust this sensor can be damaged . Another thing is calibration . Measurement at first connection is 4 degrees apart, it is too much. I understand the degree or half but not 4 . Another drawback is the loud operation of the inverter inside the panel and the annoying buzzing of the panel which can be heard at night - even with the display switched off. The last downside is that you can't turn off the panel clicking when you press , which when you try to change the temperature at night acts like an alarm clock for the person sleeping next to you. Anyway, a cool product.

After a year of therapy we managed to catch up, the daughter was happy to go to classes but the most important thing for me was that from visit to visit you could see the effects of "our" work. I highly recommend

We strongly advise against this doctor. We've been sent to Dr. Sphere with azoospermia. The doctor considered the possible cause and made a diagnosis: infection (despite the absence of any symptoms of infection) and prescribed an antibiotic. He did not ask whether there were cases of male infertility in the family. Despite our questions about what, apart from infection, can be the cause of azoospermia, he did not say a word about genetic causes. He did not commission any tests except for another semen test. Since we have read that a common cause of azoosperm is genetic defects, we performed a deletion test on the Y chromosome (AZF) and the genetic cause was confirmed. A visit to this doctor did not bring us any closer to a proper diagnosis of the problem.

Great service in the looby, canteen manager - a wonderful guy! Rooms cleaned every day, people smiling forever. The animator was nice but pushy every now and then she tried to persuade everyone to play boring games such as archery or darts - when they wanted us to play darts at a different time than she let us just got banned - mega dagger rules despite the lack of interest in games. Near the hotel there is a market, car rental, travel agency for local tours. To the beach about 10 minutes walk - the one closer to the hotel unfortunately is not suitable for bathing. But, but! You do not go to Tenerife for a stay in the hotel! We visited the island in a car rental - it was mega, and even divine!

We spent only one night in the hotel, which is a pity, because we would have liked to use the pool and spa. The hotel is located by the exit road from Busko-Zdrój. The basic rooms could be larger. Cleanliness without any problems. Very comfortable double bed and good quality bedding. In the bathroom we were happy with a platform for a child. Pleasant cosmetics . Additional duvet, bathrobes, slippers etc. in the wardrobe. Mineral water from the Buss in the room . Free, efficient Wifi . Nice service . Wide selection of teas, muesli and additives (chia, thistle, goji seeds, etc) for yoghurt. Many traditional and regional products. The hotel restaurant is definitely worth a visit, the dishes from the card are excellent. During the holiday season, the youngest were thought of, in the "orangery" adjacent to the restaurant behind a glass door, an inflatable "castle" with a slide, coloring books and crayons, various "wonders" conjured up from balloons for children! However, as the psychologist added, even if exorcists refer the applicant to a psychiatric consultation, it often focuses on determining whether it is possible to talk about a mental illness. Meanwhile, sudden changes in behaviour and identity may be associated with completely different clinical entities, which are poorly diagnosed in Poland. "Such a person may be more likely to suffer from dissociative disorders (related to trauma) or personality disorders," she says. He adds that among people redirected from exorcists there may also be neurotic people who experience conflicts over the desire for support and attention from others. And he points out that psychological help for a person will look different in each of these cases. EXORCISMS AND TRAUMAS

I warn everyone about this object. In July 2014 I had three rooms reserved there with private bathrooms for one night. The hotel chose em as a place to stay, returning from southern Europe to Poland. I wanted to take a bath, have dinner and get some sleep after a dozen or so hours of driving. They came to em about 20 - 21 . Before receiving the keys I had to pay for the reservation of 3 rooms according to the price given on Booking-u . After paying the bartender we were led to the rooms, the road led by narrow stairs to the floor - stairs covered with carpet which was dirty and smelled terrible. It turned out that one room with a bathroom and two rooms with a shared bathroom were waiting for us. The shared bathroom was dirty. He started to make a complaint to me . We were told that there are no other rooms and we have to wait for the owner. After more than an hour of waiting it turned out that this bartender had forgotten his English, he became an ironic wise man and turned his back on the person who tried to talk to him. On a clear and firm request to talk to the owner, he appeared before 23 . 00 . He demanded confirmation of the reservation in paper form and did not respect the electronic version. Further attempts to explain the wrong booking were unsuccessful. We were tired after 18 hours of driving and we were still 600km away from home from the early morning hours. The owner did not offer any alternative solution and compensation, we did not even receive a bill. Before midnight there was no point in looking for other places to stay. They put us to sleep. Repeated complaints by Booking do not bring any result - the owner denies his mistake. A clear mistake because there are no 3 rooms with bathrooms in the guesthouse. There are only two such rooms but he charged for three rooms with bathrooms. I warn everyone against this object. There are many beautiful guesthouses around but we saw it only in the morning when we left this town.

Meanwhile, scientists from several countries - Denmark, the USA, Belgium, Poland and Sweden - have described the hitherto unknown defence mechanisms that occur in the vaginal mucosa in contact with the herpes virus type 2 (HSV - 2). These mechanisms start to occur within the first day of the virus's appearance on the mucous membrane. Until now, as far as the vaginal mucosa is concerned, only defensive mechanisms have been known to appear 48 hours after contact with the pathogen. "The mechanism that we examined the mucous membrane is triggered very early - even before the virus enters the cells of the body," says the PAP interlocutor and adds that the herpes virus is recognized at the stage of physical contact, on the mucous membrane surface.
