I read these very positive opinions, she used to give them to me herself and only now I know how wrong she was and she didn't know much. Now that my son is dead, she realized to me that medicine is often helpless and doctors make mistakes. They lose their routine and conviction of their own infallibility, bordering on conceit. Because such was the case of my son. He was operated on 3 years ago by Dr. Papierz, and effectively left the hospital with the hope for further life. Soon, headaches appeared, more and more frequent and persistent. His son repeatedly visited Dr Papierz's private office, reporting the above mentioned ailments. Each time they were underestimated, associated with the psychological experience of the Son and postoperative trauma or a common cold. He did not receive any specific help, not even basic examinations were carried out. The headaches returned, making normal everyday life impossible. At the end of July and the beginning of August, he was not able to get any help. At the turn of July and August last year (one month after the visit in Dr Papierz's office) his son with the loss of consciousness and huge headache found himself again in the Department of Neurosurgery in Szp. After a CT scan it turned out that the previously established valve and ventricular drain is completely infected with bacteria, not excluding the possibility of hospital-acquired bacteria. It was necessary to remove the drain as the health condition of the son was deteriorating. The operation was performed at the beginning of August and the hospital. The operation was unsuccessful. As a result of the blood flow to the brain (approx. 400 ml), reoperation was necessary. As a result of the operation, a significant part of the skull was removed and external drainage was installed. The son's health condition deteriorated significantly after the operation, he did not move, did not make any contact with the environment, actually remained in a coma. Strong antibiotic therapy was taken in order to fight the infection, but despite the treatment, the Son's condition did not improve. We did not completely lose hope for his recovery. The fight lasted over 5 months. In December last . In December last year, an abscess was built in the place where he was operated. The digestive disorders appeared and he was artificially fed. It was getting worse every day. My son died on January 9th, b . r. although the brain work stopped about two weeks earlier. He was only 30 years old and had his whole life ahead of him. He had his Love. I will forever remain convinced that this could have been prevented, that this death could have been avoided if the right diagnosis had been made earlier, if he had been listened to, if he had been given due weight to his complains. . . . .if. . . . . . .if. . . . . . . . .if. . . . . .

We went to Madeira in March. A very successful trip, a beautiful picturesque island. The hotel met our expectations. A clean, neat hotel for a decent price. If someone was accommodated in a 2 standard room it may have different feelings a little tight and you can hear the neighbors but it is clean and not the worst conditions. We chose an apartment with sea views for an extra charge and were very pleased with the peace and quiet and beautiful sea view. Average food, especially dinners here can give a small minus. Location of the hotel in a very good place with access to the sandy yellow beach (which is rare in Madeira) in the town of Machico - good access to communication, you can also rent a taxi (which is not missing here next to the hotel) and for a good price to visit the island. I would return to this hotel once again.

Using a printer, the PŁ unit applies electrically conductive ink - which may contain e.g. silver compounds - to the surface of non-wovens or fabrics and activates it accordingly. Thanks to this solution the electrodes adhere well to the skin and the user has no problem with applying and removing them. Apart from that no parts of the electrodes stick out of the clothes and this was a problem in case of other ways of connecting the electrodes with clothes. As prof . Krzysztof Gniotek points out that such textile electrodes could be used e.g. in orthoses (used for joint damage), socks or shirt pullers. The most important application of electrodes would be to use them in electrotherapy - there the electrodes must remain on the patient's body for a longer time, so hiding them in clothes could be more comfortable for the user.

As Dr. Rudnicka points out, more and more consumers are looking critically at what they are buying and paying attention to how it is produced and how it impacts the environment. Therefore, the demand and supply of organic products continues to grow and their prices are falling. The market for organic products is also growing and nowadays, instead of looking for e.g. organic food in specialist shops, it is increasingly possible to buy it in local shops. "As more and more of these products are available on the market, their price is starting to decrease, thus achieving economies of scale. Considering the last few years, these are the products whose prices have come close to or even equalled those of conventional products" - noted Dr Rudnicka.

It can only be assumed that if it had not been for Euro 2012, taking into account the average increase in the number of trips expected by the World Tourism Organisation (UNWTO) this year of 4%, in June our country's accommodation base would have benefited from approx. 486 thousand foreign tourists. Therefore, additional traffic caused by Euro 2012 would amount to only 60 thousand tourists. It can be added for the sake of protection that the data of the Central Statistical Office are underestimated because they do not take into account those tourists who stayed in private flats, apartments or accommodation facilities which are not in the Central Statistical Office database. In fact, foreign tourists in June this year could have been a few, several thousand more.

I strongly advise against it! ! ! ! I have the worst possible feeling about this lady. I don't knowingly call her a doctor. Then we went to the Oncology Centre in Ursynów - there we found many fantastic doctors. And there she learned from the staff many not interesting things about Mrs. Kozakiewicz. . Trilogies too. The book is the last volume of the Hussite Trilogy and it would be said that the end ends with the work, but . . . Well, that's right. The author probably exaggerated. He multiplied the threads in the second part and added more and more, and trying to close them all in one volume, he got terribly excited about the action. Every page on the main character lurks a new danger, it is so full of it that the novel, instead of being drawn in, starts to irritate. I admit frankly, when in one chapter the main character was every and every move by someone kidnapped, my irritation reached a boiling point. Well, how much can you? ! Yes, as if Sapkowski tried to break the record in the accumulation of climaxes per page of text . These adventures, into which he put his protagonist, would have been enough for two volumes instead of one, and thanks to that the reading would not be annoying instead of happy. No novel can consist only of climaxes, it harms the reader, like an excess of candy in the diet, and a similar effect - the reader overeats and that's it. Fortunately, there are also good sides to it. Our hero finally grows up, gets bearable, sometimes he even gets to like himself. The historical background is still great, you can still see an in-depth knowledge of the author. The language of the novel is simply excellent, the descriptions of the horrors of war are stuck in the memory. And what has fun, is fun. The fantasy is also a little bit more, as if in previous volumes. In a word, everything would be fine if the author did not exaggerate with the climaxes.

I have just come back from holidays in this hotel and after analyzing the whole stay I can say with a clear conscience that the hotel does not deserve 5 stars at most a strong 3, 5 stars (the staff itself admits that this is a 4 star hotel). Clean rooms are cleaned daily. The only downside is the blocked air conditioning (centrally controlled - you can only turn it on and off). There is also no dvd, which according to the description is in the room (this did not bother us because the holiday also belongs to the television). The swimming pools located in the hotel are small but with a lot of chlorine. CateringMonitorial Breakfast is monotonous but as in most hotels. Dinners served in the main restaurant if someone likes fast food is ok (always fries, peree, no groats, rice.). Repeated menus such as chicken, spaghetti, casserole etc. every day. The advantage is a large selection of salads and ripe fruits (oranges, watermelons, melons, cherries, strawberries, peaches, bananas, apples, fruit salad). Dinner repeat dishes from lunch only with a small modification. What is not eaten during lunch is processed and served again (on the one hand, the food is not wasted, but for a hotel like a 5-star hotel, such things should not take place rather). Thematic dinners for which you have to sign up at the reception desk are not a revelation - because they are served the same as in the main restaurant. The same thing is true for the Italian, barbecue and Greek dinners. The corner of the children's food is visible - but I personally saw 'em there eating only once for the children during the week and it was the same as for adults. Aqua park is probably raised by it is the hotel standard to 5 stars . Slides super very safe . The staff rigorously follows the growth of the child who can take advantage of the attraction. The rapid river is cool, but I wouldn't recommend using it right away from the opening, because we saw the dwarfs pouring in from the big chlorine canisters in the morning, smell unpleasant, so let the chlorine mix a little bit with the water. Eating in the bar is good although sometimes the pizza dough with very much yeast. Ask for warm French fries best served straight from the kitchen, as those at the bar are often cool and tasteless soaked in oil. Fruit salad is very good, large pieces of fruit.

She didn't have a surgery with Dr. . Obidzinski, which I am very happy about. I am a young girl with fast moving deformity of her feet . As a result of parents' negligence, she did not wear my orthotics as a child and then it was too late. The orthopaedist to whom I went for a consultation without any doubts directed me to a corrective procedure, ensuring that it will essentially improve not only the aesthetics of the feet, but also the comfort of life (discomfort with long walking, spinal pains, problem with choosing shoes). Unfortunately, Dr . Obidzinski not only was of a different opinion, but also expressed it in a very obsessive way. At first he told me very vividly about the worst sides of the procedure, which I was able to understand because of the patient's duty to make her aware. However, I felt that he wanted to intimidate me more than to make me aware of it. When I decided to undergo the procedure, the doctor suggested that some patients would need a psychiatrist instead of a foot deformity procedure. Because they live in the conviction that if they "repair" their feet, they will finally find the only one, or maybe it is not the feet that are the problem? As a result, I was not only intimidated, but humiliated. Clearly, the doctor has no idea about the daily painful imprints on the feet and the pain in the foot, which is the result of progressive deformation (despite wearing insoles). I went to the doctor with a source of health problems and complexes - my feet are really bent, and the doctor decided to level the young girl, the patient with the floor level. She didn't decide to have a surgery with Dr. . Obidzinski .

Astoria is a hotel well located in the center of Lviv. The most important advantages beyond the location? The Centre for the Treatment of Obesity and Metabolic Diseases opened on Monday at the Centre for Invasive Medicine of the Medical University of Gdansk ( GUMed ) . The University assures that it will be "a unique unit in which the patient will be cared for by top class specialists throughout the entire path of treatment of metabolic diseases and obesity - from the moment of qualification and preparation for surgery, surgery and post-operative care". Social ombudsman for the rights of people suffering from obesity in Poland, President of the Foundation OD - WAGA Magdalena Gajda there is no doubt that such centres are needed in Poland, because ok . 70% . Poles are overweight or obese. "It's about 26-27 million people," she added. She said that the country is ok. There are 30 bariatric surgery centres (surgical treatment of obesity), which perform surgeries reimbursed by the National Health Fund. "We have only 8% of primary care physicians who know what obesity is about," she added. She stressed that the Centre will deal not only with patients with huge obesity who require surgical treatment, but also with patients who are overweight or suffer from obesity of the 1st and 2nd degree, for whom it is necessary to implement long-term treatment.

The training will be conducted by Krzysztof Głąbiński , President of Yieldplanet.com . The training cycle in Poland begins with the program "Revenue Management - All Its Aspects" . It is addressed to hotel owners, hotel managers, directors and managers as well as sales, marketing and Revenue Managers and people thinking about their own accommodation facilities. It is a complete course for every hotelier who explains what Revenue Management is, what his or her place in the hotel is, what measures, how it counts and how it translates into tactical and strategic hotel behaviour. For those interested, there is an official exam which, if passed, entitles them to receive a training certificate issued by EI.

The only hotel group that has seen a decline is the German TUI Hotels & Resorts. Their replacement by modern chains is only partial. The share of hotel groups, despite the shrinking market, is growing. The development of franchising leads to an increase in the number of facilities and rooms in chains at the expense of independent hotels. She added that these epilepsy can be very effectively treated and do not leave any defects in the form of cognitive impairment in children. Children simply grow up with them. Prof . Steinborn pointed out that the treatment of epilepsy is generally dependent on what kind of seizures accompany it and with what frequency they occur. There are epilepsy which does not require any treatment at all because seizures are extremely rare - they occur once or twice in a lifetime. But in some cases epilepsy is associated with dozens of seizures per day, and this significantly increases the risk of mental impairment of the child and worsens its prognosis. "The more frequent the seizures, the higher the risk of disability," said the epileptologist.

I have to divide my assessment of the treatment of Mr. Arkadiusz's crooked nasal septum into two categories. The effectiveness of the treatment is assessed as 5 / 5, here I can not have any objections. However, the comfort of the treatment itself is an exclamation point. The operation took place in C . M . Sanitas in Lublin . I have to admit that lying down on the operating table on my own, without any sedatives, is not a pleasant experience, and even more so a recurring consciousness during the operation, at the end of which I felt clear pain. I had no idea at the time that I was being operated on, and the voices I heard were the conversations of the operating team. The very fact that I was leaving the anaesthesia was also very unpleasant, and I tried to wake up by very bluntly speaking commands to which I was not able to react. It was a very unpleasant feeling, I had no idea what was happening to me and why someone was putting pressure on me to finally wake up when I couldn't even nod, say a word or make contact in any other way. The pain after waking up was very clear, when it started to get worse after the second ketone drip, I didn't get any more painkillers even though I was being asked for them. The "how it hurts, i.e. that he is alive" was said with a smile on the nurse's lips, who later also exerted pressure to leave the bed more quickly at the end of his stay, even though he didn't feel like he was still able to get home a few hours after surgery. When I was finally expelled, the pain intensified to such an extent that all night long I walked around the house and groaned 'em, which probably made me vomit for a while. For 2 weeks I felt terrible, I had no strength for anything, most of the time lying in bed with a high temperature. After the surgery I was still at Mr. Arkady's, several times, on pulling out the setons, 2x on removing stitches and pulling out the "plates" which hurt as if someone tried to pull out the ones at the top. The "anaesthesiologist did not want to give you any more anaesthetics, so that waking up would take less time" was really pathetic. A few days ago I was operated on at WIM in Warsaw because of acromegaly and I must admit that the tuitaj treatment is pure pleasure compared to your surgery. Unfortunately, but it will not recommend you to anyone, despite the experience that you cannot refuse. Nevertheless, I greet you and wish you to draw conclusions from my opinion.

The opening of a four-star hotel Słoneczny Zdrój Medical Spa & Wellness in Busko-Zdrój is planned for spring 2013. The building will have 116 rooms and four suites, 50% of which will have balconies or terraces. The building will have 3 conference rooms, a restaurant, patio, night club, swimming pool. An additional advantage of the facility will be the Medical Spa center and Wellness Zone with a total of 30 offices equipped with the latest equipment. Construction of the facility began in October 2011. Currently, the investment is in the phase of completion of reinforced concrete and masonry works, and the next step will be the roof truss. The main investor is Grupa Polskie Składy Budowlane S . A . The main investor is Grupa Polskie Składy Budowlane S . A . and the general contractor is Condite company from Kielce. The Polish Construction S . A . A . Group, based in Wełecz near Busko-Zdrój, has been operating on the market for 14 years, is the largest and fastest growing network of building materials wholesalers and home and garden markets in Poland. At present, the Group associates 296 small and medium-sized family companies from all over Poland, which trade in more than 420 construction warehouses, 103 PSB - Mrówka stores and 8 PSB - Profi shopping centres.

In May, pioneering operations to implant pacemakers in people in coma were carried out in the Olsztyn hospital by the team of prof. Wojciech Maksymowicz's team under the direction of Japanese neurosurgeon Prof. Isao Morit (he performed about 300 such operations in Japan). Professor Morita was brought to Poland by the Ewa Błaszczyk Foundation " Akogo ? " The stimulators for patients were provided free of charge by their producer - Boston Scientific Poland. Surgery consists in opening the spinal canal and then inserting an electrode over the spinal cord hard tyre. To this electrode current flows from the stimulator, which is placed on the patients trunk. The current from the pacemaker through the electrode is to effectively irritate the brainstem structure. The stimulator is connected to the electrode by a wire running under the skin.

He defended his master's thesis in chemistry in 1965 at the California Institute of Technology. Then, as a Fulbright scholar, he spent a year at the Institut de Biologie Physico - Chimique in Paris. In 1970 he received his doctorate in biophysics from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. As part of his postdoctoral studies, he conducted genetic research at the University of Edinburgh ( Scotland ) for three years. He himself judged that it was a wonderful time, both from a personal and professional point of view. In 1974 he joined the staff of Brandeis University in Waltham (Massachusetts), with which he is still associated today. At this university, Rosbash began to carry out genetic research on the mechanisms of the biological clock, i.e. the perimeter rhythms, in living organisms. In 1984, together with this year's second Nobel Prize winner - a colleague and friend Jeff Hall - they cloned the gene that controls the biological clock of the Drosophila melanogaster fruit fly. They named it period ( in short per ) . Daily changes in protein levels, which encodes the gene, regulate the rhythm of activity and sleep of flies in the period approx. 24 hours.

As Dr. Kozajda emphasizes, genetic background and environmental exposure to chemical agents, including mainly exhaust fumes and other pollutants in the indoor and outdoor air, have a significant impact on the occurrence of allergies. These pollutants also include factors of biological origin, including animals and house dust mites, and their allergens, as well as the moisture and fungus in the apartments due to improper use of the houses. The Lodz IMP conducted tests in 50 flats of one- and two-year-old children in Lodz. The researchers examined dust settled from the floor of the living and children's rooms and from children's cots, taken from mattresses and bedding. Dust samples were collected using a vacuum cleaner with a special head equipped with a filter, on which the dust was deposited.

FOR FOUR YEARS, MY HUSBAND AND I HAVE BEEN TRYING TO GET A CHILD. AND DURING THOSE FOUR YEARS, A LOT HAS HAPPENED IN OUR LIVES. THERE WERE VERY BEAUTIFUL MOMENTS (WHEN IT TURNED OUT THAT I WAS PREGNANT) AND THERE WERE BITTER TEARS (WHEN SHE MISCARRIED THE FIRST PREGNANCY, THEN THE SECOND.) BUT WE STILL STICK TOGETHER AND STILL HAVE NO INTENTION OF GIVING UP. WE BLANKET OURSELVES STRONGLY AND WANT THE FRUIT OF OUR LOVE TO BE A CHILD. NOT SO LONG AGO, ABOUT SIX MONTHS AGO, WE HAD ENOUGH. BUT THANKS TO DOCTOR ZIĘTKOWIAK, OUR LIVES HAVE SUDDENLY CHANGED. WE HAVE SO MUCH ENTHUSIASM TO FULFILL OUR DREAM, SO MUCH FAITH AND STRENGTH THAT SOMETIMES WE FEEL LIKE MOVING MOUNTAINS. THIS IS A MAN WHO WILL EXPLAIN EVERYTHING SO THOROUGHLY THAT EVEN SOMEONE WHO KNOWS NOTHING AT ALL WILL UNDERSTAND IT. AND HE HAS THE ANGELIC PATIENCE TO DO SO. AND THIS IS A FEATURE THAT VERY FEW MEN HAVE. I REALLY RECOMMEND HIM. I'VE ALREADY VISITED A LOT OF DOCTORS AND I ASSURE YOU THAT DOCTOR ZIĘTKOWIAK WILL BE COMING TO THOSE WITH A VOCATION.

For years, scientists have been looking for a therapist who could stop or delay polyglutamine diseases. Such illnesses are ok. In Poland, Huntington's syndrome occurs on average in one in 15 thousand people. But the genetic core of polyglutamine diseases is the same for all. Therefore, the development of a therapist who recognizes the same mutation could help a large group of patients. "The DNA consists of 4 letters - C , A , G , T . The core of the disease is an elongated sequence of three letters CAG within the damaged genes. Repetitions in the DNA chain occur naturally. For the huntingtin gene there are usually less than ok . 35 . With a mutation of this gene in Huntington's disease, the number of repetitions can reach as many as 150 sequences of the trinucleotide CAG sequence" - explains Anna Stroynowska - Czerwińska .

I'm a dozen or so months after the operation on my lumbar disc. Nowadays I have no major problems, although sometimes I feel moderate pain, especially if I sit a lot and have a seated mode of operation. I went to the physiotherapist because I wanted to return to systematic strengthening and preventive exercises. Zygmunt recommended me to another valued physiotherapist as a specialist in stabilization exercises. First, Zygmunt made a very detailed interview and got acquainted with the medical documentation. He gave himself time to prepare an action plan, which he then discussed in detail. Additionally, he explained to me the essence of my ailment and the way of working on it. He implemented the exercises gradually, as far as I was able and the progress was made. This gives me a sense of security and full control over what we do. Of course, the effectiveness of the therapy is very much up to me, i.e. the more I exercise, the better. Zygmunt tries to mobilize for systematic exercises. He likes to talk and always patiently explains the issues of anatomy, functioning of our body and specificity of ailments. Moreover, there is always good telephone contact with him. In conclusion, I strongly recommend Zygmunt as a professional and effective physiotherapist.

THIS DOUBLE ALBUM IS A SCANDAL! ! ! The visit to your doctor (in a private subscription clinic!) lasted. . . 8 minutes ! Despite an empty waiting room. The doctor asked me what I was coming with. She said that with hypertension, accelerated heart rate, chest pain. He asked if I was taking any medication for this, she answered that I was not at the moment, but I had taken it before. He didn't even ask what kind. She told me about family cardiac problems. No reaction. When asked if she was chronically ill, she answered m that yes and to what. No questions about the ailments and the drugs she was taking. Oh, there was a question if I smoke cigarettes (no); but about my lifestyle, alcohol etc ... no more. The doctor examined my blood pressure (he didn't even give me a value), listened to my heart for a dozen or so seconds ( ! ) and then found that I had hypertension and tachycardia. Here she shyly mentioned that on the last two ekg (at the occupational doctor, who noticed a big problem and even questioned my ability to work! and the family doctor) there were irregularities. The doctor even looked at me and did not ask what kind of abnormalities. Without asking about other medications taken, allergies to medications, after listening to the heart and examining the blood pressure (the same is done by the family doctor) etc. He wrote down a prescription for one medicine and had it come next month. He was very happy to give a referral to the ekg to do it immediately before the next visit. No interest, no diagnosis, no research. I went to your doctor encouraged by good opinions, hoping that since I have already broken down and I want to start treating the ailment that I have been struggling with for a few years (which she said to me), I will be able to count on the diagnosis (after all, I pay this subscription for something and it is the highest) and serious approach to the subject. It turned out that my family doctor is more careful with it. I do not recommend.
She is very nice, student friendly, cheerful, with a great sense of humor, she teaches very well, she doesn't like it only when someone doesn't try and expects a grade".

Dr. Jaskolski was my dentist for over four years. However, after my last visit I decided to change my specialist . Initially, I was delighted with the professionalism, approach to the patient and the prices were reasonable. Since Dr. Jaskólski hired an assistant the prices went up very much, the atmosphere broke down and I am starting to have doubts about the quality. The whole thing is that this is a doctor who is supposed to cure my teeth and not entertain me with conversation so I won't complain about the atmosphere. Prices initially with anesthesia were in the range of 100 - 150 zł, from the moment the assistant was hired, she never came down m below 150 zł and recently took a risk m and took the treatment without anesthesia and paid m 170 zł, a little bit more so as the hole was reportedly not large and on one surface. To the doctor is very long waiting time because at least 2 months, very rarely you enter on time (I do not mean here 5 or 10 minutes because it is normal but sometimes the delay occurs even to an hour). I am a person who rather cares about the teeth, so my surprise was huge when, after the treatment at Dr. Jaskólski's, I went to the orthodontist to put on the braces and she heard that first I have to cure the caries. To correct this, it was mainly secondary caries under the fillings from the years of my youth, but as a professional, which Dr. Jaskólski considered me to be, I should pay attention to and deal with this problem. I would like to mention that she did not believe my opinion and went to two other dentists to verify the condition of my dentition. Unfortunately, both confirmed the need to replace 6 - 8 fillings (the discrepancy in the number is due to the poor quality of panoramic pictures that all doctors had to see (by the way, I advise against taking pictures in Fordon on Fiedler - very nice lady but poor pictures). ) The caries were visible "with the naked eye" in 5 cases and the others when looking at the picture, the dentists said that they suspected that the tooth was broken but were not 100% sure. I understand that the prices are going up, I understand that the patient is not a colleague to talk to, I understand that there may be a delay, that the specialist is waiting but noticing the caries, I do not understand and do not accept.

Hotel at a very high level. 85% of products consumed in developed countries are processed products containing too much sugar, fat and salt . They contribute to a dramatic increase in the number of obese people, which has doubled worldwide over the last twenty years. "Since there is so much talk about diets, healthy lifestyles, many of us are trying to comply with restrictive calorie regimes. We have a lot of low-fat products on the market. However, it turns out that when we subtract fat from them, this creamy texture that it provides disappears. A good example is full-fat yoghurt, which has a characteristic taste and texture. However, its version with less fat and calories is much less popular, among other things because it is watery and does not taste the same," says PAP Dr Izabela Gładkowska-Balewicz from the University of Leicester and the University of Birmingham.

R . M . : Genetic recombination in bacteria . If the bacteria take their genes from the environment, new strains, new varieties are created . The most interesting question is where these new genes come from and where this diversity comes from. This is part of the project that I will be carrying out. The hypothesis is that they come from closely related bacteria, good bacteria that do not harm us. This hypothesis raises many questions. Because it turns out that you can't separate the good from the bad bacteria, there is no black and white in nature, in microbiology and medicine. So how to cure and fight the bacteria that cause diseases if they can exchange genes with good bacteria? What is a species of bacteria, if they often exchange genes and new species are created? These are questions on the borderline between evolutionary biology and medicine that are not yet answered. Magdalena Richter spoke to me.

The specialist pointed out that the main electrolyte lost with sweat is sodium, however, its concentration can vary greatly among athletes and can range from 200 to over 2000 mg/l. "Therefore, some people should use drinks with an increased sodium content, unfortunately most mineral waters provide it in negligible quantities, which is why drinks for athletes often come in handy," he explained. Prof . Edward Franek from the Department of Internal Medicine, Endocrinology and Diabetology of the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Administration Hospital in Warsaw argued that when it comes to daily fluid replenishment - it is best to drink water. "Sweetened drinks (also sweetened water) are not recommended both in diabetics due to their high sugar content and in people without diabetes, because they increase the risk of this disease" - he added.

In July 2012, 7177 collective accommodation facilities were registered in the Central Statistical Office database. This is 1.96% more facilities than the year before . In total, these facilities offered accommodation, i.e. 3.39% more than in July 2011. The number of establishments offering accommodation in the first half of 2012 is based on the information presented by the Central Statistical Office "Accommodation base as of 31 July and its use in the first half of 2012" . The most numerous group among collective accommodation facilities were hotel facilities, which were 3,414 . On the other hand, the most numerous group among hotel facilities, similarly as in previous years, were hotels, whose CSO recorded 2,014, i.e. by 7% more than in 2011. The largest number of hotels was recorded by the Central Statistical Office (GUS) when it recorded 1 883 hotels. The second group, in terms of the size of resources, were other hotel facilities with 1 400 hotels.

The hotel is located slightly below the center of Karpacz and the Kolorowa slope. Access with GPS is easy, next to the hotel there is a large closed car park (paid). We will sleep in a spacious double room (suite). For a family with a child it is an ideal solution - in one room there is a double bed and an extra bed, in the other there are armchairs and a bench; in addition, there are two LCD TVs (good offer of TV), two tea kettles, a lot of wardrobes, a refrigerator. From what we have observed, the equipment of ordinary rooms does not, however, stand at an equally high level (e.g. CRT TV); as for a hotel with a resort profile, ordinary rooms are also relatively small. Despite the late hours of the bar party, the room was quiet and peaceful. Good free WiFi. The service, especially at the reception, was nice and helpful, although the waiting time for check-in is about an hour. 23 (half an hour with a sleeping child) was unacceptably long. The weaker side of the hotel was the food - breakfasts were different from hotels in the Mercure chain, especially abroad, and the food refill was also definitely not good. The hotel restaurant was not used by us. The offer of additional entertainment includes table tennis (but requires its own rackets), billiards, cymbage. However, the equipment is strongly tarnished (e.g. broken rackets left on the table tennis table did not encourage the use of fun). Outside the playground for children . The swimming pool is small, clean, although the walls would also be useful for renovation (flooding patches), rather to play than swim. A separate paddling pool for smaller children and a lot of water equipment is a good thing. No lifeguard in the pool. Water and air temperature OK; it is possible to go to the pool without going outside, which has advantages especially in winter; bath towels were reported to the room on request. In general, the hotel allows you to have a good weekend's rest, especially in the spacious room used by the ushers. However, the standard leaves to wish; especially at a price of over 500 PLN. ( weekend ) per day you can expect more. Generally the rating is between three and four "stars". The apartment was finally four, but only for a suite and above-standard helpful receptionist.

More than 5,000 cellular nuclei have been studied and the locations of both tracked genes in relation to the nucleus centres and the nuclear envelope have been determined. For one of the observed genes (BDNF), a change in position of several hundred nanometres (billionths of a meter) was observed, with the gene in control animals occurring near or on the areola or in the middle of the cellular nuclei, while for animals after an epilepsy attack the value fell to about . 25 %. "The twofold decrease is a very big change in biology. We also found that it remains visible even for several weeks. The conclusion is therefore unequivocal: neurons also remember what happened thanks to changes in the architecture of their cell nuclei" - says prof . Wilczyński .

A few words about Airbnb if you don't know the service yet. This is a booking platform dedicated to renting your own apartments. Currently, there are also other types of accommodation facilities, not only apartments. There is a strong discussion about Airbnb in many countries because it is treated as unfair competition in the hospitality market because initially the services were not taxed. And in many places it is still not. But let's get back to the research. It turned out that positive opinions dominate overwhelmingly among reviews and ratings of Airbnb facilities. The 600,000 properties surveyed had ratings of 4, 5, or higher. On a 5-point scale. Comparing these results with e.g. TripAdvisor, the average for nearly 500,000 properties (most hotels) analyzed was 3, 8. Also in the 5-step scale.

Head of the Department of Epidemiology and Cancer Prevention of the Oncology Centre in Warsaw, prof . Witold Zatoński tells the Polish Press Agency that in the 1960s he was a member of the Polish Oncology Centre. In the 1960s cigarette smoking was common in Western countries. In the USA and Great Britain as many as 80% of adults smoked cigarettes. Even every second American doctor smoked . A report from half a century ago was the result of research from the 1950s . The report from half a century ago was the result of research from the 1950s, which showed that cigarette smokers were more likely to develop cancer. In 1954 this was confirmed by the American Society of Oncology, but then hardly anyone believed in it. The statements of the country's chief physician Leroy Burney, who in the late 1950s announced that nicotinism leads to lung cancer, also went unnoticed. The tobacco industry then claimed that filter cigarettes were completely safe.

"There are still many myths about vitamin D, such as that taking supplements increases the risk of kidney stones and can damage the kidneys. Meanwhile, the recommended doses are certainly not a risk factor for kidney damage, and chronic kidney disease is even an indication for supplementation with this vitamin" - noted Dr Płudowski . He reminded that a whole range of preparations with vitamin D is available on the market. Two of them are on prescription because they have undergone clinical trials. "I represent the position that we can use non-prescription supplements (cost more than prescription - PAP) provided that they have been manufactured in accordance with good manufacturing practice (GMP). The most important thing is to take them every day, in the right dose" - concluded the expert.

The unusual nature of these molecules has been proven by recent studies . They have shown that with the appropriate microRNA molecules an adult cell can be reprogrammed into . . . .stem cell . It was already known that stem cells can be obtained by introducing a set of three genes into an adult cell. "Now it turned out that it is enough to increase the expression of the appropriate microRNAs and the cell will "retreat" to the stem cell phase. There is no longer any need to interfere with its genome, just "add" the appropriate microRNAs and you are done! We were grabbed by the head when we found out about this research! " says the scientist. Dr. Bielawska-Pohl points out that intensive research on microRNAs is being conducted in laboratories all over the world, because there are still many question marks. "We are constantly looking for the possibility of using these microRNAs to treat many different diseases, learning about the mechanisms of their regulation and action" - points out the researcher.

For the detection of kidney cancer, so-called screening tests, similar to those used for breast, cervical and colorectal cancer, are not performed. Such tests are carried out on all persons at a certain age, e.g. after fifty years of age (breast and colorectal cancer). Dr. Bardadin claims that it is worthwhile to have an ultrasound once a year, which is already widely available. "There is then a good chance that kidney cancer will be detected in time," Dr. Bardadin emphasized at a PAP conference on kidney cancer. In his opinion, men over 45 years of age, who are most exposed to this type of cancer, should remember this.

Good price as for accommodation in such a location. I recommend !

In the case of almost 2000 overweight and obese people from all over Poland participating in the weight reduction program, the total reduction amounted to as much as 9 tons (5 kilograms on average), the reduction of excessive blood sugar levels was achieved in 47% of cases, cholesterol levels were reduced in 32% and hypertension was reduced in 65%. The participants met not only with doctors and nutritionists, but also with physiotherapists and psychologists " The costs of the programme were in this case three times lower than the estimated cost of treating complications of obesity. This is an excellent business" - emphasized prof . Jarosz . Scientists emphasized that "Keep Balance" is the first comprehensive program that shows the right direction in the effective fight against obesity and overweight, now considered the greatest health threat in the world. According to forecasts recently published by the World Health Organisation (WHO), the obesity epidemic will continue to grow rapidly over the next few years - including in Poland, which has risen to the top of the most obese populations in Europe.

The Rector's Representative for the Ministry of Economy and Labour and Social Policy. Krzysztof Chlebus, Ph.D., emphasized that this is "a very advanced, scientifically promising project which gives great hope in terms of therapy". He explained that "it takes a very long time from the moment a certain scientific result is created to implement it into clinical practice and it takes a lot of money to document the effectiveness of such a method on a larger scale" . He stressed that in order for the method to be applied on a larger scale, it takes, in the first stage, about a dozen or so million PLN to expand the laboratory and clinical base. Ultimately, it may be even several tens of millions of zlotys for conducting clinical research. "In fact, we are talking about looking for good, reliable, loyal investors who will help us ( ... ) open a production line" - he added . He hopes that "this project will be a flagship (...) not only for the University of Gdańsk and (...) will create mechanisms that can be used in the future to deal with and finance other treatment projects" .

The slogan "Time is the brain" captures the essence of the problem well. The sooner the patient is placed in a specialist stroke unit (there are about 150 of them in Poland), the better. As prof . Anna Członkowska from the Institute of Psychiatry and Neurology, every 20 minutes lost significantly reduces the chances for the patient to return to full efficiency. Imaging tests facilitate the location of the stroke, while the administration of fibrinolytic drugs reduces the extent of damage. However, it must be administered no later than 4 or 5 hours after the stroke. Due to too late arrival at the hospital and numerous contraindications the method can be used only in a few percent of patients. Stroke, as explained by prof . Membership in 80% of cases is due to ischemia of the brain, in 15% of cases. - The stroke was caused by a rupture of an artery in the brain, and in 5% of cases it was subarachnoid hemorrhage.

The mRNA molecules are a carrier of information in the cell - "documentation" which, on the basis of plans stored in the DNA, allows the production of proteins. "We have explained how human methyltransferases recognize the kapu structure at one of the ends of mRNAs and carry out its enzymatic modification. Capu is essential for the synthesis of proteins in cells. We have discovered that human methyltransferases recognize capu in mRNAs in a different way than viral proteins responsible for a similar process do. This knowledge gives rise to the search for such drugs that would block viral proteins and would be safe for people," comments Prof. Dr. hab . Janusz Bujnicki , head of a research group at MIBMiK and at the Adam Mickiewicz University. Janusz Bujnicki , head of a research group at the MIBMiK and at the Adam Mickiewicz University in Poznań, who led the project and is the author of the corresponding new article, together with the second author, Dr Marcin Nowotny , head of the group at the MIBMiK and Prof . dr hab . Edward Darżynkiewicz , head of the team at MIBMiK and Prof .

Diagnosis: discopathy at L5 / S1 level. I have been under neurosurgical care for almost two years. After numerous consultations, rehabilitation, massages and other magical treatments - the pain in the lumbar region increased, but somehow it was possible to live. However, 10 January this year turned out to be the worst day in my life so far. She woke up and did not get up anymore. She couldn't walk or lie down and just live normally. The pain in her left leg was unbearable. The next rehabilitation, strong medications did not help, even worsened my condition. I was advised by a few neurosurgeons - the so-called top 5 of Warsaw medicine - all of them unanimously decided - OPERATION. However, none of the above mentioned people were able to guarantee me that the surgery will improve my situation, even some claimed that it could be worse. She was looking for help from many specialists, and thanks to the portal and positive opinions, she got to Mr. Grzegorz. Finally, she found me a specialist who presented dry facts based on many years of experience. At the beginning of March this year we started a difficult and long rehabilitation. It's June and I feel great - I'm practicing at home every day, I've returned to an active lifestyle and every day the vision of surgery disappears somewhere behind the horizon: ) Honestly and with full conviction I recommend cooperation with Mr. Grzegorz - a professional in every respect, and also an amazing man. However, I warn you - Mr. Grzegorz is not a sorcerer (although some patients claim so :) ) - if you decide to try, hard work, sweat and tears are in front of you - Reasons!

The exception is nodular sclerosis - a rare genetically determined disease in the course of which epileptic seizures usually occur before the first year of life. This disease can be detected in a child already in the womb, as it is characterized by the occurrence of heart tumors. Polish scientists under the guidance of prof . Sergiusz Jóźwiak from the "Monument - Children's Health Centre" Institute in Warsaw observed that by performing cyclic EEG examinations in these children, changes in brain electrical activity can be observed early and drugs can be administered even before the epileptic seizures occur. Such a procedure reduces the risk of intellectual disability in the little ones. An international research project EPISTOP is currently underway to confirm these observations.

First of all : five stars is definitely not enough ! Before I got 'em to the Doctor, for a year he had been looking for the cause of my walking problems - he had come a long way, visited a lot of different doctors, did a lot of tests and didn't get 'em any explanation for my problems. The doctor persuaded me to start the pharmacological treatment, which I was very afraid of (I had bad experiences with medicines prescribed by another specialist). For a person with nervous problems it is a great support. She also directed me to psychotherapy, giving me directions to a very good psychotherapist. Now, after a dozen or so months of treatment (and psychotherapy), she has finished my treatment with the Doctor. The first time I came to the office was barely holding on to my feet. In the last vacation, I walked 'em in the mountains. The Doctor is a doctor by vocation and a wonderful man. I recommend it sincerely with all my heart! And Mrs. Magda, thank you very much !

I definitely don't recommend it. I'm very disappointed. For this price I did not expect miracles, but the kitchen is actually very different from the pictures. I've been sick for a very long time. For many years I have been feeling constant pain, sometimes very strong on both shoulders. She went to therapy, looking for help, because she didn't see any sense in anything. I was lonely and desperate. I didn't think there was anything left for me. She didn't believe me at first in the effectiveness of such meetings. "What can talking to a stranger do? "- she thought. And yet... Turns out psychotherapy really heals. The hours we spent in Ola's office were not easy, but it made me different today. She built me a successful relationship, arranged my life and I feel fulfilled. I owe the fact that I'm here to a great extent to my Therapist. Thank you Alexandra for your warmth, patience and wisdom. You are the right person in the right place. Aga

The hotel is relatively well located in relation to the city center (can be reached on foot in 10 - 15 minutes), in the vicinity of the hotel there is only a gas station. When entering the hotel you may be mistaken and enter a guarded private car park (the first barrier on the right), but I recommend to do it because a day there costs 18 PLN while in the hotel guarded car park 50 PLN and 20 PLN on unguarded. The standard room that we received was medium sized, well equipped (minibar, safe, extra blanket, tea/coffee set, extra pillows) unfortunately, quite long and until we asked for refreshment, sometimes dirty walls, literally black curtains, wiped old carpet, old TV set. The bathrooms are small, fairly clean, fluffy, fresh towels, spoiled effect cracked tiles in the shower. Really very comfortable beds you can get a great night's sleep, although there is a bit of noise from a busy crossroads, but in the end it's the city centre. The hotel staff at both the reception and the breakfast room are friendly, courteous and helpful. Breakfast is very good, fresh products and a large selection of dishes, only scrambled eggs were missing. The hotel clearly needs money to renovate and then it would be a great 4 star hotel. Nowadays it's pretty good as a stopover although I think the competition, has rooms of much better quality at a similar price.

She has lived in the hotel since 01 . 09 . 11 to 8 . 09 . 11, these were holidays organized by one of the leading Polish travel agencies . Perhaps if she had gone with another e.g. German agency the opinion would have been much better . Generally, the hotel was quite old and heavily used . It occupied my room on the first floor. Now I know that in this hotel you have to fight for higher floors. There are guests from Western Europe. On the lower floors the standard is lower. The bathroom stinks, the towels are wiped (exchanged daily), the room is cleaned, but only generally, as it is said after the heads. Food, well I didn't come there to eat. . . . As long as there were German and French groups ( first 4 days ) it was definitely better ! ! ! ! The advantage was the proximity of the beach. The beach itself is quite dirty and narrow. A tiny town, pretty. Close to Dubrovnik (very good connections) . Quite far from the market to buy water and, for example, fruit, which the hotel did not spoil. To sum up: it rested, got a tan, but for sure I will never go there again.

This lens is designed for people who are just starting to take pictures with Canon DSLRs. It is a lens without image stabilization (it is in the newer Mark III model). The price of this lens is not exorbitant. You can already buy it in very good condition for about 160 - 190 PLN, which is a funny money for a lens. For a beginner photographer it will be a good choice to get acquainted with the possibilities of his own equipment, if he does not want to lecture big sums for the lens at the beginning. This equipment can take good pictures, but it requires a little practice and knowledge of the camera we use. I recommend it mainly to beginners. More advanced users should look for other lenses.

My father was treated for a very long time for depression. He visited several specialists. Unfortunately, nothing helped, no drugs. Since spring, he was lying in bed, in summer he didn't leave his room at all, he didn't sleep at night, he didn't have any desire to live or any strength for anything! One day my brother got additionally ill - he started to talk from things, to have productive symptoms, we were all in shock! In the evening it was already very bad with him! In the newspaper we read the advertisement "Psychosoma" - Dr. Zolkoś received us on the same day. I was with them on a visit - he made a good impression on me: competent and such turned out to be. My brother prescribed effective medication - he fell asleep calmly, in the morning he woke up much calmer and had no more delusions or delusions. He started to improve his father's condition after just about. 2 weeks. - He started to get up, then go out to people, to the shop, think about work, about the future (until now he functioned like a withering plant and we couldn't do anything; 2 years earlier he had his first episode of depression, then everything changed to come back with double the force - only Dr. Zolkoś made a correct diagnosis that it was not depression but a bipolar affective disorder: manic-depressive). At the moment it is 1 or 5 years since both of them are treated with the doctor. The brother functions normally: he works, there are no symptoms of this terrible disease. The father is similar - since he has been treated with the doctor, his condition is stable (he has only slight mood swings) and functions quite normally. It is true that monthly visits cost a lot, but thanks to them my father and brother live like people. Before, my father used to spend a lot on drugs that didn't help anything! It's also true that Dr. asked several times for prescription drugs for himself - which is a little strange, but you can always refuse. . . Once it happened that he wasn't there, he canceled the visit a few times because of illness, stay in hospital (in general he has health problems - after all, he is also a human being). We will see how it goes on. So far we are very grateful to him for his help and effective treatment. We are afraid to risk changing the doctor who will be cheaper but ineffective. Aneta

very good location, close to the main train station. Not far from a great pub, where you can drink beer and eat a delicious sorbet dessert for a little money. The hotel's staff is helpful, you can do the laundry on the spot, you'll get along in English. The only downside to our room is the squeaky bed, but maybe it's an isolated case.

In their work on the ReligaHeart EXT dentures, the researchers used their experience with a similar system for adults (POLCAS system), which has already been successfully used in over 340 patients. In March, in the Silesian Centre for Heart Diseases in Zabrze, a heart transplantation was successfully performed in a patient who had previously been supported with these prostheses for a record time of over 500 days. As emphasized by the designers, the new extracorporeal dentures ReligaHeart EXT use the latest design and technological achievements developed over the last decade: a new generation of biocompatible polyurethane with extended durability in long-term blood contact and a microprocessor system for remote communication of the denture controller, which allows observation of its work during the patient's stay outside the hospital.

Hello, I decided to write 'em about this doctor so that others would think about it before they go to him. The doctor removed my thyroid in May 2013 (in Wieliszew - he is the chief there). Immediately after the operation he wanted to discharge me home, he told me to pack up and only the nurse asked me if I had a tingling sensation in my fingers or on my face he told 'em that I have (he thought 'em that it's normal after the operation) he just got scared and immediately ordered a test, attention - he stayed in the hospital for another week (he took 'em orally and in the form of a drip - 3 times a day!) because it turned out that I have hypocalcemia! ! ! It's first of all, secondly, after the operation I had a squeaky (moaning) voice and I quickly got tired of a few sentences, and he says, well, a lovely voice, after all, what do you mean, but it's been 1 or 5 months since the operation and I still had one, so I went to phoniatrics (medicine. Wakarow - I highly recommend it) and she said why I am only now coming (I had a one-sided paralysis of something in my throat), she prescribed me injections and iontophoresis (for 1 or 5 months), and why? because my lord Count Doctor told me not to read the Internet and after all what I want, when I am just after the surgery. Sum of the sum total I advise against this surgeon ! ! ! He's rude, he knows best and that's it. If it wasn't for the fact that I have my own mind and yet I have consulted me from the Internet, my voice would not come back. I'm writing an opinion so that others can think about it before they go to that doctor. I ADVISE AGAINST IT! ! ! ! ! !

In April 2010. Morgan Stanley decided to stop construction of the facility and was determined to sell the $932 million worth of the investment. In order to revive tourism in Atlantic City, New Jersey's governor Chris Christie announced in February 2011 that he would invest $260 million in the suspended project in exchange for 20% of revenues. The state aid and a bond issue for the construction of the project resulted in a package of $1.15 billion to complete the project. In practice, the implementation of this project is an example of a kind of "American" public-private partnership. Located in the state of New Jersey, Atlantic City is a well-known swimming pool, promenade and gambling center on the east coast of the USA.

I spent 5 days in this hotel with my disabled daughter. My stay cost me almost 5 thousand zlotys. A few hours after the departure I was called from the hotel that once again the staff checked my room and they were missing two candy bars in the minibar. I was surprised but she apologized to the lady and told me that I will immediately transfer these few zlotys to the hotel account. Then the lady said that she was still missing a European bison. She was shocked. She took out a candy bar if I did not see it, although it is unlikely because her daughter does not eat such a candy bar, but a bison soup? ? ? ? . You told me that I think it's an exaggeration, if I didn't drink this bison bar because I think my daughter would have known about it. Then you said you'd check again. The next day she called me, that the European bison was found, only two candy bars are missing and this time a coke. They had enough time to count me when checking out, after all she did not run away with me. When I checked out, everything was fine. I was scared of what the woman would come up with in a moment and she immediately transferred these few zlotys to my hotel account. However, the distaste and humiliation remained. How can you take from a customer a few thousand for 5 days stay and call him later as a thief to give away for a candy bar which probably costs them a zloty in wholesale. I will never go there again and I don't recommend it. For such money she could spend her holidays in any other place in the world without offending me.
German A 2 / E I recommend, even your M.A. is doing a lot to get students to pass the exam: ) He's trying to do all the right things and not to bother people with the wrong ones.

A very welcome welcome at the reception. Hotel run by a family business (grandmother, grandfather, children, uncles, grandchildren). All guests are served directly (reception, waiters, service and bicycle trips). Hotel for fans of bicycle tours, but not only - everyone will find something for themselves. Daily organized bicycle tours around the picturesque surroundings for the more and less advanced. The possibility of renting bikes on site as well as all the information about the hiking and biking trails - comprehensive information in English, German, Italian. Nice outdoor swimming pool, crawlers by the pool, sunny place. Nice hotel garden with a pond, lots of exotic vegetation around the building. Parking outside and underground in the price of the stay. Spa area: indoor swimming pool open all day long. 08 - 20 , saunas from 16 - this one, massage. Part of the pool with warmer and another with cooler water. Sun loungers, towels, bathrobes are available to guests at no extra charge. A cool restaurant with several rooms, stylish for the region. Very good card meals and dinners: strong Italian and Tyrolean accents. Super antipasti: very large number of vegetables and seafood in various forms in small portions, so that you can try a lot. Dinner in g . 19 - 21 . Breakfast is varied - without splendour but everyone will find something for themselves. Fresh products, choice of fresh fruit, drinks - regional cheese and wedges. Weak coffee - you have to order a better restaurant for a fee. Rooms with a view of the mountains, surroundings, with a balcony. We had a 2 level room: downstairs table, sofa, TV, upstairs big marital bed, TV, wardrobe in the building. Functional bathroom with shower, bidet, plenty of space, cosmetics field, etc. A small fridge in the room was enough for us: there are large mineral water bottles. There are shortages: - no possibility of using the washing machine even for a fee - a kettle in the room would be useful - I do not know if the iron and board can be lent on the spotvery successful stay and we will certainly benefit in the future

The hotel seems to be luxurious and of a high standard. But these are only appearances. First of all, rooms: I got a room in the old part. The room and the bathroom need to be renovated. In the room there was an intense smell of chemicals used to clean the carpet. Because of the small children who were with me, it made me feel uneasy. Changing the room was not an option because the hotel was supposedly full. Ventilation didn't help. In addition, the bed covers were unfortunately terribly dirty. . . Visible stains of unknown origin. . . It was truly disgusting. The bathroom, unfortunately, was also in poor condition. . . The shower wasn't cleaned, the mixer in the washbasin was old with stone barely working. And unfortunately the rooms in the old part lack air conditioning: - ( . Second service: at the reception desk, unfortunately, in my opinion, with full occupancy of the hotel was not enough employees. Arrangement of anything was connected with standing back in a long queue. Restaurant staff is a bit "sleeping". To sum up, I was disappointed because I was hoping that the stay in this hotel will be really on a high level. Unfortunately, there is a lot to improve in it.

The hotel is the peak of kitsch and rubbish. Everything must be big and gold. Golden handles, golden air vents, golden sconces with plastic crystals. The only thing missing is a gold TV - they have something to work on. Such Polish October, cheap materials but richly. Lack of taste . A terrible crowd in the hotel. The air-conditioning is practically lacking, when I arrived in the room was 32 degrees, after closing the windows and turning on the air conditioning, the temperature rose to an impossible 33, 5 degrees. Pool used up . In the saunas, the planks and floor so hot that you can't enter first, sitting down steaming through a towel and swimming trunks. You have to go out in the jumps of the scratching, you can not stop on the hot tiles. Next to the saunas there is a small pool to cool down with cool water, where at the top there are 4 kitchen pots to which water is poured and after a while poured out, independent whether you want it or not. Besides, at 9 pm the complex is closed. And now I'm going to the worst - the food. I don't remember a hotel with such heavy, tasteless and indigestible food. All fried, stinking of fat. It was supposed to pretend to be rich here too. All my energy went to the digestion. I was sick for a long time. I felt like I was in the Polish People's Republic, in a hotel for foreigners. Something between the Orbis Hotel and the Bunch. It's hard to communicate with the staff - they don't speak Polish. The hotel looks best from a distance, you can see cheap materials and wear. I advise against it.

Marriott signed an agreement to buy a Clock Tower office building near Madison Square Park in Manhattan in the first half of the 20th century, which is to house the New York Edition. According to Sorenson, further locations are being considered as : Abu Dhabi, Bangkok and Gurgaon in India and perhaps also in West Hollywood, California. In the opinion of the new president of the network Marriott, the luxury segment will be the long-term growth engine of the network, due to the dynamics of economic development, in countries such as China. The Edition is one of four life style / collections brands (the others are AC Hotels by Marriott, Autograph and Renaissance) in the Marriott International Group's 18 brand portfolio.

Super hotel. Very nice and helpful service . The rooms were clean, cleaned every day, as much as possible, the size was enough in the end we did not come to sit in the room, there is really nothing to attach to, the air conditioning worked quietly. The sea can be seen without any problems from the first floor, because the trees are not dense. The swimming pools next to the hotel are very cool - cleaned practically every morning, hot water (warmer than in the sea). The food is great - we have not managed to try everything for a week. We did not wait more than 5-10 minutes for drinks to dinner. The whole resort is sensational, very well managed. We didn't get bored with laughing there for a while. A little disappointed by the aquapark - not much of an attraction for us, but great is minigolf. I recommend hotel Niko. We will return there for sure.

The hotel is getting worse every year. I often stay there on duty. The hotel is more dilapidated every year, the rooms need to be renovated. However, it has a very nice location by the lake. Recently it has been very noisy, neighbors and events for various companies. The food is very good in the form of a Swedish table. Beware of the access road to the hotel. I recently lost my tire on it and the hotel didn't give me any compensation because they said it belongs to the city. Very not a cool attitude to the customer. Although I'm going there again, I'd rather choose another hotel.

Marconi Spa is one of the few health resorts in Poland where you can cure your ailments, such as hip degeneration. In addition, the spa offers its clients a wide range of services, such as a wide range of massages and basic treatments, which bring people into a state of complete relaxation and tranquility while giving them vitality. You can also take advantage of other treatments. You will notice the great professionalism of medical service and commitment to your work. I sincerely recommend it! I will also mention the food, which is so tasty, and especially the dinners, where you can "feel" the taste of grandmother's childhood from years ago - Very Tasty. . . ps . Note: When using the salt pools, you should take off all kinds of jewelry. Especially with silver chains, rings, signets, etc. ) . Patients are of course informed in advance by the staff, but not everyone remembers this.

I don't recommend it. Spa is a mockery, pool for 4 people. In the spa area you can only get some hors d'oeuvres. Stench on level 0. Terrible service. Fungus in the bathroom and in the room. Calling this spa facility is a fraud. I don't recommend it, I even advise against it.

He's a great man and a specialist. I immediately sensed that I was dealing with a professional. He was already with some famous sexologists and there were no effects. They chose a four-star hotel for a day's stay for our three-person family. I wanted our eight-month-old son to have good conditions (clean room, comfortable bed, kettle). From the beginning, however, we met an unpleasant surprise. Huge parking problems and lack of prepared rooms (12:30pm). We had to change the baby in the toilet on the counter at the washbasin and feed in the hall. Room in a very poor standard . Stained carpet, anointed wainscot, bathroom hair on the floor, old TV set. Generally not very clean. A bit like in a poor Italian hotel.

We spent 3 days in the Christmas period. On the Internet a loud Christmas Eve offer and more. Unfortunately, the hotel as for me has a top 3 stars, and I'm not sure. The food is cool, underdressed, the menu is noisy and really dry and on one hoof. Cakes old on the chips. Only the red borscht was really tasty. The cook is not one of the best. The room's fine, clean and uncluttered, the same goes for the area around. The waiters want to clean the plate from under their noses as soon as possible, your restaurant manager (I guess) comes up during the meal and says something about changing the place. For me it is a scandal. The first day of Christmas, according to the plan, dinner in the barbecue hut at 15 ( ! ) and then at 16:00 - this one up to 17:30 dinner in the restaurant. Hahaha , misunderstanding . In fact, there is an unpleasant smell in the bathrooms from the pipes. Huge plus for the opportunity to come with a pet . The surrounding area is wonderful and offers many opportunities to spend free time. Generally not the worst, but unfortunately there is no frenzy. Please do not expect fireworks, even if the descriptions on the internet promise pears on willow. The hotel stars are asking for a search. ps, there's a coffee in the conference hall of the coffee machine, interesting since when? ! ? The smell in this building speaks for itself, pfuj.

She bought me a product in zooplus, unfortunately apparently they have some kind of agreement with the Czech Republic because she gave me there a negative evaluation of several of the company's products and none of them were published (a few months ago, my other evaluations were published). Going back to the product itself. The food is very popular with cats but since a few years ago the RC company has been bought out by a whiskas company and the composition of the food is terribly poor quality. It is whiskas in a different package. It does not contain any meat at all, and the enigmatically named animal proteins, which are usually obtained e.g. from feathers, are extremely low quality proteins. What's even worse is that it is full of cereals and plant products (i.e. all waste). Cats are carnivores and this is what they should be fed. Why do cats like to eat it? Because it is full of chemical additives that improve the taste so that cats will touch it at all. It contains preservatives that are responsible for causing cancer. Remember that not everything that tastes healthy (we also eat chips. . . . ) . I would like to conclude by saying that my kitten has developed a strong allergy on this food (to cereals) and because of this (or maybe it is because of this that she found out what kind of junk food RC produces). She bought me a 10kg sack (she was hoping to save money), but unfortunately, I was only losing it.

Perhaps the novel the director was modeling himself on is brilliant - but this does not apply to the film. In my opinion this horror is the worst of all that she watched m - and she watched m many of them, because I am a fan of the genre . Terribly boring and monotonous, she waited impatiently for me to develop the action until the last minute and with disappointment she said that nothing happened that could have frightened me in the least.
