- Dinner in the restaurant at my own risk (it cost me 100zl and 3 days of stomach problems with fever) - the service denies any connection with their restaurant (unfortunately I ate only in your restaurant) I did not feel that anyone cares too much, Breakfast, of course, hasn't been touched - total lack of control over paid parking spaces resulting in blocking of the car by other parking cars - employees spread their hands and say that nothing can be done about it, well, the electronic system is only used to charge for as many cars as possible, regardless of the number of available parking spaces - tight room, dark room, no air conditioning, TV too small and suspended almost from the ceiling

We expect Polish food to be healthy, rich in bio-ingredients and affordable. Scientists from research institutes of the Polish Academy of Sciences are concentrating their efforts to ensure that the raw materials and products of animal origin produced in our country are the best. As part of the Bio-centre - animal, food and man project coordinated by the Institute of Genetics and Animal Breeding of the Polish Academy of Sciences (IGHZ), modern equipment has been purchased, which in the future will be used for complex research aimed at improving food quality. Researchers will also provide specialized services for companies from the agri-food sector. The director of IGHZ PAN, Prof . dr hab . Jarosław Horbańczuk .

On the occasion of her wedding anniversary, she bought an accommodation package with breakfast and dinner available on the website. At the reception desk I was informed that it is enough to go to the restaurant to have dinner. In fact, it did not turn out to be that easy. The restaurant staff asked for a voucher for dinner from the reception desk. She informed me that we did not receive any, we have it in the package. The waiter said that everyone can talk to each other like that and that I should go to the reception to explain it to myself. An embarrassing situation. The husband was left alone at the table, he was not even offered anything to drink at that time, and I slime myself to explain to the reception. Why didn't the waiter go alone or call? I have no idea. The situation is probably normal in a hostel, but strange in a hotel of this class, making it unforgivable. It made me feel like an inferior client. The reception was nice enough to call the waiter and shout him out. But they didn't hear us even apologize. Neither the interior nor the view will compensate for our unpleasant experiences. A complaint written on the hotel's website impervious to moderation. Never again!

A good hotel, in a good place, some small rooms but tastefully furnished. Continental breakfast / coffee could be better / . A small car park by the hotel. All typical Italian small hotel, but well maintained. And a great owner, helpful, helpful, helpful, helpful, you can negotiate a good price, knows how to encourage the customer.

The hotels of the National Tourist Cooperative Gromada in Ostrowiec Swietokrzyski ( 127 rooms ) and Przemysl ( 108 rooms ) have changed ownership. The group carrying out restructuring activities, the main part of which is the sale of unprofitable assets, including hotel properties and the audit of the location of facilities operating in the chain, sold the buildings to an entrepreneur operating in south-eastern Poland. Both facilities will be used to maintain hotel operations, however, OST Gromada will certainly operate the facilities until the end of Q1 2013. Whether the Cooperative will run the facilities in the future will be decided by talks .

She spent the night with her family in a 4-person apartment. Both the room and the bathroom are very clean. Breakfast is very tasty and varied, all fresh. Beautifully served, the wonderful jam of rose, made personally by the owner - fingers to lick! ! ! The service is very nice and helpful. The interior is pleasant, atmospheric in the background discreet music, I will certainly return there. I sincerely recommend this place: )

We bought orbrek with our wife almost 2 years ago. In the beginning we used it less often, now very regularly. For those who are looking for it, I recommend to go to the hardware store and get the most comfortable one for themselves. I wanted to buy a Rivo P because a friend recommended me and a super cool computer has. In the shop it turned out to be a little bit dumpy and this model is very stable and comfortable for my wife. It was much more expensive and with a simpler computer - which really does not matter for training. At the beginning I was in the way of my knees (I am 180cm tall) but standing straight fits me perfectly. For the big plus deserves a 3-year warranty door - to - door. Once the line from the load setting knob fell down and the service quickly removed the fault. Pulse measurement in my opinion does not work at all. Maybe with an ear clip it would be ok, but it is uncomfortable, so I use a chest strap and a POLAR M400 watch or a phone. The display only reads speed, distance and time. Sometimes the platforms on which you stand squeak a bit and I couldn't remove it by tightening the screws, the rest is very quiet. You can practice the movie at night when the kids are sleeping.

We were disappointed. A large hotel where a lot of people stay during the season and this is unfortunately visible everywhere, especially during meals or at the pool. The hotel also has the function of a "city swimming pool". because in the main hall there are huge queues of people (not hotel guests) waiting to enter the pool. The parking lot is accessible by whole coaches with excursions. You can imagine what is happening at the swimming pools or in the sauna. We have shortened our stay because, unfortunately, during the season the hotel is not able to provide a peaceful holiday. It can be seen that the hotel needs renovating, especially the part with swimming pools. The rooms themselves are quite comfortable and large.

Dr. Kornelia Tomaszewska met me last year, while I was weaning contraceptive hormones and preparing my body for pregnancy. After thorough research on the functioning of the hormonal economy, where problems with too high a level of testosterone were found and thus a bad omen for an imminent pregnancy, she led the body "on the straight" by prescribing drugs. Unfortunately, despite the requests, hormone tests were not repeated after the treatment, because the doctor stated that there is no need for it. This is the first downside I give her: the certainty that why her therapy shouldn't work, when too high testosterone is a book case. She continued my treatment with the doctor. What convinced me at the beginning is that at the beginning she really listens, tries to ask the patient about everything, answers all the questions (expressing her medical judgement), focuses on the results of the tests. This has its good points, which, as she said, I appreciate. What she lacks is a particle of humanity, a vocation to the medical profession, the ability to talk to people, empathy, the ability to feel yourself in the situation of the patient and above all to treat each case as a separate one! ! The doctor looks at her in general and through the prism of book cases, she personally felt at her examination like on a production line. One, two, three and another. . . The doctor was leading my pregnancy to 15 weeks. She wouldn't let her keep me pregnant for any longer, because she would have led me to a new miscarriage. As in the previous case, the doctor, not having her "own" ultrasound equipment with her, did not advise to check the whole chorion (2 weeks before the visit she landed me in the hospital with a hemorrhage) and sent me back with a receipt, inviting me next month. At the same time she said that from the medical point of view everything is ok, so they get fired only at her request, because if she could get back to work. . . I'll add that the pregnancy is in danger, I'm getting asshosted for support, recommendations, lying down, no physical activity, no lifting, etc. Dear doctor, if you sometimes look at the forum where you can learn a lot about your treatment from the perspective of your patients, please take into account that every pregnant woman needs to feel properly and not cursed. Nothing will happen if you spend more than 5 minutes on your patient's visit. Maybe you will even save some small existence.

No malice, but certainly not 5 * . Simple things: no bottled water in the rooms, no kettle, no WI - FI in the rooms (very poor internet coverage of LTE forget about it), very narrow balconies and what's the worst in all drinks from vending machines, in ice and water served to meals taste CHLOR! In my opinion these are the most important disadvantages of the hotel. Besides, there is nothing to complain about.

The study of the relationship between methylation and age can, according to prof . Płoski - application not only in forensic science but also in health assessment. "There are already studies which indicate that people whose methylation looks like it does in slightly older people actually die at a slightly younger age. So these people are kind of biologically older than their metric age would indicate," the scientist points out. However, he admits that it is still unknown whether the state of methylation - and with it also the biological age - can be reversed or at least stopped, e.g. by changing the lifestyle. This is what Prof . The rumours of the future in his research are to be addressed. DNA methylation - as prof . Rumours are the basic mechanism of gene regulation. It takes place under the influence of the environment and is not inherited, however, it has a significant impact on the functioning of an individual. "Methylation can mimic the mutation in some way - it can turn the gene off or activate it. Moreover, it seems - and this is the view now dominant - that methylation may be responsible for differences in susceptibility to diseases that are not genetic - such as ... hypertension, mental illnesses, overweight or allergies" - says a researcher from WUM .

How can the splendor of the hotel, the effort of other people be lost through the splendid, unsympathetic, obcessive receptionist? . The other receptionists were OK. I was only at the consultation with Dr. Tesinski, so I cannot comment on the effects of the operation, but as for the behavior of the doctor at the consultation visit I cannot agree with your assessments. I've had three semesters of basketball every time with someone else. At Gryszko's it's like this: you warm yourself up (throws, etc.) and then split into 3 teams and play up to 6 points and change, as there are fewer people it's a long game. In my opinion these 6 minutes are not enough. Sometimes it happened that it was divided into 4 teams and we played streetball for 2 baskets, the winners could leave once without consequences. To get a bdb you could have 1 missed (he doesn't say that, only when you give marks). The atmosphere is very good, the leader doesn't go anywhere during the class, he only referees all the time, he will even tell you how effective the free kicks the team had;). ), from time to time, he will take someone for a selfish game (and very well). "One of the elements will be a narrow, small apartment, like many in Polish cities. All this is so that rescuers who are learning the profession can enter and, for example, practice transferring patients, phantoms of natural weight, in stretchers, pulled out of the narrow tub, which will also be there" - he explained . "Rescue workers - students will have to take the patient from the apartment to the street, and move to an ambulance simulator, which differs from the normal one only in that there is no engine. There will also be a car in the center after the accident that will rotate and a rain and storm simulator so that students can also face the stress of working in really difficult conditions" - he added .

And this is supposed to be four star rooms small bathrooms destroyed and very tiny old furniture in the rooms destroyed TV almost none as for commune four channels and goodbye food hopeless monotony in every day of settling not to mention scrambled eggs sausage cheese sausage and omelets massacre dinner no different for every meal that wanted to bring 'em out I have to pay attractions for children to regret God, swimming pool cold water a lot of people have no chance to enter the sauna, what more write here unsuccessful one week holiday about the hotel the rest ok Kudowa cool city and attractions a lot I do not recommend this hotel I certainly will not use it any more

We expected something better for this price! Old room furniture, TV sets from 25 years ago, where you can normally watch 3 channels. There are a lot of corridors in the hotel and the restaurant is painted in a simple mistake! Luckily, we bought a voucher for a butterfly but I still think we overpaid. I don't know how this hotel got 3 stars! ? It's a spa, but it has nothing to do with the spa we imagine. A MISTAKE! The girls at the reception were nice, so the only plus of this place. Greetings, Olga
analysis 1 - lecture rewrites your script on the board, so it doesn't pay to walk if you have enough self-denial to read it at home. generally I advise against it.

The apartments are located in the city center, which makes sightseeing easier. The beach is about 15 minutes by taxi which costs about € 10 . Easy access by bus as well. There are restaurants in close proximity. We were with 2 small children (one year and 4 years) everything was ok. Kitchen with sufficient equipment. New equipment, clean! People working at the reception desk are very helpful - with a smile on their faces they give information. I recommend it for those looking for a cheap place from which you can both visit the city and get to the beaches.

The price of the hotel is not commensurate with quality. A huge layer of dirt behind the beds, peeling walls. In a triple room, one of the beds was an ordinary sofa, more like a boarding school than a hotel. It was more like a double room with an extra bed than the three we paid for. The temperature in the room at night, and it was 8 September, was unbearable. No air conditioning. After opening the window very loudly because of the nearby road and the multitude of mosquitoes. The staff asked about this, answers that it is now anyway better than July/August and in the attic rooms it is still warmer. In general, I definitely do not recommend. On praise deserves only breakfast included in the price, but over 400 zloty per day under such conditions is definitely too much.

Mr. Merdas unfortunately only holds the title of MA. He constantly regrets this : ) I have the best memory of all the mathematician on the polybud. Today I was 'em at that doctor's and he ended the visit in the middle of it by refusing to examine the leg that hurt me, because I came with another case, and he has no time for two cases during one visit, because he has a charmonogram and I have to understand it. There was still time, at least 5 minutes, during which he could take a look at this foot and give at least a prescription for a painkiller, but I have the impression that the doctor got scared of the patient in the orthosis after such a complicated injury, because as soon as he took a look at the discharge, he panicked at all and avoided talking about this leg and already the visit is over, he has no time. I recommend the hotel to rest. It's quiet, nice, neat. We spent 3 days there with our husband, we visited the Kłodzko Valley in general, but the evenings at the hotel made our spa session (you can order exclusive), or playing billiards. Lunches served in the hotel restaurant were very tasty, traditional cuisine. Breakfast is varied, service is nice and helpful.

The application should provide the possibility to create automated rules for changing rates as well as availability. Automated rules, in the sense of linking the rates between themselves, by means of percentage or numerical relationships . So that all others can be changed by changing the base rate . The same applies to allotments . The number of available rooms should condition the opening and closing of individual channels . E.g. with a small number of available rooms we direct traffic to direct channels . Either by closing competitive platforms or by increasing the price on them compared to direct. Double-sided, partner-authorized connection . Best real-time data update . This ensures data security and correctness of prices and availability.

A day's stay in an oval block of flats with small rooms overlooking the car park at the price of 350 N is definitely too expensive. Plus a nice staff, breakfast and location and you probably have to pay for the latter in high season. Access to the parking lot is poorly marked, on a dirt road!

We spent 4 nights at the Qubus Hotel. Great location . The rooms are very clean and reasonably well maintained . We went to the pool several times. The water was clean and warm, beautiful view from the window. And most of all, not many people in the pool or sauna - maybe it is more crowded in the season. The service on the highest level, each guest is treated with the same care. We highly recommend it.

Hotel close to the Łódź Kaliska railway station; clean and tastefully furnished room, price adequate to the service, breakfast in the form of a Swedish table - everyone will find something for themselves and tasty; hotel day set reasonably - until 12:00 so you don't have to break off early in the morning; if I'm in Łódź, I'll definitely take advantage of it : )

I can only praise the cleaning of rooms and quite a short distance to the sea about 400m - 5 min walk. However, there are a lot of downsides: the food was only good for the survey, in which apparently too many people praised the kitchens. Beverages dispensed from distributors are made of low-quality concentrate to which we had an allergy - the wife had a strong rash on her hands. Beer diluted with water (once in the morning they got em water which had no beer colour - untrained bartender could not adjust the dispenser) The drinks on the cheapest local alcohols, after a few drinks acted as a sleeping medium. It is not possible to drink it even in the sun. The public bathrooms were dirty and the stench of them was in the hallway. By the pool deckchairs - brown aluminum with veined fabric very uncomfortable and eternally dirty did not see 'em, for 10 days someone would wash them. The sun loungers were obviously missing so you had to book them with towels until 8 o'clock. 30 . After 9 . At 00, only the beach was left. Twice, my towels disappeared by the pool when we went to breakfast - the peak of rudeness. So whoever decides to go to this hotel I'm warning. The internet lobby fails, it is paid for only one device, the whole internet is through the server so you can't fool it. The speed is also poor, but if the weather breaks down then you can only watch the text files, because the video files are not stopping to cut. Price WI - FI - 32 - left week, 50 - left 10 days . In rooms in bathrooms there is a very annoying shower (no cabin), drain is in the middle of the bathroom so if someone turns the water on strongly, almost the whole floor in the bathroom is flooded, and then you have to walk on it. Another problem is communication in Polish nobody speaks, in Russian only one older lady at the reception. It's always possible to get along on the blink of an eye but you can forget about the children's activities. The hotel is already about eight years old so the rooms would be useful to refresh and renovate the bathrooms. The hotel is focused on maximizing profits in advance. And Polish tourists treat it like air - this is especially visible at the bar. The hotel discourages guests after 7 days of stay, we did not want to use their swimming pool, they preferred to go to the beach.

I am a regular customer of this hotel. The hotel is well located in the very centre of the city. A friendly service, open to the needs of guests. Clean rooms. As I see it, the hotel is slowly but systematically modernized. And rightly so, because the room decor and bathroom arrangement is at least 30 years old. The "age" TV sets are a bit off. An absolute bonus for guests (and residents of Bialystok) is the hotel restaurant. This one I admit * * * * * * stars : ) . Also for a delicious and rich breakfast buffet. It is precisely because of the level of the hotel restaurant that I consider the Cristal hotel the most recommendable in Bialystok.

Hotel in a picturesque location among streams and ponds surrounded by greenery. Recommended for those wishing to relax . Nice service, cleanliness without reservations. Breakfast very good served in a separate building, outside the hotel buildings. Nice SPA area with 16 m long swimming pool, sauna area, Jacuzzi, solux lamps. The fitness zone could be more varied.

I will not assess the hotel itself because the accommodation did not take place I was planning to book em to stay in December 2014, but despite sending an inquiry to the address given on the site did not get an answer to em after two days wrote em to another address of the hotel Mr. from the reservation department informed me that they do not work mail . They exchanged a few remarks when they wrote 'em that I have already booked another hotel, they got 'em suggestions for accommodation at the cost of two days ago and free parking (as a compensation) I have already had other bookings, however, I suggested 'em so I will move these arrangements to January 2015 for another visit to Gdansk. I got information immediately that they can not provide these prices (as if the hotel prices were set by the Martians) In January 2015, I sent 'em a request for the possibility of reservation and what a coincidence, I got 'em proposals for a more expensive parking price (this supposedly free). He pointed out to them that such an approach is rather not ok and indicates the lack of class of the hotel In exchange e - meili joined the director of the hotel recognizing that everything is ok and this is the policy of the company. Of course he added his translation as for me in a version that even a child will not convinceEveryone reading this description can make up his own mind whether it is worth choosing the hotel or among many similar choose another in which there will be not only a nice room but something that can not be counted but can be felt. I appeal to everyone who thinks that this is ok should consider the other advantages of the hotel and everyone who did not want to be in my place to once choose another hotel in Gdansk because then such behavior will not be repeated "

Place - great . To the beach 3 minutes , to the promenade 1 minute , to the tourist attractions balos etc. close. Rooms - spacious, liquid fridge, bathroom stinks, balcony plus. Volume - on Saturday there was a disco nearby, but it was probably heard all over Kissamos. At the hotel by the pool there is an open bar until 22, and the Greeks are not a quiet atmosphere - very friendly, nice, smiling staff, very helpful. The food - every day for breakfast is the same, but good and filling. Close to good pubs.

Hello, I write here as a husband who looked at everything from the side of what "miracles" did the doctor. Dr Jakub Gierczyński , an economics and health care specialist, reported that 8 000 people died directly from diabetes in Poland in 2017. A year earlier, 6 thousand people died of diabetes. However, many more people die due to diabetic complications. In 2017, 26 thousand people died because of diabetes complications. The reason for 70% of these deaths were cardiovascular diseases resulting from diabetes complications. Diabetologist from the Central Clinical Hospital of the Ministry of Interior and Administration Dr Alicja Milczarczyk pointed out that in Poland no drugs which have proven to be effective in cardiovascular complications are reimbursed. They reduce the possibility of death from 22 to 38%. Although these drugs are available in pharmacies, many patients are unable to take the therapy because they cannot afford to buy these drugs. She suggested that if they cannot be reimbursed for all people with vascular and cardiac complications, then at least the drugs for people after a heart attack should be reimbursed.

He informed that the next spring session will be "exceptionally rich in residencies" - at the moment the recruitment for 1901 seats is ongoing. He said that this year's priority will be, among other things, general surgery because the surgeons in our hospitals are "dramatically lacking". In the autumn - as he added - the most places will be for doctors of internal diseases, which are also missing. Pinkas emphasized that "we are moving away from the felicity of medicine" . In his opinion, the project of abandonment of the internship was missed and he reminded us that work is underway on a law that will restore it. As he added, the bill should soon go to parliament. "There will be no yearbook without internship," he noted. He stressed that during the internship the doctor will have the right to practice under the supervision of a tutor.

Research by Dr Edyta Brzóski-Wójtowicz is a hope, among others, for the victims of accidents in which muscle damage occurred. "In mice such damaged tissues treated with stem cells regenerate after 14 days. In humans it will of course take longer and will depend on the size of the damage. Generally speaking, the process of muscle regeneration could take about a month" - describes the PAP interlocutor. The speed of tissue regeneration depends largely on the condition in which we are in, how our immune system works and what we suffer from. The ability to regenerate also decreases with age. "We have been conducting our research for several years. Now we are carrying out projects which aim to implement the results of our research. Estimating very optimistically the implementation of the whole method could take place in 10-20 years" - reserves the interlocutor of PAP.

"The patch, which would be a few centimeters in size, + would be stuck + would be in place of the infarction scar. After a few weeks the stem cells would transform into target cells, i.e. into vessels and heart cells or support the regeneration of this area" - describes Dr Sielicka . "So far it has been shown that stem cells are very willing to transform into blood vessel cells, which increases the oxygenation of the heart and reduces the place of ischemia," the scientist adds. If a patient who has had a heart attack had stem cells in a cell bank, he could have received a patch made by scientists after a few days. "Stem cells help to reduce the scar. They will also allow the patient to function normally because his heart will be more stable, stronger and more efficient. Increasing the heart's efficiency by 10% can translate into much greater activity and physical fitness," the researcher argues.

This bowl is a mistake. Its upper and lower dimension is too small to reach the lower bar in a flush-mounted frame (in my case - Geberit Duofix). The effect ? The bowl hangs only on top screws, without any support from below. It bends and in a painted cardboard box it literally made a hole through. The bowl will go to complain, and I have to look for something new. I think that Catalano designers themselves know about their defective product, so now only a new version of the bowl is being produced, with an increased upper and lower dimension and with completely hidden attachments (without plastic caps on the side). A standing version of the bowl is also available. It is certainly a better choice than this bubble. On the positive side, the bowl is nice and short. Unfortunately, nothing justifies the defective shape, hence the 1 star .

Wonderful place with wonderful hosts . There is a gym, bicycles, a sauna on the lake, a fireplace, a public kitchen, a playroom for children and a home cinema. I recommend it for trips with friends, in pairs or with family.

Room: we stayed in the Junior Suite, very large, spacious rooms, a Jacuzzi inside. Large windows overlooking Turtle Island, step from the pool room. At night you can see the milk road beautifully - it really is an amazing view: ) What as what, but such conditions even the most demanding tourist may call a luxury. Very intimate, without the hotel crowd. The only thing that may not work is the neighbors - we have just found a Polish man from the UK. They had a drink every night and they seemed to be alone. The rooms were cleaned daily, the water in the pool was cleaned once a week. Air-conditioning and fridge are additionally paid for. On the terrace by the rooms, some visual separation of the space between the rooms would be useful - in the evening, some people were able to stay in front of someone else's room, which effectively deprived them of privacy: ) Location: hotel located in a quiet village of Porto Koukla (which literally means Port Dolls :) ) The beach by the hotel is beautiful (and close), the sun loungers are said to be free if you buy something in the bar, but all week long we used the beach for free without any problems: ) Beach to Agios Sostis ok . 5 min . on foot, to the island of Cameo (with "sheets") ok . 20 min . and to Laganas about . 40 min . I advise not to go on foot on the roads, because it is much longer. Hotel: I'll write right away that there is no internet - it didn't bother me, but some people are addicted and it can be a problem: ) The network is, but it just doesn't work, and when it does, it works for a few seconds and nobody from the staff cares: ) Eating okay, no crazy, but you can get eaten, breakfasts between 8 - 10, dinners between 19 - 21. All this time the food is added on a regular basis. What's the downside is paid drinks for dinner - it's a misunderstanding: ) You better take your own. Next to the hotel a very good Vardiola pub: ) As far as I know, people in ordinary rooms complained about the lack of water and unpleasant smell - in the Junior Suite it was not. Earlier he read 'em that there are stray animals running in the hotel - we met only a small harmless cat :) To sum up, the biggest advantage is the views from the hotel, the biggest disadvantage is the neighbors: )

The first project to be put up for sale is the Millennium Hotel " . . .we read in the announcement. The Management Board of EFH decided to start the buy-back of own shares again. This is an implementation of the company's General Meeting of Shareholders from last year (2011), which authorized the company's Management Board to buy back up to PLN 25 million of its own shares. The buy-back of treasury shares is the company's response to the current valuation of its assets, which - in the opinion of the Management Board and shareholders - is far from the valuation of its assets. Share capital of the European Mortgage Fund S . A Mortgage Fund's share capital amounts to PLN 146.6 million and is divided into 146.6 million shares with a nominal value of PLN 1.00 each. At the closing of the WSE session on 3 July 2012 the share price of EFH shares was PLN 0.44 .

It seems that all chain hotels - out of 16 football teams' residence bases for Euro 2012 only the 4 listed were hotels of international chains - were "eliminated" from the tournament after the group phase of the tournament. Does it mean that comfortable "chain hotels" attractively located in city centres, despite their advantages, would provide football players with worse conditions for sleep, rest and concentration than independent hotels located far from the big city noise? Or maybe the hotels "bet" simply on the weaker or lesser teams? No. The choice of facilities by individual representations was a resultant of the location, the offer (including price) and individual preferences of the selectors, and depended more on the representation than the facilities themselves. In sport - which was also clearly shown by the course of the Euro 2012 tournament so far - there is no 100%. The "sure-fire" and both potential leaders and potential "black horses" had to give in to those who turned out to be better or luckier.

No more shared bathrooms, early breakfasts and nylon sheets. The twilight of lower-standard pensions and Bed and Breakfast facilities, which are being replaced by budget hotel chains, is being replaced by the British daily newspaper "The Independent". The dynamic development of cheap hotels and the increase in guests' expectations threaten the existence of traditional, cheap facilities. Some will be forced to raise their standards, others will have to leave the market. This is already happening: since 2007 over 1.5 thousand B&B facilities with a standard below three stars have been closed in England. In Scotland, the number of guesthouses of 1 - 2 stars standard has decreased by 63%. The number of budget hotels increased by 80%. A third of the guest houses and B&Bs in the UK had fewer guests in the first half of this year than the year before, writes " The Independent " . Alex Polizzi, granddaughter of the well-known hotelier Lord Forte (Forte Group, the initiator and investor of the reconstruction of the Bristol Hotel in Warsaw in the early 1990s). - note Editors) The hotel is not surprised, but on the contrary, it is satisfied with the fact that B&B facilities are being displaced by hotels.

When Dominika Nowis wonders how to destroy cancer, she always checks that her methods of fighting will not destroy our healthy organs. She is the first in the world to examine whether proteasome inhibitors impair heart function. The work she and Dr. Nowis have done together with Dr. Nowis is the first to examine whether the proteasome inhibitors are impairing heart function. Gaetano Vattemi from the University of Verona, was to help doctors to better select patients for treatment with proteasome inhibitors to reduce the risk of unexpected side effects. It turned out that although the drugs are toxic, the effects of the drugs are gone after some time of withdrawal. Patients do not need to be afraid that they will recover from the cancer in order to die of heart failure. The researcher has also been looking for ways to kill cancer with light for many years. First she "sensitizes" cancer cells to light and then uses a killer combination of oxygen and laser light. However, cancer is a tough opponent. When it turned out that some cancers can survive such a murderous therapy, the researcher inhibited some enzymes that helped them to do so. Publications on this subject have accepted reputable journals promoting the achievements of world biochemistry and experimental oncology.

"Despite not very good information on the economic situation in Europe, the hotel market continued to increase attendance and room rates in October. Elizabeth Randall, Managing Director of STR Global, evaluates the performance of the hotels. Comparison of hotel results based on data collected by STR Global for the period October 2011 to October 2010. The comparison of the hotels' performance on the basis of the data collected by STR Global for the period October 2011 to October 2010 shows a positive trend in the industry's performance in terms of basic currencies. Randall adds that the cities that recorded the highest revenue drops per room available missed one major event this year, which had been lifting the rates up the year before. In fact, the highest revenue per room available, RevPAR, was recorded in Sweden's Gothenburg (- 22.7%, to 71.21 euros) and Welsh Cardiff (- 21.1%, to 45.69 euros).

They should focus on segmentation, or rather personalisation and specific service targeting. To individuals and groups that generate real income. Both as consumers, but also (in social media time) by influencing others .

Mammals, including humans, do not have the ability to heal wounds scar-free. "Each wound heals with the creation of a scar, sometimes it is a hypertrophic scar, which makes life difficult and from a cosmetic point of view looks very unattractive" - says Prof. Barbara Gawrońska - Cossack from the Institute of Animal Reproduction and Food Research of the Polish Academy of Sciences in Olsztyn. Meanwhile, in fetal life, human wounds heal without any scars. "If the operation on a child is carried out in the womb, then the child is born without a scar, it is not visible where the operation took place. It means that in our developmental life we really have a feature of scar-free healing, regeneration, in adult life we lose it. Is it possible to redirect the route in adult life so that this scar is not present? This is what we do" - explains prof . Gawrońska - Kozak .

Researchers from the team of dr hab . Katarzyna Radwańska from the Institute of Experimental Biology of the Polish Academy of Sciences in Warsaw conducted an experiment for 95 days in which they examined the tendency of mice to reach for alcohol. "Mice drink alcohol and are very willing to drink it. However, it is a little more difficult to say whether mice can be addicted to alcohol" - says Radwańska . In her research work she deals with, among other things, animal models of alcohol addiction, and one of her research goals is to understand the molecular, cellular background of the addiction memory. "If a psychiatrist is to determine whether his patient is addicted to alcohol, for example, he asks him specific questions: how long he has been drinking, whether his drinking translates into his private and professional life. We, in a sense, have to ask the same questions to mice, which, as we know, answer less willingly" - describes the researcher.

The aim is to participate jointly in national and international research programmes, as well as to cooperate in the field of medical education at Lazarski University. This is my second dagger of its kind. First bought from the middle shelf and then ncx , but in 2013 . The stick is working, but it has a design error. Both models have the same problem after a while. If it is a vertically positioned pillar (and this is the manufacturer's specification), it should work perfectly. Senk in that most frames have a pipe for the stick at some angle. This design with all these joints causes the pin, which is pushed in and resisted by two springs, to rub against the sleeve in which it is placed. No greases or specialty oils for the piston, etc. seem to be of any use. The pressure of the mass exerted at an angle causes the piston to rub one wall against the sleeve and rubs off. A man will drive 10 km to the cross and the friction starts again, which makes a sound throughout the frame. When unfolded into the first parts, one side of the piston is completely rubbed off. Generally, for such money (almost 300 PLN) is some kind of defeat. Two different models and the same reaction, and I weigh 72kg so it is rather not known what load.

Apart from nice service, this hotel does not even deserve 1 star. . . No air conditioning, in the rooms facing fans, which you have to turn off when you leave the room (separate key to "electricity" in the room), the smell of old, aerated furniture, carpet and mattresses floats everywhere, in the bathroom we found a toilet without toilet seat board, and the flush was broken. Around the hotel you can smell cat urine everywhere, cats run on balconies until the fear of leaving the window open. As for the pool, the reality has nothing to do with the pictures, except maybe at night. . Cleaning in the rooms is very irregular - the neighbors had garbage bags and bed linen changed 4 times a week, we only 2. And now the best - there are KARALUCHES in the whole hotel. I understand 2 stars, we did not expect miracles, but bugs and cats in the canteen, dirty rooms and the stench of musty everywhere. . . This hotel shouldn't be called a hotel, it should feel the coming fall. I wouldn't recommend it. Luckily, Rhodes itself is beautiful and has alleviated the unpleasant hotel experience, but in order not to be discouraged and not to get upset, I advise you to choose another hotel. Greetings.

As he added, during the research, information about many parameters are collected, which describe functioning of mitochondria. "These parameters concern the appearance of mitochondria, their structure, how they move, whether they are fragmented or not. They also describe their functioning, that is their ability to produce ATP. Mitochondria are the units in a cell responsible for the production of ATP, the energy molecule which is used in the cell for most processes, enabling the cell to survive at all," he said. "If we determine the effect of these substances on the mitochondria and the whole cell, it is possible to translate these results into the harmfulness of the substance for the whole body of the smoker. If it turns out that the mitochondria function better than in the case of traditional cigarettes, then the smoker, who uses a new technology, i.e. tobacco heating, may be less exposed to the harmful effects resulting from the toxicity of the substance" - concluded Więckowski .

I was at your doctor's house in Adameda looking for help with my severe pains in the caudal bone area. Because they are inoperable. She believed me: (After a year and a half of nonstop siphoning of anti-inflammatory drugs she started looking for help again. She found me in a pain treatment clinic and there the neurologist Dr. Kmieciak, on this weird resonance, diagnosed an already aging fracture of the tumour bone ! ! This was confirmed by a radiologist. Thank you, Doctor, for almost two years of pain! ! ! Now I don't even know what's going to happen to me because the entire tailbone is inflamed and there are necrotic lesions.

You can spend time in the hotel. The food is good, you can recommend it. A hotel with a clear conscience I can recommend to everyone. So... . . .the course is generally quite heavy, a lot of people go out in the beginning. Absolutely not. My problem with which I decided to come to this doctor has been going on for a year. She found me at his office by order and I guess I'll never listen to anybody else about doctors again. When I finally managed to make an appointment for my first visit, which was not easy anyway (she had to specify on the phone what the visit was supposed to be about - a little bit pointless, she would prefer that the doctor himself find out what was wrong with me and not based on my guesses) she was quite satisfied with me. The doctor seemed to be professional, very kind and polite. With each subsequent visit, my confidence in his competence diminished. Already on the first visit she was given m antidepressants and millions of ointments (including painkillers) - the doctor said vulvodynia, although I was not sure if he listened to the fact that her symptoms do not coincide with mine. But good, she thought I was probably right. Unfortunately, with time, my condition did not improve, but on the contrary, it was getting worse. With each subsequent visit (and let's not hide, visits to the cheapest ones are not) she heard m " You do not feel any improvement yet, but I can already see her. ( . . . ) We will only increase the dose of drugs. ( . . . ) Next time you have a pain attack, please apply a painkiller ointment. "I'm finally getting tired of something like this. Pain relief ointment and only temporary pain avoidance will not solve the problem. She decided to go to another doctor. The doctor, where I was, said that I should go to a urologist, because I have a cyst in the vulva region of the urethra, which a specialist should see. Currently I am after two treatments trying to remove the cyst, which is recurring in the form of an abscess. There is a chance for surgery. The doctor who came to me said that the problem had been untreated for too long and he was in severe shock when he heard about the treatment of this doctor. I am very disappointed and angry that she wasted me so much money, time and obviously health. I wonder if I wouldn't go back there again and explain why there wasn't a treatment appropriate to the disease. I am very disappointed I do not recommend to anyone, even for ordinary visits of women without major gynaecological problems.

An attempt to transfer the idea of the Coalition to the regional level was made in the autumn of this year by establishing the Silesian Cervical Cancer Coalition. According to the professor, similar initiatives should also be developed in other regions, and they must be followed by local activities in municipalities and districts. "This requires a concerted cooperation of doctors, community nurses and local institutions. For example, social welfare centres can be involved in promoting free of charge cytological examinations" - believes the professor . In his opinion, women from poor families are most often disregarded by the examinations . Professor quoted the example of Tychy, where the mortality rate from cervical cancer is among the lowest in the region . Professor . For 33 years Poręba was associated with the gynaecology and obstetrics clinic operating in the city. Currently, after the withdrawal of the clinic from Tychy by the Silesian Medical University, professor is a consultant of the gynaecological department of the Tychy hospital.

I think there are people who want to go to a gynaecologist mainly for psychological and even psychiatric advice. Good contact with the patient is important in every specialization but especially in these specialties like gynecology it is important to be objective, to be able to give important information important to the patient who has to use it and not to forget it five minutes after leaving the office. As far as these issues are concerned, the Doctor is irreplaceable here because she gives specific information, not fantasies, and for the forgotten, she writes on a piece of paper. A visit to the doctor's office is not a conversation with a friend or an opportunity to unload your frustrations. I prefer the doctor's objectivity to the lack of precision, which leads to the fact that you do not know what you have come to the doctor for. I recommend it.

I have had psoriasis for a very long time. I went through many surgeries and without me it was 'treated' in them. I am only after the first visit to the doctor but I cannot have any negative comments. He explained to me exactly the course of treatment, ointment and other medicines how to use, he dictated exactly how to use them so as not to confuse them (I have 4 of them in the same jars). He explained the purpose of the exposure, the price of the treatment and the medicines. It is not important to me whether the doctor is in a great mood or not, what matters to me is knowledge and professionalism, which at the moment I can not take into account your doctor, he was relatively nice during the visit, so I'm surprised by the comments after which she set herself rather not pleasant visit. I hope that with the next checks and a little bit of them I will be able to speak as positively about Dr . Rostalski .

In its Consumer Intelligence Series analysis, PwC surveyed over a thousand travelers from the leisure and business segments. We don't send stupidity: ) The aim of the study was to find out guests' preferences for hotel loyalty programs and loyalty to the hotel as a brand. The more interesting conclusions are as follows: - differences in millennium preferences do not differ significantly from other groups of consumers (which is different from what Em wrote earlier, using the Revinate blog) - the main factor in choosing a loyalty program is the subjectively perceived value of the points gained, although in the leisure group as many as 58% of respondents did not use the points gained - the way of involving guests with a hotel brand is very similar in groups interested in leisure and millenniums - how are the points realized?

Perhaps the investor himself has changed his hotel plans, which may be related to the general, not very favorable economic situation. The progress of works is also not visible in the modernisation and extension of the Grand Hotel in Łódź, which is not surprising, however, because they were to start after the hotel in Warsaw was put into operation. If the works start in the spring this year, it is not surprising that they were to start after the hotel in Warsaw was put into operation. If the works start in the spring of this year, Prudential will have a chance to become the second luxury hotel in Warsaw, after Bristol, which has just joined the Luxury Collection chain. If it is extended to 2015, it may be overtaken by the European hotel, whose modernisation and renovation is expected to start in the coming months and last until 2015. The European hotel is to return to the market as part of the Raffles chain. Thus, in 2015 as many as three luxury hotels may operate in the capital city market. Will they find visitors? They should, because the launch of direct flights to Middle Eastern countries by Quatar Airways and Emirates Airlines, promises to increase inbound traffic, including tourism by a more affluent group.

I have cancelled the visit twice, and when I finally managed to get it with my daughter, it turned out that I was taken in by an assistant who couldn't refer to the doctor's earlier recommendations and still simply cancels it for the visit. On the next visit at Mrs. Wary's I get a recommendation to remove two teeth from the child, while in accordance with previous recommendations, we have already removed three, each of the three other specialists with whom she consulted because she did not want to leave the child without teeth knocked on the head for such a diagnosis. Unfortunately, she recommended me earlier to a colleague who, after a similar adventure with the proposal of pulling out half of the teeth, quickly changed the specialist. Hello, when she found out I was pregnant she wanted me to be led by an experienced doctor. So she signed up for a visit to Dr. Bystrzejewski suggesting herself with opinions on the internet. I can now say that all my appointments were made in a hurry because every time there was a delay of at least one hour because the doctor was always late. Such a situation should not happen, taking into account that each visit must be properly paid for. During the whole pregnancy I had about 13 visits after which the doctor did not even remember my name. With a clear conscience I can say that the sympathetic doctor conducted the examination in a gentle manner. Unfortunately, the visits lasted a few minutes in total, the doctor forgot to write prescriptions because he was in an eternal rush. The worst thing is that with this hurry and distraction, the doctor had to interpret the results of the examination which could result in damage to the fetus. When after my overzealousness finally came out that the results are bad and it is because of the doctor's inattention, she did not even hear me apologize. I do not recommend it.

Hotel: located outside the center of Krakow, however, with very good access to both the center and the airport. The hotel provides free access to the centre of Krakow twice a day. Prices for accommodation are competitive in comparison with other 4 * hotels in Krakow. Rooms: Standard furnished with double bed, sofa, television, minibar, safe, internet, telephone, coffee machine, kettle, bathroom with shower. Room: heated / air-conditioned. Pluses: Attractions and facilities for children (playgrounds, playgrounds, playroom, animations, mini-discos, fireplace, mini zoo, etc.). ) - super pool adapted even for a crawling child (additional paddling pool with slides) Feeding - b . good (all meals in the form of buffet including lunch - there is no saving after proposing some dinner. ) Attractions for adults were also a nice touch of this stay. Generally, you can not leave the center and have a great time. Minus: Small rooms, no air conditioning.

A small room, but clean. It's even good in comparison to other Ibis, because it has a normal bathroom and not a shower in the room. The air-conditioning - efficient, wifi - also. The hotel is very well located, 10 minutes walk from the Market Square. Upon arrival at the reception desk immediately and without asking me a question, they downloaded me from my credit card for the stay and parking (usually I pay at check-out). Breakfast (pricelistically - 36 PLN per person, I just had it included in the night) - as well as in other Accor / Orbis hotels in the form of a Swedish table, so (theoretically) you can eat at will. But only theoretically. Most of the products are inedible: the "cheese" cheese, probably even scrambled eggs were from egg-like "eggs" . He tempted em to "apple pie according to grandma's recipe. " . And I also failed to murder her.

Maybe I'll start by saying my name is Tom and I'm a gambler. Patrician was my individual therapist as well as he was running group activities in the place where I was starting to get out of my addiction ... It is very difficult for me to describe, assess and find words that would describe his contribution to my health ... and this is because the contribution was simply huge and actually indescribable: ) It all started in the autumn of 2015 when I was sent to the centre after several years of playing in a deeply depressed state, on the verge of mental exhaustion, with huge debts ... "Life or death" - these are the words of Patrician, which I will remember for the rest of my life and which he said, when he found out that a few months after the earlier interrupted therapy, he started to play 'em again ... Words that he said with full responsibility knowing my condition ... Through which he also knew that I could always go back to therapy and call him ... ... and he called 'em. The moment he actually realized to himself that I only have two choices. From the moment he started therapy again, Patricia was the man he trusted em with. He trusted 'em 100%. . . He was and is my mentor and guide (here, sure, reading, smiling and a little reddening) . In individual contact, it turned out that we broadcast on "one wave" and we had similar problems in life. Thus, in the initial phase of therapy, each meeting poured a lot of hope into my heart that I can get out of my addiction and my depressive state and enjoy life: ) ( because he's done it. ) Each of our meetings has always brought something new, innovative for me. It wasn't easy ... The trust that Patrician gave me paid off and resulted in the fact that today I lead a very happy and active life free from addictions, full of joy from the smallest things: ) With Patrician, although our therapeutic meetings are not yet held, we are in constant contact with him... who I appreciate very much :) On the way, it turned out that we have similar interests, sense of humor and we simply understand each other: )

Despite the dynamic growth in Rio de Janeiro, which will host the World Cup next year and the 2016 Summer Olympics, there is a shortage of hotels of an appropriate standard. Currently, the city has 25,000 hotel rooms meeting the requirements of the International Olympic Committee. This is only 3,000 fewer rooms than the IOC requirements as of 5 August 2016, the day the Games begin. Brazilians are confident that they will meet the challenge and the number of hotel rooms will not only comply with IOC requirements, but will even exceed them. According to the analytical company STR Global, at the threshold of 2013 in Brazil, there were hotel projects with 18,600 rooms in Brazil (the size equals about 10% of the current market), including 1,900 rooms in Rio de Janeiro.

The Doctor has given us almost 1 hour of his time. It is a great rarity for this type of specialists who have so many patients that the visits are very short and hard to get out of them, except in a hurry. In the meantime, we have been quietly explained what our daughter's disease is about, how to live with her and how to treat her. With great patience, but also with professionalism, the doctor answered our questions. We spent a week in Eleon with two children (13 months and 5 years) from TUI Poland since 23rd . 05 - 30 . 05 . 2014 . A comfortable room, clean without vermin, good food but no seafood . "The results of our research in a series of five papers have been published in world-renowned scientific journals. On April 3, 2018, our latest publication was published in the scientific journal Scientific Reports of the Nature Publishing Group, the world's most prestigious scientific publisher," she added. Researchers from the Institute of the Polish Academy of Sciences (IRZiBŻ PAN) in Olsztyn also conduct research on human skin tissues stored in the tissue bank. "Interestingly, our pilot and very preliminary studies carried out on human skin samples confirm the observations in mouse skin. It turned out that in post-traumatic tissues (scar tissue) there is a higher activity of + scar gene + Foxn1 in comparison to the uninjured / healthy skin" - described Barbara Gawrońska - Kozak. One of the current directions of the Olsztyn research group is to demonstrate the relationship between individual age and Foxn1 activity.

More than 139,000 rooms in 869 hotels were under construction in November 2011, and different stages of preparation for construction in Europe, according to the Construction Pipeline Report prepared by STR Global. A year earlier, in November 2010, 732 hotels with 124,348 rooms were at various stages of construction in Europe. In November this year, the largest number of hotels in Europe were in the exclusive segment (Upscale). 30,369 rooms in the hotels in this segment accounted for 20, 1 of all hotel projects under construction and planned. The higher segment invariably takes first place in terms of participation in new projects - in November this year. In November last year, the share of rooms under construction amounted to 21.3% of all rooms under construction. Out of seven segments identified in the STR Global research, three more had a share greater than 10% of all rooms under construction and planned. These were: comfort segment (Upper Midscale) - 19, 2% and 26,726 rooms, non-classified (Unaffiliated) - 19, 2% and 26,755 rooms and the highest segment (Upper Upscale) - 15, 0% and 20,802 rooms. Source: STR Global

The concentration of the "traced" particles will be announced by the participants of the action during special information and health actions. They will take place on March 15th or 22nd in all towns visited by patrols. During the action you will be able to take advantage of free medical tests, get medical advice, measure blood pressure and blood sugar levels. In some locations, free spirometric tests will also be performed, allowing for early detection of bronchial diseases, including chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), which is, among other things, a result of inhaling particles. Patrols and health actions are held in cooperation with the International Medical Students' Association IFMSA - Poland, which is a partner of the Particle Tracers campaign. The equipment for measuring the level of particulate matter has been made available by 3M company and the Scientific Circle for Environmental Protection of Warsaw University of Technology, which are also partners of the initiative.

In 2005 she came to see a doctor for brain tumor exposure. The doctor claimed that it was a gamma knife, and as it later turned out, it was a simple linear accelerator that uses a different kind of radiation. That's what the doctor should know. But whatever, because it wasn't the worst. After the procedure she did not get any recommendations (the doctor assured that there will be no side effects). At that time she didn't know that, but nowadays I know that normally after radiotherapy a patient should be recommended to take steroids if something was wrong. Then I had no idea about it. After all, it is the doctor who is the treatment and the patient can only rely on it. About 3 months after the treatment she was walking around with a headache and when she tried to contact the doctor, he cut himself off completely. He did not answer the phone calls from me or from my parents. I'll add that he took money for the surgery itself. The effect of all this was that as a result of untreated swelling (at first she didn't even know I had it) I suffered damage to motor neurons in my frontal lobe, which resulted in paresis and which unfortunately I am experiencing until today. All I had to do was to order further treatment. If the doctor didn't want to do it himself, he could just tell her to go to another doctor. I have a great regret, because before the procedure she was a fully fit person. Today is different. I warn you not to do the irradiation with this gentleman.

"Polyglutamine diseases are rare diseases. Before the first symptoms appear, people with a genetic mutation usually do not know that they will get sick. Therefore, genetic testing is most often performed only on children of sick parents. The test detects the mutation and the children may only know that in approx. In 20 years they will be sick. But there is no drug that could somehow prevent such a fate" - regrets Stroynowska - Czerwińska. Scientists must not only learn the exact mechanisms of action of non-coding RNA, but also answer the question how to deliver such drugs to the body. If nerve cells are susceptible to mutations, then small non-coding RNAs will have to be delivered to the brain, which is problematic even by the presence of the blood-brain barrier.

On October 29th ibis mega brand will be joined by ibis Styles Gdynia Reda as the first hotel in Poland to represent the brand. By the end of 2015 Orbis SA wants to have at least 10 hotels of the brand in Poland. The hotel is located in Reda near Gdynia and will operate under a franchise agreement. Ibis Styles, previously known as all seasons, is a chain of budget hotels launched by the Accor Group in 2007. The facilities of this brand combine an individual hotel concept of independent hotels with chain service standards. ibis Styles hotels are medium sized (up to 150 rooms in Europe and 200 in Asia). In Europe, the brand is growing mainly through franchise agreements (95% of the hotels), while in Asia and the Pacific, it is growing under management contracts.

As prof . Gawrońska - Kozak , it is unusual that in people at a very early stage of life (in fetal life) skin wounds heal without any scars. Surgery performed on children in the womb until the end of the second trimester of pregnancy leaves no traces, while when the child is operated on in the following weeks of pregnancy the scars are already visible. Interestingly, redirecting scar-free healing to scar tissue coincides with activation of Foxn1 - "scar gene" activity. Currently conducted research in the Regenerative Biology Laboratory in the future may enable treatment of healing wounds, e.g. in diabetics. They may also help in the treatment of patients whose wounds leave extensive, debilitating or disfiguring scars.

The second of Krakow's facilities - Quality Hotel System Krakow North - has chosen independence and currently provides services under the name WM Hotel System. All listed facilities have a three-star standard. The five-star Clairon Hotel Grand Baltic Resort & Spa, on the other hand, has completely abandoned the reference in its name to both the Choice (Quality) and Hotel System and is now called Havet Hotel Dźwirzyno. Therefore, the beginning of Choice Hotels International's operations in Poland did not turn out to be very prosperous, and the development of events confirmed the restrained approach of large hotel chains to binding their brands to condo facilities. The negotiations not with one, but with a few or several dozen owners, and thus several dozen different views on the hotel business, can be much more difficult or even impossible to be successfully concluded. Is the end of cooperation with the former Hotel System facilities also the end of Choice's presence on the Polish market?

The prototype of the device, which was created thanks to the cooperation of scientists from the Silesian University of Technology, Częstochowa University of Technology, doctors from the Burn Treatment Centre in Siemianowice Śląskie and engineers from the Institute of Medical Equipment in Zabrze, moves over the patient's body, "scanning" the wound surface. After the measurement, the thermograms are "spread out" on the plane and compared with each other. Therefore, apart from the diagnosis of the burn itself, banded thermovision allows for comparison of the way and rate of wound healing, allowing for adjustment of therapy and effective treatment. "The path of such an invention to universal use is very long," says Professor Majchrzak. "First there is the concept and the virtual model, which we created in cooperation with doctors from Siemianowice, through the prototype made by the Zabrze IAM, and then the tests, which are still few and far between. Such equipment is first tested on dummies, its safety is checked, the way the test is carried out is tested (e.g. distance from the wound, allowing to optimize the measurement), then the test is carried out on the healthy and sick" - describes the researcher.

"The IHG was the first international hotel group to appear in China almost 30 years ago, which gives us a deep understanding of the market and consumers. Over the past years we have been successful with five of our brands already present in this market and we will use this experience to develop the Hualuxe brand. ...says Keith Barr, director of IHG China. The largest hotel group in the world, IHG, is also the largest international hotel operator in China. IHG has over 160 hotels in 60 cities in China and wants to be present in more than 100 cities in 15-20 years. The Hualuxe brand was created in response to three growth factors: - The demand for a prestigious international hotel brand that would reflect the local Chinese tradition and aspirations, - An increase in the number of domestic travels in China to 3.3 billion in 2015 and an increase in the hotel market of 5-8% per year by 2030 (according to forecasts of the China National Tourism Administration), - An increase in international travel by Chinese residents from the current 10 million to over 100 million over the next 10 to 15 years. Photo: Hualuxe hotel visualizations: facade, tea room, lobby and room. About preparations for the launch of the new IHG brand: InterContinental Hotel Group presented a project of an upscale (5 star) hotel designed specifically for the Chinese tourist.

" Kap7 - Methyloguanosine is located at one of the ends of the mRNA ( the so-called . end 5 ' ) - explains prof . Darżynkiewicz . - In the cytoplasm, the structure of capu is recognized by the eIF4E factor initiating the process of protein biosynthesis, i.e. translation . This stage determines the speed of the whole complex sequence of events that end up producing a protein in a cell. The presence of capu also protects mRNAs from premature degradation by intersecting enzymes - nucleases. Unfortunately, the cells have a natural mechanism of capu removal by the so-called capu degradation enzymes (decapping enzymes, e.g. Dcp1 / Dcp2). A few years ago we discovered that the use of modified capu analogs can make the end of 5 ' mRNAs more resistant to degradation and increase their efficiency ' . "In a paper recently published in the journal Nucleic Acids Research, we presented a new class of modified caps - an improved version of those currently found in clinical trials, informs Prof . Jemielites . - The modification consists in changing the oxygen atom with a sulphur atom in several positions . The cap is then bound to a record high efficiency and has high resistance to degrading enzymes. The modification leads to the creation of much more therapeutic protein " .

Ablation is a non-pharmacological treatment for cardiac arrhythmias. It consists in inserting special electrodes into the heart through an insertion into the femoral vein, connected to a computer. This allows the doctor to properly assess the electrical activity of the heart and precisely locate the place causing the arrhythmia. Then the malfunctioning tissue of the myocardium is heated up by alternating current of radio frequency. The desired effect of this procedure is a small scar which loses its conductive properties and stops being a source of heart rhythm disturbances. Training ablation procedures in Zabrze were performed with the use of electroanatomical system Ensite Precision - a new generation tool which allows to perform complicated procedures of cardiac arrhythmias ablation in a much shorter time and increase their safety. The system allows to create a three-dimensional geometric map of the heart with the simultaneous creation of potential and time maps of studied heart structures. Thanks to this system, it is not necessary to use X-rays during the procedure, which in high doses are dangerous for patients and medical personnel.

The second important objective of the project is to develop new methods of synthesis of antidepressants. These methods can be used both to obtain existing drugs on the market and to obtain new substances. "We were looking for solutions that would be more efficient, more economical and more ecological, in line with green chemistry principles. I can confirm that we already have two new methods developed at this stage of research. We are preparing to patent them" - said Dr. Jaśkowska . As she explained, the measures proposed by her team will shorten the drug production process by several time-consuming and costly phases. "According to our methods, the time when the desired chemical reaction takes place is a few minutes, and in some cases just a few dozen seconds. Our ideas have also reduced the contribution of toxic solvents to the formation of new compounds," said the scientist.

According to prof . Kwiatkowski - one of the contractors of the first chain kidney transplantation in Poland, changes are needed in the field of kidney acquisition and distribution, eligibility rules for kidney transplantation and financing of transplantation. The qualification of patients for kidney transplantation, which is carried out in dialysis stations, where patients with chronic kidney failure undergo blood purification procedures from toxic toxins. "In these centres about 22 thousand patients are treated, but only 5% of them are reported for transplantation. Therefore, the vast majority of patients, i.e. as many as 95%, are not included on the national waiting list for a kidney transplantation" - emphasised prof . Kwiatkowski .

The pool is small but ideal for sitting in the water. Three depths, so every child will find a place for himself. We spent a lot of time there because we could let our little girl go free to crawl. There is also a ping-pong table by the pool. We didn't use the evening animation at the Insotel, so I can't judge that. LocationThere are three beaches in the area from about . 5 - 15 min walk. A shallow descent so ideal for families with children. Sun loungers and umbrellas are paid for (set of 2 lounger umbrellas about 14e), but you can freely unfold on the sand, there is plenty of space. Not far from the village of Porto Cristo, about 45 minutes on foot, by car about. 10 - 15 min . However, I recommend a walk, because the road is very simple and it is hard to find parking places in the city. There is a bus stop next to the hotel. There is a Spar shop next to the hotel, but shopping in Porto cristo in the Hiper Centro Navegante supermarket is more like it is. The prices are much lower. The town is generally a quiet place and it is more of a place to go to further corners of Mallorca than a place to party.

"Unfortunately, we still do not use the potential of peripheral blood morphology to detect blood diseases, including leukaemia. In the past, 20% of cases of this disease in Poland were detected in the morphology of peripheral blood performed routinely as part of periodic occupational medicine examinations, now only 2%. However, statistics show that in other European countries up to 40% of all cases of leukaemia are detected in this study" - pointed out prof . Wiesław W . Jędrzejczak . " The role of occupational medicine in early diagnosis of diseases is invaluable . Often it is the only moment in a few years when we perform any examination . Occupational medicine, apart from the basic role, which is of course to determine the possibility of performing a given job, is also an incentive to monitor one's health, a chance to detect possible diseases more quickly. The morphology of peripheral blood is not a standard test performed as part of preventive examinations, however, many employers finance additional health service packages for their employees and it is worth remembering about this examination" - emphasized the national consultant in the field of occupational medicine Paweł Wdówik . ( PAP )

The stethoscope is probably familiar to every patient from the sight - these neck hung headphones have long since become a symbol of the medical profession. Thanks to this simple device, the doctor can quickly and comfortably listen to the patient and initially diagnose e.g. structural defects of the heart, lungs, abdominal cavity or even thyroid and arterial diseases. A traditional stethoscope is not a very complicated device - thanks to the membrane and the funnel hidden behind it, sounds from the patient's body are transmitted to the doctor's ear. "The flow of blood or air in our body is accompanied by noise, which is transmitted through tissues and can be picked up on the skin. These sounds may contain information about certain pathological conditions in the body" - explains Łukasz Nowak, PhD from the Institute of Fundamental Technological Problems of the Polish Academy of Sciences in Warsaw, which conducts research on a new generation of stethoscopes.

Oh, Dr. Dr. I have a very bad opinion. In May 2008 I was sent to a private office of Mrs. Dr. Lewandowicz on Rajdowa Street - she was looking for help - all my joints hurt, my hands and wrists were swollen and she couldn't move them, my neck was stiff and I barely got there. She paid m 100 PLN and received an answer: that I am at that age, that it hurts (she was m 56 years old). On the page of Mrs. Dr . She wrote that she should buy a ZINAXIN in a herbalist's and take it for 3 months, then 2 breaks and the same again. She also advised me to apply for a disability group if it hurts so much. So far I have this card written in my hand by Dr . Lewandowicz - who considers himself a great authority. She couldn't cope with the disease - she was looking for specialists and then she went to Dr. Lewandowicz. Hild . she took it at 3 Piotrkowska Street. Unfortunately, she did not get to know each other either. Earlier she had been treating me at Ogrodowa Street with Dr Burczyńska for many years - a bad diagnosis was prescribed steroids. Somebody told me to do some tests for decalcified diseases. It turned out that I have BORELIOZA and she got me to the infectious ward in Biegański . They cured me there. She got 30 infusions of biotraxone and all the ailments were gone. The truth is that the disease is coming back, and I'm still healing myself. Thanks to that I can function normally. BORELIOZA is a disease that pretends to be different diseases. It can be like my case of RA, it can be multiple sclerosis, it can be neurological diseases, or parkinson, or many others. We patients may not know this, but celebrities such as Dr Lewandowicz or Dr Hild should at least rule out such a dangerous disease as BORELIOZA before they give steroids, or they will find that it must hurt because you are already 56 years old. Grażyna Słuszniak

In the countries of the European Union, it is done ok . 900 000 hernia operations per year . The treatment consists in discharging the contents of the hernia sac into the peritoneal cavity . This stage is common for all types of hernia surgery. There are differences in the way of supply, i.e. simply closing the so-called hernia gate. There are two basic types of hernia supply - voltage supply with own tissues and voltage free with hernia meshes of different shapes and materials. Most often a hernia is treated by sewing a surgical mesh of polypropylene in a rocket or foot shape into weakened tissue. On such a scaffolding a weakened part of the body can regenerate. Progress in the treatment of this type of diseases is based on limiting extensive surgery in favour of laparoscopic procedures. During the surgery with a minimum incision, a rolled-up mesh is introduced and developed inside the patient's body.

The research will use the most modern techniques of molecular biology. Strączkowski estimates that the laboratory should start operating within the next two months. The analyses of blood and tissues, e.g. fat will be carried out. The research will be carried out within the framework of already conducted research projects, but the scientists will also apply for new grants for this purpose. For example, the facility has already carried out one project on weight loss, weight reduction in obese people based on dietary factors and intends to carry out more. Strączkowski said that the scientists wanted to be present in the Białystok Science and Technology Park, because the laboratory where they will work there is from the beginning designed and prepared taking into account all the requirements related to the standards of scientific research. "These are very demanding research in terms of designing the premises. It was adjusted to our needs" - stressed Strączkowski .

As emphasized by the organizers of the action, in Poland, every hour someone finds out that he has leukemia, a blood cancer. This diagnosis is heard by parents of small children, youth and adults. Regardless of age, anyone can fall ill. The Marrow Donor Day action is to make us realize how little is needed to save someone's life. "This action fills an area of ignorance - its main aspect is social education. It will help everyone to find out more about the problem and we feel that there is a great deal of lack of information: we don't know how or where to report our own admissions, how to collect biological material. We came to the Riva del Garda late at night. A very nice owner explained to us the location of the free car park, which was only a few minutes on foot from the resort.
