The guesthouse is located in the centre of the town on one of the busy narrow Italian alleys very close to the lake. Under the rooms there is a popular restaurant of the same name where breakfast is served in the morning (coffee, bread, fresh fruit, juice, ham jam, cheese). Although the description of the hotel was written that on Wednesdays breakfasts are not served, it turned out that during the season are (unfortunately, we found out after the fact ;) ) . To sum up, we had a very pleasant time and on our next visit we will be happy to stop here again.

Almost 3 years ago I had a godforsaken nose surgery - lifting the tip. I chose this doctor because I heard that he doesn't make big changes and that's what I wanted. Before the surgery I repeated 3 times that I like my face, I said that the most I like the nose between the eyes is how it connects to the forehead and that's why I don't want to break it. So we decided not to break it because I have a small nose and I didn't want a smaller one and we just lifted the tip, I admit that I have a pretty tip but as for the bones the doctor pinned it on me even though I didn't want to and the worst thing is that he also pinned it between my eyes, which made my nose unnaturally thin and not fit in my face. My face has changed dramatically, especially between my eyes, I have eyebrows close to me now and I look just weird. I was at his place a month after the surgery and he said that he wasn't watching high up there, but I think the man knows his face. so I let go of him. in october I will have a bone transplant in france and maybe raise my eyebrows or rather stretch them. I don't say that the man is a bad doctor because during my stay in the glade I saw satisfied patients with nice noses but there was also one who looked much better before the surgery and fit her wider nose. I knew that the doctor liked straight noses and that's why I marked my nose passage into the eyebrow gaps to stay and not to do anything there. At the front of the bones looked similarly to the letter V, wider at the forehead, which was collapsing downwards and the connection to the adventure was already very thin, now I have something of a style and a simple dash firm for you.

Breaking the concept of good taste, STRONG FILM parodies pop - cultural parody with unstoppable virulence attacking the most popular styles and loud moments of recent films, television and commercials. The film boldly mocks classic scenes from Screaming, Sixth Sense, Matrix, Last Summer's Nightmare and The Blair Witch Project, and then goes on to parody a whole host of clichés from teenage cinema, regardless of genre. It all starts with the murder of a beautiful high school student, after which a group of derailed teenagers - played of course by 20 to 30 year old actors - discover that there is a killer between them. The main character and her friends must protect themselves from danger. . . . . .and an annoying reporter, Gail Hailstorm, who keeps them busy. The film is set in an old house where a mad professor (Tim Curry) secretly lures a life-satisfied student Cindy Campbell (Anna Faris) and her adventurous friends under the pretext of conducting a scientific experiment. The house is ruled by an old butler of gold ( Chris Elliot ) . The crazy professor is helped by an equally crazy Dwight ( DavidCross ) , ready for anything for the sake of the experiment. The extraordinary and over-programmed photos are the foundation of a whole series of terribly funny events.

What active compounds did the medicines used in the Republic of Poland from the 16th to 18th century contain? Were the therapies biologically active enough to treat the ailments that plagued the patients of the time? The combined historical and laboratory research will be conducted by a team led by Dr . Jakub Węglorz from the Faculty of Historical and Pedagogical Sciences of the University of Wrocław. The project received PLN 1.57 million from the Sonata Bis programme of the National Science Centre. The subject of historical research will be old Polish diaries, letters, diaries and private notes. Historians will choose from them information about drugs used at that time. Then they will identify these therapeutics and describe them in detail on the basis of medical historical sources: prescriptions and compendiums. Prescriptions obtained in this way will be the basis for detailed reconstruction of old medicines.

Meeting with Mr. Peter is one of the most interesting, most beautiful and at the same time most difficult adventures that took place in my life, I am not the best writer, but I can not fail to describe what happened to me. My therapy lasted a year. It took me a long time to postpone my decision to meet, but there comes a moment in every man's life that he is tired of everything and tired. My private life, problems in my family that I couldn't accept, stagnation, a relationship in which I wasn't happy, lack of courage to make any decision, lack of acceptance of myself - finally she understood that you have to ask someone for help. The course of the therapy was not easy for me, she was still only crying, there was silence that she could not stand, there was doubt on my part but in spite of all this Peter was next to me, waiting for me to be ready for a step further. I don't know how, I don't know what method, but I was able to "break" for which I thank you very much - this is called effectiveness. Finally I stopped fooling myself and started to listen to my person, my thoughts, my body. Thanks to the therapy she improved my relationship with my beloved dad, she understood how selfish she was, she underestimated what I have, that thanks to these wonderful people like my parents I am in this world. She got rid of my excessive perfectionism, became a more assertive person, started to discover my femininity, and most importantly, despite the problems, she learned how to face them and not feel sorry for myself. I know what I want, what is most important for me, what makes me happy : ) She stopped racing with life, with herself, she regained my peace - it is amazing for me! Mr. Peter, thank you very much for the opportunity to experience this adventure with you. Thank you for the good energy that you shared with me, for your patience, goodness, for your smile! For those who have any doubts, it is worth to take a step forward and ask someone for help - although I know that sometimes it is not easy. Greetings :)

For the first time the competition was held in the Silesian Voivodeship, hence the plot of medical simulation scenarios was set in the realities characteristic for this region. In the competition called "The Front Game" the participants of the competition played the role of medical personnel who were called to the coal mine, where the pit collapsed due to a gas explosion. The competitors, assisted by mine rescuers, had to provide medical assistance to three injured miners. Two of them were in very bad shape, while the third one, named Ernest, was very lucky and did not suffer any serious injuries. However, he was not an easy patient, and his mental state was not a problem for the players. As SUM spokeswoman Agata Kalafarska stressed, this task surprised the competitors. Thanks to the cooperation with the Central Mine Rescue Station in the SUM Medical Didactics and Simulation Centre, it was possible to create conditions similar to the real ones that rescuers cope with during the action in the mines.

She added that gluten-free diet, which is popular among people who want to lose weight. When used without a medical indication, it can actually cause the loss of excess weight. However, this will only happen because everything that contains gluten, such as bread, pasta and starch products, will be eliminated from the menu. But it is often the case that instead of losing weight, those who are on a gluten-free diet will face an unpleasant surprise - weight gain. Gluten-free products that are available in stores instead of gluten contain fat and are therefore much more calorific and fattening. "Protein in the form of gluten is replaced in gluten-free products by fats, which are a spare substance and will be deposited in our body" - emphasized Natalia Drabińska .

This theoretical model has gained much attention in the scientific community, reflecting the popular in recent years behavioural therapy of pain. However, the theory of pain as a learned behavior - emphasizes the interlocutor of PAP - does not yet have a solid foundation in experimental research. The results of the research that has been carried out so far do not allow us to unequivocally determine whether the hypothesis about learned pain is true. In the experiment planned by Jagiellonian University scientists, healthy participants will be subjected to the procedure of so-called causative conditioning, in which they will receive series of stimuli causing pain. When subsequent evaluations of the pain they experience will increase, they will receive positive reinforcement - rewards. However, if they are reduced, the participants will receive penalties. If the learned effect of the pain persists despite the fact that the applied stimuli are not actually "painful", the model of the learned pain will be confirmed.

Two brothers, one waiter and the other bartender at the pool are fine. At the pool you can choose from vodka, ouzo, tsipouro and beer or wine. Coffee is hopeless unless it's paid from the coffee machine. Orange juice from the distributor also payable 5 euros . Beautiful surroundings, close to the beach. Only 18% of adult Poles go to work on foot or cycle to work, but it usually takes no longer than 15 minutes. Most people get to work by car or public transport . As many as 66% of adult inhabitants of our country, i.e. 19.6 million, do not make an active effort to move to or from work (or do not work at all, do not study, do not learn). The least active during the mobility to or from work are residents of large cities, which is probably related to a better public transport system. In smaller cities, physical activity is higher, especially for women.

Dr. Magdalena Mizerska - Kowalska reserves, however, that today it is difficult to determine how effective lactase will be in treating cervical cancer. "So far, in vitro tests have been conducted using cell lines. In order to be able to speak about the efficacy of lactase in the treatment of cancer, it would be necessary to carry out in vivo tests, i.e. on the living organism - first on animals, and then clinical tests involving humans. Only then it will be possible to determine how effective and how strong this factor is" - emphasises Dr Mizerska-Kowalska. However, for this, huge financial outlays are needed. "Such research is a long-term work. If we obtain an appropriate amount of money for the research, it is possible to carry it out - I think, within a few years. Unfortunately, in the absence of funds, this research can be prolonged even for several years," he explains.

Hotel De Goezeput was ideal for our needs during our visit to Bruges and after coming from the USA for the first time. The hotel is located within walking distance of the train station when you head to Oostmeers street (signposts are not too visible). We were warmly welcomed and reporting was easy and fast. We had to bring our suitcases to the second floor, but since we were only going through Belgium and France by train, we packed our lightweight luggage and it was a pleasant transition to the cosy corridors (my wife and I are almost 60 years old!). The room was a delightful room, with ceiling beams and an amazing view of the street outside the hotel and Market Belfry. The room was very large and the bathroom was clean and adequate. A walk to the center and through the quiet streets of the town was easy. I recommend this hotel to everyone.

The grantee checked whether a single molecule could be a cure for all diseases in this group. All polyglutamine diseases are caused by the same mutation, and potential therapists are now recognizing this mutation site - the extended CAG string. "The potential therapies that m dealt with were just the non-coding RNAs. They wanted us to switch off the process of gene formation in the diseased cells, which has a long sequence of CAG repetitions. By excluding the mutated allele, we leave the correct allele for this gene. And only one - good - works, and bad does not work. Thanks to that the patient could recover" - says Stroynowska - Czerwinska . As a result of the research, it turned out that depending on where the mutation is located - at the beginning, in the middle or at the end of the gene - the effectiveness of the same examined particles is unfortunately different.

Over the years, Krakow's hospital has been visited by the best doctors from all over the world, and thanks to the cooperation with Project Hope Foundation, Krakow's doctors and nurses have been doing internships in the best American facilities. "Today, it is the employees of this hospital who can educate the next generation of personnel caring for the health of children. Buildings, equipment and apparatus are one thing, but without trained staff, there would be nothing," said Thomas Kenyon, President of Project Hope Foundation. Rector of Jagiellonian University prof . Wojciech Nowak emphasized that the whole university community is proud of the achievements of the Children's Hospital. He mentioned that during his studies and many times he was there. "We have seen a different world, a beautifully colored, beautifully functioning hospital. But the most important thing was that we met wonderful people there in the 1970s who opened up our horizons. They showed us that one can treat differently" - said the rector of Jagiellonian University prof. Wojciech Nowak . "He also used the hospital's help in the most difficult situations for every parent, when a child is ill. Thank you," he said.

FIVE FINGER FINGERS We HAVE IN GENES The scientist explains that genes that regulate e.g. the number and length of fingers, activate during embryonic development and then usually "go to sleep". However, if they wake up at the wrong time or place, they can lead to disease phenomena. This property makes it possible to study the mechanisms of disease through research on the development of the body. "We already know how to turn certain genes on and off at different times and thus, in a controlled way, we can, for example, regulate the number of fingers in experimental animals" - declares Prof. Tylżanowski and supplements that researchers can already bring about the birth of a mouse with 14 fingers in one limb.

Diagnostic pathomorphology, which uses primarily the microscope, allows to examine the structure of cells, tissues and organs. It is up to the pathomorphologist's assessment to decide whether the patient should be treated with an anticancer. Other methods are only auxiliary - they give an initial diagnosis or confirm the pathomorphologist's assessment. "The microscopic image even allows to determine what is the patient's chance for survival" - says prof . Olszewski . Pathomorphological diagnostics has a large share in the assessment of the disease severity, as well as in forecasting and supervising the course of the disease. The choice of therapeutic methods and even the strategy of treatment depends to a large extent on it: whether it should be started immediately, or it is better to wait and do more research. "It is necessary not only to determine the histological type of the cancer, but also to find its genetic mutations," he adds.

" Molybdenum - 99 is the basic material for the production of technetium - 99m generators. The obtained solution containing radioactive technet - 99m is in turn a component of diagnostic kits used in scintigraphy of the brain, kidneys, heart or bones. It is a gamma-ray emitter with an energy of 140 keV with a half-life of approx . 6 hours. 80% of medical procedures performed worldwide are performed with the use of 99m technology - reminds the director of NCRD, prof . Krzysztof Kurek . - Although the production of molybdenum - 99 was dominated by four companies, we are working on an investment which will allow us to have every element of the whole process. Now we have a reactor irradiating uranium disks and the POLATOM Radioisotope Center producing generators of technetium - 99 . We lack a processing laboratory. "For physical reasons (half-life) and economic reasons (transport costs), the processing laboratory should be built near the reactor. Polish scientists are preparing a project for this investment, but its estimated value is 35 million euros. NCRD is trying to obtain appropriate funding. The investment would be located in Świerk, next to the MARIA reactor (irradiating uranium disks) and OR POLATOM (producing technetium generators - 99m) . An additional advantage of such a location is the proximity of the Radioactive Waste Disposal Plant, which would receive radioactive waste produced in the process of molybdenum extraction - 99 . The new investment could be made within three years and thanks to it Poland would become a tycoon on the nuclear medicine market worldwide.

The test is comfortable, but the analysis of the test material - a little less. The video recording from the capsule takes up to 8 hours. The doctor must look through this long video carefully in search of abnormalities in the digestive system. The Polish company CTAdventure, thanks to funds from the National Centre for Research and Development, is working on GastroView software for image analysis. It will capture in the video the fragments that the doctor should pay special attention to. "The use of our software is to enable efficient and reliable analysis of films made by means of a webcam placed in the capsule - says David Jereczek from CTAdventure in an interview with PAP. - This will shorten the time needed for the analysis of the recording and reduce the number of hours that the doctor has to spend on it" . PAP's interlocutor claims that the program would choose fragments from the whole material, which should be given special attention. Now the examination with the use of an endoscopic capsule may cost even 4 - 5 thousand PLN . Jereczek believes, on the other hand, that if the software was used, the cost of the examination could fall by at least half. "It is possible that one day such tests will be reimbursed. And then more people will be able to afford prophylaxis" - hopes the PAP interlocutor.

So far it is not known what the gene has to do with alcohol suicides. Prof . Rumour has it, however, that alcohol in people with this gene variant can cause worse moods, and so these people can more often "get sadly drunk", which in extreme cases can even lead to haggling over their lives. Perhaps some suicides in people with this gene variant might not have happened if they were sober. As the scientist admits, this variant of the AUTS2 gene occurs in quite a large part of the population. However, this does not mean that each of these people drinks less alcohol than the others and that they are less able to handle alcohol. The relationship is more subtle. The discovery of Poles cannot be used to designate people who might have suicidal tendencies after alcohol, but rather it is intended to help understand the genetic conditions of the impact of alcohol on the body.

The doctors from Olsztyn do not yet know why SLA patients react differently to stem cell therapy. According to their preliminary assessment, this was not influenced by the age of the patients who took part in the experiment. The full effects of their research will be known in a few years. Atrophic lateral sclerosis is an incurable disease consisting of destruction of nerve cells responsible for the work of muscles, including respiratory muscles - at some stage of the disease patients are not able to breathe by themselves. The disease has different rates of treatment and leads to death. Stem cell therapy only slows down the progress of paralysis, but is not able to restore the nerves that have disappeared.

The neutral ambient temperature for humans is about 21 degrees. In such conditions we can comfortably give away excess heat to the outside without even noticing it. The difference between our internal heat and the ambient temperature is large enough. At 25 - 28 degrees, we feel weakened. We get tired quickly because the body saves energy and does not allow physical effort. It has to put all its energy into what is most important for us - maintaining a constant body temperature. And what happens when we overheat? The professor warned that even a small change in blood temperature, which flows into the brain, can threaten the processes which take place in the so-called hypothalamus. This is where our thermoregulatory centre is located, which is very sensitive to exceeding the optimal point for each organism.

Spring vegetables, like the first seasonal fruit, will not be able to produce natural sugars, acids and aromatic compounds and are already being transported from abroad. At their destination they are gassed to produce the aging hormone. They are picked when they barely started, now they ripen within 24 hours and present themselves beautifully to buyers. "Tomatoes from Morocco or Israel are picked in the so-called amber state: only white, bright, orange. They have not yet managed to produce ( . . . ) all the things that determine their taste and smell. When they arrive in their destination country, they undergo rapid ripening, which most often involves gassing with ethyl or carbon dioxide. These gases produce ethylene, the ageing hormone responsible for the ripening of the fruit. Therefore, during the day, vegetables acquire appetizing colors, but not taste, smell and softness. They are also deprived of most nutrients" - explains dr hab . Ewelina Hallmann from the Department of Functional Food, Ecological and Commodities Science of the Faculty of Human Nutrition and Consumption Sciences at the Warsaw School of Life Sciences.

"This is a natural and rational way to dose UV radiation. I strongly advise against it! I reported to my doctor with chronic fatigue and headaches for six months, which make my life quite difficult and exclude me from any social life. I have been very much affected by this and my mental health. After a minute of conversation with the doctor, she only managed to tell me that I suffer from polycystic ovarian syndrome and accept hormonal contraception. She was shocked that the doctor immediately made a diagnosis "it's the pills' fault". She asked me if maybe she wanted to see my blood test results, head CT, MRI. . . . .nothing was important because - and I quote - "what to diagnose here, if the reason is simple" . The doctor was annoying me with her condescending tone, refuting all the methods of treatment of previous doctors (and because of my health, she visited a lot of them within 7 years). For two months now, the doctors have been trying to find out what is wrong with me by doing detailed examinations, and finally the neurologist suggested a visit to an endocrinologist. . . . .and the doctor barely asked me to examine my thyroid hormones. . . She repeated twice that I'm not the doctor here and she didn't even want to give a referral for a glucose test (and as it turns out, I have insulin resistance). During the gynaecological examination she asked why I take hormonal contraception when I have PCO and it will be difficult for me to get pregnant (the last thing she wanted me to hear, because she wanted me to have a baby). I consider such an approach to a confused patient to be shameful, because after commissioning tests from an internist it turned out that I have a huge shortage of vitamins. D deficiency and it is possible that he is the cause - now I supplement it and I feel much better. I have the impression that the doctor is against the use of hormonal contraception because the explanations that this allows me to regulate the cycle, hirsutism and skin problems, and at the same time to play the role of a contraception. I think that such views should be clearly communicated to the patient before the visit, and not to tell him that all his life other doctors were wrong and did harm to the patient!

There is such a business worth almost PLN 3 billion a year, which operates in Poland in six, not consecutive months. This business is a wedding reception. The fact that they are organized in waves, because most of all: in March, June, August, September, October and December, results from ... superstition. According to him, getting married in a month that has the letter "r" in its name guarantees happiness to the newlyweds. Although this is not indicated by statistical analysis, because the percentage of divorces is increasing and the number of months without the letter "r" does not, but superstition , it is superstition and most weddings and therefore wedding receptions accumulate over six months . What does not change the fact that for accommodation facilities it is a good and - despite the smaller number of weddings - growing market segment.

In my opinion, Mrs. Julia Otto is a top-notch specialist who was the first to help me find and love myself. Her delicacy, warmth, and determination make our therapy sessions a safe journey into the inner world of my deepest experiences, needs and desires, which I had no idea existed. I especially recommend meetings with Ms. Julia to those who have been afraid to expose themselves to another person, because in her office they are not waiting for a strict evaluation, but on the contrary, learning to love and respect each other, regardless of the baggage of experiences and personal history. When I think about what I owe to Mrs. Julia, I am reminded of the words "Letter to a young poet". by R . M . Rilke: "We have no reason to be distrustful of our world, because it does not turn against us. If there are fears in it, they are our fears. If there is an abyss in it, then the abyss belongs to us. (...) Perhaps all the dragons in our lives are princesses who are just waiting to see our beauty and boldness. Perhaps everything that is terrible is deeply defenseless and expects our help".

In my opinion Mrs. Monika is a very good and effective psychologist, committed, wise, warm, individual approach to the patient, very empathic and patient. She can really listen, she doesn't feel like being judged, and she feels a lot of understanding, and this is the basis of good therapy in my opinion. Your psychologist is able to establish an understanding with the patient. In my case, she has very aptly chosen the direction of therapy, offered effective ways to improve my mental situation, helped me improve my mood. Of course, nothing happens without the participation of the patient and you have to get involved in the therapy yourself, but the big advantage of Mrs. Monika is that she can ask the right questions so skillfully that she makes you think, helps you to look at your own problems and look at your feelings from different sides, which helped me a lot. A very cordial person. I wholeheartedly recommend!

"In the U.S., it is estimated that only 9% of the population has a normal vitamin D concentration. In Europe it is similar, in the future it may be even worse, because for 10 years now the percentage of people with normal levels of this vitamin has been steadily decreasing" - emphasized prof . Roman S . Lorenc from the Department of Biochemistry, Radioimmunology and Experimental Medicine of the Children's Health Centre in Warsaw . Head of the Department of Biochemistry and Clinical Chemistry of the Medical University of Warsaw prof . Jacek Łukaszkiewicz said that he recently examined Warsaw students. Nearly 80% of them showed much too low levels of vitamin D in the body. Other studies show that as much as 83% of them are deficient in this vitamin. Polish women.

We had a wedding in summer 2014. Unfortunately, we have terrible memories of the planning phase. The hotel made a mistake and suddenly our rooms were booked by the couple organizing the wedding in the second room. The reaction - the washing out, making a statement that it was our fault because the reservation was not included in the contract and there were no phone calls. After some time, the insolence of the staff stopped even surprising us. Another version and other decisions made every 5 minutes. Mr. Manager pretending to be helpless . Stress caused by the fact that someone lost room reservations fell on us . We have been suggested many times that it was our fault. The room one year after the reservation was in worse condition. Numerous dirt on the walls, curtains so dirty that the hand is black after touching it several times. We wanted to replace them with our own curtains for aesthetic reasons, but we had to hang them on top of each other because the hotel would have crumpled - maybe that is why they were never washed? ! The manager avoided us like a fire and did not show up at the hotel when they announced our arrival. The staff answers every question - it has to be agreed with the manager. As a young couple we got a room with a broken shower and we were washed with water bouncing off the wall. We have no allergies, but there was so much dust in the room that the wedding night was a constant sneeze. We didn't have the strength to ask for another room in the morning because I can imagine the reactions of the staff. The most violent room for the bride and groom. . . After the wedding, nobody even said goodbye. We packed everything ourselves - decorations, flowers. No one even asked if there was anything to help. At the breakfast, my guests had to sit down while eating because suddenly it turned out that there are some reservations on the tables despite the lack of any information. We were so disgusted with the quality of service. . . . .none of our marrying friends had to worry about things like us both before and after the wedding. At the end of the wedding, I still got a coffee bill that the guests who didn't drink soluble coffee asked for. Some bayonet money for a teaspoonful of ground coffee poured with boiling water. They paid us a bill for the wedding and accommodation, and the lady first prepared the coffee and then informed me that I have something else to pay. It's a shame. . . . .unfortunately we have such memories thanks to the service of the Borowina Hotel

What can be helpful for hearing, which together with the voice is a working tool? The questions were answered by an expert from the Institute of Physiology and Pathology of Hearing Maciej Ludwikowski during the XII Science Festival in Jablonna . As Maciej Ludwikowski observes, the term "good hearing" is often mistaken for "musical hearing". . . .the so-called . . . absolute . Persons with absolute musical hearing have an excellent frequency resolution of sound . They can distinguish between 1000 Hz and 950 Hz. They are the so-called "bookkeepers" among musicians, who are able to pick out any unspoken note from a song. At the same time, they may have a lowered threshold of hearing, because one with the other is not excluded. Often musicians suffer from hearing loss, especially after many years of performing, exposure to unilateral noise. According to an expert you can defend yourself against it.

He spent two weeks in "Sniezka" as part of a holiday settlement offer. The apartments are very large, elegant and very well equipped (as described on the website). The ground floor apartments are mostly located in such a way that you can look into them through the window passing by the sidewalk, so I strongly recommend those located on the first floor and because of the comfort of moving around the object I recommend those not included in the settlement program (sealed with pets for children). The food is very tasty and varied, the problem is quite small amount of space in Sniezka restaurant. The swimming pools are clean, small and without slides for bigger children. Animations within the settlement framework addressed mainly to younger children . The facilities in the form of family center and playground are very small and in the season far too tight. If you are going to exercise in a fit center, I would like to warn you that it is microscopic and very poorly equipped, but I think it is a plus. The fact that in the settlement you can buy tickets to some of the nearby attractions of the region (e.g. Julia steelworks) at very attractive prices deserves a big plus. During the season, there is also a slight problem with parking cars (lack of a sufficient number of parking spaces under the apartments). In general, I recommend the resort for families with children who like to spend time actively and not necessarily on the premises of the resort, because its location is a base for trips in the area. To the shop and gas station about 500 m .

As the head of the scientific team, Dr Henryk Jaremek, explained to PAP, the invention is based on the detection of temperature changes in tissue. In combination with other methods, it enables the diagnosis of patients regardless of age, structure and temperature of breasts. Therefore, contact thermography can improve screening tests. The effectiveness and usefulness of the device BRASTER Tester in the process of diagnosing the pathology of breast glands was proved by a clinical trial completed in February. "The liquid crystalline state of the matter was already observed in the late nineteenth century. However, it was only in the 1960s that the interest in liquid crystals increased significantly - especially when the colour change properties of the thin layer of liquid crystal and their other no less interesting properties were discovered. The first LCD screens were developed as early as 1968 . For many years, liquid crystals have been the subject of interest and research work in aspects of their applications in medicine" - explains Dr. Jaremek , Vice-President of BRASTER S . A .

advantages : + quite clean + nice person in service in the kitchen minuses : - the owner moves from room to room - our things in our absence without knowledge and consent ( ! ) - potatoes, fried pasta, rice and groats for breakfast, with several Georgian dishes such as beets, fried eggplant, cucumber and tomato salad; often the same for dinner - wi - fi barely worksWe chose this place tempted by opinions in travel portals, where various people write about the friendly atmosphere, Georgian hospitality and tasty food. It has become a low class guesthouse, so if you want to get to know the culture, taste traditional cuisine and experience Georgian hospitality - choose to stay away from home. Nam Nino successfully spoiled the trip.

I bought 'em two Manta navigations, for myself and a friend. I was tempted by the low price and the fact that you can install AutoMapa . The purchase was made on 11 February 2017 and during those few months I can say with a clear conscience that it was the worst purchase in my life. Navigation often freezes (the map is frozen), it is hard to start it, often even a hard reset does not help. You have to connect it under the home charger and it will graciously start. If it loses the signal it catches it very long and sometimes only hard reset helps. The messages pop up on the screen and when you press ok the navigation resets itself. Using it is so tiring to me that I have had enough of it. Two Polish companies, i.e. Manta and AutoMapa, can't get along to make it work well, I am extremely disappointed. I believe that Manta abuses the information in its description, and I quote. However, there is nothing to prevent the user from installing another car navigation application on their own, such as MapaMap or Auto Mapa, which says that their device is compatible with AutoMapa, no, it does not, and it is the same with the other navigation system. This matter is suitable for the Consumer Ombudsman.

The first attempts to make a blood substitute in the world were made many years ago. However, until now, synthetic blood is not available. "The most common cause of failure was the toxicity of the carrier itself, or that it carried oxygen too poorly. Blood is a very strong oxidant - it destroys tissue. It is quite difficult to keep it in check, i.e. keep the balance so that it carries oxygen but does not destroy tissues. An example is a stroke of blood to the brain. Blood that comes into direct contact with tissues simply burns them" - describes Dr. Ciach. "The only cells adapted to constant contact with blood are the endothelial cells lining our circulatory system from within," he explains. The technology was developed at the Faculty of Chemical Engineering of the Warsaw University of Technology and was licensed to NanoSanguis. Start - up was included in the investment portfolio of the StartVenture @ Poland fund, which was created in cooperation with the National Centre for Research and Development.

- In Poland, too little is said about what sepsis is, what are the treatment options, how to take care of a patient after sepsis. Therefore, together with the Association for Sepsis Research and Treatment "Beat Sepsis" we decided to launch a platform which will be a compendium of knowledge on this subject - says project coordinator Adrian Szulczyński . The PokonacSepse.pl portal contains information on the diagnosis of symptoms, prevention and the latest guidelines for the treatment of this disease. The materials available on the platform have been developed by experts in various fields, including microbiology, cardiology, surgery, nephrology and paediatrics, as well as specialists in intensive care and primary care physicians.

A hotel just in time for a one-hour stay. The room is clean and tidy. Very compact - the bathroom is tiny, "plastic" but clean. Scientists are also interested in how different genetic variants control the expression of genes, because it in turn regulates more complex traits, such as those that are important for health. This approach has been used for example in research on genetic control of the size of the hippocampus, i.e. the region of the brain which plays an important role in memory processes, control of emotions, reaction to stress. "We have found genetic regulators of gene expression acting in this region of the brain," said the biologist, "We hope that this research will bring us closer to understanding the role of these genes in shaping hippocampus function," she added. Dr. Jasinska tells us what her work looks like. "Within the framework of this research I do such different activities as fieldwork, i.e. examining animals on their natural populations - these include collecting observations and taking samples for testing, chucking, releasing them back into the natural environment - by DNA or RNA analysis for bioinformatic interpretation" - she lists. ( PAP )

The dose of exposure and the moment when it can be applied is important in the fight against cancer. Whether or not the moment is right is determined by, among other things, the partial oxygen pressure, which can be understood as the oxygen concentration. This parameter changes during the day and depends on many factors. With such information, doctors know that radiation will destroy cancer and not healthy cells. They can regulate the dosage of the therapy, which will make it less painful, more personalized and has fewer side effects. Diagnostics aim to expose the tumors just when the oxygen level is at its highest. The animal studies confirm this possibility. It is important in brain cancers, the eye, or small organs in children.

In his opinion, one of the most innovative points of the Polish solution is the use of an appropriate mixture of polymers, which will be biodegradable after nerve regeneration. "With their help we are able to direct the nerve during self-regeneration of the defect. Additionally, after fulfilling their function, the tubes will be biodegradable, i.e. they will dissolve in the body" - he stressed . Thanks to this, after the nerve regeneration it will not be necessary to repeat the surgery related to the removal of the implant. Another innovative solution is to place a polysaccharide hydrogel inside the tube, which provides support for the re-growing nerve and is also a carrier of growth factors, i.e. biomolecules necessary for proper and fast nerve reconstruction. The hydrogel is synthesized inside the tube and at the same technological stage it is simultaneously sterilized - added Dr Wach .

"In Poland, thyroid cancer is diagnosed annually in approx. In Poland thyroid cancer is diagnosed annually in about 2,500 people, more often women. In 90% of cases the course of the disease is mild and patients live for decades without a relapse. However, in about 10% of patients the disease is very aggressive, quickly leading to metastases and death. These people should be treated very intensively from the beginning, but so far they have not been identified. Thanks to genetic testing it will now be possible" - informs the Foundation for Polish Science in its communication. Doctors and geneticists from the Medical University of Warsaw, the Centre for New Technologies of the University of Warsaw and the Institute - Centre for Oncology in Warsaw have shown that the course of the disease is related to the presence of an inborn lesion in the DIRC gene3 . The presence of the mutation in the gene allows to qualify the patient as a high-risk group. Thanks to the fact that the mutation can be determined already at the stage of therapy planning, it is possible to modify the scope of surgery and complementary treatment.

In simple terms, the system consists of a scoring of individual elements of the infrastructure and services provided by the facility and the qualification of the facility for a given category based on the sum of the points achieved. An important - and not existing in the Polish categorization regulations - element is the fact that the lack of e.g. a reception desk with a lobby or breakfast does not deprive the facility of the possibility to become a hotel. Today, after four years of operation, the categorisation system according to Hotelstars Union rules is already in force in 15 European countries. These are : Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, the Netherlands, Switzerland, Sweden and Sweden.

Hello. I strongly recommend Dr. Rafał Olejnik. At the end of February I had a severe kidney stone attack. At first, I thought that this attack is a one-off event and more will not happen. Unfortunately, after a week I was attacked again by terrible pains. I found myself in a hospital in Opole. He was happy for me, because despite the strong pain I was able to withstand it thanks to the pain drip. After 5 days the pain attack was over. Unfortunately, the stones did not come out! I was discharged and advised to report to the clinic in 2 weeks. After leaving the hospital the pain made it impossible for me to take up my normal job, not to mention driving a car, which caused an immediate attack. A few days later I was admitted to the urological ward of the hospital in Kedzierzyn-Kozle. There I could also get to know Dr. Olejnik more closely. He is very committed to his work. You could say he puts his whole heart into it . This can be seen by the fact that after a whole day of hard work he can still smile at patients and find patience to once again explain to them things that are obvious to him and difficult or incomprehensible to the patient. The doctor finds time for each patient, creating a friendly atmosphere in the ward. This is especially important when you are waiting for a procedure or an operation and you are necessarily under a lot of stress and don't really know what awaits you. To sum up, doctor Olejnik is a competent, sensitive man who can talk to the patient. Once again I would like to thank Dr. Olejnik, thanks to whom my suffering has ended and my stay in hospital was not so terrifying for me.

"Same treatment is not acceptable," said prof. Hryniewicz . Antibiotics should be used only with the doctor's knowledge, while 5 - 10% of patients take them on their own. Moreover, patients do not take these drugs as they should, i.e. in the right dose, at the right time and for the recommended period. If they do not, there is too little concentration of the drug in the body, some bacteria survive and acquire immunity. The experts admitted that it is not without guilt that there are doctors who too often succumb to pressure from patients to demand effective antibiotics. As a result, they are often prescribed unnecessarily for viral infections that they do not act on, such as the cold and flu and pharyngitis. Only 15% of adults with upper respiratory tract infections have indications to use antibiotics, while 70% of patients receive them.

The Unicorn Forester's lodge is located in the forest, far from the main roads. Converted into a guesthouse, it consists of two buildings, one with a kitchen, dining room and several guest rooms. In the second one there is a large common room with TV and billiards, and upstairs there are new rooms. The main attraction of this place, apart from its location, is the possibility of horse riding. In August 2012, there were two large horses and one pony available. You can take riding lessons, ride on a lunge, and more advanced riders can take a ride in the forest. In the forester's lodge there is a representative of the smallest horse species, there are also two sheep and a very friendly female Sabinka. The rooms have their own atmosphere, but they are a little bit dusty - long-washed dust on the furniture, cobwebs on the ceiling, blankets, upholstery rather un-washed and unrefreshed. In the pictures it looks better. The whole kitchen, giving out meals for a dozen or so people, cleaning and preparation of rooms was done by only one lady. The local hostess was very nice, but she couldn't handle everything. The meals were very tasty, especially the soups we tasted. A couple of times we ate delicious apple pancakes straight from the frying pan. Unfortunately, the local excellent honey, served daily at breakfast, we did not manage to eat with fresh bread once. I generally consider my stay in Unicorn to be successful, the children were delighted with the contact with animals and did not worry about the dust. However, I think that the hosts could be a little more involved in running the guesthouse. They were completely relaxed, chatting with the guests (which they boasted about), watching movies on a notebook on the terrace and did not seem interested in correcting their shortcomings. For example, the guesthouse had six clocks, none of which were walking! ; ) Luckily, the mentioned slack also included the settlement issues - the owner approached us with confidence and understanding, and for my twelve-year-old daughter he counted as if she were a child, although theoretically she was already covered by the adult rate.

Jerzy Starak, Chairman of the Supervisory Board of Polpharma said during a press briefing that the first Polpharma Group biotechnology product will be registered in the USA in the first quarter of 2019. The product is to be introduced to the American market in 2020 and to the European market a year later. "In the U.S. the patent expires earlier, in Europe we can only do it one year later" - he explained . He expressed hope that "the therapy will not change, because if it changes, the investment will pay for itself much longer. Starak announced that the next biotech product of Polpharma, a drug for multiple sclerosis, will be filed for registration in the U.S. in 2021 and will be implemented on the American market in 2022. He noted that work on one product takes about eight years.

Bacteria can take DNA from the environment and exchange genetic material among themselves. As a result of this process, known as recombination, they may become antibiotic resistant or effectively resistant to vaccines. Although the recombination process was discovered almost a hundred years ago, it was only with DNA sequencing - a method to read the genetic code - that we began to learn how often this process occurs and how much change it causes. Using the DNA fragments of bacterial strains, scientists can create an evolutionary family tree, showing at what point the bacteria have acquired new genes and how this has affected their evolution. This knowledge is particularly useful in analyzing the pathogenic bacteria that we fight with vaccination. Through sequencing, we can analyze the evolution of bacteria and, based on this information, try to predict when and where antibiotic-resistant or vaccine-insensitive strains will appear.

Since there were no tools for measuring hand muscle strength on the medical market, Olsztyn's specialists decided to create them. As a result, after several months of doctors and mechatronics technicians' work (in cooperation with the Institute of Fundamental Technological Problems of the Polish Academy of Sciences in Warsaw), a device was created which measures muscle strength in the hands of people suffering from SLA. It looks inconspicuous: it's a small box with two tinglers. The patients put their fingers on these two tinglers and press the tips with all their might. "The device is very simple, but it is of fundamental importance to us because it measures the pressure of the patient's fingers. Thanks to the fact that the device is graduated we know whether this force is decreasing or constant" - explained PAP Dr Siwek. He added that since the device is light and small, eventually patients will take it home and the results of the muscle strength test of their muscles will be sent by the device itself to the hospital.

The specialist pointed out that children should not be in strong sunshine during the hours of the day. The specialist pointed out that children should not be exposed to strong sunshine at 11-15 hours, and that they should be treated with filter creams, protective clothing and headgear. "There are two ways of sunbathing: natural or artificial, but it should be remembered that the number of melanoma cases has doubled in the last 10 years. This also applies to solariums. Unfortunately, the average age of young women using such services is now 17 years. Iwona Sajór from IŻ reminded that an example of a malignant cancer, in the development of which obesity and the nutritional factors leading to it play a very important role, is breast cancer. "It is mainly about a high intake of monosaccharides, total fats, but also saturated fats, cholesterol and at the same time low intake of dietary fiber," she explained. According to her, in order to reduce the risk of breast cancer, one should eat a lot of vegetables, preferably different colors. "With vegetables we cannot exaggerate, there is no upper limit on consumption. But there is a lower limit - we should not eat less than 400 grams per day," said the specialist. We must also remember to include in the diet fruit, whole grain products, skimmed dairy products, fish, eggs, lean meat, and avoid processed products with high calorie content.

As PAP said, Dr. Ing. . Beata Piłat from the Faculty of Food Sciences at the University of Warsaw in Olsztyn, the sea buckthorn has not been widely known in Poland as a bush bearing very healthy fruit so far. It was and is treated mainly as an ornamental plant which can be found in parks and sea dunes. The medicinal qualities of the plant, whose orange and sometimes red fruits like corals stick to the twigs, are known in Russia and Belarus. In Russia, scientists have patented the ok . 100 different methods of using this plant. Medical literature describes the salutary properties of sea buckthorn: it increases the resistance of the human body because it is one of the few plants that has stable vitamin C in its juice compared to other fruits. As Dr. Ing. explains. Beata Pilate sea buckthorn fruit does not contain the enzyme ascorbination, which contributes to the breakdown of vitamin C . Therefore, during heat treatment, the losses of vitamin C in sea buckthorn fruit are small.

These data are from the report " U . S . Travel and Tourism Industries : A Year in Reviev 2010 " prepared by the U.S. Department of Commerce Travel and Tourism Bureau. The U.S. could regain 17% of the global tourism market share by 2020 and create 1.3 million new hotel and tourism jobs if a visa reform is introduced to facilitate the arrival of foreign tourists, according to a report prepared by the U.S. Travel and Tourism Industries : A Year in Reviev 2010. S . Travel Association . USA Despite the revenues which indicate the post-crisis rebound of the market, the tourism industry lost 112 thousand jobs in 2010. This was the third year in a row when employment in the tourism sector was decreasing. Since 2007, the number of jobs in tourism has decreased by almost 1.1 million and this decrease turned out to be higher than in three consecutive years after the events of 11 September 2001. These reductions have affected the accommodation sector the least - in the last year. These reductions affect the accommodation sector the least - last year, employment in hotels and other facilities operating in the U.S. decreased by 13,000. This is less than 1% of the employment in hotels and other facilities operating in the US.

The location is a clear advantage of the hotel. At the beach itself, a wonderful view of the sea from the bar on the 6th floor and in our case only from there. The reception desk seems to have understood the problem, but in fact it did nothing but "gesture" to offer us parking for free. The service is generally friendly and kind, although there are some unpleasant exceptions: both at the reception desk and in the restaurant. In my opinion the standard of service is definitely below 5 stars. Frequent comments about the crowd in the main restaurant turned out to be unjustified. The a ' la carte restaurant turned out to be a failure: the time waiting for any dish was over an hour ( ! ) . Swimming pools, SPA area according to the description. Tidy, clean - although without any frenzy. Ordered treatment was cancelled two hours in advance. The earlier the cancer is detected, the greater the chance of a cure, which in oncology means at least 5 years of survival without a relapse. As Michał Siwik reminds us, endoscopic examination of the large intestine, i.e. colonoscopy is free of charge and available for every person after 55. The colonoscopy is free of charge and available for every person over 55 years of age within the framework of the screening programme. Patients receive invitations to examinations which allow them to detect cancer at an early stage. Each of us has a chance to reduce the risk of cancer. During the examination pre-cancer lesions, i.e. polyps, are already detected. Patients who come to the doctor's office only with full-blown colorectal cancer are in a very difficult situation. Nevertheless, even in these cases the most modern medical and therapeutic procedures are used, which extend the life of a patient with the cancer. "Every year patients have access to more and more modern treatment, be it chemotherapy or surgical methods. People with generalised colorectal cancer, i.e. those who have already metastasized to the liver, have access to new drugs, targeted at specific molecular targets. Last year the Ministry of Health decided that drugs that were only available in the third line of treatment were transferred to the first line of treatment," says Siwik .

New strategies for the diagnosis, prevention and treatment of bacterial diseases are a huge block of tasks involving seven research groups. The mechanisms of replication and segregation of bacterial chromosomes are discovered by prof . dr hab . Jolanta Zakrzewska - Czerwińska . Dr Wiesław Świętnicki fights against pathogenic E . coli, new vaccine preparations are developed by prof . Czesław Ługowski . Whereas prof . dr hab . Maciej Zabel develops a method of binding antibodies to a nanodetector capturing rare cells in blood . The prevention and treatment of periodontal diseases is being worked on by dr hab . Teresa Olczak , diagnostics and prevention of bacterial diseases is dealt with by prof . dr hab . Andrzej Gamian . Cancer diseases are the area of interest of prof . dr hab . Piotr Dzięgiel . The group dealt, among others, with research on breast cancer. The scientists were looking for markers, i.e. substances secreted e.g. to blood, which would allow to recognize the presence and course of the neoplastic process. The team was very successful. We managed to develop a simple diagnostic test with the use of material from a thin-needle biopsy of a breast tumor. The test can indicate to oncologists what type of cancer they are dealing with, whether it is benign or malignant, how to plan the surgery and further therapeutic treatment. The scientist has also established cooperation with a diagnostic company, which is interested in developing a test for early detection of breast cancer.

The Parador also offers services not found anywhere else, such as a free breakfast for pilgrims wandering to the tomb of St. James the Apostle... After all, this building used to be a hotel - a hospital for hikers finishing the many kilometres of trail leading to Santiago. According to the rule in force at the time, every pilgrim could stay here for three days and was entitled to three meals. By taking over the hotel as a chain, they decided to continue this beautiful tradition, which they announced on the day of its inauguration, July 23, 1954. And so, every day the first 10 pilgrims get free breakfast "overlooking the cathedral". How are they chosen? They must have a Compostela, which is a certificate confirming the pilgrimage (only those who have travelled at least 100 km on foot or at least 200 km by bicycle or horseback can receive it; the Parador in Santiago is your No. 1?

The test starts with a short fairy tale shown on the screen to focus the child's attention on the monitor. Later on, it presents the right stimuli, i.e. faces, each for one second, followed by images in different parts of the screen. "Everything lasts a total of 3 or 5 minutes, but for such a toddler it is a lot of time anyway" - stresses the PAP interlocutor. Eye movements of a child's eyes are automatically recorded by an eye tracker, i.e. a monitor with a built-in motion sensor and a camera. Thanks to that scientists can measure very precisely how long babies look at the face, how long they look at a given picture, how quickly they transfer their eyesight from their face to another object appearing on the monitor.

Sports psychologists recommend so-called imaginative training. You can try to run the entire marathon route in your mind, taking into account the established strategy and involving as many senses as possible. "Sit down in a quiet place, close your eyes and imagine how you run the whole route kilometer by kilometer. Take into account as many details as possible, including what you see on the route or on the face of a sports watch, but also observe various noises such as your heartbeat, the cheering of your fans, monitor your own well-being, taste the food and drink you eat and test ways of dealing with emergencies. Before you stand on the starting line, you will be prepared for various eventualities. It is worth sticking to this plan, because euphoria during the first kilometers can make the pace of the run much faster than intended, which in subsequent stages will pay off with a drop in form and motivation" - experts advise.

It turned out that the treatment the doctor prescribed for me, namely cough syrup, is not necessary and I should not even use it because I am pregnant (which she informed me about immediately and which is also visible) and it has quite a strong effect and is used, among others, in pneumonia. Unfortunately, I have already managed to buy it and it was also quite expensive, so basically I spent my money on a medicine which I cannot use and additionally I have to buy another one prescribed by another doctor. This time it is completely safe for me and my child. My comment is neutral because she did not have enough contact with the doctor to give a fair assessment. I can fully sign this comment with my name: "This was my first visit. The office looks well equipped, the visit took place on time and lasted a whole 30 minutes. The examination as for me detailed - both the patient interview and the examination itself. My problem is the throat, the doctor also looked in detail at the nose and ears. He made a preliminary diagnosis, had additional examinations done, explain everything. The patient gets a printout with all the information - both the potential causes of the disease and a description of what tests to do, how to take the drugs. You can see that the doctor is looking for the cause and is not going to only alleviate the symptoms or cure "blindly". This is what I expect from a good doctor. Also this was my first visit, but I am satisfied with it. "

These innovative heart valve prostheses are designed for both adult and pediatric patients. They may be particularly important for younger patients due to the potential for growth and remodelling of the implanted valves, which creates hope of reducing the risk of re-surgery in this group of patients. According to the FRK promotion department, work on bioactive heart valve is based on the latest solutions in tissue engineering, bioengineering and material engineering. As a scaffolding for the creation of biological heart valves, acellular pig matrices on which autologous cells are cultured are used. In order to achieve this goal, a comprehensive system has been created to ensure that bioprostheses are cultured in bioreactors reproducing natural in vivo conditions, which should ensure high durability of the valves.

"We've achieved our planned results. We supported both the larger and smaller animal dentures for a month. The dentures worked properly, confirmed their hemodynamic performance, functionality, and the way they interacted with the heart and circulatory system. The dentures were free of clots, none of them had a defect, the animals did not have any inflammatory reaction" - he added. Currently, there is only one German paediatric denture on the market, used in several dozen children also in Poland. "Heart failure in adults is a more frequent problem, it is even a social disease. However, heart support in children is also developing. It is a more difficult field, because dentures need to be miniaturized, but it is a technological challenge that needs to be taken up, because children's heart support systems are needed" - said Roman Kustosz .

The group of prof . Małgorzata Lewandowska - Szumieł from the Medical University of Warsaw has extensive experience in the selection and settlement of cells for a given case of bone tissue. This group deals with the method of settling a porous structure created by engineers, resembling a sponge. The group is now preparing to study the effectiveness of colonization in mouse research. The Oncology Center is leading the project from the medical side. The task of the group dr . Janusz Jaworowski's group is to select appropriate patients, to work out how facial bone defects look like - in order to then develop model implants and examine them. Designing and testing the course of bioimplantation surgery is very important for patients. Patients are already being operated on using a computer system and surgical navigation.

I'm not judging Dr. Luboñski yet. I was with him once. Now I have a second visit. But I have to say he knows what he's saying. She had an arthroscopy 7 years ago, after which I was promised that I would be propelled into the basket as before. Unfortunately, my knee was unstable right away. Sport - only in the stabilizer. A visit of 150 PLN . each time, a commercial operation in the clinic of the Ministry of Interior and Administration - 7 thousand . ha ha ha ha - I prefer to rely on the mercy of NFZ . Good morning, Sorry, but I can't recommend this doctor. She made a private appointment for me to visit her thyroid. The result of the tsh very bad, she was convinced that on that day I would get another dose of the drug to start stabilizing the tsh level. The doctor said that the result was bad, but you have to do additional FT4 tests etc. Of course this is normal but you would have to start treating the patient from the visit. She had a lot of questions and she wanted to tell me that my thyroid is giving me a bone. Unfortunately, I wasn't given any. She was in the office for 5 minutes and she paid 130 PLN only to hear that you have to do additional tests. No endocrinologist had ever treated me like this before.

Serious bone damage can occur as a result of e.g. cancer or accidents. A common solution used in humans has been to place a metal implant in place of the damaged bone. However, this implant must have remained in the body for the rest of its life. In the case of animals, more serious bone damage - e.g. in the paw - usually resulted in amputation of the limb. Meanwhile, researchers from the Faculty of Material Engineering of the Warsaw University of Technology have developed a bioimplant - a solution that helps to rebuild damaged bone tissue. It's a polymeric scaffold printed on a 3D printer and porous as pumice stone. After being implanted into the body, cells of the patient's bone tissue can grow on it, gradually rebuilding the bone.

One of the most wonderful places that we discovered for holidays with children (6 and 8 years). The rooms are very nice and clean, the garden is full of attractions for the whole family, and the food is very tasty, varied and unlimited, which will please every hungry person! The family that runs Kowalowe Wzgórze is so warm and committed that you will want to come back here 100%, and your children even more so, because the presence of other families with children guarantees great holiday friendships! There are a lot of attractions around, every day you can visit something interesting in the area, and in the evenings there is always something going on, you will be able to milk a fudge, make butter, ride a horse on a vault, take advantage of art workshops, see how honey is made, play billiards, play in a hammock, eat a sausage from the fire. . . . until it's hard to count! The hosts are happy to tell you what else you can visit, they also have additional discounts! We personally recommend Teplice Rock Town, Radochowska Cave, Bardo Rally and all the surrounding gold, coal and uranium mines. For history enthusiasts the whole Riese complex is close to everywhere! Prices are, in my opinion, very reasonable for Polish standards this year, especially that everything is clean and neat! I recommend with all my heart, you will not be disappointed!

Dr Lenecki is a professional ; ) . For some time now, I have been having a headache. In one of the hospitals I had an X-ray taken and the doctor who examined me then diagnosed me with sinusitis and prescribed an antibiotic. Despite the end of the antibiotic there was no improvement, another doctor and another antibiotic. Situation as before. It was only after a long time of torment that I found Dr. Lenecki, who after seeing the X-ray and the description of the disease by previous doctors grabbed my head and explained to me that the problem is not the sinuses, which are clean and there is nothing in them. My problem was allergic rhinitis, where no antibiotic therapy was needed. After Dr. Lenecki prescribed me regular pills and drops for allergies, the symptoms disappeared. From now on, I only go to see the doctor, even though sometimes you have to wait in line for a really long time ; ) .
The guy is okay, he gives a pretty simple rump on his lap. In case of failure you can get along - in my case, in the year of analysis II made a total of 5 appointments.

A team of young researchers from the Jagiellonian University in Kraków under the supervision of Professor Tomasz J . Button from Kraków and Prof . Andrzej Wysokiński from Lublin showed that living in a polluted environment negatively affects the cardiovascular system of young healthy people. The study was conducted on the initiative of medical students of Jagiellonian University and was financed by the grant "Generation of the Future" from the Ministry of Science and Higher Education. "We compared the risk indicators for cardiovascular diseases in inhabitants of two Polish cities - Krakow and Lublin, which are similar to each other in terms of demographics and climatic conditions, but differ significantly in terms of air pollution. This applies in particular to pollution by particles with a diameter of 2,5 micrometers ( PM2,5 ) and 10 micrometers ( PM10 ) " - explained PAP prof . Button . He reminded that Kraków is one of the most polluted European cities, while Lublin is located in the centre of one of the least polluted areas in Poland. The data obtained from air quality monitoring stations show that in the last 10 years the concentration of PM2 , 5 and PM10 in Cracow was about twice as high as in Lublin.

When a doctor enters key patient information in the application, the system will generate recommendations of the European Society of Medical Oncology (ESMO), which are the same as those in force in Poland, tailored to the specific clinical situation. The doctor, knowing what is recommended, will make his own decision. "Oncology aims to make the treatment of patients individually adapted to their clinical situation. Therefore, it is important to assess the patient in clinical terms and to characterise the cancer in biological terms. Knowing the biology of cancer, doctors can conclude on the course of the disease and on the drugs that will be most effective. The results of the latest scientific research are included in the recommendations for treatment. Doctors are obliged to follow these recommendations, which is not always the case in practice" - admits Dr Ługowska .

Innovative work on the implementation of a hybrid ultrasound tomograph for women's breasts was co-financed by the National Centre for Research and Development, which supported it with a grant of PLN 6.9 million. According to PAP NCRD's office, it was the support directed to entrepreneurs from the competition "Industrial research and development works carried out by enterprises" under the Operational Programme Intelligent Development. This is one of NCRD's main programmes addressed to entrepreneurs. Its innovative formula - reduction of formalities to the necessary minimum, the call for applications carried out in stages and the short time of issuing the decision on co-financing (60 days) - is very attractive for companies. NCRD grants for the implementation of R&D projects by entrepreneurs are granted by NCRD on a competitive basis, on the basis of experts' assessment - explained the NCRD press office.

The treatment should start with a change of diet, which should be a low-purine diet, with less meat, giblets and seafood as well as alcohol and fructose products. "However, in this way, uric acid levels can be reduced by 10 to 15%. Therefore, if this proves to be insufficient, pharmacological treatment is necessary - said prof . Widecka said. Pharmacotherapy consists mainly in using a drug that blocks the activity of xanthine oxidase, which reduces the concentration of uric acid. "The treatment starts with a small dose of 100 - 200 mg/day and increases to a maximum dose of 700 - 900 mg/day if necessary. In general, the so-called maintenance dose of 300-600 mg/day is sufficient," explained prof . Widecka .

As he added, HIV, although it is extremely "clever", has only three enzyme proteins that regulate its life cycle and infectivity. Prof . Jaskólski and Dr. Wlodawer examined two of these three proteins: protease and later integration. In the following years, the researchers determined the structures of the proteins of other retroviruses - including the HTLV virus causing leukaemia - and helped to explain the mechanism of action of the drug effectively fighting lymphoblastic leukaemia in children . "Here, it was exactly the opposite. The leukemia drug, asparaginase, was found by accident, but the chemical mechanism of its action was not known. Our structure explained to us how the molecule of this drug is built and how it functions. This opened up possibilities to improve its therapeutic properties, e.g. by eliminating side effects" - explained prof . Jaskólski .

It is more difficult to study them, especially outside our facility, but they are an excellent and reliable set of data for analysis. They help to build visitor segments that largely reflect actual group behaviour. Needs and expectations with regard to the group of services that consumers are looking for . They relate to the benefits that potential guests can gain. What can the hotel offer them, especially against the background of competition? A very pragmatic approach, which allows us to influence the purchasing behaviour towards us with a high degree of probability. At the same time realizing that actually the lack of loyalty of the guest (caused by orientation to direct benefits) can cause an equally quick escape to the competition. They refer to the purchasing power of people .

The joke apparently evokes the situation in Gdańsk described, among others, by Polish media. To support the thesis about the excessive appetites of hoteliers "Deutsche Welle" quotes Jan Wawrzyniak, the head of the Berlin branch of the Polish Tourist Organisation, who says : "In fact, the hoteliers have apparently recalculated themselves". The fact is that in March or April hotels in the host cities limited the availability of rooms in the reservation systems, artificially creating prices. Only in June, when it turned out that there were no people willing to spend too much money on accommodation, the hotels introduced more rooms. However, since many fans have already bought cheaper rooms in other localities, many of the rooms were left unused.

Perfect location is the biggest advantage of the hotel. Delicious food, a wide range of choice plus the possibility of dining on the terrace with a view of the sea. Beautiful rooms with free WiFi access. Nice service. The only downside is the paid parking at a high, but adequate to the quality, price per stay.

"We have tested our media on three species of bacteria that cause meningitis: Neisseria meningitidis , Streptococcus pneumoniae and Haemophilus influenzae. We detected their presence correctly in 95% of cases, and the species identified us with a certainty of 98%. And since we are talking about extremely sensitive Raman spectroscopy, it was enough for us to find a single bacterial cell to obtain such precise results," stresses Dr Kaminska. The whole process of analysis is largely automated and reduces the contact of the laboratory technician with the sample to a minimum. In order to perform the measurement, it is only necessary to take a microlitre portion of cerebrospinal fluid under the laminar extract to a syringe and then place it in a syringe pump connected to the Raman spectrometer. In order to increase the reliability of the measurement, the recorded signals are processed by software using advanced statistical methods and the operator only has to read the result .

I'm very happy to see Anna and I sincerely recommend to everyone. I decided to consult with a dietitian not only to lose weight but also to support a proper diet my treatment. After several months of following Anna's recommendations, not only did my health improve significantly, but I also lost weight from size 44 to size 36 without ever being hungry or frustrated. My whole family has also benefited from the change in my eating style - the household is healthier and much slimmer. I'm going to continue to follow Anna's recommendations because they have proven themselves in practice.

By winning a well-known and respected hotel chain Iberostar hoped to be satisfied with the choice. Unfortunately, the hotel turned out to be a total mistake. If a holiday would cost 2 thousand zlotys certain facts could be silent but for the amounts you pay for this hotel you get very poor quality. The hotel seems to be new, but you can see that it has already worn out a bit. The beach is not far away but it's not like it's directly next to it. The hotel is quite far away from the center of the village, so there is not much happening there. There are no attractions in the hotel, the animations cry out for vengeance to the sky. Maybe for seniors okay but for young people unfortunately not. The pool is quite small and there are not too many sunbeds either. The room has nothing to worry about but the problem was with the air conditioning, which the hotel at specific times turns off, explaining the environmental protection. The worst point of the hotel is the restaurant, which is too small and often lacked free tables. It was also absurd that you couldn't often sit at a particular table because the staff prepared the table for the next meal, at breakfast they already prepared for lunch, at lunch for dinner and so on. As for the food, I am most disappointed here. A small selection of meals, no variety, every day the same. Often it was like that for breakfast there was just nothing to eat and on the next meals the best thing was pizza. Coffee, tea and juices could only be drunk for breakfast, for the next meals the coffee machines and juice machines were covered. I wonder why the hotel has such high prices for the stay when there is not much good to say about it. Mallorca is beautiful but I don't recommend staying in this hotel. There are many cheaper hotels that provide a much higher level and choice of food. Unfortunately my choice was not successful.

"Breast cancer is the most common female cancer and any new device that improves the detection of breast cancer contributes to saving lives. The ultrasonotomograph has the chance to become a new tool to help you detect breast cancer more effectively, and in the future perhaps even a new standard of diagnosis for this cancer. The new device combines the numerous benefits of various existing methods and removes some of their limitations. Unlike mammography, during ultrasound examination, the breast is not compressed and is not exposed to X-rays. The images obtained are three-dimensional, just like in computer tomography, but without the use of harmful radiation" - explains prof . Jóźwik . "The hybrid ultrasound tomograph scans the whole breast using ultrasound waves of about 2 MHz frequency from many directions around and at many levels, and then processes the acquired data and reconstructs images of any of its cross-sections" - said Andrzej Wiktorowicz from Dramiński S . A .

First the advantages: the hotel is very nicely located, modern and clean. You can see that it has the potential to create a climatic place there.
