"The number of transplants from living donors since 2001 has exceeded the number of transplants from deceased donors worldwide, but in Poland we are still on the grey end, because in Poland this level is only 3%. Meanwhile, transplantation from living donors is the only possibility to improve the quality of life and treat patients who are treated with dialysis on a daily basis" - said Witkiewicz . Prof . Hubert added that in France the transplantation rate from living donors is about . 10% . " However, they would definitely like us to increase it to at least 30% . We managed to achieve such a value in the hospital in Nancy and this is definitely due to the robotic method" - explained the doctor .

I don't recommend it. We got a doctor and his son, suspected of celiac disease. "Nature has given us the best baby food. It is, of course, breast milk, which is why I am in favour of feeding babies with breast milk for a long time. The World Health Organization recommends that babies should only be breastfed for the first six months of life, and if this is possible, feeding should continue for two years. However, it is clear that natural feeding is not always possible," said Dr Joanna Bryś of the Warsaw School of Life Sciences. In situations where infants cannot drink their mother's milk, special nutrition is used. However, the ones available on the market are not perfect, they can cause constipation and calcium losses in the youngest children. "I was fascinated by this subject and started to research infant nutrition" - describes Dr Bryś. It turned out that the cause is the wrong kind of fat contained in modified milk.

Dr. Iwona is a professional in every way: ) Going to the dentist I always feel a terrible fear. "We know that parasites have an amazing ability to inhibit the immune response of their host, which allows them to settle for a long time without causing an inflammatory reaction. Thus, in persons with autoimmune diseases, the presence of intestinal nematodes in the body results in the inhibition of an excessive inflammatory reaction and, as a consequence, the symptoms of diseases such as non-specific inflammatory bowel diseases and even multiple sclerosis (MS). Our experiments were aimed at indicating the mechanisms that are induced during treatment with live nematodes in mice with autoimmune encephalomyelitis - the SM model. During the experiments we identified a new population of leukocytes, the number of which increases significantly during remission of the disease in mice infected with nematodes" - explained Dr Donskow - Łysoniewska . Further studies have shown that it is possible to activate and increase the number of such leukocytes not only in vivo, but also ex vivo, in blood taken from diseased mice. "The discovered mechanism is very likely to work for other autoimmune diseases as well, as it may be universal. We are about to start experiments on mice affected by Alzheimer's disease" - adds Dr Donskow - Lysonskaya.

The medicinal properties of sauerkraut were first mentioned in Hippocrates' writings in the 4th century B.C . However, the first great sea trip of the famous traveller and explorer James Cook brought her fame. "Thanks to its high vitamin C content and easy storage during long journeys, it turned out to be an excellent panacea for scurvy, which at that time decimated sailors who were deprived of fresh vegetables and fruit for a long time" - recalls Dr Ciska. For his observations and conclusions concerning, among other things, the impact of a diet enriched with sauerkraut on the health of sailors, Cook was awarded the Copley medal by the Royal Society of London in 1776. Ewelina Krajczyńska ( PAP )

"Sports activities of children with diabetes are, however, very positive, as they help to compensate for diabetes and protect against chronic complications of the disease," the specialist stressed. "At the beginning, controlling the glycemia seems to be very difficult, but you can learn it quickly, you just have to keep self-discipline," said Joanna, the mother of 11-year-old Nicodemus, who trains in the team preparing for the championship in Arnhem. He was diagnosed with type 1 diabetes a year ago. The boy has always been very active, for example, in sailing. "After the diagnosis there was a fear that he could continue to do so, but it turned out that there are no contraindications," she added. She pointed out that the insulin pump, which is a device for continuous subcutaneous insulin administration, is a great convenience.

In particular, people after cataract surgery should remember about eye protection during hot weather. "Patients after cataract surgery have artificial lenses implanted, which are transparent and do not filter the light in the same way as natural lenses. That is why they should especially protect their eyes with sunglasses, because there are more and more of these patients - and this at an ever younger age," she added. In the case of children, sunglasses are not always advisable and "you have to be careful here". "If the glasses only darken the image, they will prevent the pupil from narrowing, that is, those natural protective processes that take place in the eye. This will cause that much more unfavorable light will fall into the eye, that is, in our conditions, if a child is to wear any glasses, it is better that he or she does not wear any," she noted.

Apartments are a joke and in my opinion they deserve a complaint. The whole as if from the 90s of these but clean. As far as my opinion is concerned, for this price - it is not worth it! I suggest you look for something else.

Two weeks before the visit, I made and paid the room to say that I wanted a deluxe with a baby bed. As it turned out I got a room with three single beds which the lady in the service joined in 1 claiming that they no longer have deluxe rooms with double beds, I wonder why they are on offer? The shower was damaged - no lighting, the heat was behind the seat, so in order to drip, I had to use an ordinary handset, no water regulation (very hot) and a few other cabin components, when the jacuzzi in the cabin was switched on, it started to stink. . . Poor food. I do not recommend!

Is the doctor familiar with men's hormones, and can he help you with things like Tuesday hypogonadism? I wonder how easy it is to get to him when you have a referral to an endocrinologist from your family doctor? Is that not possible at all?

The Orbis Hotel Group and its partner Accor are launching the Avanzi project. The project consists in the modernization of public space available in ibis hotels, increasing the comfort of guests' rest without changing the price of accommodation. In Poland, ibis Warsaw Old Town was the first to undergo renovations. Since April this year, guests can enjoy its new design. The Avanzi project aims to adjust the decor of ibis hotels to the changing expectations of customers. They are increasingly looking for modernity and their own style in hotel brands. Innovative design and the use of public space proposed in the Avanzi project, add cosiness to the interiors and create a homely atmosphere.

My opinion ( woman 62 ) and a brief summary of the consultation with Mr . dr . Yuriy Ksenyuk The doctor, after seeing the X-rays ( there was no MRI) of course noticed on 2 sections of the spine of the degeneration and made a short interview with the patient ( watching his back ) . After asking about MRI, we received a business card for this examination (with a discount) + a prescription for medicines (anti-inflammatory / muscle relaxation). When asked about the surgery schedule for this condition (e.g. discopathy, osteophytes, vertebral degeneration), we were informed about waiting for a few years (6 years) for this type of surgery (NHF). When asked that we could cover the cost of such an operation (without the doctor continuing to talk about it). There was not even a proposal for rehabilitation (from the doctor) in this respect. The advantages: - > price for the consultation is not exorbitant - > fast enrolment deadlines Minus: It is "the doctor learns about the patient's condition, his problems and expectations and then presents a diagnosis and a plan of action" . And the latter is what I missed. . . Dog . And from the comments one can wrongly conclude that there will be this "light in the tunnel" . . . Ps. . .

The visit went too fast. The doctor made a diagnosis that surprised me a little bit, maybe I don't judge it right. In any case, it is normal that every patient because they hear the diagnosis would like to ask about certain issues, especially when they are strongly surprised by it. The doctor was obviously in a hurry and unfortunately he did not create an atmosphere in which I felt comfortable. She left me quite worried, with many unanswered questions.

I don't recommend this doctor either. I went to him after reading the positive comments, because as a person with AD I am looking for a good specialist . She threw me into the mud 150 PLN . The visit lasted maybe 5 minutes, the doctor was not too interested in what I have to say, he did not interview and in general he had a feeling that I am disturbing him, he looked at me and prescribed an ointment that did not help and the problem grew even more despite the doctor's assurances that up to 2 weeks everything will go away. When she showed me the prescribed ointment to the general practitioner, he was really surprised that she got it from the dermatologist.

Hello! I'm very sorry, but I don't recommend Dr. . Nowosielski ! ! ! Very uncommunicative! ! ! ! I have been reading my daddy's book on the Internet and consulting with another professor and with patients suffering from the same cancer all through the fight against cancer! It was from them that she found out the most about me! Then she remembered m and asked m Dr . Nowosielski, but with great reluctance and grace, she responded and sometimes adjusted to these indications. Mostly by chance, e.g. about additional medicines, therapies, etc., she stated that this would not help or that it was unnecessary! Anyway, since the beginning of the disease, she has been telling us negative things! And yet, the psyche is so important in treatment! ! ! They say that faith works wonders and we have kept it up, but every time the doctor managed to get us. My daddy is unfortunately already dead and that is why he wanted to warn others against this doctor because in my opinion the doctor should talk to the patient and their loved ones, mobilize them to fight and give them hope! And unfortunately, on the part of this doctor this GERMANY! ! ! I know that people suffering from cancer don't have what their dad had but why should they emphasize it on every visit! ! ! !

She's beautiful and shiny. Interesting design . The downside is that everything is visible on its surface every pollen or drop . It would be good to polish it every day. Cleaning is made difficult by an interesting design - the unevenness in which the grids are embedded . Burner is a small hell . They heat up hard . Double is a flamethrower . Good for a large pot, but if you don't use the boiler it's impractical. Choosing the cooker a second time would give up the wok. Two medium burners even on the smallest fire heat quite strongly. The burners light up immediately, you do not have to hold the knob for 15 seconds, only about 2 - 3. It annoys me because it is dirty even when you do not use it. My wife likes it because it is black and beautiful.

Very cool coffee machine, unique design, ease of use, and super Latte. I admit that I bought it with a lot of uncertainty, there are practically no opinions about it on the Internet, it is impossible to see it anywhere, nor touch it, but I took em risk and ordered it in MALL for 2500, it's a very good price for this machine, I admit that I searched the whole world and nowhere do they sell it under 3000 in PLN. In fact, the company that produces it is KALERM, but it is called PHILCO, BORG, FEL, ZELMER, HENDI. I generally recommend this coffee maker, the coffee is tasty, hot and has a beautiful foam, very nice latte with one button. It froths the milk fantastically, the froth remains even after intense stirring. With the disadvantages, annoying is quite often the need to empty the drainer, but this is due to the frequent switching on and off of the machine in my case, once again I recommend, it is worth it.

Beautiful villa from outside and inside with a large garden. Many different rooms to move around . In some rooms you can find old and beautiful furniture. The room that we had was rented outside the villa. The room was large and spacious, the bed was very comfortable and well lit. We did not like the smell in the room. Sharp and not pleasant as if the humidity. You can see that the room was because it was freshly painted but still had an unpleasant smell of moisture. The bathroom was very small and therefore not comfortable. It was hard to move around in it. Breakfast was very good, quite a big choice of everything. Very good coffee and scrambled eggs with bacon and homemade cake. The service was quite nice. I recommend that you visit this place.

Russia's Prime Minister Dmitry Medvedev has set the 2014 Sochi Winter Olympics Winter Olympic Games price cap at 14,000 roubles (about $464), reports " Russia Now ", an online supplement to the British daily newspaper The Telegraph. Deputy Prime Minister Dmitry Kozak explains that the event will be made more accessible to visitors by reducing prices, which in Sochi are normally rising by 30 to 40 percent at the tourist peak. And they reach up to 157,000 roubles ($5,200) per night. The decision of the Prime Minister will limit the prices paid during the Games for the deluxe suite in a 5-star hotel to 13 896 roubles (460 USD) . Single and double rooms will cost no more than 8,253 roubles ( 273 USD ) and 10,569 roubles ( 350 USD ) .

A little crowded, because the hotel is connected to a car dealership with sensitive exhaust fumes, view from the window (cars, parking) breakfast - buffet for a small selection but tasty, beds very comfortable roller blinds on the windows large plus you can send well, bathroom without crazy lack of hairdryer, for 2 people room definitely too small difficult to move. The dishes with card in the restaurant very delicious applause for the chef! ! ! opposite a very nice park! ! !

We came for the evening were booked spa treatments for an hour. 20 , your receptionist 2 hours before the massages informed that only on 22 or the next day of May time. A lot of disappointment on our part, because the fiancé had a birthday. Gift not fulfilled. Luckily, the trip to the Czech Republic compensated us for our unsuccessful stay in Margot. The pool and jacuzzi are rated in the plus, with service to change. . . The rooms are clean even though there is no revelation, the new part of the hotel has a strange smell and coolness in the rooms.

It was the second, but certainly not the last stay in a hotel that deserves five stars. The double room was clean, spacious, functionally furnished. Room service is excellent, willing to help if necessary and discreet. A great swimming pool complex, saunas, Jacuzzi. The brine pool in the evening with a lit up huge fireplace and delicate, atmospheric music is an unforgettable impression. The kitchen with a huge variety of delicious and varied dishes is a feast for the eyes and palate. It is worth to come with your child, because the hotel provides our kids with a lot of unforgettable experiences, games, etc.. We were just being part of the Halloween Ball: the party was frontal, lots of prizes, interestingly organized games. I strongly recommend: )

He's been playing 'em in GTA since the 2nd part of this famous game came out. Frankly speaking, I was disappointed with 'em in San Andreas, but I wasn't delighted either. I played much more interestingly in Vice - city . . . maybe because of the plot or maybe because of this gloomy atmosphere in SA . The game overall good, quite interesting but does not attract to the computer for long. This is the only version where I did not want to return to the game after a short break. Currently, the price of GTA SA has fallen, so I think that those who wouldn't be able to play SA in the newer GTA 4 are not working. I recommend it in general, but not hot: P

Meetings with Mr. Kamil in my case started early in the year. I don't like the stiff, office atmosphere or therapists who ostentatiously peek at the end of the conversation. That is why I am glad that there is a possibility to meet with a therapist in a more intimate space, over coffee, in a calm, normal, non-clerical atmosphere (this office gives me additional stress). We have several (maybe several) sessions behind us. What I personally liked the most are elements of provocative therapy, which Mr. Kamil in his sessions more and more often uses (who does not know - I encourage you to read about this topic, very brave and interesting way of conducting the therapy). There are no taboo subjects in these sessions - you can talk about everything honestly, touch on every problem. Another very important element of therapy with Mr. Kamil is the interaction. He is a man who listens actively, responds, explores the subject, is one hundred percent focused on what is happening in therapy (I have meetings with a therapist who sat like a peg and minutes of silence between us gave me a fever). To sum up, I highly recommend it. As you do not know how to say something, Mr. Kamil will find a way - in my case it was pouring some things on paper. There is another great advantage of this therapist - honesty. If Mr. Kamil sees that it is better that working on himself, he proposes to meet with less frequency.

She wanted me to be operated on by Dr. Dedecius because of his good reputation. After the first private visit, I was really satisfied. He talked to me in a nice and concrete way, he also performed a thyroid ultrasound. He also performed a thyroid ultrasound. She paid PLN 150 for the visit. The nice lady who made the appointment explained to me that this quite high cost is caused by this ultrasound. So my surprise was enormous when for the second visit, which lasted less than 5 minutes and consisted only in setting the date of the operation, she paid me exactly the same amount. She spent two days in the hospital. The doctor appeared literally a few minutes before the surgery and gave her permission to perform the operation. He didn't explain anything, he didn't talk and what's worse, he didn't get acquainted with the results of the last tests. I was waiting for a few hours for the final decision about the operation to finally hear "We will have to say goodbye". He may be a good surgeon, but I, due to the lack of professionalism of the doctor, did not have the opportunity to find out about it.

She's already written me an opinion on this invention but I see she's gone. I do not recommend it! If there's something to everything, it's not good. It is heavy, you have to be careful with furniture because it is hard to drive and there are no covers on plastic. The foot is very high so it is impossible to drive under the furniture on your feet. On the stairs, vacuuming and washing is not possible! There is no ordinary cable reel and you have to maneuver with a long cable . A long cable is a plus. It must have been designed by some guy who has no idea about house cleaning .

The Doctor's making a good impression, but that's all. She was treated for 3 months for recurring inflammations, which she finally managed to control, but it turned out that the cause is erosion. After 2 months of her " treatment " When everything was supposed to be okay, she went to another doctor for a consultation where it turned out that the erosion was not cured at all. She lost a lot of money during these few months and the effect is that she returned to her initial state of health. I do not recommend it! Besides this minus is also the wholesale treatment of patients, strange comments and not very clear explanation of the causes of health and treatment. She trusted m her because she had good opinions and therefore she did not listen to my intuition and continued to treat me. As you can see, it was a mistake.

Vision Hotel Management is a new company on the hotel market, belonging to the PUHIT SA chain, whose task is to manage hotels operating within international chains. The management process will be conducted in cooperation with investors and developers who decide to engage in the construction of such facilities. Despite its short activity, the company is already conducting first negotiations. In principle, Vision Hotel Management Sp . z o.o. is not a new entity, because the company was registered as early as 2004, but PUHIT decided to activate it in order to improve hotel management. PUHIT SA was established in 2007 as a result of the transformation of a former state-owned enterprise dealing with the operation of workers' hotels. Currently, the company operates 7 hotels (4 in Warsaw, 3 in Kraków) offering a total of over 1,1 thousand rooms, 3 of which operate under the Best Western brand.

The great knowledge, the accuracy of the interview and ultrasound examination, a noticeable willingness to help the patient and empathy are the first things you feel during your visit to the doctor. Personal culture and great contact with the patient. I underwent stem cell treatment after my tibial tendonitis. The treatment was unpleasant and painful. The pain I had to deal with non-stop for many weeks, when every step, movement of my foot was painful - it made me able to endure the unpleasant feeling of the procedure. The doctor was very gentle at the start of the procedure - and at the same time, she was determined and confident in carrying out everything to the end. Now I am waiting for the results for about 6 weeks. After a follow-up visit I will write about the results.

I agree with the opinion below ! ! ! I had this unpleasantness to experience it on my own skin, I was hospitalized in Piaseczno a week ago with a dead pregnancy (my second miscarriage was in January this year too). The doctor gave me an ultrasound, she was terribly nervous that I was crying. It is known that for every woman a miscarriage is a traumatic experience and it was my second miscarriage this year, now a twin pregnancy! ! I was given powders after which she was supposed to save me, in the morning the doctor asks me if she saved me (how should I know, after all, she is a doctor) She gave me an ultrasound and it was stated that she did not save me and that it is necessary to do the procedure. . . when she asked me if if if it happened to me the second time, maybe she should do some tests, the doctor said that she did not, that if I miscarry the third time, it was then. . . . ...ok it's time for the surgery. . . . .when they tried to put me to sleep I was very nervous and she was crying when the anesthesiologist tried to calm me down just before I went to sleep she heard the doctor say that now it's no longer necessary to cry, girl. . . . .I was woken up from anaesthesia, my stomach hurt terribly, I was given an IV and said I was going home. . . . .but I was still feeling bad all the time. . . . . ...she got a fever. . ...the next powders, the midwife said she didn't know what to do with me. . . . .then I was given another drip and powders and discharged home. After the surgery, the doctor didn't even bother me because why should I be interested in my patients how to drink coffee at that time! ! ! What is more, the procedure was about 12 o'clock and the discharge from the hospital was ready: ) there are no test results on the discharge, not even the exact age of pregnancy and it is written that it is a twin pregnancy! (Comparing to my previous stay in the hospital with the previous procedure). I will add that I needed a visit of a psychologist but our hospital in Piaseczno does not have one! After a week of my very bad mood, I went to see a doctor and it turned out that despite what I have been through, I have not been completely cured, I have an infection and the procedure must be repeated. . . and so today she had to measure the treatment again and suffer again! Thank you very much and I do not recommend it !

Two classes of rooms with the same price - half of the crew lived in normal conditions, such rooms can be seen on the hotel's website. The second half of the rooms are like from a sports camp, in the 90s. I had a dubious pleasure to live in the second class - problems with heating (either cold or sauna). Dark, 25w light bulbs? Bathroom in standard below the hostel. Shower cabin for children . Terribly uncomfortable beds, on mattresses, under a sheet - a cape! Nice service, matching clothes "behind the bar" while placing an order. For the lady at the reception desk it was unthinkable to solve the problem of too small a bed for a person with a height of 200cm - "at the end of the pot" she will not help, because during the reservation no one warned that someone will be tall". . . I leave the evaluation of such a position to you. Nasty breakfasts, "juice" did not even stand next to the fruit, delicious "ovary" with powder. After ordering an egg judged for breakfast, after 30min we gave up eating out. It seems to be a coffee maker, but it is better not to touch it! ! Delicious lunches, but not in a hotel but in a nearby pub! ! ( And the prices are lower than in the hotel!) .

In the last few decades, more people have died in hospitals or hospices. According to the data of the Central Statistical Office (GUS), in 1980 42.7% of people died in a hospital, 0.5% in another health care institution; 49.1% of the deaths occurred at home. After 30 years, these proportions changed significantly, among other things, due to long-term treatment processes in hospitals. In 2011 as many as 50.6% of deaths occurred in hospitals, 6.6% in other institutions (mainly in hospices) and 37% at home. Thus, the burden of family care for the dying was reduced. At the same time it may be suspected that as a result of the natural disappearance, in past historical periods, the "taming of death" mental stress resulting from the loss of a loved one has not decreased, but on the contrary is increasing.

Today, some cases are referred for treatment abroad. Specialists from Zabrze calculated that there such surgeries are at least twice as expensive as in Poland, where the real average cost of treatment and lung transplantation in a patient with cystic fibrosis (as in the case of 17-year-old Michał) was calculated to be approx. The real average cost of treatment and lung transplantation in a patient with Cystic Fibrosis (as in the case of 17-year-old Michał) was calculated at ca. 350 thousand PLN and in a patient with extreme pulmonary hypertension (as in the case of 15-year-old Marta) at ca. . 320 thousand PLN . In both cases the Ministry of Health decided to cover the actual costs, although if the standard appraisals were followed, this would be much less. The Silesian Centre for Heart Diseases in Zabrze is the leader of chest organ transplantation in Poland, both heart and lung. Apart from the centre in Zabrze, only the centre in Szczecin, headed by Professor Tomasz Grodzki, has performed two successful lung transplants in patients with emphysema.

She stayed in this hotel in December 2012. Unfortunately, a total failure . The staff was not nice, the waiters behaved as if someone forced them to work. The food was monotonous, processed from lunch to dinner, etc . And the biggest surprise was the paid drinks for meals, even if you bought a package with 3 meals. The swimming pool is partially renovated, the attractions for weak children. The only advantage is the large rooms, but they would require refreshment. Definitely not adequate quality to the exorbitant price. I'll add that I have already visited several hotels in Poland so I have a comparison. I advise you to avoid from far away.

Probably the biggest advantage of the hotel is its location - close to the sea as well as to the center of Faliraki. The rooms are neat and reasonably clean (towels changed). The dryers were supposed to be in the room, there were no dryers in our room. We asked the Lord from the reception desk about it, but he did not report it all week. The hotel staff was medium. Some of the rooms are located in a different building than the reception desk and restaurant (across the street). There is absolutely nothing going on at the hotel after lunch, the music for lunch during the week's stay was played twice. Air conditioning paid 7 euros per day, and wifi 5 euros per day. Meals and cleanliness in the restaurant leave a lot to be desired (food trays smelled awful, oil and spices standing on the table dirty). Breakfast would still be okay if it wasn't for the fact that even butter couldn't give, only margarine. . . There was no fresh bread, so we ate toast every day. Dinners a little better, but the taste of the food is medium, Hotel definitely for older people. We left the hotel at 5:30, so we didn't even have a key where to leave it, because the hotel was closed (we lived across the street), not to mention the take-away breakfast. . . In general it is possible to survive, but it is really better to pay a little bit more and have a better standard and not pay for air-conditioning and wifi.

The INTER BUSINESS Hotel is located in Bucharest's business and commercial district. It offers spacious rooms with air conditioning, free Wi-Fi and flat-screen TV. It is a 3-minute walk from the underground station. There is a supermarket and a shopping centre nearby. A total misunderstanding was the breakfast buffet served on the cold heaters, the dishes are not tasty and cold tea has reached its maximum. 3 .

The hotel was a stopover on the journey from Italy to Paris, it is located just off the road, easy to find, private parking, large. The room is clean, quite large. The only surprise is the bathroom, which looks like a cabin on a ferry - very tight and all plastic. For French conditions, the room is quite cheap, worth its price.

I guess enough advertising of this hotel will be a sentence that for a supposedly romantic dinner and by candlelight we waited more than an hour and a half from the moment of order, and for the order itself more than 20 minutes. (as understood by the staff, a romantic dinner is a pork with potatoes and the candlelight was a cartridge for candles).

A Galician town where you can stay overnight, eat well and see what the towns in Galicia once looked like. The layout of the buildings forms the structure of a small town concentrated around the town hall and market square. Various craftsmen have been recreated. You can buy handicraft products. The restaurant serves regional and local dishes as well as local beers and stronger liquors, including plum brandy: ) Free, lockable parking, fast Wi - Fi . Rooms are stylish and comfortable . Recommended !

Ewa Błaszczyk said that during her daughter's surgery she took care of the "Alarm clock" clinic for adults. "This is the best thing she could do while waiting," she added. Before her daughter's surgery the actress said that she was aware that Ola has been in a coma for 16 years "which is a burden" but she added that she would rather hope than not have it. Prof. Morita came to Olsztyn after he got to know the achievements of the Ewa Błaszczyk "Akogo" foundation and became acquainted with the activities of Prof. Maksymowicz and his team during the autumn scientific conference in Warsaw. Moved by the care of people in coma, Professor Morita declared his help to the Poles and agreed to carry out the first four treatments free of charge.

The owners of the hotel are very unpleasant, it would seem that they are doing everything from the unwanted. As far as breakfasts are concerned, identical daily, it includes: one slice of cheese, one disgusting salsa, small portions of butter, marmalade, two slices of test bread and an orange. As far as the rooms are concerned, I just found myself with a non-smoking toilet cistern. Despite several times reporting a problem at the reception, nothing worked at all. After 5 days of stay and a complaint we sent to the resident, we were offered to change the room, because probably because of the end of the season it didn't pay to fix it. I definitely do not recommend it.

The visit was quick, the doctor was a bit annoyed by my long trouser that bothered her here and there, and you could look at it with humour. The factual and automatically efficient terms come to mind. The visit was a routine examination, so I am not able to assess the competence, but I met with a more pleasant and gentle treatment. On the other hand, the doctor's pragmatic approach certainly prevents the construction of too long queues. To sum up, I have nothing to complain about, and with the ise dogs I will stop.

Full profession from the reception desk to the waiters, SPA, not forgetting those who care about cleanliness. This one sentence contains everything. It's a pleasure to write about the facility just superlatives. I don't know what the season is like, but in my humble opinion professionalism is independent of the season.

I advise against anyone planning to stay in this hotel completely ! ! ! It was supposed to be a beautiful and romantic Valentine's Day weekend. Getting to the place - drama . We arrived late. The road was completely unlit, full of holes. Not a single free parinh place. The car on the car . Nightmare . No person responsible for piloting the cars or even the object itself. There were no cameras in any hallway. The first fire was filled with cigarette smoke on the stairs . The room on the second floor seemed ok at first sight. Only on the first floor. On the balcony, an empty bottle of alcohol and cigarettes. After leaving the luggage, we went to dinner served in 3 minutes, heated up. After that we went bowling. A nightmare track. 3 crutches on the cross, two tracks running. The curve track is not even. The balls were flying and made it impossible to play any more. After the bowling we wanted to refresh ourselves as it turned out there was no warmer water! ! ! ! They asked us why you assured us that it would be so until the day we left. Although the reception desk provided hot water every hour. After an unsuccessful attempt, we went down to the disco, where for 2 drinks, you wanted 30 PLN. Like in a luxury bar. Laughter in the hall. . . Breakfast was pretty good. When we came back, our door card didn't work. . . In cable TV, 4 channels. . . . Drama . . . Cobweb on the walls . . . . Scratched couches . . . . Billiard nightmare. . . And the pool. . . A mini pool where it smelled, and what's most interesting, not even chlorine that wasn't there. . . . In addition, the jacuzzi that was in the price of the groupon was smashed, and not lit up including the showers. No lifeguard at the pool nightmare. Dinner was the same as the day before. Warmed up? On the day we left, because we came with the dog, you expected to pay for the dog. They openly told us that we would not pay because the stay was annoying and nightmarish. The lady suggested to us a lie that the hot water was not there. Where the most interesting thing was that she read in my opinion that the problem is at least half of last year! ! ! ! The hotel above the inscription has 3 stars stuck. Coincidence? I don't think so.

A nice greeting - a gift and a basket with a saint's basket . The hotel is nice, but completely unprepared to welcome guests on the occasion of Easter 2016. Breakfast is simple, simple - not Christmas at all and only a symbolic amount of Christmas mazurka. Dinner is not very tasty, no choice. Very good coffee for dinner and a nice lady from the restaurant staff. A fatal impression. Christmas Eve 2015 we spent in the Kossak Hotel and were great - you have someone to learn from.

The doctor is late and then in such a hurry to serve the patients that he almost forcefully pushes them out of the office. The rush results in the doctor watching the patient briefly, quickly informing him how much to pay, opening the door and saying: "Goodbye." The patient leaves without a diagnosis and treatment, but is very disappointed with the doctor's treatment. I sincerely advise against visiting this doctor.

Ideal for tourists who want to visit the historical part of Istanbul and feel the climate of this part of the city. A great location for these purposes in the Sultanahmet district: a 10-minute walk to the Hippodrome, the so-called Blue Mosque (Sultanahmet Camii) and the Hagia Sophia Temple, from there a piece to the Topkapı Palace; the other way round, 2 minutes to the Constantine Column (Çemberlitaş) and the tram stop of the same name. There are many souvenir shops, cafes, restaurants with good kebabs and kofte. The nearby small mosque makes it necessary to get used to the calls of the muezzin in the early hours of the morning, but you can get used to it; ) An ideal location for evening walks in Sultanahmet, when you can feel the specific, magical atmosphere of this part of town. The location is worse if the goal is to get to know the nightlife of Istanbul - the Taksim district is far away and the access is not easy, the more so as the trams and subways end up quite early and taxis are not cheap. There aren't really any pubs nearby, there aren't many in the whole district. The hotel service is nice and helpful. Wi-fi only works in the common room downstairs, but the signal is strong and no problems - ask for your own login and password at the reception. With a friend she lived in a double room - no revelation. A tiny room, two power sockets, no table, a broken knob on the door (but it worked.)) but the beds are comfortable, the linen is clean. The closet is small, actually we kept our things in suitcases. The view from the window on some nasty backyard, but living on Sultanahmet you shouldn't stay in the hostel rooms long so it doesn't matter. Perhaps the other rooms are better with a view. You can hear noises from the corridor, but if you don't have a large and noisy group it shouldn't bother you. The shared bathroom is clean but uncomfortable with three lockable showers, three toilets (also lockable) and washbasins. You have to check if the windows are open and close before the shower, at least in February ; ) Breakfast type Swedish table, monotonous - every day the same (Turkish breakfast so olives, white cheese in several types, bread, cheese, yellow cheese, etc . of course different butter, jam and honey in typical small boxes). ...unlimited distance to coffee and tea. For those who require variety, there is also a small stove where you can prepare, cook and store something in the fridge. Generally - I recommend it for short stays for tourists. For a longer stay the lack of a table, a decent wardrobe and a bathroom in the room would be much more burdensome.

I have no idea why there are so many good opinions about this doctor - in my opinion - and I know what I am saying because I have been on several visits to the clinic on jasmine - he is mainly a doctor - arrogant - conceited and unfortunately does not treat well, and the gastroscopy he did - it's a failure - I wanted to write a complaint on him, but my friends advised me to stay calm - because it's just nerves - my nerves, of course - and his hair won't fall off - I won't go there anymore - I'll try to heal elsewhere

An excellent specialist - we have been under Doctor's care for 5 months. The examination lasts almost an hour - the daughter is now 7 months old, so it is not easy to deal with such a tiny child and the Doctor is doing great. Armani , Versce , Ferragamo , Missoni , Bulgari are already, but soon other brands associated primarily with the world of fashion, including Fashion TV, will also begin to function as hotel brands. The most important thing is that for life style hotels, which are becoming more and more popular on the accommodation market, a marriage (what - branding) with fashion houses seems natural and profitable. Although certainly not everyday. Owners and operators call emerging hotel chains with a label "collections". as well as subsequent editions of clothes presented on the world catwalks. Because such objects, just as they are supposed to be exceptional, unique. Today there are only a dozen or so of them, but they operate on four continents and have ambitious expansion plans. Leading hotel chains are more and more willing to marry well-known clothing designers and see this option as another niche to develop.

I don't recommend it. The doctor asked her a question about her past illnesses and without waiting for an answer she got up and started looking for a leaflet, after which she said "Please read to yourself", she threw two sentences without even looking at her face (she came with acne) and then she prescribed me drugs without really explaining what their purpose is and what their effects are. Good morning. Actually, I have 2 different opinions about Dr Wolski: 1 in the private office - a sensational visit, 2 in the hospital - a nightmare: no interest on the part of the doctor, no information about the surgery, no history (unless the doctor has such a great memory and knows what the patient is reporting with and what is her medical history). I have a hair loss problem. For a long time I have been doing a lot of tests which show that I am healthy, only this loss on my head. . . . He read the results and offered me a cheaper treatment to first check if by chance we couldn't remove my problem without expensive intervention in my scalp. We will see if the diagnosis was correct and in a month's time, the earliest I can get to your doctor. Nevertheless, I applaud you for your honesty towards the patient.

For now, it is difficult to say anything about the treatment itself, because I got a referral for research and only based on the results will there be a diagnosis and recommendations. Mr. Jaroslaw Cywiński "took care of" me from 7 to 8 years ago. In my opinion, he is an eminent proctologist and a wonderful nice and cordial man. Mr. Dr. J . ( tsd )

A decent price for a pseudo-mill, small and quite pretty appearance. However, this is where the advantages end. Bought 'em together with a flask coffee maker. I was deceived by the brand. I visited this facility during this year's winter holidays. The main goal is laser therapy or ultrasound. The hotel is a facility from the communist times - renovated, but still feel the " the " climate. Some of the rooms are completely renovated and can be recognized by the new entrance door. In the winter season in the area of the hollow and silence. In summer it is probably completely different. Generally, I recommend for medium demanding and not expecting luxuries (especially because the prices are low).

The hotel is located in the center of Licheń, to the Basilica and the entire sanctuary just walk to the other side of the street. From the central side the hotel is located directly by the lake. Rooms are cozy and clean, the only drawback is the lack of a double bed in the apartment. Instead, there are two separate rooms that slip apart. The food in the restaurant is very good. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful.

"The promotion of the country on the occasion of Euro 2012 may accelerate the growth dynamics of the number of tourists by 1 percentage point per year," said Krzysztof Łopaciński, vice-president of the Institute of Tourism in an interview with the Polish Press Agency. In his opinion, without a football event, the annual increase in the number of tourists in the coming years could reach 3% per year. However, if further promotion, reminiscent of the Euro, is added to the promotion related to the Euro, this increase to 2017 - 2018 will amount to 4% per year. Krzysztof Łopaciński predicts that this year 14.4 million foreign tourists will visit Poland (in 2011 there were 13.4 million of them), which is 1 million more than a year ago. Taking into account the forecast, it can be expected that thanks to the Euro and the promotion of the event in the following years, an additional 144 thousand tourists will come to Poland in 2013 (out of a total of 15 million), and in 2014 an additional 155 thousand. The forecast is based on the Euro and the promotion of the event in 2013, and it can be expected that thanks to the Euro and the promotion of the event in 2013, an additional 144,000 tourists will come to Poland in 2013 (for a total of 15 million), and an additional 155,000 in 2014 (for a total of 15 million).

Course: English B 1 / E I recommend [ / b ] Stress-free classes , very nice lady. She basically allows you to take an exam (even with a few absences - it is enough to say that you have something else to do during the English course). Interesting classes, something is happening. It is worth it .

We slept in Ibis for a few nights with our less than a year old, crawling son. It's good that the weather was fine and we were only staying at night in the hotel, because it would be hard to spend a few hours during the day. The hotel has a rather business profile (accommodation during the weekend is cheaper here than during the week), so the rooms are quite cramped (in ours after inserting a cot and a pram there was not much place to stand. . . ) . In this situation, the fact that there is linoleum on the floor (and not, for example, a carpet) does not make any difference to a small child - there is nowhere else to lay out toys or to crawl anyway. Beware of hotel "pens" - they are simply dangerous for toddlers ( I enclose a photo ) . No baby bathtub can be rented on site. The child does not get his own towel either (although we took his own from home anyway). Breakfast at the hotel - very expensive (36 PLN per person), and medium. Products such as sausages or canned ham, scrambled eggs, which look like made of powder (and not fresh eggs). . . For a lower price you can have a delicious and nutritious breakfast in nearby pubs (which we also did). The advantages are that the room and the bathroom were clean (so much so that the young man was able to bathe in the shower tray without any resistance), and the location of the hotel is very good - a tram stop at the door, a few minutes walk on the subway. Dinner in the hotel restaurant tasty (much better than breakfast).

Great doctor! If it weren't for P . Caroline's braces would have worn me to this day, and I've been wearing them for 2 years now. The doctor took me under her "wings" from another incompetent doctor. It's a miracle that she agreed to correct a failed job for someone. . . . .for that great thanks to the atmosphere in the office sensational, you can relax by looking at the beautiful landscapes that are displayed on the ceiling. The ladies at the reception desk are very friendly and helpful. I guess I don't have to mention the doctor's office, a sensational, competent, friendly woman I recommend the office to everyone. Greetings to the entire staff. Natalia Rynkiewicz

Quiet, pleasant rooms. Breakfast is quite good. Nice receptionists . WiFi free of charge . The only thing you can attach to - is the work of the cleaning ladies - lived in the hotel for a week - not once has the bed linen or vacuumed carpet been changed. Hotel parking " under the cloud " for 25 PLN per day: / /

The hotel is well located, it can be a problem to park your car to bring your suitcases and download a card that allows you to enter the garage. . We found a room overlooking the wall of the old building and the lady at the reception told us that this is a room with the best view and with no better. It turned out that the air conditioning in the room only cools, the underfloor heating in the bathroom does not work. They changed our room (bigger, with nicer view but it was available) plus we got an electric heater. At the reception desk there is a nice area with sofas, where you can use the coffee machine with good coffee, tea, chocolate for free. . The hotel boasts that you can rent bikes there for free. It turned out that the bikes are only four. They cannot be booked in advance. They asked the lady at the reception to call us when the bikes were free and we went to visit the city. After some time, they called us at the hotel and told us that the bikes were available. They came to us in a few minutes and there were no bikes, supposedly for a long time. . . . .joking, bad organization? The beds in the rooms are very soft and quite narrow, sleeping not very well. .

My husband and I spent one day at the hotel and in fact the arrangement of the hotel and the decorations are already very impressive from the entrance. The surroundings are also beautiful. Even in such a short time you can relax and unwind here. The ladies at the reception desk are very nice. In front of the hotel you can sit down and have a drink or coffee, there are also very comfortable sofas in the hotel lobby. Unfortunately, the restaurant services were not used by us, so I cannot say anything about it. The breakfast, on the other hand, was very varied and tasty. There is really something to choose from. Upon arrival, we went to the swimming pool, very neat maybe not huge but also not the smallest one, compared to other hotels. There is also plenty of room for the little ones in a separate pool and paddling pool with a slide. A big plus is a really big jacuzzi where you don't have to push yourself with others like sardines. It can easily accommodate 6-8 people. The saunas are also spacious, the only downside to this zone was that not all showers such as the "tropical rain" type are working. From the pool you can go outside where there are also loungers. The rooms are very bright and spacious, a comfortable bed, a bathroom of considerable size. The only thing that alienated me a little bit was the cleanliness of the floor in the cloakroom and swimming pool changing rooms and the windowsills in our room where probably the last guests left empty mineral water bottles and papers. But the trip was successful ! We highly recommend !

As he explains, nanocellulose is currently not used in medical practice, but there is ongoing research into its formulation and various applications. For example, the Technical University of Lodz is conducting research on bacterial nanocellulose (one of the ways of its production). After cleaning, the finished material is obtained in the form of a dressing - a membrane or film. In Bydgoszcz, hydrated gel is produced from powdered cellulose. "I very much hope that this invention will be able to introduce it to the market, because it can help many people in the treatment of wounds. For the clinical trials it would be necessary to increase the scale of the undertaking and cooperation with a pharmaceutical company. For the time being, it is not this stage yet, laboratory tests are still in progress" - points out Karol Bocian.

The doctor made me a TV service on Malczewski ( NFZ ). She was rather cool, but nice. She didn't rush me, she answered my questions briefly and in a matter of fact. She was very gentle in her research. She was a little afraid of him, but she asked me and it was quickly over.

It is a person who is able to combine purely theoretical data and his or her life experience during the diagnostic process and the diagnosis is not only a medical term but the result of an in-depth analysis (something that means something to the patient). Not only does he know how to listen, he knows how to advise against what other psychiatrists are so defending themselves against, not wanting to take responsibility for our decisions. The decisions are ours, but the indications of the diagnosis are invaluable when we stand still and are unable to take a step or are afraid to get air in our lungs. Try it yourself and it gives you hope because you know that there is someone standing by and helping you. She helped me a lot, thanks to her professional but also purely "human" attitude I have the courage not only to take shy steps but even to run. If the fear of another breath paralyzes you terribly, she is the right person to go to. I think I value her "life" approach to the problem most, as if standing in a valley (sometimes with only shreds of information), she has the ability to evaluate, which others do not have when they are on a mountain (with hundreds of pages of documentation). I admire her, but at the same time I appreciate her very much as a doctor.

I was at the Doctor's for a check-up visit and for the selection of glasses. I do not have any defects or ailments so it is difficult for me to assess the competence and knowledge of the Doctor. Nevertheless, she is a nice, kind and patient-friendly person. She has devoted enough time to me. I am satisfied and I recommend the Doctor. Joanna

The hotel absolutely does not hold the Accor 4 star level. I definitely don't recommend it. Apart from the fact that the doctor is indeed cordial, nice and smiling (even exaggeratedly) it did not help anything. He has not even analyzed the case. He stated that "young is healthy" already after entering the office and starting the visit (which lasted circa 5 min). He stated this before any conversation about the ailments and repeated throughout the meeting. He did not analyze and did not even try to analyze the case in order to help, and after I took the discharge card out of the hospital he found that it was not a gastrological operation (it was a urological operation and a referral to a gastrologist got 'em from a urologist who did not like the morphology and enlarged spleen) and was not related to the ailments. He only asked about "my diseases and the diseases in the family", a question that the family doctor might as well ask. He also did not look into the history of treatment, including the antibiotics administered. He showed me two results of blood tests (performed almost 3 months after the operation (about 4-5 days of hospital stay)). The doctor found that one of the tests was abnormal, that is, one with increased liver and pancreas parameters (3-5x) and the other, later, around the standards (the period between tests was a few days). He did not commission any additional tests to make sure which one (because even if one of the tests is actually done incorrectly it is a 50% chance that it is bad and a 50% chance that it is good, but the doctor on the eye stated that everything is ok because "The pancreas does not hurt and the young is healthy"). The only thing he recommended was to appear in 4 - 5 months and take Essentiale forte . It is also a kind of ignorance to propose one type of diet "proper" (50 - 60% carbohydrates) ignoring even if physical activity. I definitely do not recommend .

I am a little surprised by the negative opinions, because after the first visit I am very satisfied, according to Mrs. Munir is ok much better than the orthodontists in the hospital at Karmelicka Street, who said that the treatment of my defect makes no sense! A book with nice pictures of gluten-free baked goods, but anyone who has baked gluten-free baked goods knows that they don't look like these pictures, so whatever is in these pictures is - it's more likely plastic. . . The main disadvantage of the book is that when gluten-free people cannot consume cereal derivatives, the author insists on basing almost the whole book on flour products instead of presenting gluten-free products from nature (dishes based on rice, groats, vegetables, meat, legumes, potatoes. . . ) To make matters worse, flour products are based on extracts and not on naturally gluten-free flours - corn, buckwheat, rice or potato. As for me, the whole book is sponsored by a company, and the author cared more about the advertising box office than about showing gluten-free people how to eat well and with sense.

A few days ago we spent a weekend in this hotel, a nice location, a comfortable bed and a spacious room. The pool area is small and unfortunately very crowded. The sauna sessions are great. Unfortunately the dinners were not tasty. . . . . .the pork chop had 3mm of meat and the rest was a coating. Soup creamed with tasteless vegetables. She asked me about 3 desserts and none of them were available because it was over. The waitresses were mainly busy talking even though they asked us for juice for the baby and we only got it after 25 minutes. Breakfast was varied, fresh and tasty. Unfortunately, on Saturday, there was a wedding at the hotel, very loud and you couldn't sleep, the next day almost to 1:00 p.m. dirt everywhere in the corridor "vomiting" the guest, dirty. . .

I don't think it makes any sense to write an opinion about something that is great, so she wanted me to write about a dishwasher defect. I have BOSCH for the first time and I will admit that he is far from the Whirpool I had before. First of all, there's a lack of control that the washing has ended. If I'm out and she hasn't heard the final signal, it's not clear that the washing is over. The same is not known what the stage is. Sometimes she doesn't spit out the pills and the pots are dirty. And unfortunately, compared to Whirlpool, she loses in the category of tightly placed pots, whirlpool did great, apparently had better water pressure. It's a lot of limp with Bosch. I have to manually wash it down to the maximum. The guides at the bottom are not precise and the bottom basket always falls off when fully extended. This did not happen in Whirpool because the guides had contours on the door.

During the ski trip to Les 2 Alpes we stayed in Maeva apartments. Worse place has not yet seen the m . The first, a huge minus, is the heating, or rather its lack. When after almost 30 hours of travel we entered the icy room and found out that the heating is not working, she thought I'd cry. In the middle of winter, high in the Alps, the non-working heating should exclude such a room from the offer, or am I wrong? They reported us lack of heating (in our travel agency, because the hotel staff did not see us even once), but NO one showed up, for a week. They heated our "apartment" by unscrewing the electric cooker to the maximum. . . It wasn't safe enough, but at least we didn't freeze. The second big minus, it's cleanliness. Our apartment was just a mess - the whole kitchen and all the dishes were dirty, not to mention the bathroom. In order to be able to use the room, we had to clean it first. Interestingly, we were required to be impeccably clean on departure under the threat of deducting cleaning costs from the deposit. So we cleaned the room a second time. It is a pity that those who lived there before us did not deduct anything from the bail. The common areas in the building have also long since seen no vacuum cleaner or mop. And a third huge minus - noise. The building was very noisy, every night wild screams of drunken people at 3 am. I understand that not everyone goes skiing, just to a party, but you can do it a little quieter. Even the earplugs did not guarantee a good night's sleep. In conclusion, it couldn't be any worse. We will never go there again.

It's hard to tell me what kind of pediatrician he is, but as an internist he didn't show off in my case. I came with an untreated cold, even though I had taken antibiotics before, but unfortunately I didn't get rid of my cold. The doctor said that with a cold, it can be that it lasts for weeks. . . ... I asked for 2 - 3 days off to get rid of it (2 weeks of the disease made me very weak and I barely stood on my feet), unfortunately I found out that there was no need: / in return I got a whole list of healers i.e. nurofen, sudafed etc. If after 2 weeks of a severe cold, a persistent rhinitis despite taking antibiotics, the doctor prescribes sudafed, then there is probably something wrong. . .

It's a really great place for people who want to rest and seek silence. Fairytale location and beautiful nature is the certainty of a good rest. It is also important that the staff is helpful and nice. It is really worth coming here and the time you will spend here will not be wasted.

You're amazing! Just perfect. I have had two episodes of depression so far, which I have treated in consultation with a psychiatrist. The first one was treated by Dr Kaczmarkiewicz, the second by another psychiatrist in Cracow. Dr. Kaczmarkiewicz prescribed me medication which helped me to get out of my depression temporarily, but I had a relapse. When I managed to get out of my first episode, I was very grateful to him and even recommended him to my friends. Now, after the second episode, I see his role completely different and under no circumstances will I recommend him to anyone else. I judge my psychiatrist in Krakow by an order of magnitude better. First of all, Dr. Kaczmarkiewicz did not go through enough trouble to at least superficially realize the causes of my condition. He did only a very basic medical interview (he asked about the tendency to depression in the family, stimulants, etc.), diagnosed "mood reduction" and immediately prescribed antidepressants. Then basically all he was interested in was whether there were any side effects and how I feel. He didn't refer me to psychotherapy right away, and it is she (I know it only now) that is the key to actually dealing with problems once and for all. To excuse him, I have to say that after 1, 5 from the start of the treatment, the holidays started and I was not in Warsaw long. However, he informed the doctor about it in advance and today he expects me from him all the more that he will devote my time and explain how he should continue to treat me and that the key is that I stay in contact with the doctor (not even necessarily with him) . At the beginning of the second episode I was em abroad and decided to contact the doctor by phone. It was difficult, the doctor at first did not have time for me and the second time he spent all 3 minutes of his precious time with me. Although if there was a reasonable suspicion that I was depressed, he knew how I was suffering and how much it cost me to make even a simple phone call to him. In general I have a deep feeling that the doctor didn't do his best in my case. I can't tell if I was unlucky or if Dr. Kaczmarkiewicz treats all patients with such attention. However, I am convinced that there are better doctors than him.

"Trans isomers are present e.g. in hard margarines - in cubes, confectionery fats, chips, fast food products, powdered soups, snacks" - said the director of IŻŻ, Professor Mirosław Jarosz. He added that trans isomers show only adverse effects on human health. They are a recognized risk factor for cardiovascular diseases, atherosclerosis, malignant tumors (especially prostate cancer) and type 2 diabetes. They are also likely to affect infertility, cause lactation disorders and promote bronchial asthma. The Food and Nutrition Institute recommends that in a diet ensuring appropriate nutritional value, the intake of trans isomers should be as low as possible - in the worst case, it should not exceed the maximum level of 1% recommended by the World Health Organization. In the worst case, it should not exceed the World Health Organisation recommended maximum level of 1% of energy from a full day's diet.

We stopped at the hotel on the way to W-you. Despite the location (exit to W - W) rooms are quiet and comfortable. Clean and fresh. It's an inexpensive hotel - it's at the same price level as Ibis, but in my opinion you get more in relation to the price. The room was quite spacious, had a decent desk with TV, wardrobe and kettle + tea/coffee. The bathroom was a bit worn out, however, especially the shower. They put foot pads on the floor, probably to prevent the guests from slipping - but the dirt is gathering on the edges and it was disgusting - I started to wonder if I would catch a fungus by using the shower. The whole room smelled a bit of old furniture, but that was not the biggest problem. It was a small single bed - not only short, but also very narrow. Another thing that could be a problem in the summer was the lack of air conditioning - but in November I only needed warm radiators. Another great advantage of IOR is the restaurant. The food is very good, the choice is good. They specialize in Italian cuisine - she ordered a caprese salad and pizza, both dishes were very good. Besides, the buffet breakfast was rather tasty - with a wide choice and nice details such as small desserts and warm coffee milk. Above all, however, the hotel staff is free, and it's great if you want to relax in your room after a hard day, but also want to have a snack. Since I was there to conduct training, I didn't mind being away from the city centre and I was glad to be very close to the airport. Generally speaking, despite the small problems, I would rather come back here if I had to go on a business trip to Poznan and face the costs again.

Cheap travel is becoming increasingly popular. Especially as there are more and more original ways to save on holidays. Names such as carpooling and couchsurfing sound a bit mysterious, but they mean simple ways for tourists to spend less without denying themselves the pleasure of a holiday. In planning a cheap holiday, the internet proves invaluable. The popularity of couchsurfing is growing, i.e. sharing accommodation with each other. On specially designed websites we can find accommodation in a given place. However, we do not pay the owners of the apartment in cash, but we provide them with accommodation at home. "The condition is to find people who want to rent us a room and in the same holiday to visit our city and stay with us .

In relation to the actual state, it is more than half the number. According to the Central Statistical Office on 31 July 2013, 105,8 thousand rooms were available in 2107 hotels in Poland. However, according to the estimates of the "Hotel Management" at the beginning of this year the number of hotel rooms in Poland exceeded 130 thousand. Such large differences result from different calculation methodologies and a different definition of a hotel. In Poland the basis for considering an accommodation facility as a hotel is its categorization into 1 - 5 stars in accordance with the law in force. On the other hand, STR considers as hotels first of all facilities operating within the structures of international hotel chains (even if they are not categorised as a hotel according to Polish regulations), and then the largest and modern facilities operating under their own brands.

The biophysicist says that DNA repair mechanisms sometimes break down. If scientists get a better understanding of the structure of the complex, they will be able to better design pharmaceuticals in the future that will support seamstresses in certain dysfunctions. But there is another important aspect of this research. Perhaps they will help scientists to develop compounds that will repair the DNA in selected cells and block it out completely. For why should the body waste energy on mending DNA in cells that are anyway spoiled - for example in cancer cells. . . "It is better that the spoiled DNA of these dangerous cells is not repaired and the cell is destroyed faster" - notes prof . The spinal cord . And it does not exclude that in the future the research on DNA seamstresses will be used in the work on new cancer therapies.

Let's check if services such as sauna, meals, parking are not additionally paid for. The classification of the object to the appropriate type and category is made by the Marshal of the voivodeship, who also checks whether the entrepreneurs comply with certain requirements. The list of hotel facilities can be checked in a special register. Requirements In hotels and motels five-, four- and three-star motels there must be a bathroom in each room, and in the case of guesthouses only in those that have five or four stars. Only four - and five-star hotels and motels must provide a guarded car park, a guarded garage or a guarded parking space.

She was at the Olender Hotel more than once. A plus of course is the swimming pool, saunas, spa and very nice service at the reception. The playground. Unfortunately, the breakfasts are getting poorer and poorer, and you have to ask for a finished butter or cake. Once upon a time there were cakes, casseroles and now every day only scrambled eggs, sausages, black pudding and sausages. The quality of dishes from the restaurant menu depends on the chef who is on shift. In the past, pancakes with chocolate-nut cream were 2 or 3 times bigger. However, if I get an incomplete dish because the chef made a mistake, it is either given a discount or some gratis for the customer. The rooms are generally clean, but I think that daily garbage removal should be standard and not only when you hang a card "Please clean up" . Water is not refilled either.

The Szafir Hotel in Jastrzebia Gora, which is based on the Willa Magnat guesthouse, will soon welcome guests. After more than a year of construction work with 15 rooms, built in a manor house style, the Magnat guesthouse has been transformed into a modern 50 room Szafir hotel. The hotel has gained not only a new body, additional rooms and an extensive gastronomic area, but also conference facilities, spa complex, swimming pool and bowling alley. Due to its location, close to the centre of Jastrzębia Góra, the facility will also house a bank and service points. A characteristic element of the hotel is the garden arranged on the roof.

She had the misfortune of giving birth to my first child, and she was on duty by this "doctor" in Ujastek. The reason that this gentleman gave as a refusal to give oxytocin was that in 12 hours my doctor will come on duty and she will take care of me. I'll add that it was Saturday night on Sunday, 6 years ago so the traffic at Ujastek wasn't that big then. The birth was terrible, nobody took care of me, my midwife friend "Doctor" also denied me. Kowalczyk during childbirth all the time he was joking in a disgusting way, he regretted that he was not paid enough and yet other people's childbirths must be picked up. At the end, as a retaliation he probably sewed me up alive, without anesthesia, mocking me and teasing my moans! He is a really "wonderful" doctor ! I hope there are more of them ! And I will never forget how you treated me, and I will continue to spread the word wherever I can! !

This is 85 times the standard price of 42 euros. In fact, it is much more than the increase in the price of an apartment in Warsaw near the National Stadium, which during the games increased "only" 57 times compared to the standard price. This does not change the fact that prices in hotels in Ukraine have increased significantly. While a day at a hotel in Lviv or Kiev normally costs 25-35 euros, during Euro 2012 the same rooms are sold for 500 euros. AFP, citing an anonymous source similar to the tournament organizers, informs that UEFA is dissatisfied with the situation in Lviv, where even the UEFA office located in the new stadium is leaking the ceiling of the communication room. According to the Statistical Office of Ukraine in the country operates ok . 1, 3 thousand hotels, most of them with a standard of 2 - 3 stars, there are only a dozen or so hotels of the highest standard. These are mostly new facilities, created especially before Euro 2012, and mostly belonging to international hotel chains.

Problems with teeth may be the cause of sinusitis, but an untreated sinus disease may also cause dental complications, e.g. loss of implants - said Dr Michał Michalik at a scientific conference in Warsaw on this subject on Friday. "Therefore, for the patient's sake, close cooperation between laryngologists and dentists is necessary, e.g. during endodontic treatment (root canal treatment of teeth - PAP) or when inserting dental implants. Thanks to this, the treatment is shorter, more effective, avoids serious complications and is cheaper" - said Dr Michał Michalik from the MML medical centre in Warsaw, which hosts the first interdisciplinary laryngological and dental conference in Poland, held from 27 to 28 March in Warsaw.

On Wednesday, the University also held the official opening of the Dental Simulation Centre. Students can use 60 phantom stands simulating clinical conditions. The stands are equipped with, among others, appropriate sets of jaws, teeth, rubber gums and models of the mandible for teaching block anaesthesia. "When a few years ago we started learning on phantoms and after all the exercises we talked to our parents and colleagues, we were all jealous that we were learning so modernly. (...) It was only today that I understood the notion of jealousy, because that is what I feel today in relation to my younger colleagues" - said Mateusz Tarnowski, a 5th year student of dentistry at the Maria Curie-Skłodowska University.

The hotel doesn't have a public parking lot but a public one that you have to pay for. Breakfast is cold only (no scrambled eggs and hot sausages). You're really nice. But what about the patients after that? Three people who have the same hourly appointment, not by chance, but knowingly. Such facilities are mainly disposed of by state-owned companies, which in the process of privatization took over a large number of state-owned enterprises in the 1970s and 1980s. The third, the least numerous group, are facilities which have been built (or purchased) from the beginning with a view to their sale . These include Radisson Blu and Westin in Warsaw. Transactions concerning the first group of facilities are few and the amounts obtained do not exceed, as shown in the previous year, PLN 4 - 5 million. The situation is no different in the whole Europe, where larger transactions concerning facilities in an unfavourable financial situation constitute a little more than a tenth of the market.

The winners of the award - the Jaskólski - Wlodawer tandem - were selected from among 55 nominations, which were evaluated by a jury composed of outstanding representatives of the Polish and American scientific community. They received the award - and with it 5 thousand dollars each - for structural research on proteins of medical significance, which contributed to the development of new therapies for treating human diseases, such as AIDS or leukaemia in children. "This award shows that not only one achievement in science is important, but also a long term cooperation. What Mariusz and I have been doing together for so many years has been appreciated" - Wlodawer told PAP. "In science, cooperation is extremely important and should be exemplified by others, including politicians, who often forget that without cooperation you cannot achieve much," - said Prof. Wlodawer. Jaskólski . He did not hide the fact that science has brought scientists so close to each other that they remain very close friends despite their distance.

The user interface is a failure. You know when you saw 'em? How did he borrow em from a colleague's low-cost navigation system bought in a shop on B . ( for poor Poles ) with a different map . Maybe it wasn't perfect, but what a wonderfully simple way to use it, a few clicks on the big keys and you can go, what a relief it was after the constant fight with Automapa . I don't want to write any more about Automapa, please read other not very flattering opinions - they are true. I don't need to invest a lot of money in the EU version. Automapo! - Don't go that way, please, please, please, for more convenience, simplicity and transparency. . . . . . . . . P . S . I'm not a B-type or any other shop representative.

She was at Dr. Krajewski's with nightmarish acne scars. Her face looked very bad, even her makeup did not cover everything. Dr . Krajewski listened to me carefully, looked through all the medical records so far and reassured me. He proposed a comprehensive treatment (chemical peelings, laser, mesotherapy). It had a calendar of treatments set up. Finally, somebody took care of me comprehensively, did not dispose of me, treated me humanely. The treatments turned out to be effective, my face looks much better now. I have also established a long-term treatment plan, so that the skin of the face looks even better. What was most important to me - Dr. Krajewski creates a sense of security, he is an excellent professional, he really knows what he is doing. He treats the patient as a partner, talks about contraindications, risks and benefits of treatments. From the beginning she knew what awaits me, what the treatment will look like, what effects I can expect. A great specialist and a good person.

It is commonly believed that green tea is very beneficial to health and is also a drink recommended during diets. Already in previous studies prof . Walkowiak and his team found that green tea also limits the absorption of fats. Does the new research mean that it is beneficial for people who fight against overweight? Professor Warmus reserves that such conclusions should be drawn carefully. "Theoretically we are dealing here with a situation in which it would be possible to reduce or slow down the absorption of sugar from starch and thus prevent hyperglycemia or excessive sugar absorption" - he said in an interview with PAP. Potentially this means "some chance in the context of obesity problems, which is nowadays the size of a pandemic" - he added .

In the diagnosis of gastrointestinal problems - in the detection of cancer, bleeding, ulcers, parasites - endoscopic examination is useful. Therefore, it is necessary to introduce a camera into the gastrointestinal tract. In traditional endoscopes, the webcam is placed on a long duct, and this makes the examination may not be too comfortable for the patient. However, less invasive solutions have already appeared on the market - webcam capsules, which you just need to swallow, and they go through the entire digestive system to record any abnormalities in the digestive system. The video is transmitted wirelessly to the receiver in the vest or belt that the patient wears. This solution applies especially to small and large intestine examination.

Certainly in the case of a doctor one should assess his accurate diagnosis and treatment, but in the case of Dr. Infantry his ability to treat completely overshadows his criminal behaviour. The Sound Garden Hotel, the first in Warsaw, music and self-service hotel should welcome guests in spring 2013. This will most likely happen in April. The facility with 206 rooms (377 beds), 9 conference rooms (over 600 sq m, approx. 310 beds) and a dining area (approx. 160 people) is being built in Warsaw as part of the Business Garden office and service complex at Żwirki i Wigury Street. Guests, depending on their preferences, will be able to choose floors in the style of jazz, classic, chillout, rock, silent or pop. Sound Garden is to be the first musical, but most importantly - a self-service hotel in Warsaw. After making a reservation through the website, phone or tablet, guests will be given a unique code, based on which not the receptionist, but the kiosk check - in will give them an entry card to the room. "You do not have to stand in line to check in. You will be issued by a vending machine, but forget to check out - just have breakfast and leave". The operator of the hotel under construction ensures that the hotel is being built.

I'm not convinced of your doctor. The visit took place in a nice atmosphere, but it did not bring anything to the matter in the sense of treatment. I am after the surgery and I run, jump, enjoy life - but it is not thanks to Mr. Doctor.
