MASAKRA ! ! ! We really are not demanding customers, but the offer on the Hotel's website has nothing to do with reality. It was supposed to be a great weekend for the kids - we really rarely have the opportunity to leave all four of us, so the trip, although short, is very much awaited. Unfortunately, after the arrival, we had the impression that we have confused our facilities - I understand that marketing, beautiful photos, the offer to attract customers, but people! ! ! we have to deliver on our promises. In the offer of the children's menu - in fact, even we, adults had nothing to choose from. For breakfasts cold scrambled eggs, sausages interchangeably with sausages + standard sausage, cheese, some vegetables - as far as possible to survive, although every day the same (a small plus for cake and fruit), dinner is not tasty - dried meat from bemaras (not to mention fish, because she would rather not remember that she tried m) . Typically for children NIC - Complete! ! ! But OK - no discussion about tastes, maybe somebody liked it (although there are many complaining families with children around - finally holidays). Unfortunately, the ubiquitous dirt effectively disgusted meals - to steam around the children's corner in the restaurant, dust from the previous year, baby chairs threatened injury or lack of possibility to unstick the child from them (leftover food from predecessors, dried stains from soups or other unidentified liquids). ...the yoghurt spilled by one of the children after 2 days simply dried on the floor - because why wash it? I understand - children will get dirty anyway, but without exaggeration! ! ! ! After the second visit in the restaurant, she asked the waiter to wipe the child's chair - you wouldn't want to see what a white cloth looked like after this procedure: (Tablecloth on Sunday breakfast like a harmonica - clean, but pressed, as if a dog's throat was taken out. About food enough. The neighborhood really has potential - in the summer, for sure, beautiful and green, now something dug up there, something closed, and in the middle of the lake in the dorsal style floats a dead fox - a wonder of nature! If it wasn't for the fact that most of the attractions for children are only open on Saturdays and Sundays, we would come back after 1 day. The sealarium is really great - no reservations here: ) The zoo is also worth seeing. Standard room, quite a nice decor, comfortable beds (a cot for a child again after the passages - it would be useful for him to clean, but let's not get carried away). The small bathroom, the entrance directly to the mouthpiece is quite surprising, only the painting tape around the lamp pointed with insect faeces spoiled the general reception a bit. And the hairdryer - washed my young girl's hair after swimming pool chlorine, I grabbed the hairdryer and horrible! it stuck to my hand - I do not know if it's a mistake in cleaning, because the coating as if it was slightly dissolved (with a layer of sticky dust) - disgusting! I went to the pool once - the best times are behind me, a little bit of falling parts such as a nozzle from the Jacuzzi lying loose next to the pool basin, a broken children's board, a paddling pool quite deep, but it is. After the general impressions, we did not want to use the SPA anymore. The toddler's corner is open 10 - 18, and after 18 if you do not go to the pool you have nothing to offer the children. Nice roomy . General conclusions - never again! ! !

The castle on the rock is very disappointing. We didn't feel like eating after what we saw. I have been cooperating with Mrs. Kasia for some time now and I can't even estimate how much this cooperation helps me, because 5 stars is certainly not enough. The Doctor was very nice, she did a detailed interview, did a thyroid ultrasound and due to the good results she offered only supplementation and preventive examinations in six months. The hotel has already had its glory years behind it, but prices remain too high. 390 PLN for a standard room is an overstatement. He asked em at the reception desk for a room reasonably low and close to the elevator because they have no smoking rooms and he wanted 'em close to the court. He got 'em a room on the 3rd floor and as far away from the elevator as possible, which is an extreme room at the end of the corridor. Parking 45zł for hotel guests, tight places, so about the car upholstery by a neighbor very easily. There is no socket in the room by the bedside to be able to recharge the phone overnight. Actually, there is only a desk socket (except for the vacuum cleaner in the hallway). Wi - terribly annoying, every time you lose range you have to log in again and in addition only one device, so you have to choose whether you have a laptop or a phone. Polish channels in TV literally a handful, programs c + additionally paid 20 PLN. In hotels, more channels are half the price, including c + channels. Air conditioning on the lowest run is noisy, but at least drowned out traffic and trams. Soundproof windows may have been in the 90s now it is a massacre. The price of a mini bar is some kind of total abstraction, 15 PLN for a can of coca-cola, so it's 900%. The only advantages are location and breakfast. There will be no return.

I regret to say that the goods do not match the shop description. I wanted to have a maximum power of 1500 W . And that's what he found 'em in the shop. It turns out that this kettle uses 1630 watts. Very uncoordinated by the seller. Secondly, the base of this kettle is disturbingly light and without rubber bands on its feet. Nothing much, but imagine a child pulling the cable. Then the lightweight plastic will slip off the top. That's why you need to put some non-slip mother under the base of the kettle. All in all, I should return the kettle, but I won't do it. I just don't want to rock with this cardboard for the post office. I know one thing, this shop ( MediaExpert ) I won't trust anymore. The description on the site is VERY important. I've been deliberately misled. 1630 is not 1500W . Correct it . Don't let anybody else push on you anymore . . . I also see in the censor's office the false information about 1500W . . .

The hotel has been a regular guest for five years, a magical place by a climatic lake with good cuisine based on local products with a lot of fish. A large aquapark, a large hotel so it was easy to have peace, quiet and relaxation. . . A year ago the buffets passed by themselves, scallops, snails, venison, kangaroo cutlet, excellent for several years strogon boeuf, large selection of fish, both hot and cold. These flavors remembered 'em. After all, you could relax in the lobby bar with a bottle of beer "fresh" or a glass of wine. And for that I will repeat the peace again. . . Encouraged by a four-fold fantastic vacation, completed with all-day relaxation in the saunas, salt cave and aquapark pools, I went to Pigeon for another. The year 2017 holiday time to start . The first impression was made by the reception, this year a nice surprise, because we came to the hotel thickly before the time, but we were offered a room at once without having to wait for a fixed hour check in. We even offered us a room with no problem at all and we would be happy to go for a walk in Santa Claus. . . . .plus for hotel staff . I felt fair as a guest you are waiting for. Two hot spots in the room, half an hour of spinning at the panel and the temperature of 28 degrees, ok contact the reception - as an explanation the lady at the reception desk corrected that there is no air conditioning in the rooms and the "cooling system" so it will certainly not be as cool as with a classic air conditioner. Okay, but if I report it, I'll send the conservator. Here's another plus, because the restorer was already after 5 minutes, a quick check-up and bingo - the aerated system - after five minutes was after the problem, cool, nice, pleasant. Congratulations to such an employee - I think so far ok. From this place a heartfelt applause for the maids - quick cleaning, towels changed every day, the room perfectly vacuumed, all in all the plus. Ok if you have survived the stitches so far, you will probably think what the guest is picking on. . . . .then let's move on. Buffets - the food is correct, fresh but - for dinners in addition to the brilliant cheeks of beef and snails with garlic butter more and more fried sausage, neck, and next to the wonderful Masurian fish and sterin (poultry or fish) minced meat. . . . .until I was afraid to ask if it was made from a can. The second point of alcohol - the size of the drinks served does not satisfy even the dwarf - long island in this size is a mockery and the price of 50zl is a bad joke. Beer 12 zloty - okay, but the wine weathered and warm is a big fusion. The late coffee served again in a glass for about 200ml is another minus. Quite a long wait for the realization of the order - with an occupancy rate of about 30% in the lobby bar - you have to wait over 30 minutes for a glass of wine. And now the core of which hotel I will not choose again. It was quiet and calm, and here suddenly. . . On the balconies it was loud even after 10:00 p.m. and it was thick. The speakers with music (reigning Zenon Martyniuk and similar rhythms) brought beer from nearby Orlen and running with a terrifying scream in the corridors of children. In fact, they are not surprised because I would run myself if my parents would party in my room. It's just a wonder if there are no suitable places in the hotel? For example, a disco in the underground or a bar at the marina. It's a wonder that it's better to drink beer from Orlen in your room than from the hotel bar, terrorizing the rest of your guests with its rude and loud behaviour. Children run around, the beer is pouring and every second k-word in disco polo rhythm. . . . a ch . . . . . .etc. Where did these parties come from in the rooms with their own alcohol, it wasn't. Is that what you're aiming for, dear Hotel Gołębiewski? The question is, I could always report too loud, a party, etc . . . . . . .but that's not the point. The point is that during these few years the type of customers of Hotel Gołębiewski has changed a lot. It is becoming more and more difficult to meet here a gentleman in a suit, but the proverbial Janusz in socks for sandals. Sad but real . I have to rest from Pigeon, the first time I want to go back to . . . . home

We were in Grand Lubicz with a family of five from 22 to 27 February 2015. We were delighted. The hotel has been operating since October, everything is clean and new, fantastic swimming pools, children's playrooms and meals are poetry. The food on the five with a plus various, fresh and very good. The staff is young, smiling and very nice. Comparing this hotel to Gołębiewski, in terms of price and visual, wins without a doubt Grand Lubicz. I recommend to rest with and without ten and without. We are already planning a visit in the summer. From 3 pm to 7 pm the children are taken care of free of charge. Greetings to Mr. Łukasz from Emilka .

I'm not a demanding man, but this hotel was a complete failure. The modern bathrooms turned out to be rooms from the early 80's if not 70's. Don't suggest you take pictures of them because I'll be happy to share my own, which are certainly not even close to those published by the hotel. The hotel is located on the outskirts of the city in the vicinity of the demolished warehouses or factories, which had a "beautiful" view from the window. The entrance from the squalid courtyard - we barely found it) . The water in the shower flew if too many guests did not take a bath at that time (when she was taking a shower and her husband was washing his hands in the sink next door - I ran out of water to rinse). In the toilet under the ceiling pipes wrapped in some grey rags. Massacre ! ! ! ! The room was very average - no fridge or TV (for comparison, in a 2-star hotel in Berlin it was all ! ! ! ! ! ! ) . For the first breakfast we ate bakery products from 3-4 days ago, because they didn't roll when slicing, they fell into breadcrumbs. On the second day of breakfast there was a hunt for anything, because it was already at 9. At 00 there was almost nothing. Thank God the third breakfast ate me already at home. It is good that the room was on the 2nd floor, because no force would have dragged me into the elevator - it was certainly from the 70s! The corridors were dirty - painted as in old schools with a terrible lamp, there were holes in the floor after the fallen tiles. It is a pity that such a squalid place destroyed the beautiful impressions of this wonderful city - do not take this hotel! ! ! !

I was at Mrs. Malinowska's house a few times and everything seemed to be going in a nice atmosphere, but I had the impression that the doctor was not involved in the consultations. She answered the questions as if she did not want to hear more. She came to me for a check after a spontaneous miscarriage. She was recently in another early pregnancy. When asked about the formalities related to the pregnancy, the doctor was not very interested in it. Doctor, I think you lost your routine. I will entrust my pregnancy to another doctor.

Once again, he is staying in a four-star hotel and you find the reason why someone once admitted this star. It's okay for me, but I think these four stars are way too much. The rooms are neat and tidy, the bathroom is tiny but it worked. The biggest disappointment for me was the recreation and meals. In the first issue expected me to have a gym and left me two bikes and a treadmill. Aha . The pool is also not very big. In general, despite the crowd of guests, no one has ever been there. As for the food is breakfast - Swedish table ok but the quality of served ingredients leaves much to be desired. Maybe that's how I got it. Anyway, during the whole stay I had stomach problems just after having breakfast. I also did not like the behavior of the restaurant staff who did not allow to drink coffee or tea after the evening because it was available only to foreign guests. The rest is a plus.

Always ! Therefore, let's focus our efforts: first of all, to make the conference service always better than before; and secondly, to always exceed the competition. Kap Cafe is a place with a soul. In the very centre of the town Chapels, a tastefully renovated tenement house has been adapted for a great hotel, café and mini cultural centre with live music, exhibitions of works and crafts. We stayed for one night, but all we had to do was to like this place with its hospitality, tasteful décor and relaxed atmosphere. A great hotel, competent service, delicious breakfast.

She spent 2 days 03 - 04 at the Hotel Dosłońce. 09 . 2015 . If you are looking for a place cut off from the hustle and bustle of the city this is the perfect place . The hotel is situated in a field, there is nothing around. Writing there is nothing I am literal. Around there are only fields, forest and farms. The smell outside the hotel was unpleasant (because of the fertilizers taken to the field). The location also means that the only way to get around is to transport yourself. I came to this hotel from Warsaw and had the impression that I was going to the end of the world. And what is very important in the hotel is a very poor coverage in the PLUS network, she could talk on the phone only in front of the hotel in one place in the parking lot. So much for the location. As for the hotel itself, there are modern, nice and clean rooms decorated with taste. The food in the restaurant is tasty, nicely served. The conference room is spacious, air-conditioned with access to daylight. Professional and courteous service. The hotel has a swimming pool which compensates for the lack of entertainment in the area. Evenings can be spent in the hotel bar.

He used 'em to stay overnight and the conference room where he was training 'em. The hotel in some places is a bit like from the previous era . But it has a great service. I beg you. . . . .do not change. . . . .continue to be so beautifully hospitable. . .

A middle-class hotel. Definitely too high price in relation to the quality of the facility. Breakfast is not crazy, but you can eat. Generally. - Uninteresting cuisine. When it comes to card dishes / lunch / - a small selection / 3 dishes / and not tasty. In addition, you can include LAZIENKA - shelves, shelves, hangers, and the most important BIDET. ! ! ! Clean rooms - daily service . The offer says that they help in arranging trips, but it turned out that only with a guide speaking a foreign language - "Polish - not".

An interesting solution for hotels struggling with financing problems was presented by the independent hotel group Magnuson Hotels. On the occasion of the launch of a new brand group Premier Collection , hotels of this brand , or facilities of other Magnuson brands , such as Magnuson Hotel , Magnuson Grand Hotel and M Star Hotel , gain access to a quick ( possible one day ) credit from the company Ascentium Capital . The facilities may apply for a loan of up to 250 thousand. The facilities can apply for a loan of up to $250,000 for the period from 24 to 72 months.

I highly recommend . Weekly family stay - me, wife, son, daughter and child. Two rooms in building B combined. The standard of rooms after the recent renovation is high - large rooms, spacious wardrobes. At every step you can see the hotel preparation for family stays with small children. Three meals a day, varied, tasty, everyone will find something for themselves. Swimming pools, saunas, playgrounds, spas, entertainers - you can not leave the building. At every step of the way, the staff smiles. There is no other such hotel in Poland with such a focus on the family. I highly recommend, we will definitely come back not once.

How we arrived at the hotel, from the outside and inside it makes a nice impression at first sight. But it wasn't quite like that. In short: one curtain doesn't cover the whole window, for hot water in the shower in the morning you have to wait a little bit, the food from the card if available is below any standards (she never ate m cocktail of shrimp in ketchup and horseradish sauce), bowling is barely working, the water in the pool so cold that you can't enter, when it comes to the jacuzzi it's big, it's a pity only that it worked one third of it. Generally very expensive, but if there was to be a standard * * * * * then affordable prices, it is a pity that the standard was rather * * . I don't recommend it.

"More and more people are giving up eating dairy products. There are various reasons for this, such as lactose intolerance, allergies to one of the main ingredients of milk - casein, or simply deciding to switch to a vegan diet. However, it is worth remembering that products which are formed as a result of the action of milk fermenting bacteria - such as yoghurts or kefirs - have a very positive impact on health," says PAP Klaudia Wojtachnio from the Warsaw University of Technology's Herbion scientific circle. "Hence the popularity of substitutes for these products, such as yoghurts based on coconut or rice milk," she adds. The members of the circle to which Klaudia Wojtachnio belongs - students of biotechnology - decided to use the knowledge gained during their studies and create their own equivalent of traditional yoghurt. They decided to use millet for its production. "It is mainly cheap and easily available in Poland" - stresses PAP's interlocutor. She also points out that this cereal is full of nutrients: you can find in it, among others, phosphorus, silicon, iron or vitamins B1 and B2.

The location enables walking to the centre. The rooms are perfectly good quality. Swimming pool, sauna, Jacuzzi - great and included in the room price. Food is good - definitely too much ; - ) ) . The New Year's Eve party was organized flawlessly - we had a great time. A lot of staff - they were wondering how we could keep it that way. Parking by the hotel - large, cleanly lit and fenced. The lift works flawlessly. I have no reservations - I sincerely recommend it.

I've had 'em with this gentleman, course but, but: ) 5.0 for all the attendance, one possible without making up, more - you have to make up for it if you want to have a pile. The course is nice and pleasant, but you have to run after the ball, so I often stood on goal: ) No stress, no tests or other bullshit, at the beginning of the warm-up, team selection and driving. I recommend it warmly.

A very pleasant hotel. Picturesque location, clean and spacious rooms. The rooms either have no fridge or are broken - it does not cool, it warms! Wifi does not work in the rooms, only near the reception. You can connect to the room with a cable, but nowadays wifi is the norm, so very big minus for that! The pool is big. Unfortunately the children's wading pool was closed. The zoo is accessible by car, which was not a problem. In the zoo it is difficult to see some animals on the islets. I suspect it's even harder to see them from a boat. The entrance costs 18 zloty, I think it's too much that the zoo is not worth the price. We recommend the sealarium. Interestingly conducted training and seal show. Generally, it was pleasant, but we were not delighted with this place enough for us to want to go back there, and it's a pity, because the website looks all great.

A very pleasant hotel. One drawback was the lack of air conditioning in the room (which on the top floor was extremely unpleasant, despite the fact that we were dumb in September). Every day the maids vacuumed, there were fresh towels (5), there was a lot of food, quite a variety of dinners, although for breakfast was a permanent package. The pool inside was clean, with sea water filtered, outside was water directly from the sea. The service was cordial, helped when needed. Overall, our memories of this lounge are very positive and we highly recommend it.

In the Hostel Gate has been many times over the last few years. I don't sleep there anymore and I don't recommend it to anyone. Why? At the beginning I was delighted: great location, great breakfast, nice, clean rooms and bathrooms, nice service. Unfortunately, that was a few years ago. . . The hostel clearly needs refreshing! And that immediately! The furniture in the rooms is literally falling apart, the towels are washed to the limit, the pillows don't even look like them, and the dirty, stained mattresses on the beds are just disgusting! And the most important problem of the hostel - BRUD! I don't know, maybe we in Silesia have different standards, but for me, the floor is barely wiped with a dirty rag is not clean! And one more word about the staff. It is strange to them to tell guests "good morning" . I understand that these are young people for whom perhaps working in a hostel is not a dream come true, but the basic principles of good manners apply to everyone, and even more so in such a place. To sum up. It is a great pity. . . Until recently, it was my favourite hostel and I recommended it to everyone who visited Krakow. Unfortunately, those times are over. Please renovate it, and I'll definitely come back.

The hotel is a confirmation of the greatest advantages of chain hotels. There is a specific standard that is almost always met and you know what to expect. In Novotel the level is set quite high. The functional, clean rooms. The bathroom is very decent. Separate toilet. There is a double bed in each room, but there is also a sofa bed if it would be more advisable to have a separate bed: ) . You can make coffee, tea or cocoa. Breakfast is very good, and for Dutch conditions, it's even great. The service is very nice and patient (after a few attempts it has dealt with everything that must be on the Polish invoice :). ) . Location primarily for motorists or using the nearby airport. Very large car park by the hotel .

A physician in kind, he certainly knows his job, but he will look and face a la "Terminator". ...can scare you off, sometimes it's hard to talk to the doctor. A very good doctor, after 3 years of incompetent treatment by other gastroenterologists, was in depression - constantly diarrhea and uninterrupted bleeding from the intestines. When she came to your doctor she had anemia and a terrible pain on the left side. On the good day she got an extra medicine after a month the disease went back. After a year the steroid drug was discontinued and she had been knocking off for over a year with no symptoms of relapse. Of course the doctor recommended an acute diet of zero fried fish with omega acids and zero milk and its derivatives. All steamed and cooked. I am satisfied and finally lives like any healthy person.

Today he didn't take me in with a damaged hand after the fall. He didn't even look at his bandaged hand. He was busy with the computer. I'm 65 years old, I'm lonely. We got a room where the door to the other room was closed, of course. When the neighbors came, they told us that we could hear every word spoken in the adjoining room. 90% of the 500,000 accommodation facilities available on the kayak.pl website allow their guests to use Wi - Fi at no extra charge . In the comparison of European countries with the highest percentage of hotels with free Wi - Fi , Poland was on the second position, and in general, including facilities around the world, on the fifth position. "Does your hotel offer free access to the Internet? ” This is certainly one of the more frequent questions hoteliers have been hearing from their guests for several years. More and more people cannot imagine their holidays without using gadgets such as a smartphone, tablet or laptop. Thus, free Wi Fi in a hotel becomes, next to the location or number of stars, the basic factor when choosing a place to stay. Kayak's research * has shown that 90 percent of the hotels around the world analysed by the service can freely use the Internet without paying extra fees. The overall ranking was followed by America (94%), Europe (90%), Asia (88%), Africa (81%) and Oceania (55%). On a country-by-country basis, Romania (99%), Vietnam (99%) and Taiwan (98%) were on the podium.

She bought this mixer about 3 years ago, betting on a Polish company, and just a week after the warranty ended, she broke down during dough mixing - official diagnosis - for dough. Somehow, the mother-in-law's zelmer mixer has been dealing with dense, yeast dough for 30 years and has always had a reserve of power. Repairing it cost me more than a new mixer, but the valuation itself, without repair, would have cost 50 PLN, so I had no choice but to pay. Yesterday, another crash and this time the mixer lands in the garbage. After finishing work - a light powder cake, so it is not possible for it to overheat - she put it aside without disconnecting from the power, shot once, in a few seconds the second, third, smoke, knocked out traffic jams and so much for our cooperation. Now I wonder whether to risk and buy the same, because I was left with accessories to zelmer, or look for something better. . . . . .but are they better? To the defect I will attach the still cracked at once plastic paddle covers, soft, soft gears in a rotating bowl, causing slippage, or jumping when rubbing the dough with pieces such as not yet grated fat etc. Generally for mixing water, or whisking proteins is quite strong, but for rubbing the dough, it's more solidified my aged grandmother had than this machine.

Anticarcinogenic phytochemicals are a very diversified group of tens of thousands of chemical compounds, responsible for the taste, colour and smell of fruit and vegetables. Some of them are so effective that they can be used directly in advanced cancer therapy. Others serve as a starting point for the production of substances even more effective in treatment. A very important group of phytochemicals are polyphenols. So far more than 10 thousand such compounds have been identified, but their protective role in plants has not been fully understood. The properties of plant foods and their prophylactic and therapeutic effects depend on their quantity and quality. Research shows that in the nutrition of modern man, however, they are as important as vitamins.

I've had this trimmer for 2 years. Earlier I had a Philips 7000 BT7085 / 15 which I unfortunately lost. Hello I've had this chair for 4 months. Here are my observations . The first weeks were a nightmare chair smelled so smelly that it could not withstand the open window, smelled of rubber plastics and exceptionally lubricated mechanisms. After the first week the headrest fell off, it turned out that the latch is made of such a weak plastic and falls off by the action of the internal spring. The following weeks passed on complaining about the headrest fastening screws, which when fully supported crumpled into the back at the height of the blades, the problem was partially solved by replacing the screws with shorter ones. When replacing the screws, I found em that the threads into which they are screwed are so poor quality with one more unscrewing and they will not actually be there. After about two months, the backrest of the seat started to crackle when it was seated. After 4 months, the investigation showed that one of the pins in the mechanism worn out or was defective. For such a price I definitely do not recommend this armchair, it was supposed to last for a few years of use and after 4 months the mechanism of leaning disintegrates.

I have had an oven for a year now. Plus fast heating up and easy to use . On the minus side - loud work ! Annoying thermostat cycling . Quality of material - below criticism . After applying steam cleaning, described in the manual as Aqualytic, massacred discoloration appeared on the oven floor. In the place where the heater is located, the enamel has become dull. There are only 51 days left to the whistle that starts the first match of the Euro 2012 football tournament. Comparing the announcements made by the owners of the whole Poland, individual regions or cities, from the middle of 2007, with what was actually done, you can clearly see that most couples went to the whistle. Not a judge's whistle at all. So what do we have? We have stadiums, and even one too many, because considering the little needed, almost parallel creation of two arenas in Warsaw: Legia and Narodowy, it seems that one is redundant. Is it really, it will show the future. We have hotels and we have a great desire to earn money at the event. What do we not have? Certainly the leap of civilization that we expected. We do not have a network of motorways, and only a few new, poorly connected sections, we do not have modernized key sections of the railway network. We do not have a sufficient number of public toilets.

On September 11-12th, Łódź will be visited by psychologists and representatives of social and medical sciences from several countries, including Great Britain, the Netherlands, Israel, Portugal, Turkey, Russia, Ireland, Croatia, China, Italy and Switzerland. Poland will be represented by researchers from the Universities of Łódź, Gdańsk, Kazimierz Wielki and Cardinal Stefan Wyszyński - informed PAP prof . Eleonora Bielawska - Batorowicz from the Faculty of Education Sciences at the University of Łódź, member of the Board of SRIP . The Society for Reproductive and Infant Psychology, based in the United Kingdom, brings together representatives of various scientific disciplines who deal with research in the field of procreation and reproductive health and development in infancy and postnatal period. The association is international in nature; a significant number of its members are psychologists, but SRIP is open to representatives of other social and medical sciences.

"The problem is the color of light. Blue and green light penetrates poorly into the tissues" - admits Dr Borowiak . For the time being, the drugs could be used specifically to treat e.g. melanoma. One can also imagine that patients are introduced endoscopically thin fibers or implants are implanted to illuminate the tumor site, but researchers are looking for further solutions. "We are looking for compounds that will change their structure under the influence of red and infrared light. Because light of such colours best penetrates tissues" - assures the biologist. For now, the compounds developed by the researchers are tested in the laboratory on cell lines and mice. "I think it may be 15-20 years before the drug goes on sale," says the PAP caller.

The guesthouse is located in the very centre of Polanica by the promenade. Next to it the owner provides parking space (free of charge). The rooms are tastefully decorated and spacious, the furniture from Ikea, practically all new. LCD TVs. Clean and moody. "The wall is described as an unpleasant experience that is more of a physical than a psychophysical crisis. It is most often manifested by general fatigue, decreased motivation, unintentional slowdown of pace, loss of form, increased effort, muscle pain or heaviness of limbs" - explains the author and the work promoter, "The wall is described as an unpleasant experience which is more of a physical than psychophysical crisis. "The analysis of motives and cognitive strategies used during the competition in athletes training marathon runners. According to the experts, the phenomenon of the "wall" is associated with the level of training, so the debuting runners who want to try their hand at the marathon in the coming season should prepare for the difficulties. The key is to plan how to deal with the "wall" and to adapt to the conditions prevailing during the competition. It is worth taking into account the start time, air temperature, sportswear, but also the terrain.

The hotel deserves the highest rating! There are not many such places in Poland. "My research focuses on the epigenetic regulation of angiogenesis - the formation of new blood vessels from existing structures. It is important to learn about the mechanisms regulating the process of angiogenesis, because it is thanks to the network of vessels that all cells of our body are nourished. Thus, angiogenesis determines the proper development of the body, but it is also an important element of tumour progression because it regulates tumour growth" - explains PAP Dr Balcerczyk . From a molecular point of view - explains the researcher - epigenetic mechanisms can also be used as a tool to fight cancer more effectively. "This has directly led me to take an interest in this subject in terms of blood vessel formation and angiogenesis" - says Dr Balcerczyk .

As Dr. Pabiś explains, the ankle therapy should last for several months, except that each child will be treated differently. One child will need three months for it, another six months. According to the project assumptions, the therapy will be adjusted individually according to the age and sex of the child. Before starting the therapy, the cognitive processes, long and short term memory capacity, eyesight and hearing will be examined. "The special diagnostic platform will be used to examine the activity of mirror neurons and check whether their population is large or small. On this basis the training will be modified and adjusted to each patient," explains the scientist. The developers of the device would like to launch production of the cube on the global market, among others in the USA and China. That is why they plan to conduct more extensive research.

I went to see a plastic nose doctor about 3 years ago. The doctor is very nice, unfortunately, the effect of the surgery is so nice. There is also a much greater asymmetry in the view en face, the holes are crooked and are too small in relation to the tip of the nose and the tip of the nose itself is turned. Ophthalmologist Professor . Edward Wylęgała from the Regional Railway Hospital in Katowice pointed out that thanks to modern technologies doctors can restore vision to people once sentenced to blindness, including victims of accidents. This year prof . Hatch, together with his team, performed the first in Poland and the third in the world transplantation of corneal epithelial stem cells in a child. The patient was a 10-year-old Cuba, who four years ago burnt his left eye with extinguishing lime and lost his sight in it. Modern technologies, devices and materials also save the patients of the Regional Hospital of Trauma Surgery from disability. J . Daaba in Piekary Śląskie . As recalled by the director of the hospital, Professor Bogdan Koczy, in 2012 a modern operating theatre was opened in the bakery hospital, and in 2014 one of the most modern imaging diagnostics facilities in Poland. "Without such a good base, orthopedics does not exist" - he noted .

The doctor may be good at diagnostics, but he is very tactless and at times arrogant. She paid me to pay 200PLN for the visit and after doing the examination she heard that I was a bit hysterical and panicked me doing the ultrasound because my finger was all right. And most importantly - she came to me to get a medical diagnosis and not psychoanalysis . . . . I'm not going to explain to anyone why I need an ultrasound, especially since I pay a lot of money for it.

Hotel really in a great location, first class views. The rooms are clean, spacious. First class swimming pool - did not see em swimming pool with better views . . . This is the first minus, the second is the air conditioning - or rather its lack. I think that in a four-star hotel the air conditioning should be the standard, especially in this class of hotel.

The doctor has done a long, detailed interview with me. After a few visits I saw that she was not sure about her diagnosis, but she decided that I have a very serious disease and prescribed expensive medicines (claiming that they are not harmful in any way and can only help). I was a little bit broken and at the same time I was surprised because only two of the results of the multitude tests came out wrong. I decided to consult another doctor just in case (one of the best I could find in Warsaw). The doctor stated definitely no disease and even issued me with a certificate (he said that the only two bad results are also in healthy people). He also asked if I had been to see an ophthalmologist before taking this medicine because it could damage my eyesight. To sum up, Dr. Heather gave me a bad diagnosis that caused me a lot of stress and I wasted a lot of money not to mention the health I could have lost by telling myself that I was sick and taking the medicine with a serious side effect. I do not say that I do not recommend visiting Dr. Heather, but I strongly advise you to consider her words and in case of a bad diagnosis verify it.

Prof . Stępniewska reminded that the discovery of ectoine is the result of research conducted in Bogdanka coal mine. First the scientists wanted to find out why there is no high risk of methane explosion in Bogdanka, as it is in mines in Silesia. It turned out that in the coal rocks in Bogdanka live bacteria - methanotrophs - which "feed on" methane. "They are such invisible allies of the miners of our mine," she noted. Then it was analyzed how these bacteria live and function in such difficult conditions, more than a kilometer below ground, with low humidity, increased salt concentration in the environment. "They discovered that they are protected by ectoine. They saw that we have a unique, one and only material," said Stępniewska.

In addition, in the coming years it will still be possible to undergo screening colonoscopy without an invitation (the so-called opportunistic system). Prof . The rule stated that persons with such symptoms should be subject to diagnostic tests (including colonoscopy) but financed by the NFZ and not under the prevention programme financed by the Ministry of Health. Information on centres to which it is possible to apply for screening colonoscopy can be found on the website of the Screening Programme ( http://pbp.org.pl ) .

A very successful holiday at the Hotel Montecarlo ! I sincerely recommend . Everything exactly as in the pictures . As written, the hotel was being renovated, as you can see. Everything is new and clean. We had a room on the 2nd floor with a view of the sea. There are also rooms overlooking the pool. In the evening there are parties with live music by the pool, I expect it can be a nuisance for those who have rooms on that side. We have not heard anything from you. Large balcony, new balcony furniture, towel dryer. Air conditioning in the room without any problems. Programs on TV mainly German and English. But I'm not going on holiday to watch TV. To the beach 5 minutes walk, a charming street among the palm trees. The beach is sandy, wide, clean. You can use the sun loungers on the beach (10, 50 euros per set/day) or lay out towels directly on the sand. The water is clear. Along the beach is a long promenade with shops and restaurants. You can not get bored. The food in the hotel is delicious. Every day different cuisine . Mrs. Anna , Tui resident nice and helpful. We did not use the pool, but there were a lot of deck chairs.

I will start with the fact that I do not understand the delight of patients because of the "high personal culture" of this doctor, for me it is obvious that the doctor should behave culturally towards the patient, but to the point: I am after the first visit, the doctor informed me very thoroughly about the mechanism of my illness and the therapies applied to it, a neurological examination carried out also very accurate. I am glad that he has offered me a therapy that no other neurologist has offered me, a new light of hope has shone, if time will rightly show. The downside of this doctor is that he doesn't really listen to the patient and that among the prescribed drugs he has been prescribing me an emergency pain reliever for a year, which has been withdrawn from the market for a year, and the other one, which is a public over-the-counter remedy too weak for my pains.

"Our method is to detect the presence of pathogens in the blood of a patient with suspected sepsis within a few hours. Thanks to this, the doctor will be able to take fast, proper antibiotic therapy to immediately apply the right, effective drug to the patient and not to do it blindly" - explains one of the creators of the method, Tomasz Dr. Gosiewski from the Department of Microbiology at the Jagiellonian University Medical College. As the doctor explains, who wants to be sure that the medicine he prescribes is effective, he must have a hint from a microbiologist what is sitting in such blood. "The method we have developed can give such a hint faster: up to six hours maximum" - explains Dr. Gosiewski .

My husband and I will recommend you to the Doctor. We have been given a visit after our first pregnancy, which died. The doctor ordered a number of tests, then implemented treatment, monitored the results. All this was done in order to get pregnant again in due time and most of all to keep her pregnant. "They surprised us" at once. The pregnancy itself was complicated, fortunately thanks to visits, prescribed medicines and the Doctor's care we are the parents of a 3-month-old son (healthy and born on time). The Doctor is able to bring him down to earth and calm down when he reads too much stupid stuff on the Internet and then finds the same symptoms. He can also react quickly when something happens (and here I am most grateful for the private telephone number she could call every day at any time - the Doctor answers all calls). Of course I also sometimes had to sit in the waiting room. However, she entered the queue 3 times and she didn't speak to me due to complications, that's why I know that some things will not happen. Especially in medicine . Once again I highly recommend!

Stimulator implantation operations consist in opening the spinal canal and then inserting an electrode over the spinal cord hard tyre. To this electrode current flows from the stimulator, which is placed on the patient's trunk. The current from the stimulator through the electrode is to effectively irritate the brainstem structure. The stimulator is connected to the electrode with a wire running under the skin. Every 15 minutes the stimulator sends a "dose of current" to the brain. Prof. Maksymowicz earlier explained to PAP that it is supposed to increase brain flow so that there is more nourishing blood, "so that those neurons that survived injuries, feel better, are better nourished. The increase in brain flow and brain stimulation is consequently supposed to lead to contact with people who were previously in a state of minimal consciousness.

There are several methods of reducing radon concentration. The basic method is to ensure adequate ventilation and airing of buildings, especially cellars, where this gas accumulates most. Other methods include control of building materials, proper selection of land for house construction, sealing of cracks in foundations and places of connection of installations to buildings, use of protective films. In Poland, a draft of regulations concerning the implementation of the EU Directive has already been prepared. They propose, among others, mandatory radon measurements in workplaces . "We must raise people's awareness so that they know what the effects of natural radiation can be. It is necessary to establish the so-called radon plan for Poland. It is necessary to recognize the situation we have, collect archival data and perform screening measurements as well as information campaign in the communes, including training for construction companies and developers, so that people will know this problem" - said dr hab . Cossack. ( PAP )

"Atrial Fibrillation, which is the most common arrhythmia in adults, occurs when the atria do not contract. The heart starts beating immeasurably, there is a heart rate deficit on the perimeter, which means that the pulse wave on the radial artery does not coincide with the heart rate" - explains a scientist from the WUM. He estimates that atrial fibrillation is found in 5 - 10% of elderly people, and in Poland about 400 thousand people suffer from this disease. Patients with fibrillation complain about palpitations, weakness, limited ability to perform physical efforts. They may faint or develop coronary pain. Atrial fibrillation is recognized by ECG. In cases where it is rare and short, a long-term ECG is needed, e.g. Holter ECG. Prof . Gaciong points out that it is important to find the cause of this condition, e.g. undetected heart defect. For this purpose, additional tests are performed to assess the condition of the heart and lungs, i.e.: blood pressure measurement, ECHO heart, chest X-ray and blood analysis.

He pointed out that in the case of people with skin phototype I, i.e. very light complexion, blue eyes, blond or red hair, regular exposure to the sun is not recommended due to the risk of developing malignant skin cancer (especially melanoma). Moreover, in the majority of Poles, even during the sunny months, the production of vitamin D in the skin is not sufficient. "Our life looks like we move around in cars everywhere. We get up in the morning, take the children to school, spend eight hours there, come by car to pick them up, take them to extra-curricular activities, and it all takes place indoors. That is why children and adults are also exposed to vitamin D deficits," said Dr Płudowski .

"I am an industrial worker, not a scientist, but I have more than 30 years of experience in conducting research related to the use of lasers in the industry, their control systems and the design of medical equipment. "The education that he has received from me has allowed me to develop my skills comprehensively. I owe it to the people he met in the process of his education. He graduated in precision mechanics, now it is the Faculty of Mechatronics. He studied biomedical engineering, my professor was Grzegorz Pawlicki, President of the Association of Warsaw University of Technology Alumni and Friends. My second mentor is Professor Tadeusz Pałko. Although substances similar to LifeGel are developed in various places around the world, this solution developed by Poles is better in several respects. "It is a solution that gives a clean and repeatable product. Our goal is to enable research to be carried out widely using three-dimensional cultures" - adds the biotechnologist. Start - up Real Research from the Jagiellonian Centre of Innovation, apart from Marcin Krzykawski, is created by Renata Szczelina . Both of them are graduates of the Faculty of Biotechnology of the Jagiellonian University in Cracow . Marcin Krzykawski is currently completing his doctorate in the Department of Immunology at the Jagiellonian University Medical College. Their adventure with the development of hydrogel began a few years ago, when they joined the team whose task was to develop three-dimensional bioprint - a technology that would make it possible to print structures containing cells.

I was very lucky because I managed to get to doctor Marcin Kosiński in due time, who helped me a lot in the treatment of my prostate, which I have been suffering from for 20 years (I am now 83). Recently the ailments have intensified to such an extent that in practice they have prevented me from living a normal life. Hope for them has just been restored to me by Dr. Kosiński. The whole period of waiting for admission to the hospital took care of me, professionally and patiently performing the necessary examinations and treatments, including periodic catheterization. The operation was performed by Dr. Kosiński very professionally, stress-free, painless and without complications, for which I am extremely grateful. To all those who suffer from urological ailments I wish that, like me, they would have a chance to meet a friend in their illness. Doctor Marcin Kosiński is not only an outstanding specialist, a great doctor, but also a good man in human terms. Grateful Mikołaj Cz . from Wrocław .

She pointed out that obesity is a very complex disease which leads to very large health changes and consequently to premature death. As she said, it is ok. 50 factors that can cause obesity, e.g. environmental factors (diet, lifestyle), but also medications taken, emotional disorders. "If a pre-obesity condition appears - as doctors say - then it would be ideal for every patient not to look for diets on their own - a miracle on the internet, but to go to the doctor, to check up, because maybe this overweight is due to the poor functioning of the body" - she explained. She assessed that patients rarely decide on treatment with a specialist. "We still don't realize that obesity is not an aesthetic defect, but a disease" - she emphasized.

The treatment of small tumors not only promises to be better, but does not always require immediate treatment. All you have to do is observe if the tumor is not getting bigger. "Some of them develop slowly, in such situations you can wait until the disease progresses," the specialist said. Such a strategy is used in the case of prostate cancer in men. It can also be used for kidney cancer patients when the tumor does not exceed 3 cm and is not enlarged. The treatment consists mainly in surgical removal of the tumour or the whole kidney. When the tumor is not big, it is enough to cut out part of the kidney. The choice is then a minimally invasive surgery involving the removal of the tumor by cryoablation (by freezing), radio frequency waves, laser or ultrasound.

"Our product will be purified and therefore free of any ballast substances. It will contain phages that will be well characterized biologically and genetically. The Waldorf Astoria Hotel Amsterdam, located near the Herengracht Canal, in the UNESCO World Heritage Site, in Amsterdam, was the first to receive guests. It offers 93 rooms and suites and is located in six restored 17th and 18th century buildings. The luxuriously furnished rooms are in ochre shades with a touch of lapis lazuli and refer to the key of paintings by the Dutch painter Vermeer, the author of "The Girl with the Pearl". Each bedroom has retained its original charm thanks to wooden ceilings, winged windows and spacious bathrooms with free-standing bathtubs. The dining area consists of the Hotel Restaurant Librije s Zusje Amsterdam, Maurer Room, Armillary Sphere, Waldorf Astoria Peacock Alley and the Vault Bar. The banquet and business part of the restaurant includes the Hooft Ballroom with its windows overlooking the picturesque canals of the city. The hotel's garden area includes the Guerlain Spa, which includes three treatment rooms, a sauna, a steam bath and an indoor pool with heated water and a beautiful view of the private garden.

A hotel at the highest level. Metaphorically and literally. Every detail has been worked out, professional and friendly service. The climate and view is breathtaking. Hotel by the forest, on a hill where everything seems to be better ; - ) High level decoration with coziness but without excess. SPA Cabinet that puts people in a different state - professionals themselves. Words of appreciation for the Chef, each dish is delicious and stylishly served. I recommend: )

Prof . Dziadziuszko added that creating something like a genetic portrait of a cancer already translates into the possibility of treating certain groups of patients with the help of so-called molecularly oriented therapies. Scientists hope that in the future these possibilities will be even wider. The effect of molecularly targeted drugs is to block the defective protein that is produced by a given mutation or genetic change. Its activity leads to uncontrolled replication of cancer cells. These drugs are much more selective than classical chemotherapy and sometimes prolong patients' lives much more. "We have examples of patients who used to live for a maximum of 6-9 months and now live for 2-3 years, work, and lead an active life" - said professor. Grandparents. He added that there are also other examples of targeted drugs whose effectiveness is much lower.

Hotel unfortunately 4 / 5 * only with name and price. The service is correct, but do not count on too much openness and smile. One of the few advantages? Wifi on the premises and in the rooms . And finally, this bathroom again. . . . .not for the money.

Hello. We came to the hotel in August last year (11-12), traditionally on the anniversary of the city. A year earlier we had been in the Paszkowka Palace, but the hotel delighted us more. I recommend this hotel for a short stay. The rooms are clean, basically the whole hotel is clean. Room renovated, comfortable bed. You could not hear the street (6th floor). A little tight but for 2 - 3 days ok. Good food in the restaurant - prices to be received. Close to the old town and to the museums. The only failure in the hotel is the price of parking 60 zł / day. As for this class the hotel is a massacre. When travelling in Poland on business, I usually pay 30 - 40 PLN / day (e.g. recently in Radisson in Krakow paid em 38 PLN / day) . So it's no wonder that the parking lot is empty. I know that this is a 2 star hotel, but in most hotels you can already make yourself a tea or coffee (equipped with a kettle).

The resort is located very close to the beach and very close to the lake. Access to the beach by a path through the forest . Descent to the beach through a dune - rather difficult to overcome for people with a wheelchair, or the elderly. The surroundings of the resort are sad, unseen. The whole area is lined with bone, no greenery or places to relax. There is a swimming pool and an internal playground for children (we did not use them so I do not judge). We booked a room with a view of the lake. At night a beautiful view, but during the day in front of the lake a view of the adjacent plot with the remains of rubble from the demolition: ( When we booked, we asked for a room on the top floor ( 7 ). We heard that it was impossible, because the last floor is being modernized. During our stay we saw our guests entering the last floor - an unfair approach: ( Big rooms, at first sight clean. But a fold-out couch in the middle is covered with old, uncleaned food. Although it was known that we would be using the extra bed, there was no trouble to clean it. No phones in the rooms. To ask for the couch to be cleaned you have to call the reception desk with your own phone. We started our stay the day before the holiday package started. We came for dinner and our first disappointment - to eat leftover cold fish, some cold chops, hard beans and cold water to drink. A massacre - a non-circumcised meal. The reception desk, when asked if this is how all meals will look like, helplessly shrugged their shoulders. On the luck of the next day (Christmas package) was better. The meals were rich, varied but very average in taste. The holiday package included breakfast and dinner. When I booked, I was assured that the restaurant would be open all the time and we could buy an extra meal during the day. It turned out, however, that the kitchen did not have enough staff to prepare a meal from the card - we were told that we would wait at least 40 minutes. And sooner we could only get a pizza - pathetic: (It's not cool that you mislead customers when booking. The Christmas atmosphere is missing (outside the bases on the tables) . Tablecloths on the tables only for Easter breakfast . Other meals on paper pads with advertisement of the resort: (Restaurant decor rather on the level of a fast food bar. If the resort wants to organize Christmas stays, it still has a lot to learn. We would rather not use it again: (

I've been Mrs. Beata's patient for 10 years. She led me out on a straight line after a serious car accident, a broken pelvis, stretched cervical vertebrae, etc. Later on she had another incident as a result of which she suffered a shoulder injury and a fracture of the 4 thoracic vertebrae. She is regularly rehabilitated because of the post-traumatic degenerations that have occurred. One visit to Mrs. Beata brings relief and immediate improvement. A few series in a row makes me calm down for at least a year. Mrs. Beata is a high-class specialist, excellent knowledge, experience and great intuition. She senses the patient and recognizes the cause of the condition. A specific person, who is very nice and warm at the same time. At the same time full of power and strength. I have not met a better physiotherapist than her. I recommend it to all my friends and you. She is really great! Additionally, she inspired me to change my lifestyle and nutrition. To start taking care of your health and physical condition, because it is really worth it! And she is a great example of that! Thank you Mrs. Beato : ) Lidia Stankiewicz

There were no precise regulations on organ procurement for transplantation in Poland yet. The Act of 1948, which was in force at that time, concerned only the cornea removal and obtaining tissues from the deceased, and not organs. However, kidney removal from the deceased was then considered to be a preliminary stage of the autopsy. This interpretation was also supported by prosecutor Zygmunt Papierz . In this situation it was not necessary to ask the family for permission to take an organ, but this was not concealed. At that time there was no concept of brain death yet. Its first criteria were developed in 1968 at Harvard University. Therefore, although the kidney donor for Danuta Milewska was a woman who "died from a severe cranial injury". As it is written in the hospital protocol, the collection of the blood was waited until the blood circulation stopped. It was only then that the death was found, although the kidneys were often severely damaged, they were not always suitable for transplantation.

The hotel is perfectly located, right by the sea, quiet and peaceful. Room well equipped, kettle, refrigerator, daily mini bar. Safe is available. The swimming pool complex is small but sufficient, with paddling pools for children. Two sauna zones, one defined as the total nudity zone. Nice and new rooms, clean and comfortable. Unfortunately, we had a view of the car park. The downside is the lack of balconies. The hotel is beautifully situated on the shore of the lake. The only thing that bothered me personally was to leave some of the walls unplastered, unpainted and the rooms and the pool - it looks messy and completely luxurious, just like there are a lot of glass and other glass elements that are dirty from fingerprints etc. - If you want to have them, then unfortunately you have to take care of them. However, the biggest plus is the super breakfasts - I often stay in hotels, so I know how it is, everything is of the best quality from bread, to cold cuts, salads, cakes and all this in the beautiful dining room overlooking the lake.

Over the last five years, more than 600 hotels and 24 thousand rooms in hotels have arrived in Poland. Growing demand, EU funds, preparations for Euro 2012 and good - despite the changing global economic situation - forecasts for the tourism market have resulted in an unprecedented investment boom on the Polish accommodation market. Between July 2007. Between July 2007 and July 2012 the number of hotels operating in Poland increased by 42%. The number of available rooms in hotels increased by 47% . The number of available rooms in hotels increased by 47%, according to an analysis prepared by the Editorial Office of "Hotel Management". This increase was possible, among other things, thanks to over PLN 6 billion, which were estimated to have been spent at that time by investors, mainly domestic ones, on the construction and modernisation of accommodation facilities. Among these 600 hotels quite a large group are the pre-existing facilities, which, after thorough modernization, were for the first time categorized as hotels.

In Poland, almost half a thousand accommodation facilities are for sale. Although the number may seem large, it is less than 5% of hotels, guesthouses, resorts, holiday homes and other tourist accommodation facilities present on the market. Although investors have a lot to choose from, and thanks to the supply they can count on attractive prices, there are relatively few transactions this year. Especially the larger ones, which concern hotels located in large cities operating under the banner of international groups. For example, the Europa Hotel in Lublin is currently being sold.

As IPC PAS specialists explain, the new polymer was made by molecular printing. The lipocalin molecules were first surrounded by appropriately selected short polymers (the so-called "functional polymers"), which bind to this protein in places characteristic only for it. Next, a second polymer was introduced, which was bound to a functional polymer . "The crosslinking polymer was later polymerized and then lipocalin was washed out of the resulting structure. Eventually, a durable polymer layer with molecular hatches adapted to the lipocalin molecules in terms of their local chemical properties as well as size and shape was obtained" - reads the IPC PAS message sent to PAP. "When lipocalin molecules in the solution tested come into contact with the polymer formed in this way, some of them have a chance to be located in the gaps. However, proteins are quite large and are reluctant to migrate through the polymer network. Therefore, the structure of our polymer had to be artificially loosened, enough to give the lipocalin molecules the best possible access to as many gaps as possible, but not too much so that the polymer layer would not collapse" - describes Dr. Noworyta .

Quite a typical guesthouse by the Baltic Sea, far too expensive in relation to the standard it offers. Rooms equipped with not very sophisticated furniture, but quite functionally. The building is very acoustic - you can hear all the neighbors, their conversations, steps, swimming, etc. Quite tasty and varied dishes at breakfast. Comfortable parking by the building. The transition to the beach - through the forest, short and quite nice. Beach without crowding. The offer could be considered as attractive if the price per day for a few days stay does not exceed 220 PLN for a room for 2 people.

I decided to write, maybe somebody with chronic sinusitis, with frequent colds, blocked nose for years and headaches will read it and decide to undergo endoscopic sinus surgery. If you have chronic sinusitis, don't regret it, sell a car or anything else and have an endoscopic operation, you won't regret it (I'm currently unemployed and not regretting it). When you air yourself through your nose, you'll forget about the money you spent. After the surgery, do not wait for the effects, in my case only after two weeks the ventilation in the nose has definitely improved and the pus from the clotted blood has started to flow intensively. After the surgery, all control visits to the doctor. After the surgery, all the follow-up visits to Mrs. Paradowska (there were three of them) are free of charge. TO SUM UP - I RECOMMEND - MEDI CLINICUE AND DR . PARADOWSKA ARE THE BEST

I also had the opportunity to meet Dr. Wojciech Kamyk. living on ŻELAZNEJ Street with his sick lying mother, who is 87 years old, Mr. Kamyka took care of my mother and I would like to say one thing I have never met in my life such a dedicated doctor, who has his big heart in relation to the elderly. I WISH THE WHOLE HEALTH CARE SERVICE AS MANY SUCH DOCTORS AS POSSIBLE WITH THE RESPECT OF THE DAUGHTER OF ŚTANISŁAWA PALUSZEWSKA ANNA PALUSZEWSKA

Because 64% of holiday guests and 52% of business guests are not loyal to a brand or a particular hotel * . There are many reasons for this . Certainly one of them is the neglect of an attempt to build lasting relations between a guest and a hotel . What a certain premise is the result of the business segment . Where we have a higher percentage of loyal guests . However, one can think that this loyalty does not result from the relations created (although of course it can) but is based on a fleeting attachment based on a favorable, negotiated corporate price. The space of lasting business relations is still to be developed in the hospitality industry. This is confirmed by another statistic. 39% of potential guests prefer to sleep in a hotel that "knows them" as opposed to 21% of guests who choose a hotel that is alien to them, in the sense that they have no in-depth information about them. As we can see, the personalisation of services is already rather a current trend.

When confirming a reservation, when writing about the advance payment, it should be noted that its subsequent fate will be in accordance with the terms and conditions of the cancellation and cite them. For example: "Cancellations : - If the client cancels the stay between 14 and 7 days before the planned arrival, the hotel will deduct 50% of the advance payment from the advance payment; - If the client cancels the stay less than 7 days before the planned arrival, the advance payment will be forfeited in full to the client (the type and name of the accommodation unit must be entered here). "Such records clearly specify when and on what terms you will retain the advance payment. Of course, the dates and percentages can and should be adjusted to the individual circumstances of a particular facility. We are only allergic to uncritical extensions of deadlines. It is worth to get to know those that offer competitive facilities in the area or region.

The hotel has a variety of attractions to offer for the elderly and the youngest. The swimming pool with paddling pool, slides, monkey grove, children's entertainers, board games, table football. I advise against it. First of all, an unpleasant midwife who registers a visit. She also wanted me to be referred to a routine ultrasound - many diseases can be discovered only through this examination. She said no, because there are no indications. The older building has a simulation room for practicing nursing and obstetric skills, as well as resuscitation, laboratory teaching of surgical skills and rooms for practical exams in clinical subjects. In the new building there are high fidelity simulation rooms, including a hospital emergency ward, intensive care, operating theatre and delivery room. There will also be an ambulance simulator used for rescue exercises. The opening of the simulation centre will allow for modern education of students from the faculties which are part of the Collegium Medicum. Before their first contact with a real patient, they will be able to practice all medical activities on phantoms and simulators, reproducing situations and conditions similar to real ones. As the Vice-Rector of Medicine said . As the vice-rector of the Collegium Medicum prof . Wojciech Maksymowicz , the simulation centre is still in its start-up period, but classes with students are already being conducted there.

Clean rooms, cleaned daily. Good location . On the balcony we could use a chair and a tiny dryer to dry our swimsuits (the bathroom had been drying for centuries). The food is okay, but after a few days, monotony creeps in. Breakfast is the same every day. For lunch every day chicken dishes in different versions, (apart from chicken there were also other dishes, but nothing surprising). I personally missed the fish. For lunch there was no drink (being in hotels in different countries, not buying all inclusive option was always free water! ) Internet does not work well, the range was only in certain places in the room. The service is nice and helpful. For renting new bikes, the possibility of using the tennis court - equipment at the reception. In my opinion, the hotel requires refreshment from outside (especially balconies).

The doctor is a very nice person. She was answering the questions she was asking. She talked to the person she was visiting, that is my daughter. She explained what the problem was. I got the doctor by order of a colleague. I've been his patient for over 2 years and she wouldn't trade me for any other doctor even though the prices of visits aren't the cheapest. This is the first time I've encountered such an unprofessional approach to a patient. Without a closer look at my foot, without light, magnifying glass or anything - the Doctor asked questions of the figure "And here was something or wasn't there because I can't see" . I was with this doctor on one visit, looking for expert advice after the first bad diagnosis of another doctor for me. The Doctor was very effeminate and smiling, but he spent 80% of his visit promoting his person and his own competence, highlighting the fame he has worked with in England, who he knows, who he studied with, etc. He criticized the methods of treatment and diagnosis adopted by my former gin. He himself did an ultrasound (during the visit) on much worse equipment, which was not very visible in comparison to the previous pictures. He made a wrong interpretation of the changes on the ultrasound (this was not confirmed later by further examinations and treatment), he saw pathology where it was natural physiology. At the end of the visit he was shown his previous ultrasound and immediately changed his mind, stopped criticizing and agreed with the opinion of the previous doctor. The fact that he was strongly striving for my well-being, but he clearly wanted a good posting on the forum, which he himself emphasized and what he boasted about. On the plus side: he recommended that I continue to be contacted and treated by two outstanding specialists in the area that concerned me. These were very valuable and useful contacts, for which I am grateful to the doctor. Unfortunately, he is not a reliable doctor for me.

I've been using it ever since it came out on the market and it would give me the same advantages for this vacation. I stayed at the hotel for one day. He took advantage of the apartment, which turned out to be very spacious and well decorated. Two bathrooms, two bedrooms, a wardrobe, everything on a high level. It is probably worth working on these minibars. Generally speaking, we will surely take advantage of the offer one day. I sincerely recommend!

A colleague who before his departure got sick children and came in 3 people instead of the declared 5 - for which he paid 50% - was ordered to pay 100% for 4 people even though he had a free cancellation option. No praise from superiors10 . Lack of care by superiors11 . Lack of commitment of all employees equally12 . Lack of motivation to work - not always financial13 . No physical protection14 . Lack of optimal working conditions. Each hotel has different chances and different barriers - which, as seen through the eyes of the employees - affect their work, well-being, productivity, quality. They also have an impact on staff turnover at the hotel. And in your hotel? Even if the issues overlap with the lists above, the order of the lists may be completely different, which means that they are important for the staff members. It is worthwhile to conduct such a survey at your hotel, keeping an eye on the methodology - to get to know the opportunities and barriers in the hotel as seen through the eyes of those who build the hotel's position on the market with their daily work.

He may be a good specialist, I don't question the fact that he has certainly helped many people, but I remember my contact with him as very unpleasant, even traumatic. I have a rather unusual health problem, which many specialists have unfortunately died of. Mr. Arthur also failed to find a solution. All right, it happens. In the course of this ineffective therapy, however, Mr. Arthur claimed that he knows exactly what is wrong with me. That I have a problem that I should go to a psychologist. He was afraid of the very negative consequences of a possible surgical operation. He reacted with anger (or at least I was so affected by his reactions) when she reported a lot of pain in his treatments, which did not bring any improvement (even worse was after a few sessions). After all, the therapy "must sometimes hurt". From the last visit came out m with crying . Many of his tips were certainly valuable, psychological therapy is also not a bad idea (although I do not know if the key to my illness), but the way of contact with me was very unpleasant for me, and scaring the consequences of the development of the disease completely unnecessary. Especially since she read a lot later about the disease, which she "diagnosed" me with, and these descriptions were very little in line with what I was experiencing. No physician also confirmed these hypotheses. It's a pity that Mr. Arthur focused on the drawing-up of my symptoms and their causes and this in a way that goes beyond his competence, instead of honestly informing me that he simply can't help me.

The IChM is characterized by a high mortality rate - one in five people die from it. One third of the patients who have undergone it suffer permanent consequences such as: significant hearing impairment or deafness, amputations of squares or entire limbs as a result of tissue necrosis, in the future these may be intellectual disorders, attention deficit or learning problems, as well as seizures, hydrocephalus or damage to various organs. Experts have pointed out that in the case of sepsis it is very important to quickly diagnose and administer antibiotics - preferably within the first hour after the diagnosis is made. "Each subsequent hour of delay in the administration of antibiotics in the case of sepsis increases mortality by 8%. " - emphasized prof . Kuebler .

Unfortunately, I regret to say that I am dissatisfied with the visit to the doctor's. She signed up for a private visit, following her opinions after doing two pregnancy tests with results indicating pregnancy. I have never been pregnant before and she informed me about it. The doctor took an ultrasound of me and said that I couldn't see the pregnancy and couldn't tell her, after which she told me to come in two weeks. She informed me that I couldn't stand such a long time in ignorance and asked me if there were other ways to confirm it faster, and then she asked me: "Why do you want to know that? Do you want to tell someone about it? " I was surprised, because it is rather important information. She replied that I want to know if I have to take care of myself twice (it is probably obvious). The doctor said that the tests are often mistaken (she did two tests of different companies, so it is strange that both of them are mistaken). She got me a referral for a beta hcg blood test. The doctor informed me that if it is elevated it indicates a pregnancy, but that you should not yet be happy because it could be an ectopic pregnancy. You don't know where the pregnancy is and what it is. She was scared and shocked and came out of the office. The doctor stressed me very much and scared me. Worried about the ectopic pregnancy, she couldn't sleep at night, she cried. The next day she went to another doctor and only there she heard that she shouldn't worry because in such an early pregnancy (about 4 weeks), it is normal that you can't see anything on the ultrasound and that there is nothing that could indicate an ectopic pregnancy so early! and that there is no reason to think about it! I think that the doctor wrongly and unjustifiably scared me, instead of realizing in which week the pregnancy should already be visible and possibly if it wasn't visible you could mention the ectopic pregnancy at all. In addition, she didn't get any recommendations for nutrition, lifestyle or supplementation. No gynaecological examination during the visit, no question about the current cytology. The doctor seems to have probably stated that I am not pregnant, which did not work out. After the visit she felt terrible and felt much more insecure and afraid than before the visit . I do not recommend it.

Greetings! Dr Witwiski performed two nasal surgeries, the first one was the correction of cartilage in 2012 and the full correction in 2016. The effect was unfortunately very unsatisfactory both after the first and second surgery. After the first surgery the nose was a bit shorter in truth, but after the wounds healed it took on a strange shape, there appeared thickening, the tip of the nose fell down, the nose just disfigured the face. After consultation with the doctor, I decided to have a second operation, this time a full correction. Currently, the nose has a slightly better shape, no less, however, it is far from looking bad. The bone is on the one hand unevenly sawn (the doctor's attention was drawn to it during the check-up visit - she heard that it is probably still the wound after the surgery and should heal). The unevenness has remained until today. To sum up, yes, the nose looks a bit better than before the surgery, however, after two treatments she expected a much better effect. Personally, I cannot recommend it !

"It is important to realize that we have as many as 18 such subtypes, with only eight in human pathology. But these eight are characterized by such variability that no one is able to predict whether even in the following year or years there will not be a new mutation, which will not undergo rapid prophylaxis with a vaccine" - emphasized prof . Górski . As he pointed out, the aggressiveness of this disease is very serious, and the increasing mobility of societies makes its occurrence much longer. Once the flu used to come to Poland at the end of February and lasted more or less until mid-April, and now influenza cases are recorded from early autumn until very late spring.
