Roofed patio with an area of 1,2 thousand square meters is ideal for parties or feasts with barbecue. National Tourist Cooperative Gromada was founded in 1937. Operating for 75 years, it has become one of the oldest Polish tourist brands. Gromada is the third largest hotel chain in Poland. It has 15 hotels in the country, 1 own hotel in Berlin, 1 licence in South Africa, 3 resorts in the country - total approx. 1, 8 thousand rooms . It also operates as a travel agency in the field of outbound and inbound tourism through 14 regional tourist offices in the country and 1 abroad, 11 licence offices and 300 active agents. In 1Q . 2011 r . The group recorded PLN 19 million in revenue and less than one million in profit, which means an increase of 13 and 29% respectively in relation to the first quarter of 2011. 2011 r . . The Group, which is the third largest hotel chain in Poland, plans to end this year with revenue of PLN 128 million and a profit of 38 million gross. Source: OST Gromada Photos: Hotel Gromada Dom Chłopa from outside and four-star rooms .

A large hotel ideal for a weekend outing. Nice, large rooms, many attractions for children - aquapark, bowling, stud farm. Nice swimming pools outside the hotel. Very nice patio. I got 'em after reading positive opinions about her. Unfortunately, he was very disappointed in 'em. The details . . . Well, it would be a good idea to cover up your earning attitude towards patients a little bit. Another issue is the level of Doctor's knowledge. Evidently, Eve does not take such a fact into account. Although she is objectionable (contrary to all the other neurologists who have been with 'em!), she gives her opinions very quickly and freely. Perhaps, a very light and quick way of approaching the patient is enough to analyze simple diseases. He wanted me to make it my case. For those who need really specialist advice - I advise against it!

The hotel is located on the third floor of a tenement house at 43 Giovanni Bettolo Street. In fact, the hotel is an apartment divided into several rooms for rent. The hotel is not far from the Vatican and the Olympic Stadium. There is a grocery store, a restaurant and a fast pizzeria in the neighbourhood. The room was very small and dark, from what I noticed, the rooms from the main street are much brighter. The equipment: wardrobe (small but sufficient for a short stay), TV (several channels, did not watch 'em so I do not know exactly what), lamp, 2 bedside tables. . . modest but OK . Bathroom also in size did not knock on your knees - long but narrow. Tall people will have little room to take advantage of it. Towels of very poor quality . There is no option with food, but vending machines with coffee, tea, mineral water are available in the hall - no extra charge. People working there are very friendly and nice. The ratio of quality to price - very good.

A great hostel with a great owner! The rooms are very nice, the bathrooms are small but clean, the breakfast is tasty but the best is the roof terrace where you can drink wine and discuss with other hotel guests until late at night. The location is good if you are going to explore the city because the beach is 30 minutes away on foot or 10 minutes by bus (the stop is next to the hotel). I recommend it !

Dr. Drzewicki led my pregnancy, which ended in a caesarean section because she had a buttock position. He set the day of birth for me almost 2 weeks before the planned date of delivery. He said it didn't matter much, and besides, he was leaving for a few weeks, so she had to decide. The birth took place without any problems, my son was also fine. She was very happy until the day she found out I had endomeriosis caused by too early delivery. Now I have to go to the surgery and remove the hematoma from the scar, but by the time I get to the menopause I have to reckon with the fact that it may come back, not to mention that I may not have any more children. Girls be careful with the caesars, don't get cut too early and for any reason.

The visit was timely, the doctor was nice, but he listened to me as it turned out later. . . . . .he made a bad diagnosis! In my case, the problem was an itchy rash that appeared on the forearms, legs and cleavage. The doctor after seeing it was scabies - he did not check it under the microscope, but he said with such conviction that she believed him m . He wrote out medicines for me and my partner - because he claimed that he probably got infected from me. The diagnosis was so shocking that the next day before the application of the drugs (which she bought m anyway - they were not cheap) she went to see my family doctor, who stated with conviction that it is certainly not scabies! ! The next step was to go to another dermatologist, who also confirmed with conviction that it is not scabies. . . urticaria . She got ointment for urticaria, changed her cosmetics for children and after a few days the problem disappeared. I will also add that my partner did not have any skin problems despite the fact that we were together and used the same bedding - this only confirms that the diagnosis of Dr. Ludew was wrong. I am very sorry because I was exposed to unnecessary stress, buying unnecessary medicines and wasting time.

Unfortunately, I can't agree with all the positive reviews. DogWonderful.com is a website launched yesterday that allows you to book pet-friendly hotels. In addition to the possibility of booking a hotel suitable for the dog (we have checked the dogs, works, there are also hotels in Poland), the site contains a lot of information, articles about the four-legged and entertainment elements. Unlike most websites that only contain links to pet-friendly hotels, DogWonderful.com allows you to take the next step, whether you are booking a room, airline tickets or car rental. The creator of the site, American Teresa Matsui Sanders, also made sure that 10% of the commission on booking fees made through the site, goes to two charities that prepare dogs for the needy and disabled.

A doctor may have experience, may have knowledge but does not respect his patients. For a private visit she arrives late, examines 10 minutes. The same with regard to the National Health Fund, she once waited 4 hours in the hospital for medical advice (interpretation of results). In addition, the doctor served me in 5 minutes. In addition, she prescribed me tablets which were supposed to improve the results of too high sugar after the curve. The pills turned out to be wrong and it was good that she didn't take them because my sugar was normal and she would only do me some harm, she could even die. Too little sugar could have led to unconsciousness and an accident. In addition, instead of treating a lack of menstruation and too high a prolactin, the doctor focuses on sugar, which, as it turned out, had nothing to do with lack of period. I do not recommend it! I won't go again!

Due to a charming place and a beautiful Wedding Hall, we decided to organize a wedding in Sobienie. Unfortunately, 3 months before the wedding, we accidentally found out that our dream room had burned down. The director made every effort to prevent this information from reaching us. He then assured us that the room would be rebuilt for our reception in August. The director's assurances can be put between the fairy tales. The promised "financial compensation" we have not received until today because, according to the director's superior, "we do not practice this kind of compensation in our hotel. The reception took place in a tent, a pardon in the "Tent Room" . It was too dark, after entering the tent, fruit flies flew over the tables, the bottom layer of the cake was made of Styrofoam, about which we did not know. The director washed away about. 3, and the waiters had a full range of things to do. Nothing (except potatoes) was left to eat. . . For the price of 200 PLN / person you can expect the tables to be set, but in this case we were ashamed that it is so poor. We did not save ourselves on anything, but the hotel saved us and above all our guests. Do not believe the director's assurances, he promises everyone, everything and then he will do nothing and run away. To the worst enemy I do not recommend organizing a wedding on Saturdays, because " . . . . .no day will happen again, there are no two similar nights. . . "

Approximately 60% of dry legume seeds are carbohydrates and approximately 2% are fat. The exception is soya, where the fat content exceeds 20% . As much as 70% of fat are unsaturated fatty acids such as linoleic, linolenic and oily. At the same time, legumes do not contain cholesterol. "Leguminous plants contain the most protein of all crops. It constitutes from 17 to even 40% of their dry matter. Soya and lentils are the most protein-rich plants, followed by peas and beans. For this reason they should necessarily be included in the diet of vegans and vegetarians", says Dr. hab . Ewelina Hallmann from the Warsaw University of Life Sciences.

Spanish hotel chain Paradores is synonymous with luxury. Here you pay from 100 euros upwards for a room, and in your hotel, which is the showcase of the group and is located right next to the famous Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela - even 280 - 400 euros. Despite the crisis, Paradores are doing well. What is your philosophy? What we do here, we do in other hotels belonging to the chain. As you know, our chain has 83 years of history. It was founded in 1928. It was founded with three objectives: to restore the historical heritage of Spain to its former glory - castles, palaces and monasteries by transforming them into hotels; secondly, to give a boost to the national economy through the development of tourism; and to revitalise lesser known or even unknown regions and places.

"The optimal temperature for our body is 20-24 degrees Celsius" - Andrzej Kędziorski, PhD from the Faculty of Biology and Environmental Protection of the University of Silesia, told PAP. How does the body cope with getting rid of excessive heat? "Our body has no other possibilities to give away heat than through evaporation. That is why you have to drink a lot of fluids" - said the scientist. In his opinion mineral water is the best; it can be slightly salted. On the other hand, the food should be easily digestible. It is best if there are a lot of vegetables and fruits on the menu. On hot days you should avoid alcohol. "Drinking alcohol during hot weather is very dangerous and can lead to serious health consequences, and even death" - specialists from the Regional Rescue Station in Warsaw warn. That is why beer consumption - often advertised as a refreshing drink - is not a good idea during hot days.

The trip to the wreck bay did not manage to get off the shore but it depends on the weather conditions, be careful here with children because people vomited and all were soaked because the water was blowing inside. I hope you will find the tips useful, we and the family were very happy with the stay and I can recommend this hotel for families.

Dr. Hadacz has been able to reach me through this portal. Already on her first visit the doctor captured me with her care, forbearance and patience with which she explained everything that happened to me. In general, on that first day she left me with a referral to the Polish Mother's Memorial Hospital, because she started to bleed and miscarried my first pregnancy. Even though she wasn't a patient of mine so far, Mrs. Dr. took care of me both in the ward and then when she left the ward. No wonder that the next pregnancy was led by Dr. Hadacz. It was thanks to her that I quickly found out that I had pregnancy cholestasis. Fortunately, the disease quickly detected and then constantly monitored did not harm our baby. I must add here that Dr. Hadacz was irreplaceable during those 9 months. She was always able to call her and ask her about things that I had doubts about, especially when it turned out that the results just received were far above normal. Besides, she has a great sense of humor and she and her husband were always in a good mood. At the end of the pregnancy cholestasis was particularly bad and I was admitted to the hospital, of course, to the Polish Mother's Memorial Hospital. On October 2, 2017, thanks to Mrs. Dr. who made the cut herself, our beautiful and healthy daughter Kasia was born (and there were concerns about whether everything is okay because of the cholestasis). I must also add that despite the workload, the next day after the birth, Mrs. Dr. visited me and my daughter in the ward and interested in what is with us, which was a very nice gesture. As for the cut, I must also add that thanks to the presence of Mrs. Dr. during the CC she felt safe because she knew I was in good hands ☺ . All of this made me recommend Dr. Hadacz to everyone with a clear heart because on the one hand he is a very good specialist and on the other hand he is a wonderful and kind man. Marlena

"Thrombotic-embolic complications are the pathogenic basis in patients with deep vein thrombosis and consequently pulmonary embolism. In patients with atrial fibrillation, thrombi formation occurs in the atrial ear. They are very similar in structure - the essential element of such a thrombus is fibrin. Antithrombotic treatment consists in inhibiting the formation of this fibrin. Both the structure of the thrombus and the method of therapy - antithrombotic treatment integrates these two different entities: venous thromboembolism and atrial fibrillation" - explains Prof. Tomkowski . The life-threatening effect of atrial fibrillation is ischemic stroke, which in Poland affects an average of 65 - 70 thousand people annually. It is the third most common cause of death and at the same time the most common cause of disability in adults. Even 53% of survivors become partially or completely dependent on others.

Dr hab . Małgorzata Dorobek from the Institute of Medicine assessed that the current methods of stroke treatment are imperfect and insufficient. Thrombolysis (i.e. pharmacological dissolution of the thrombus that blocked the blood supply artery to the brain) or thrombectomy (i.e. mechanical removal of the thrombus from the cerebral artery) can be applied to approx. The thrombectomy (i.e. the mechanical removal of a thrombectomy from the cerebral artery) can be used up to approx. 4, 5 and up to 6 hours after the stroke. "Therefore, the percentage of patients who can benefit from this treatment is small", the researcher noted. According to her, the hope for patients after a stroke may be regenerative medicine, which offers therapies to stimulate tissue and cell repair. It gives a chance to increase the percentage of patients who will benefit from stroke treatment. Currently, scientists associate high hopes with so-called mesenchymal stem cells (it can be obtained from adult tissues, including bone marrow, but also from tissues such as the placenta and even umbilical cord blood).

The modernization of public space in the Novotel Gdańsk Marina Hotel has been completed. The lobby, reception and bar have gained a modern character in line with the current requirements of the Novotel brand and trends in interior design. According to them, the lobby is "the heart of the hotel", where guests can hold business and informal meetings, have a free meal, work on a laptop or read a newspaper. The renewed lobby gives a sense of cosiness thanks to the combination of orange and azure colours. The lighting of the walls and the ceiling has also been taken care of. A distinguishing feature, as well as an interesting element of the whole decoration are bookcases placed in the central place, forming a mini library.

As far as the procedure itself is concerned, it was not a pleasant one and the scar is bigger than the one I thought it would be (of course, after consultation with the Doctor), but in this respect I have nothing to reproach the Doctor, the wound has healed and there were no complications. As for the approach to the patient, well . . . . It makes no sense to set a price range for the treatment, especially if the amount of money from the upper limit is immediately dictated during the visit. Moreover, for each change of the dressing I had to pay additionally - 140 PLN / change (there were several changes), even though the change itself lasted maybe 1 minute and after reaching home the dressing simply fell off. It was all the more strange to me that when I was doing various treatments that I had to do in other surgeries, the change of dressing is simply included in the price of the treatment, and this one at the doctor's, I stress again, was not low. The sympathetic approach of the doctor to the patient is also different, I just did not experience any sympathy. And the last issue, I was supposed to appear at the follow-up visit (also paid), she called me to ask if there are already results of the histopathological examination. It turned out that they were not there. Therefore, she asked me to postpone the visit to the date when the results are already there - she wanted to save her time and she did not want me to pay double the cost of the visit. After 20 minutes, she answered my phone and it turned out that the results, however, are, it was a little strange to me, but she did not go into this issue anymore. The visit itself lasted maybe 2 minutes, it did not take place in the doctor's office, but standing up! in the room where the dressing was changed.

The room may not have been bad and not even so terrible, but the food was nasty, the bread was not once fresh spoiled toaster, coffee and tea in jugs already made, sometimes spoiled milk they gave, vegetables and fruit unfortunately almost shaved, the staff may be, although the cooks very unpleasant, I do not recommend this hotel.

Dietician and doctor Anna Senderska said that the average person needs ok . 500 mg of omega - 3 a day to meet the need for these compounds. This means that we should eat about half a kilo of fish per week. However, people with chronic diseases - cardiovascular or neurodegenerative diseases - should provide themselves up to 2 grams of omega-3 every day. "This would require a significant change in the dietary behaviour of Poles and an increase in the consumption of oily sea fish. However, as this may be unrealistic in European recommendations, dietary supplements with these fatty acids are allowed - said Professor Mamcarz . As he pointed out, many doctors are sceptical about this because research has shown that there are no health benefits from taking vitamin preparations.

The product is completely useless. Practical range - several meters. Any walls along the way practically block communication . When she called me to find out the price for me and my 5 year old daughter, I was informed that you can use the mini spa and sauna in the resort. The prices seemed pretty high to me but there was to be a room for children and bowling so she agreed. Unfortunately, it so happened that the day she came to the resort she fell ill and had a fairly high fever. She came down to dinner with the child and asked me if, as an exception, it would be possible to bring the child's dinner to the room because I have a high fever and she wanted me to go to bed. The waitress said that they do not do such things. . . . .but at the end of lunch she came up to say that if there wasn't much traffic, she could bring something for the little one. . . After two days, the fever had passed and she wanted to take advantage of the "attractions" of the resort. She decided that I would go with the baby to the spa. Unfortunately, the inscription on the entrance clearly indicated that only adults can use it. In that case I couldn't do it because I didn't have anything to do with 5 years old. The lady who informed me on the phone knew that I was with a small child (even if the price for a child up to 10 years old is different) so I do not know why she informed me about the possibilities of using places where it is forbidden to enter with a child - because what would she have to do with a 5-year-old boy - leave him alone in the room? ? ) . There was also an option to leave the child in the playroom. . but it was closed because they exchanged something so you could not use it. So she went to play bowling. . . .and bad luck here. Some lady threw a bullet in such a way that the system hung up and it was impossible to play. We went back to the room. My daughter got sick the other day - she got a very high fever at night so she decided to go home. When paying the dues I was counted 50% for the days when I wasn't there (when she arrived she told me that I would stay until Sunday and on Wednesday I was leaving because of my daughter's illness). So for a few days she had to pay me even though I was not physically there. Because it is so in the regulations (which, of course, nobody showed me, supposedly hanging by the entrance). I also make no secret that it upset me. Because if the hotel did not fulfill that the spa, bowling or a room for a toddler, somehow they did not lower the price of the room but they counted for the days when I was not there. I DO NOT RECOMMEND IT! ! Because I think it is a fraud!

Course : Engineering Geodesy I and II Simply a holy man . If every lecturer was like that. . . The lectures are conducted in a very interesting way. The accommodation was ordered by phone. After quite critical opinions, he didn't expect me to be even worse. At the entrance the owner blocked 500 PLN on the card . And this vacation decided to go with my husband and my children to Kos Island. After persuading my friends, we chose the summer palace hotel. Beautiful view from the room, delicious food. 10 years ago, the visit to your doctor lasted a minute. He asked me to chisel my teeth and then prescribe me a medicine that is given to women with nipple cancer. The visit was 150 PLN, the medicine that went to the basket of 340 PLN. No research, no interview, no questions. The reason for my bad mood turned out to be the beginning of depression. Thyroid hormones in perfect order. Sounds unlikely even for me.

I STRONGLY RECOMMEND ! I came to Luke after a car accident with a twisted cervical section of the spine. At first I could barely turn my head to the left, after a few treatments the pain stopped and if it wasn't for the memory, I probably wouldn't have known anything about the accident: ) At any time he has time to talk, intervenes quickly and is willing to help. During one spinal surgery I complained about the pain in my groin, Luke immediately took care of it. He can diagnose the problem well, if I had listened to him, he would have saved me 400 PLN which I spent on unnecessary MRI. It turned out that the adductor muscle ruptured (and not as the doctor suspected - a hernia), and the help offered by Luke in the form of manual and physiotherapeutic treatments brought the effect after a week. In short, he got himself a doctor for the future and I also recommend him to you if you ever have a problem with your spine or muscles.

It's a mess. A nightmarish hotel that was the biggest disappointment of the holiday. The photos on the hotel's website are a lie. Tiles fall off at the pool, and its location (surrounded from 3 sides by the walls of the hotel) makes the sun reach there around noon, and the pool area quickly enters the "shadow trail". The pool bar is cleaned probably once a season. Snacks in this bar offered in all-inclusive option smells at least troublesome, alcohols of poor quality and dubious provenance. Animations and the hotel bar are a misunderstanding. The hotel itself is located in the "less representative" part of town. The only plus 15 minutes on foot to the beach. The food was the biggest failure. - No local delicacies - French fries and old rice, weird sauces and stews, fatty, heavy, unhealthy - Canned fruit and fruit salads! - Watermelons cut with a knife from onion ! - Old, black bananas - Juices from boxes of bad quality - Cola and alcohols for meals (wine, beer, sangria) diluted! - Noisy service, not particularly nice. Room and bathroom - large, but the years of splendor are long gone. The furniture is old, dirty, worn out. - Internet, swimming pool towels - additionally paid - early check out - in the case of all-day trips there is no dry take-out lunch - a small shower in a bathtub so constructed that the bathroom is flooded with water - the staff pretends to clean up to top it all, on the day of departure, in the bathroom at the reception desk we found a dead cockroach!

Beautiful view of the Tatra Mountains, I recommend taking a photo. God forbid to enter the restaurant. We had a family dinner at the bar empty, we waited 2 hours for the order. What came was not suitable for eating. Everything was either burnt or dry. The hit was when the waitress served trout claiming it was a sturgeon. Never in my life will my leg be there again.

Hello everyone , We visited the hotel with an idea for a romantic weekend for two. We have very mixed feelings about the visit. I also recommend it, a great nice guy. the classes are interesting and I'll probably sign up for them one day.]

"We want the Polish medical biotechnology sector to be one of the strongest in Europe in 10 years' time," said Łukasz Szumowski, Deputy Minister of Science and Higher Education. - We need this sector because it is one of the fastest growing areas of scientific research today. In many countries it is also an increasingly important area of the economy, as biotechnology is entering into various areas. In order to be able to think about designing Polish medicines at all, we need to have very good basic research, also in the area of cellular biology" - he stressed . The Institute of Medical Biotechnology (IB - Med), whose concept was presented at the end of December by Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki and Deputy Prime Minister, Minister of Science and Higher Education Jarosław Gowin, is to support Polish scientists in conducting this research. According to their announcement, the new institution will invest half a billion zlotys in research conducted in Poland on the creation of new drug molecules.

A nice place for a quiet stay without any fountains, you need to get lazy this is just such a place, a little out of the way but if you take care of the pleasures for yourself then you can really rest, clear your head and go back to normal duties. If you like to swim and lazy up on the beach then this is what you will find! The water is great, the beach is so nice and pleasant. You go very well. Rooms without revelation but enough to sleep well.

"The data published in the world show that the problem of anaphylaxis is growing. In the last 10-15 years the number of its cases has increased 5 - cio and even 7 - times," said Dr. Raciborski . European data indicate that one in 300 people has experienced or will experience anaphylactic shock in the past. According to the data presented in the latest report, which was created using the registers of the National Health Fund (NFZ), the number of people who received medical services due to anaphylactic reaction has also increased in Poland in the last few years. In 2015, for example, the number of patients after a foodborne anaphylactic shock was almost three times higher than in 2008.

Small rooms, but beds ( bunk beds ) comfortable - you can sleep : - ) The ideal place to sleep after tasting the city attractions. Bathroom is clean and quite spacious. The staff (hotel reception) is very nice and friendly. Quiet, quiet, great location on the island - a few, several minutes walk to the market square and other interesting places. The hotel paid car park (39 zł / day) can be let go for free parking spaces in front of the entrance (if there is space). I recommend.

Hopeless guitar. The performance is tragic and the price is very high. We mainly pay for the Ibanez logo itself. The moving bridge is very poor quality. When you push the guitar in, it immediately gets unstable. The pickups are coupled on the amplifier. The sound quality calls for vengeance to heaven. No matter if we want to play punk, rock or metal - every time the sounds are very artificial and flat. For such a price we will buy a much better guitar from another company, but for this better made. A dry guitar doesn't sound like it has a hole in the box at all. I advise against buying such equipment even for beginners.

"This requires working together with research institutes, big industry and finding innovative ideas that arise during research and then incorporating them into European projects. We have started to work intensively with global companies to use research to create innovative products for an ageing society. Innovation can be about creating new medicines or medical procedures, but also about making health care more efficient through new organisational systems or social innovation " - added Prof . Woźniak . The Vice-Rector informed that next week in Brussels she will receive a certificate of the European Commission granting the university the EIT reference centre title. The Medical University of Łódź will be the first university in Poland to obtain such a certificate. Thanks to them it will be able to cooperate with 74 EIT centres in Europe.

ATTENTION, WE'RE FEEDING ! ! ! I do not deny the doctor professionalism, but he has zero knowledge of lactation. Here are excerpts from our conversations: The doctor writes down my medication I: what about feeding? L: He advises me to pump and boil the food, out of curiosity: How is this supposed to help? L : Because it kills everything that is bad, you will kill the drugs that get into the milk, after all the cow also drinks boiled food. I : And antibodies ? And digestive enzymes ? L: What antibodies? Antibodies are produced by everyone in the body, not from milk ( ! ) J: Maybe I can advise the lactation advisor and decide if I will buy a prescription. L : What is a "lactation advisor"? you've never heard 'em, is that what the fb says? ( malicious giggle here ) . You better not listen to the kind of people who advise by the fb. I don't know how cooking kills ( pif - paf ) drugs. But from the Lactation Lexicon of Medicines, they belong to L2 groups. The proctologist is good, but the visit has to be supplemented by your own blindness in the Lexicon or a visit to a lactation advisor.

She bought me a holiday stay in your hotel from 23 . 12 - 26 . 12 . 2016r . for 3 adults and two cats . She made a reservation in October 2016 and made a prepayment of 50% of the costs . The reservation was confirmed by phone on 19 . 12 . 2016r . The offer you presented on the Hotel portal for the holiday period encouraged you to use it . It was cheap, you could take the animals from the beautiful surroundings. However, the reality turned out to be completely different. Already at the time of arrival I met an unpleasant situation, a crowd of screaming people at the reception desk demanding allocation of rooms. I was also qualified to this group because there was no room for me either. The reception staff was completely unprepared to serve guests. There was no orientation on the number of available rooms and the condition of their equipment, living conditions. The resignation of people from staying in the hotel for Christmas caused that we managed to get a room. The room was quite neat and tidy, warm, I was only surprised by the flies in the lampshades, dirty curtains and drapes sticking out of the dirt, dirty walls, an unfit bathroom anyway, because there was no water drain in the shower and sink and no hot water. Dust everywhere. Some old TV without a working remote control. So a nightmare. For two days of my stay, none of the staff were interested in what was going on in the room (maybe no toilet paper, throwing away the trash). Dinner on arrival was quite decent. She tried to take advantage of the attractions that were offered on the holiday offer with her family. Unfortunately: 1 . The cloakroom by the pool smelled of urine, fear of getting undressed, 2 . Dirty and cold water pool was not visible to the bottom at a depth of 1, 2m, 3 . The second pool was clean, but the cold water did not encourage to use it, 4 . Jakuzzi incomplete (used for daily washing of guests because there was hot water in it), 5 . Bowling alley - all belts were closed (not everyone could use it), 6 . Ice rink is closed, it was not frozen on the day of guests' arrival, 7 . Lack of information about the attractions on the second day of the holiday (we did not use them anyway), 8 . Lack of Internet access - no WI-FI coverage, Christmas Eve is a nightmare. Lack of information about the time of dinner and the table booked. The nightmare started at 18.00 . Lack of seats at the table, quarrels with guests dressed for Christmas, crying hungry children, there was no restaurant in the hotel on Christmas Eve. The next disappointment was the lack of full dinnerware. Some plates and cutlery, no bouillons for soup glass for drinks, in fact, were not needed because neither borscht nor compote or even water were not given to us. Christmas Eve dishes on our table are fish in jelly, vegetable salad, herring in cream. The mentioned dishes were served in skimpy bowls, but only in small bowls. Getting dumplings is a horror. The served Christmas Eve dishes were below criticism. Empty dumplings of poor quality. And so did the rest of the dishes. The hit of Christmas Eve was to serve at the end of the evening a platter with boiled potatoes ( only for what ) . The staff - young people, despite their willingness to work, were not able to organize the proper "publishing" of the dishes. They themselves were lost in the situation that arose. Lack of a person responsible for service in the Room . The hungry people went to the hotel kitchen by themselves in order to get "something" to eat. The sight of what was happening in the room, angry, confused people, crying children forced us to decide to leave the Hotel the next day. Lack of interest at the reception who is leaving the hotel and why. There was no one to talk to about complaints and booking surcharges (she did not pay me for my stay). I do not know if she was checked in at your hotel. It's criminal to treat people like that in these times. Due to the lack of any apologies from you for this situation, which will remain in my family's memory for a long time, spoiling the Christmas mood and the Christmas world itself and the humiliation and arrogance towards my family, I ask you to reimburse me for the costs incurred in paying for my stay and transport costs. Please avoid this Hotel with a wide arch! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! !

Many Lyme disease patients do not remember being stabbed by this arachnid. This is not surprising, because, as scientists from the Warsaw University of Life Sciences remind us, the disease is also carried by tick larvae and nymphs, which are so small that they are sometimes difficult to see. Experts make it difficult to see them. Experts make the arachnid, which is stuck in the skin, not to lubricate it with any fat, onion juice or anything else. To get rid of the parasite, it should be grasped right next to the skin and pulled out with a strong movement, perpendicular to the place of insertion. The tick should not be twisted out as this may cause the tick to twist and leave parts of the mouth apparatus in the body. One should also be careful not to press the abdomen on its opits - the arachnid must not be allowed to return the contents of food.

According to the specialist, this is most evident in gastric cancer, one of the most malignant cancers. The decrease in the incidence of this cancer clearly falls during a period in which some Poles have changed their diet to more beneficial for health. For example, in the years 1960-2005 the consumption of fruit increased in our country by as much as 2.5 times, and vegetables by 41%. In turn, the consumption of salt - which is one of the main risk factors for gastric cancer - fell by 26% between 1999 and 2011. As specialists reminded, salt reduces the thickness of the protective mucous membrane of the stomach - and when it is thinner, it is easier to nest Helicobacter pylori, which increases the risk of gastric cancer.

When asked about the financing of the new facility, Ortyl pointed out that in the new organisational formula the leading body will be the university. "This means that for the university, the ministry that carries out direct supervision is the ministry of science and higher education, but the ministry of health will also have a substantive influence on this. But the status of the hospital will clearly change," he said. The Marshal pointed out that after the transformation the hospital "enters the formula of financing university clinical hospitals" . "It is not just a simple contract with the National Health Fund. There are also funds for research, for special procedures. Funds for the whole process are increased up to 20% in some areas, some procedures. The hospital will also have access to the Operational Programme + Infrastructure and Environment + and not just as now to the Regional Operational Programme" - explained Ortyl .

" The questions are usually related to the disease entity and the condition of the patient in order to detect any negative symptoms early. In this way we obtain the results of measurements and a description of the patient's condition, i.e. relevant data which, when collected systematically, give rise to therapeutic decisions. In this way we are able to keep the patient in a better condition in the context of key clinical parameters," Dahle pointed out. The equipment for seniors is very simple to use; the devices are equipped with "bluetooth low energy" technology and have a small number of buttons. Within the system, the doctor does not have to be available all the time, as so-called "alerts" are emitted when certain values of examined parameters are exceeded. "This allows for a lower occupancy of specialist personnel and we are able to better manage health care" - assessed Staroń .

As much as three billion zlotys, i.e. half of all expenditure on diabetes, generate complications of the disease, of which 75% generate heart complications, 14% of strokes, 8% of kidney disease and 1% each of eye disease and diabetic rate. Between 2009 and 2012 the total cost of treatment of complications (direct and indirect) increased by approximately . 550 million . As Professor . Czupryniak, in order to stop the rate at which diabetes expenditure is growing, intensive state action is needed in the fight against obesity and social education on healthy lifestyles, as this will prevent many new cases of type 2 diabetes. "On the other hand, type 2 diabetes patients need to be sought more actively in society. By early detection of the disease, even before the occurrence of complications, appropriate treatment can be applied beforehand to prevent or delay them" - noted the diabetologist. Nowadays, still too many patients (about one third) find out that they have diabetes only when the disease is seriously complicated.

Monchigue is a tiny, sleepy little town at the "end of the world" and its charm lies in its location on a hill. And here is the hotel where we spent 2 nights. The place is quite unique and impressed me - big enough that I decided to write about it. The hotel building from the outside is modest, rather bland. The rooms are very comfortable, elegant. Several rooms including ours have beautiful large balconies overlooking almost the "jungle. This is because behind the hotel building, guests are greeted by a real jungle - an exotic, lush vegetation overgrown by the sides of the ravine, it goes up the stairs to the town. A great place. Upstairs it is climatic, as if time stopped a long time ago - a restaurant in an old tavern building from the 17th century. The food. . . ...good, wine even better. And in the morning we were woken up by singing birds living in a tangle of branches and leaves. I remember this place very well, it is worth visiting the Hotel Terma in Monchique if you are on a hike or go for a longer stay.

Speaking about the upcoming change in the health care system, the Minister emphasized that two teams are currently working in the Ministry of Health: System Changes and Basic Health Care, which are preparing statutory changes, including the liquidation of the National Health Fund. "The NFZ is an institution which provides universal health insurance, and this solution means that among Poles there are insured and uninsured, entitled and not entitled to use the universal health care system. Those who are uninsured currently live in Poland approx. 2,5 million - and this is an untenable situation. We are moving towards the introduction of the so-called "civic entitlement" - everyone who is ill and needs help should receive it. In this situation the NFZ as an institution loses its raison d'être" - he explained .

We spent a very nice week at the Kiston Hotel in September. Since it was already after the season, there were not many guests, which was even an advantage when we could freely use the hotel's attractions: massages in the spa area (I recommend back massage), saunas and, of course, a spacious swimming pool with jacuzzi, wild boar, and a shallow children's area (with a "water tongue" and a slideway, which was very much to our daughter's liking). In the swimming pool area there are generally available accessories for swimming useful especially for children (boards, children's lifeboat, hoses). The hotel is located in seclusion, in a quiet area. The area surrounding the hotel is large and is great for walks - lots of greenery, some trees, for children's 'mini zoo' with poultry and 2 horses (which for an uncooked price you can ride or order a carriage ride). Despite the bad weather, we had a very nice time and had a good rest. The Wi Fi works very well and is available without extra charges. Adult guests can count on bathrobes and soft slippers. The service is very helpful and helpful. Upon arrival, we reported a malfunction of the wardrobe and it was removed immediately. There was also no problem with postponing the departure 2 hours later than the end of the hotel day. We purchased a stay with breakfast served in the form of a Swedish table - with a sufficient choice of dan - from muesli with milk, yoghurt, wedges and bread. There was also the possibility to order scrambled eggs, omelette, pancakes and steams. In addition, hot and cold drinks. Prices of lunch dishes from the card started from 34 zloty; dishes that we tasted were tasty and elegantly served.

Prof . Rosiak explained that in their research, Łódź scientists were confronted with literature reports on the use of a simple tetrapeptide to induce angiogenesis by delivering it to the treated body area. It is a compound naturally formed in the human body, with a relatively short half-life of 5 minutes, hence its concentration in a normally functioning body is very low. This tetrapeptide has been registered as a drug and approved by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA). "However, it was injected into the tissues surrounding the wound, which made it impossible to control the area of action and had the typical effects of reaching high concentrations rapidly and disappearing as rapidly as possible, thus negating its therapeutic effect. Our original idea, worldwide, therefore boils down to trying to combine a hydrogel dressing with this tetrapeptide" - explained the scientist.

Hmm... . . .when she first came to see me at your doctor's over six months ago she was a completely different person: full of anxiety, not knowing who I really am, what I want, powerless, in total depression. The next meetings helped me to understand what it is, what I have to work on, who I really am. She is a wonderful person, full of understanding, she does not speed up anything, she does not judge anything and in this difficult time she is a point of attachment and support. And at the same time demanding, because in this fight a lot depends on us, on our self-denial and willingness to change, which is not always easy. I know that I still have a lot of work ahead of me, but I'm already on the right track and I'm getting happier. Thank you: )

Dr. Markuszewski is a specific person, I have been looking into him for 3 years, she has been walking with me regularly very often, waiting for a few hours to visit. . . to hear the same thing again. It is easy to divide them into two groups: those who have a different (usually main and supporting) business outside the hotel and entrepreneurs for whom the hotel is a dominant or sole venture. Such a distinction can be found and read about it even in the opinions of guests ( ! ) . The guest simply feels the attraction with which he is treated.

He stressed that a given simulator can be "tasked" with a sequence of specific events, including complications that may occur in real life and even those that occur rarely, and the student must react accordingly. The student's behaviour can be immediately assessed whether or not he is receiving the right treatment and intervenes in the treatment. Within the framework of the project, the staff of the Białystok University will undergo appropriate training in Poland and abroad. The project also involves mentoring . Groups of several medical students will select mentors under the direction of whom they will work. "We plan to create a database of scenarios related to various simulated patients. After the end of the project the university wants to "employ" patients who will learn to simulate specific diseases, and the students will have the task - "to correctly collect the history, properly examine this patient, make a diagnosis, propose treatment" - said Chabowski .

Prof . Krętowski noted that in the field of such research his centre is one of the pioneers. "In the last few months we have received equipment which is nowhere else in Poland" - said the Vice-Rector. Thanks to the modern equipment, scientists will be able to analyze proteins and chemicals in blood or urine which are evidence of a given disease. They will also be able to examine human genes in search of information useful in detecting and treating diseases. "First of all, we will want to find the markers of the disease at an early stage, and secondly, to choose the right treatment for the patient," said the scientist. He added that his unit wants it to be competitive with other projects in the world. "We rely on the most modern technologies, which, however, generate huge amounts of data" - said the PAP interlocutor. He explained that all parameters that can be tested in blood will be examined. "So by examining one patient we get hundreds of thousands if not millions of data. Somebody has to interpret this data. We are a medical university, but we need the support of people who can analyze such data using, for example, artificial intelligence" - said prof . Krętowski and pointed out that for this we need experienced bioinformatics or biostatisticians. That is why the Bialystok unit has already established cooperation with the Belgian Hasselt University.

It's difficult to judge someone who hasn't enough that he has refused to treat it, he took money for it without the slightest embarrassment. My mother is in very serious condition after a serious medical error which led to intestinal necrosis, stoma and further complications in the form of an abscess and an unhealing wound. The doctors who have successively taken care of my mother have confined themselves to treating her without any vision of comprehensive treatment - surgical removal of the abscess and/or reconnecting the intestines. I try to understand this somehow - not everyone was born predestined for this profession. However, after nearly a year of wandering around county hospitals, when my mother finally left the hospital for a little longer, I decided to hit em privately to - as I thought - a top-notch specialist. Nothing could be further from the truth! The professor, whose time is very limited, just took a look at the first two discharges from the hospitals (there were 8 of them together). Something even started scribbling on a piece of paper, but he quickly got bored of the job and declared that he could not deal with it! I was walled up! My shock was even greater when, at our begging requests to try to help my mother, he thanked us and informed us that we should receive 200 PLN for the visit! At the end he asked a supplementary question: are we here on someone's orders? When he heard that it was "some" friend of mine, he said that we had to deal with ourselves. So much for the visit.

This hotel unfortunately has nothing to do with 5 *, in my opinion it deserves a maximum of 2 * or 3 *. One big dirt and stink. Rooms: Sufficient in size for a family of 4 people. Meals: Meals daily the same (with minor changes) . In all bars and restaurants, drinks were served in thin disposable plastic cups, even drinks and wine. Animations: The hotel employed two animators: one was only for volleyball and the other for children. In the evening there were outdoor group shows (typical: Turkish night, stunts, live music).

In the case of an IgE-dependent allergy, an allergic march may occur, i.e. another form of allergy, such as bronchial asthma or allergic rhinitis. This is facilitated by the so-called cross reactions, when one allergen paves the way for another. They occur between different food, food and inhalation allergens (plant pollen and animal hair) and food and contact allergens (e.g. with latex). Typical cross reactions are birch - apple - nut, celery - carrot - mug - spice, banana - latex and mites - snails. "This does not mean, however, that a child with ABMK should be eliminated from the diet of beef and veal, because in time he will be allergic to them. It happens only in 10 percent of cases, which is very rare" - convinces Prof . Szajewska . Children allergic to cow's milk protein should not drink goat's milk. In this case the risk of developing an allergy to goat's milk protein reaches as much as 90% .

In 2013, recommendations on vitamin D supplementation for Central European residents, including Poland, were published . They were developed by an international team of experts chaired by Dr Płudowski. "The recommendations were developed for all age groups - from pregnant women to newborns, infants, children, adolescents, adults and seniors. We also included people from special groups at risk of vitamin D deficiency, such as obese people and those working night shifts" - explained the specialist. Thus, the experts recommend giving 400 international units (IU) to children under 6 months of age, i.e. 10 micrograms of vitamin D per day; toddlers from six months to 12 months of age should receive between 400 and 600 IU, depending on the amount of vitamin D in their diet; children and adolescents under 18 years of age should receive between 600 and 1000 IU, depending on body weight, throughout the year if adequate skin exposure to the sun is not ensured during the summer months. Adult doses have been set at 800 - 2000 IU, depending on body weight and all year round, if from April to September the proper skin synthesis is not ensured. In pregnant women, vitamin D supplementation at doses of 1500 - 2000 IU should start no later than the second trimester of pregnancy.

More ! The lease expires in 36 years. In 1999, the city of Gdynia leased for 50 years to Echo Investment SA of Kielce the property of Ejsmonda 1 Street, the so-called Polanka Redłowska . Echo undertook to build a luxury hotel with a restaurant and a water park. Although the investment was to be ready in December 2001. Although the investment was to be ready as early as December 2001, until 2006, when the company and the project were bought from Echo Investment by Dariusz Guzek, owner of, among others, the Velaves hotel in Władysławowo . According to the plans presented at that time, the hotel complex was to consist of a five-storey hotel with approx. 25 thousand square metres of usable area and approx. 300 rooms, a congress centre for 1,500 people and a water park with swimming pools, slides and saunas. The cost of the project was then estimated at approx. 60 million euro .

"Our problem is that in our research we have to combine clinical knowledge with knowledge of acoustics, psychoacoustics or sound propagation in the human body" - says Dr Nowak. He admits that it is difficult to find a common language in this. "For example, the doctor tells us that in the acoustic signal from the stethoscope it is important whether he he hears any whistling. But we have to find out what kind of whistles he is talking about and examine what characterizes these sounds", says Dr. Nowak. Dr. Nowak reminds us that today, with the help of a stethoscope examination, doctors initially detect e.g. heart murmurs of newborns. Only 40 percent of children who were referred for further examination are confirmed to have significant disorders. "I know what parents experience when they wait with their child for a cardiologist's examination. My daughter was also wrongly suspected of having a heart defect on the basis of a stethoscope," admits the acoustician. She adds that due to the imperfections of the device, the opposite situation can also happen: there are no defects in children, who should be treated further. According to Dr . Nowak's opinion is that the effectiveness of these preliminary tests could be improved by modern devices which he is developing.

By participating in the study, participants will gain knowledge about the processes taking place in the body during pregnancy. They will learn, among other things, about changes in the symmetry of their body, breast size, amount of adipose tissue, skin colour or even voice colour. The program also allows to monitor bone loss during pregnancy, which is important in the prevention of osteoporosis. Researchers ensure that such an examination will be simple and safe - women will have a heel ultrasound. In addition, women will also be tested for oxidative stress levels. Oxidative stress is an imbalance between antioxidants and free radicals formed in cells. Too high a level of stress is harmful to mother and child . The milk test, in turn, will provide information on the nutritional and energy value of food . Researchers ensure that all the studies are without influence on the course of pregnancy and are harmless to the health of mother and child. Participants are guaranteed full anonymity and all information is used exclusively for scientific purposes. The programme has received a positive opinion of the Lower Silesian Medical Chamber.

The second stage of the Warsaw Mummy Project will consist of taking samples from the mummy - however, as the researchers reserve, everything will be done without damaging the exhibits, using laparoscopy. Thanks to them, it will be possible to carry out thorough laboratory analyses, including genetic ones, using DNA tests. "We are honored to contribute to this fascinating project. Gaining knowledge about the types of cancer that occurred in antiquity, the organs that attacked and the stages of disease development can make a significant contribution to improving today's methods of preventing and combating cancer," says Andrzej Radkowski, Medical Director of Affidea Poland, which is the exclusive medical partner of the first stage of research under the Warsaw Mummy Project.

Within the group, the economic segment was growing faster than Upper & Midscale, with not only All Seasons brand, but also Ibis and Etap hotels. A detailed list is presented in the table. The All Seasons brand, which was established in September 2007, is the only non-standardised brand among hotels in the economy segment in Accor's portfolio. Other non-standardised brands include Mercure ( Midscale ), Pullman and MGallery ( Upscale ) and Sofitel ( Luxury ) . The lack of strict requirements for hotel furnishings and decoration, as well as probably favourable settlement rates between Accor and hotel owners, are the main drivers of the current dynamics of All Seasons. This is because it allows independent hotels to join a large international hotel group on a franchise basis and benefit from the advantages of the reservation system without incurring excessive costs and loss of individual character.

Celiac disease, known as visceral disease, affects one in a hundred children. As Natalia Drabińska, a PhD student from the Institute of Animal Reproduction and Food Research of the Polish Academy of Sciences in Olsztyn, explained to PAP, it is an autoimmune disease caused by the presence of gluten in food. In the patient's body gluten causes inflammation of the intestine, atrophy of the intestinal villi, which reduces the absorption surface from the intestines. The visceral disease is incurable, it accompanies the patient throughout his life, there are no medications for it, no surgery is performed, the only way to treat it is to apply a restrictive, gluten-free diet for the rest of his life, which will alleviate the effects of the disease such as chronic inflammation, absorption disorders or vitamin and mineral deficiencies. "Through the use of prebiotics we want to improve the general health of children with visceral disease" - emphasized Natalia Drabińska.

Optical methods for monitoring the brain use the fact that light can penetrate the skull bones to some extent. This is particularly true of near-infrared light with wavelengths between 650 and 850 nanometres (a nanometer is a millionth of a millimetre). The properties of the blood - specifically haemoglobin, whose oxidized form interacts with light in a different way than the reduced form - are important here. This phenomenon allows to assess the degree of oxygenation of the observed part of the body by analysing the intensity of light penetrating the tissue. The basic elements of optical diagnostic devices are small light sources (laser diodes) and sensitive photodetectors. Sources and detectors, usually 2 - 5 cm apart, are put together in pairs. The patient's head can be put into several to several such pairs at the same time, which potentially allows to examine a significant part of the brain.

Both of them come from Spain, where medical procedures related to the care of patients before and after surgery are organized in an interdisciplinary way. Another guest from abroad - prof . Renato Pasquali from Italy is one of the authorities in the field of endocrine disorders associated with obesity, especially fertility disorders and polycystic ovarian syndrome. The congress was also announced by the endocrinologist Prof. Marija Pfeifer , who has been dealing with metabolic problems and obesity in Ljubljana, Slovenia for many years.

We prefer to eat vegetables and fruits raw or cooked, but the preferences are quite varied. Women more often than men choose relatively " exotic " forms of preparing vegetables and fruits: stewing ( 31% . women and 26% . men ) , pairing ( 28% . women and 19% . men ) , baking ( 24% . women and 15% . men ) and grilling ( 24% . women and 12% . men ) . Also women ( 77% . ) more often than men ( 69% . ) eat vegetables and fruit as independent dishes, e.g. in the form of snacks . An even greater disproportion can be observed when eating vegetables and fruit as an addition to other dishes, e.g. . in the form of salad or salad . As much as 88% of women and 75% of men eat them in this way .

PAP's interlocutor tells us that in the German uDISCO method, mouse bodies are first fixed so that, among other things, the cells do not degrade. Then a mixture of chemicals removing blood, water and fats is fed into the bloodstream. However, if these elements are already removed from the body, the body must necessarily shrink. In the case of the uDISCO method it reduces its volume by up to 65%. Fortunately, however, all tissues shrink evenly without changing the proportions. "Such tissue shrinkage can be a great help for scientists - a smaller body is easier to scan under a microscope," explains Paweł Matryba. The biologist points out that the whole process of body preparation in the uDISCO method takes only four days. Meanwhile, the histological examination, which prepared subsequent tissue sections, may have lasted for months. Scientists using the uDISCO method will thus be able to study certain processes much faster.

I would like to thank dr Marcin Czternastek, dr Michał Cibor and dr Pietras anesthesiologist. On 20 May 2016 at St . Although Accor added 266 hotels with 38,085 rooms in 2012, this did not prevent it from making the biggest cut in its history, with 910 hotels and 81,000 rooms down. This is a result of the sale of the Motel / Studio 6 chain operating in North America. As at December 31, 2012, Accor's portfolio comprised 3,516 hotels with 450,487 rooms as compared to 4,426 hotels and 531,714 rooms a year earlier. Overall, the chain recorded negative growth for the first time in years, reducing the number of hotels by a fifth (20.6 percent) and the number of rooms by 15.3 percent. . Such a large decrease is mainly due to the sale of 1102 hotels with 107,347 rooms operating under the Motel 6 and Studio 6 brands (economic and economic extended - stay facilities) for USD 1.9 billion to the Real Estate Partners VII fund belonging to the Blackstone Group.

Hotel: nicely renovated, not with some craze but is neat, clean and nice. Rooms are decent, comfortable beds, quite nice bathroom. Blackstone , a private equity fund that owns, co-owns or leases hotel companies with a total of approx. 1,030,800 rooms in more than 7,220 facilities, will be extended by another 66 hotels with 7,658 rooms . Blackstone Group's partner company has just signed an agreement to purchase Apple REIT Six Inc. a hotel investment fund, for $1.2 billion. The buyer is BRE Select Hotels Corp . an affiliate of Blackstone Real Estate Partners VII, Bloomberg reports. Blackstone is buying all the accommodation facilities - both economy and luxury chains. This year alone, it bought Motel 6 chain from Accor for approx. The Motel 6 chain sold: USD 1.72 million for each hotel, USD 17.7 thousand for each hotel and USD 1.9 billion for each hotel. USD 17.7 thousand per room) The company is increasing its investment in the Hilton Worldwide network and its stake in Extended Stay America Inc. The Apple REIT Six fund, which focuses on exclusive, extended-stay and service oriented hotels, owns 66 hotels with 7,658 rooms located in 18 states.

I feel cheated by the Rainbow office. The room marked as standard in a 5-star luxury hotel turned out to be a clinic with an extra bed in the form of a field bed located just above the hotel entrance, at the public transport bus stop. And all this is reportedly in accordance with the contract. We were informed in the hotel that it is possible to exchange the room for a standard extra bed but for an extra charge of 20 EUR per day. We made a complaint accepted by the resident and ... paid us. When we returned home, we made a written complaint that was not accepted by the Rainbow office. RecommendationsWhen buying a holiday from the Rainbow office, think carefully about whether the agreement guarantees the comfort you expect by suggesting a standard hotel room.

A hotel with a particularly pleasant intimate atmosphere of its own. Situated in an original spa villa, very nice interior design, nice and professional staff makes sure that guests feel comfortable. Hello , She would like to thank me very much for a very successful stay at the Hotel Kiston . She spent a very nice time with her family in Kashubia. This inconspicuous hotel is a pleasant surprise. Inside we will be welcomed by a small reception and lobby with a small terrace ( patio ) . The location of the hotel is quite good, in the back (on the way to the Centre) there is a beautiful climatic High School which is surrounded by a million bikes, after going down we have a view of beautiful green trams. The hotel is an independent apartment, but clean and comfortable. The helpful staff, you can communicate in English. The hotel is located in a quieter district of Prague, close to a shopping and business centre, close to metro and tram stops, and you can walk to the Old Town and the Mala Strana in 20 minutes. The kitchen is fairly well equipped, but there are some dishes missing, the bedroom is fine. Interesting staircase, quiet elevator. In general, stay in Qubus hotels I judge very poorly. Why? Making reservations on booking.com I chose options with parking, which turned out to be at 23:30 when I arrived, that there is an extra charge and if I have a problem with this I can park on the streets. Earlier, there was no talk of paid parking on the site. Since 23rd you will not get any more, and the bar is closed. The bedside lamp has not worked and the door to the bathroom has not closed. Normally such things don't impress me, but for a room costing 300 pln you expect something better. I'll probably never stop there again.

A very good and caring doctor. She got to your doctor at the end of 7th month of pregnancy, with symptoms of hypothyroidism. The previous doctor ignored them. Dr. Kucharski recognized them immediately and had them examined. He led my pregnancy to the delivery. Before the delivery, he predicted complications which could have been caused by hormonal disorders caused by abnormal thyroid function. His predictions proved true. Thanks to the fact that he had referred me to the hospital earlier and that I was cared for, the doctors could make a quick decision to have a caesarean section, which saved our child's life. I highly recommend your doctor.

Another ( 6 - you ) stay in this hotel and the least successful. The room on the 8th floor with an intensive post party stench, despite the open windows. Generally, the hotel is focused on large tour groups, which is best demonstrated by the design of the renovated restaurant - but it is a matter of taste. Nice reception and nice service. Unfortunately, the enthusiasm ended after entering the bathroom. Tiles on the walls popular in the early 90s, the stench of swamp from the drains and the "smell" of chlorine after turning off the tap. The real circus began, however, when it was time to sleep. After unfolding the sofa (supposedly a 4-person room, one double bed and a fold-out double sofa) it turned out to be nothing more than the well known from the 90s - these field bed - a frame made of steel tubes and on them pillows. You don't have to go on a walking pilgrimage to Czestochowa - the desire to sleep on such a bed is a real penance. With each even the slightest movement it squeaked mercilessly, and the straightening of the legs was associated with the process of folding the bed. The real climate of Częstochowa night was given by a nightclub just below the hotel, which in combination with a leaky window turned out to be a psychiatric therapy worthy of the "Mechanical Orange". I do not recommend to people who look for accommodation with their families after a day-long sightseeing to rest for one simple reason - to sleep there is NO DA. Hotel for 2 stars. The bathrooms in the rooms are terrible . Very small and there is mold on the walls of the shower. In our room the door from the balcony was broken down and as a result there was noise and heat flew out into the room very quickly despite air conditioning. The food is not the best either. Not much choice . The bar is equipped with alcohol of very poor quality. I absolutely do not recommend this hotel.

Unfortunately, not much good can be written about this hotel. You can see that there is no good attitude towards customers here, rather it is a masquerade attitude. The prices are not low at all. This is the only hotel that does not immediately offer a room with two separate beds when booking a business room for two people - you can only express such a request, but even though it was written in the reservation at the beginning we got a room with a friend with one double bed. After the intervention at the reception desk, we were exchanged for a room that was not very different from the previous one - it was very small, and the distance between the beds was about ok. 10cm. There were no sockets at the beds - you couldn't recharge your phone with it at hand. There was also no room for suitcases or shoes - only under the bed. There was no room for cosmetics in the bathroom, not to mention the fact that there was no place to put clothes on after changing clothes and they landed on the floor where they were soaking. . . There was not even a toilet brush in the toilet. . . The restaurant had a burger, but the breakfasts didn't knock it down anymore. Despite the great location, which is undoubtedly a great advantage of this hotel, I will not return here and do not recommend it to others.

Hotel belonging to the group " to refresh / renovate " . Clean rooms, but requiring renovation. The most annoying nowadays - the lack of an outlet near the bed. Restaurant - for breakfast ok, but completely not for an evening dinner or drink - a complete lack of climate. Nice service.

This year's performance of hotels in these cities, which is worse than the average in recent years, shows this. In the case of three cities: Opole, Szczecin, Olsztyn, in the years 2007 - 2012 the potential of the hotel base decreased. This is related both to the aforementioned changes: a new smaller facility replaced the older one with a larger number of rooms, as well as to modernisations during which hotel rooms are increased at the expense of their number. E.g. in Olsztyn two 4-star hotels have arrived, while two one-star facilities have disappeared.

My husband and I went to the Stary Browar Hotel to celebrate their wedding anniversary. The hotel is beautiful, climatic and very tastefully decorated. Nice and helpful service, which does not happen so often in other hotels. Great breakfasts. Not only that tastefully it's a very big choice, so everyone will find something for themselves. We took advantage of the attraction which is a beer bath and we liked it very much. The rooms are clean and neat. Next to the hotel there is a restaurant and a company shop where you can buy beer produced in the brewery. We strongly recommend a romantic trip for two : )

"In other people, i.e. those who have not had a heart attack or stroke, or diabetes with complications or kidney disease, a 10-year risk of developing cardiovascular diseases should be assessed using SCORE tables (Systematic COronary Risk Evaluation)" - emphasized Prof . Broncel . It depends on whether someone has high total cholesterol and LDL, whether they smoke, how old they are and whether they have arterial hypertension. For example, a person who, according to the SCORE table, has a 10% risk of dying within 10 years is classified as a high risk of heart attack and stroke. Such patients should have a reduced LDL level of at least 50%. Cigarette smokers are also more likely to have a heart attack. "A 45-year-old man who is addicted to nicotine should remember that his heart is the same as that of a person in his 60s," stressed Professor Broncel .

However, in the 2000s the use of Revenue management ( RM ) in the hospitality sector did not prove as effective as expected. Today it is already Price Management (PM), which is better than revenue management because it is based on several factors and not only on the capacity of facilities. In the near future it is expected to integrate Price Management with multiple systems and a more CRM-like approach, which hotels will need even more in the future. Hotel Revenue Management has not always been a simple matter due to a huge number of factors that must be taken into account: location, seasonality and current season, number of hotels in the area, customer profile.

My stay in the hotel allowed me and my fiancée to relax perfectly. The spa and fitness area, room standard, room service and breakfast in the restaurant were on a very high level. The hotel is surrounded by forest on one side and on the other side there is a view of Jaworzyna Krynicka (the lower station of the gondola is 5 minutes walk). The fiancée had only some reservations about the service in the Institute of Cosmetics - she felt as if during the treatments she was treated a little "from above", and during the facial cosmetics treatment the diagnosis of shortcuts was carried out quite sketchily. Apart from these minor drawbacks, we remember our stay very well and we will gladly visit the hotel in the future.

A wonderful place to relax . Rooms are cozy, very tastefully decorated. Bathrooms are clean. Public kitchen and dining room well equipped - in addition to kitchen utensils you will find here coffee, tea or sugar. In the dining room there is also a children's corner with many toys and books. The villa is surrounded by a garden with barbecue areas, swimming pool and children's facilities - cottage, sandpit, bicycles, toys. There is a parking lot on the property. Quiet Corner is beautifully located, through the garden overlooking the promenade on the Soła River - a fantastic place for walks, while sitting in the garden you can listen to the sound of the river. Writing about the Quiet Corner you can not miss the owners, thanks to whom this place is so unique. We recommend it!

First of all, the quality is completely out of date, the photos on the site of the object and other portals are out of date, and maybe even not very real, as if not from this object. A room for about 250 - 300 PLN / day, remembering the times of the People's Republic of Poland, as if nothing has changed since then. Old furniture, carpet in the room is dirty but rather old. In the room itself the pros and cons are missing and the cons could be written out a lot. The bathroom is a total misunderstanding and like all the rest, it's falling apart from old age. The swimming pool is very small, where a maximum of 2 people can swim freely, if nobody uses a water whip. The saunas are but so what if we were dining for 3 days, of which only once on Sundays in the afternoon were turned on, on Saturday the steam bath did not work the same way on Sundays to about 17. It would still have to be written that the spa area is only open from hours after noon probably from 17 - 21 all week long and on weekends all day long with a break of 1 - 2 h, and nowhere did I find such information. The hotel's reception desk has been notified of the fact that the offer we bought differs significantly from the one we found, and has received information that this is not the first such complaint and that if we want we can move elsewhere. And if it wasn't for the fact that we had to spend 3 days there in a rather sensitive period of 13-15 February . I'm sure I would have taken advantage of that offer. But unfortunately the seats were already taken . FRANKLY AND WITH CONVICTION I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS FACILITY! ! ! ! ! ! Location of the object really cool close to the sea about 300 m and to the center also quite close. The staff trying as hard as they can, nice, friendly and friendly, unfortunately there are no more advantages. Normal breakfasts are not distinguished by anything bad or good, as in many facilities of this type.

The "Hotel" does not meet the standard three stars, the entrance to the hotel car park only at the gate is a cube, the rest of the car park covers the trail, the car park is unguarded. Double rooms in the attic are kitschy, the floor cracks at every step, hot water flies alternately with cold, which should be repaired before the arrival of guests. Towels are changed every third day, as recalled on the bathroom door. "From ok. 120 years ago it was known that there are relationships between the human immune system and cancer. This was indicated, among others, by cases of self-healing of even advanced cancer. However, it was only for a few years that a huge breakthrough in research on this phenomenon occurred" - explains Dr Zagożdżon . As he reminds us, until now the cancer was supposed to "escape" from the immune system, that it is still changing so as not to be diagnosed by it. That is why research has focused on methods to make the immune system catch up with the cancer. "It's as if we're constantly pressing the accelerator pedal in the car, without knowing that we're also dealing with the handbrake being applied heavily," says the specialist. In recent years, however, it has been understood that the cancer uses other ways of defending itself against the immune system, using so-called checkpoints. They are used by the immune system to check whether the encountered cells are the body's own cells, or foreign cells or pathologically altered cells. "It's like checking a passport," says Dr. Zagożdżon. Unfortunately, the cancer is learning to "pretend it's not alien. "Understanding this has led us to learn how to switch off the appropriate control mechanisms and it turned out that this way the immune system can be much more effective in the fight against cancer," he adds.

Even in pregnant women, sleep disorders in the third trimester can promote changes in the fetus's body, which after birth increase the tendency to be overweight and obese, as well as metabolic disorders and diabetes. Dr. David Gozal from the pediatrics clinic at the University of Chicago showed it on mice, but he claims it could be similar in humans. His research shows that sleep disorders during pregnancy inhibit the expression of the adiponectin-coding gene, a hormone that affects many metabolic processes, especially those associated with the metabolism of glucose and fatty acids. Therefore, the more it is in the body, the better because it protects against obesity, diabetes and atherosclerosis.

The results of the report showing the costs of SM treatment in Poland were presented by Dr. Małgorzata Gałązka - Sobotka, Director of the Postgraduate Education Center and the Institute of Health Care Management at Lazarski University. She referred to the data of the National Health Fund (NFZ) for the years 2008 - 2016. The data show that in the analyzed period the average annual number of patients with MS was stable and amounted to approx. The average annual number of patients with MS was stable in the analysed period and amounted to approx. The NHF spent on the therapy of patients in 2008. PLN 137 million in 2008, while in 2016. - PLN 400 million . Average expenditure on a patient increased from 3.5 thousand PLN in 2008. - to over PLN 9.2 thousand in 2016. The percentage of patients for whom the NHF financed the therapy within the framework of drug programmes was approx. The percentage of patients for whom the NHF financed therapy within the framework of drug programmes amounted to approx. ( 10 717 patients ) in 2016. In 2008 . The NHF spent on drug programmes in multiple sclerosis approx. In 2008, the NHF spent about PLN 74 million on multiple sclerosis drug programmes, and in 2016. - approx. PLN 312 million in 2016 . The average value of therapy for one patient was approx. 28,7 thousand PLN . Dr Gałazka - Sobota pointed out that the state finances should be looked at as a whole . "Higher expenditures on the treatment of multiple sclerosis translate in the long term into lower expenditures of the Social Insurance Institution (ZUS) related to pensions and social care, not to mention much higher quality of life of patients" - he said .
