The book contains a lot of valuable information. It turns out that oranges eaten in winter are not so healthy because they are not intended for the climate zone where Poland is located. Nature invented this way that what grows in Poland is also suitable for people who live here. I have eaten bananas and oranges so far in winter in the belief that they are very healthy. From the book she found out that it is exactly the opposite. I haven't eaten any citrus for two months now, but instead a warm, full-bodied breakfast and she stopped carrying handkerchiefs, which she hadn't practically parted with before. I highly recommend it.

"Currently we are talking about epitopes (determinants), i.e. small amino acid structures on the surface of proteins or hidden inside it. During the technological processes, protein structures change, which may cause the allergenic fragments to be revealed outside. As a result of contact with such a protein - allergen, IgE class antibodies are formed in the body. For most people the antigens are safe. If a predisposed organism, in response to contact with the antigen, starts to rapidly produce IgE antibody, then the antigen as a foreign compound is called + allergen + " - emphasized prof . Wróblewska . As scientists indicate, the causes of allergy are twofold. In 50% . its formation is associated with genetic conditions, the second 50% . can be attributed to the influence of human life environment .

Fetal Alcohol Syndrome (FAS, PZA) belongs to the group of physical and mental congenital diseases. Its symptoms are e.g.: malformations (e.g. heart and joints), damage to the central nervous system, neurological disorders, delayed physical and mental development, behavioural disorders, mental underdevelopment, psychomotor hyperactivity. These abnormalities may result in learning difficulties, concentration of attention, memory and ability to solve problems, lack of motor coordination and speech disorders. FAS impairments have an impact on intellectual and social development also during adolescence and after adulthood. Often people from FAS are not able to take responsibility for their own lives, often break the law and for years are condemned to help various organizations and institutions.

The curriculum of oncology varies depending on where the student is studying and with whom he is teaching. The university is not geared to providing expertise ready to be transferred to everyday clinical practice. The basic skill expected from a medical university graduate is to diagnose cancer. A young doctor must know what symptoms may suggest cancer in the patient and skilfully conduct a diagnosis. However, specialist treatment is reserved for oncologists, oncological surgeons, radiotherapists, oncological gynaecologists etc. The treatment is different for each tumour. The conference "Innovations in Oncology" is to provide specialist knowledge about colorectal, ovarian and thyroid cancer. Doctors will learn how to treat patients surgically, what are the advances in chemotherapy and what to expect from pathomorphologists who produce a histopathological report. Such a report will confirm the diagnosis of cancer. Some of the pathomorphology centres are limited to compulsory information, while specialist centres also provide additional information, which is extremely valuable for the patient's further management.

The principle of the probe is to introduce a thin needle into the tumor area or lymph node, which will give you almost instant information on whether HER2 is positive or negative and accurately quantify its concentration. "Today, the diagnosis of a tumor is very time consuming. It is also a complicated and painful test for patients. The use of the microscope will save the woman from the pain and stress associated with the biopsy and long waiting for the results" - explains Marcin Staniszewski, the originator and CEO of SDS Optic. The current version of the device is capable of detecting marker concentrations in medically required ranges. Thanks to the probe, there will no longer be any need for tissue collection, and the precise numerical result of the examination will be delivered to the doctor and the patient in several minutes.

I'm very disappointed with this doctor. I'm almost 40 years old and my husband and I have decided to have our first child. I know that after 35 years of age, such pregnancies are potentially threatened. Full of questions and anxiety I went privately, because you know - at the National Health Fund it happens differently, and if you pay 130 PLN it is expected that the doctor will pay you more attention. The visit was express. When I asked if I should take any vitamins, do some tests, prepare myself somehow for getting pregnant, the only answer she heard was that "I shouldn't panic" and I should "hug my husband hard". From my sisters' experience I know that they had tests done on hormones, took vitamins, folic acid and followed a healthy diet. Because that's what gynaecologists told them. When she asked me directly about it, he said that it was completely unnecessary but if I insisted, I could do the tests. The ultrasound examination was only done because she asked me to do it. I think it is a very unprofessional approach to the patient. Lost money and lost time. I don't recommend it to anyone, and certainly not to women who have decided to have a child at a later age.

"A strong magnetic field produced during the operation of the resonance is directed along the tunnel where the patient is located and forces this small magnet to position itself in the direction of the scanner field acting on it" - explains Dr. Eng. Tomasz Wolak from the World Hearing Center. The force acting on him is so great that he pops out of the "pocket". The implant is located and can move under the skin beyond the implant, causing damage to the implant. According to Dr. Wolak, the MRI examination would have to be performed in a weak magnetic field (below 0,5 tesla), which reduces the quality of the obtained images. Or the implant would have to be removed before the examination and then implanted again, which in turn exposes the patient to further procedures.

Studies have already been carried out on mice and macaques (primates). The animals were irradiated with a high dose, which is lethal only for some animals. "In their blood, we examined several hundred different microRNA particles. Using statistical methods, we narrowed down our search and detected three molecules, which indicate a high dose of radiation and two molecules which determine the probability of survival," says Dr. Fendler. He explains that macaques are so similar to humans that the findings can be applied to humans. "In order to check this, we compared the genomes of both species and confirmed that the microRNAs will behave analogously in macaques and humans" - says a researcher from the City of Łódź.

I was sent to Dr. Salata by accident, by order of a friend. After 3 years of infertility treatment and looking for various causes of my problems at home, we started to seek a child with my husband. Another fourth year has passed, this time not only of treatment but also of intensive efforts. Unfortunately, without any results. Doctors from my region let go, claiming that the situation is too complicated, the ovarian reserve is exhausted, and time unfortunately did not work in my favor. Then they decided to visit the doctor with my husband. After not a whole year of treatment, including different types of tests, treatments with different medicines, also treatments were successful, although there were difficult moments. Doctor Salata did not lose hope, he always approached the problem with a sense of humor, reminding that the mental state of the future mother is as important in the treatment as the mentioned treatments. I am now in the fifth month of pregnancy. I am convinced that it has been possible to get in and sustain it thanks to the great experience of the doctor. I would like to add that I come from the Podkarpackie Province and despite the long journey, fatigue and costs it was worth getting to know and decide to visit Dr. Salata. I sincerely recommend .

The risk of having a heart attack in patients suffering from e.g. coronary artery disease (particularly dangerous and many people do not know they have it), obese patients with high blood pressure increases if they have a sedentary lifestyle and physical activity starts suddenly and is intense. It is important to ensure a proper warm-up and gradually increase activity. It is important to finish the exercises calmly, because a heart attack often occurs not only during the exercise but also after it is finished. Patients," said the doctor, "should not engage in physical activity when it is too warm. Immediately after the exercise it is dangerous to use the sauna and take a hot shower. Exercise can also be fatal when the air temperature is low and in the mountains. Before climbing the slopes, you should wait some time for your body to get used to the new temperature and pressure.

The hotel is elegant and luxurious, it certainly deserves five stars. We have already used the New Year's Eve offer twice. Wonderfully located . The rooms are beautifully decorated clean with taste. A great advantage is the view from the windows on Lake Mikołajskie. Breakfast is abundant, wide range of dishes, everyone will find something for everyone. Although we do not eat meat, both the breakfast and lunch offer includes meatless dishes (fish, seafood), a large selection of vegetables and fruits. The service is very nice and professional, both at the reception and in the restaurant. Great facilities of the world of saunas, clean, provided water to drink, tastefully decorated. The saunas operated without reservations from the first minutes after opening. Wonderful view in the relaxation room. Swimming pool a little small but enough. The hotel is animal friendly. Our dog was delighted ; ) The only downside is: - Alcohol prices in the bar on the island (except for wine and champagne) much too high, much more expensive than in Warsaw in the best restaurants: ) The SPA treatment for men (manicure and pedicure) turned out to be a cream on hands and feet for a price of almost 400 PLN. . . ! Price absolutely not adequate to the service ! Apart from these two disadvantages, we consider the whole stay as very successful and plan to return in the summer.

The second modification allows to obtain a molecule which has strong inhibiting properties of the enzyme degrading cap, which occurs naturally in cells. According to scientists, this discovery can be used in the development of a drug for spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) or other genetic disorders. This new molecule is more than a hundred times more active than our previous inventions. Many of us think that revenue management and sales strategies automatically complement each other. After all, these two elements are strongly linked. According to the World Health Organisation (WHO), the most harmful to human health is PM 2,5 , i.e. containing the smallest particles (no more than 2,5 μm in diameter). It penetrates more easily into the lower respiratory tract, causing inflammation of the lungs, but can also penetrate (through the alveoli) into the cardiovascular system, intensifying atherosclerosis. Dr Dąbrowiecki explains that the body defends itself against atmospheric pollution by increasing mucus secretion in the airways to protect the mucous membrane, but it can also shrink the bronchi. "The result is dyspnea and wheezing, an asthmatic reaction which is more common in allergy sufferers, and in Poland there are many - it is estimated that 40% are allergic. Poles," he stresses.

I advise against it. She gave birth to my child in January 2017, from the beginning she wanted to give birth to M.S. and be prepared for the birth as well as possible, so Joanna called me in November to make an appointment and sign a contract for midwife services during the birth. The deadline was New Year's Eve 2016 and Joanna warned me that she wouldn't be there on Christmas, but she didn't want me to worry, because even if I start giving birth in her absence, she will provide a decent replacement. Apart from holidays, Mrs. Joanna was to be available at any other time of day or night - I was assured of that. On the 8th of January around 22nd the contractions started (I was already in pathology at the hospital on Madalińskiego Street). Unfortunately, one of the midwives on duty told me that Joanna could not come to me because she had to sleep before the duty and could come, but only about 3 in the morning. Joanna could have warned me earlier that such situations may occur, they would simply protect us from such a situation - she would have hired another midwife, a doula, she simply did not want me to give birth alone (her husband was more stressed than I was). Mrs. Joanna finally arrived at 3 am, after 5 hours that we spent with my husband practically alone in the delivery room. The evaluation was neutral, and not negative, because one of the last 3 hours of the birth was nice and pleasant. I would like to add that unfortunately Joanna did not ask me for my consent at the incision and despite the absence for the most part of the birth she issued an invoice for the entire amount of the service. Despite the good first impression she made on us, in my opinion, she did not fulfill the contract - she came much late and did not take care of the blockage during her absence.

The above is a list of tasks that they perform on a daily basis, apart from their basic duties connected with serving guests at the reception desk - receptionists of many small 3-star hotels "somewhere in Poland". Is 1 . 400 zloty "on hand" with night hours and work on Sundays - is it much or little for doing all the above mentioned work? Should receptionists in a 3-star hotel do such work at all? The answer to these questions depends on several conditions: how big is a 3-star hotel, i.e. how many rooms and other areas it has; where is it located, how high is the attendance, and how does the seasonality look like. And finally: how do we approach the employee billing system. 160 room 3-star hotel located in the center of Warsaw, Wroclaw or Poznan, where the traffic of guests and clients lasts practically from 6 am. 00 am to 2 am. It is impossible to compare it to a 12 - 20 room holiday hotel located in the depths of the Warmińsko-Mazurskie Voivodeship or to a city hotel in a small county town. The receptionist from a big city hotel and the receptionist from a small local hotel are two different employees.

According to the sociologist from Łódź, over the last half-century we can observe a permanent increase in the importance of cancer among the causes of death and a decrease in the significance of infectious diseases. According to the data of the Central Statistical Office, in 1960 cancer was the cause of 8.9% of all deaths, and in 2010. - 25.3% in 2010. Infectious diseases constituted in 1960. Infectious diseases constituted 6.9% of all deaths, and in 2010 only 0.7%. Cardiovascular diseases have been the predominant cause of death for many years, although this trend has been slowly decreasing over the last several years. In 1990 cardiovascular diseases were the cause of 53.4% of all deaths, and in 2010 the number of deaths was lower. - 46% of all deaths in 2010 .

"Therefore, in pathological states, when the immune system is too stimulated or its activity lasts too long, the consequences of dysfunction of other systems are more and more severe. As a result, the immune system destroys the body instead of protecting it. If we could block the influence of pro-inflammatory cytokines on a cell, then the immune system would not damage other systems," explains a doctoral student of the Faculty of Biology at the University of Warsaw. Originally it was believed that specialized information particles in the body are characteristic of certain systems, e.g. neurotransmitters for the immune system and cytokines for the immune system. It was assumed that it is a "code" which communicates with the cells within their system, not understood by other cells. Nowadays scientists know that this view was false, and receptors for cytokines and neurotransmitters can be found in most of the cell population.

There are several reasons for this. First, data on the metabolism of drugs, such as cocaine, are from the 1950s. . . .the 1950s. For ethical reasons, no one today volunteers are testing the pharmacokinetics of narcotics, so there are no new data. Moreover, the metabolism of these compounds is always slightly different in healthy people and in addicts and this is not taken into account in these studies. A very big error is caused by the sewage system - how old it is and to what extent it leaks. Studies in Germany and Switzerland show that during leaks and overflows after rains, about 50% of wastewater may not reach the treatment plant. In addition, the value of the flows reported by the treatment plant is affected by an error of about 20% . In addition, some substances degrade along the way.
Researchers from the Korean-American-Polish team took one of such mechanisms responsible for DNA patching - Mre protein complex11 . Their research appeared in " N atur e S truc t u r

I've been treating your doctor for several years now, so far I had no objections, but during his last visit he was very nervous, not very gentle. Honestly speaking (despite the best opinions about the doctor so far) after leaving the office she was thinking about changing the doctor. . .

The EgzoEMG robot is to be an assistant rehabilitator. It also provides diagnostic possibilities, allows the assessment of muscle strength, electrical activity in the patient's muscles and measurement of the range of movement. It will be the only robot available in the world that uses EMG, that is electromyography. It gives a chance for active rehabilitation - using electrical activity appearing in the muscles of even weak patients. The robot was developed in Poland, especially for physiotherapists. It has already passed the first tests with the participation of patients - volunteers. "We had a patient in Wrocław - Jakub, who moved his hands for the first time in five years thanks to our robot. This patient would not have been able to participate in rehabilitation of another type, like the one with the exoskeleton" - says Mikulski .
The grandmother is nice but you have to know how to pass.

And it was the sales of Sheraton in Kraków and Bristol in Warsaw that made the market value in 2013. This year, at least so far, similar transactions have not been recorded, although in ub . The sale of Warsaw's Westin and Radisson Blu Centrum hotels on Grzybowska Street has been discussed. They are selling because they do not earn any money Most of the hotels are currently for sale due to the fact that their owners cannot cope with the increasingly competitive market. They are primarily smaller, older and most often not hotel facilities. Such facilities can be purchased for several hundred thousand to several million PLN. The second, less numerous group are facilities belonging to companies which dispose of them due to restructuring or cessation of accommodation activity.

She was at your doctor's for a visit with my four-month-old child. The son had dry skin on his cleavage and scaly skin on his neck, after one time he was rubbing the pimples on his neck with an ointment with a small amount of zinc oxide (the pimples disappeared but the skin dried up). She was counting on a good ointment made on prescription, unfortunately we got a steroid + syrup so the little one would not scratch. I am one of those people who read the leaflets from A to Z, and she said that I will not give these medicines to the child, the syrup was in the leaflet "for children from 2 years old". and the steroid seems to me to be the last resort, but my son only had a skin problem for 2 days. She consulted my pediatrician with my medication, she reacted to the syrup: "God forbid, it's too small for such medication". and the neck had to be lubricated with an ordinary emollient cream, after 3 days the skin regenerated and the problem disappeared.

We were the whole family in Sosence: 2 + 2 . They booked us a 2-level apartment. The surroundings are peaceful, quiet, beautiful coniferous forests. The town itself is rather empty. Unfortunately there was a ban on swimming in the lake, so we did not take advantage of it. I do not know if this is why the nearby beach was completely closed, but even the restaurant was empty. In the resort next door you can rent water bikes, mountain bikes and other equipment. There are bicycle and hiking trails in the area. Sosenka is a small centre, only 10 or 12 cottages, fenced, which gave us, as parents of school children, the freedom to let them loose throughout the centre. The cottages themselves are nice, renovated and equipped. I somehow suggested that it would be two rooms, and unfortunately it was one room where two sofa beds see each other. Sleeping quality is medium, because, however, these are narrow sofa beds. If somebody is ordinary to sleep on a normal 160 cm bed, they may not get any sleep. Especially since the standard is one duvet for 2 people. Towels on the equipment are supposed to be, but one small towel per person. A little too little. An interesting option is to combine rooms within one house. On the one hand it's nice, because the bigger team has communication without going outside, but on the other hand you can hear the neighbors.

"Our device has been in existence for several months now, however, to be able to sell it, it must undergo clinical trials. All these centres will be invited to a clinical trial. This stage we want to finish in 2018" - plans the PAP caller. The device - according to preliminary estimates - will cost about 700 euros, but various forms of payment are taken into account, such as micropayments, so that the user pays for the hours actually used. The creators of the device are currently participating in the international Chivas The Venture competition. Each year, the creators of the contest invest $1 million in projects that improve the quality of human life. Until April 25th, the Internet users can vote for a specific project from among 27 proposed by the organizers ( bit.ly/eNDaphasia ) through their Facebook account. The winner of the first place will receive 50 thousand dollars . In total, a prize pool of $200,000 has been allocated for this stage of the competition. In the final stage of the world finals, which will end with a conference in Amsterdam, prizes from the pool of 800 thousand dollars will be awarded.

The hotel's reputation and the reputation of the chain have increased by similar values. The facilities such as free breakfast (up from 70 to 73%) and the possibility of later check-out (up from 65% to 69%) have also gained in importance for hotel guests. Criteria related to free internet access in the room (from 63 to 75%) and public spaces (from 45% to 53%) are also increasingly important for guests. Likewise, guests can view photos or videos and read about the hotel: on the hotel's website (up from 47% to 52%) or on websites such as Expedia, Travelocity (up from 48% to 52%) as well as on blogs and social media (up from 33% to 41%) . The MMGY Global report points to the stabilization or decline in the importance of criteria aggressively promoted by hotels in recent years, such as: better soundproofed rooms, top-quality bedding, additional points in loyalty programs, and free press.

"Eating even one donut can be a burden on the body. A doughnut is high in calories and contains a lot of sugar - if it wasn't, it probably wouldn't taste good. Yeast dough, filling, icing - all this has a lot of sugar. In addition, the doughnut is soaked in fat, in which it is baked," - said Dr. Moor - Jankowski to PAP. Eating doughnuts is a challenge for several organs - stomach, pancreas and liver. People who suffer from pancreatitis or chronic liver diseases should avoid these delicacies. "The excess calories that the body will consume must be used up somehow. If a person doesn't burn it and instead sits in front of the TV, it has to be put down and most often it is put down in the liver first" - explained the doctor.

This is confirmed by an experiment carried out in China in 2009. In which silver nanoparticles and microparticles were injected under rat skin. The microparticles did not enter the bloodstream, while the nanoparticles were transported to the kidneys, liver, spleen, lungs and brain. The tattooing process consists in introducing a small amount of pigment under the skin by means of pricking. Tattooing can also be dangerous to human health due to skin damage and the possibility of infections. As explained by Dr. Teresa Bilewicz - Wyrozumska from the Chair and Department of Environmental Health of the Department of Public Health in Bytom, while maintaining the rules of hygiene such a risk is minimal. "The general rule for every procedure where our tissue is affected should be to open the needle pack or the device tip in our presence" - she emphasized .

So far, two out of every three hotels in the world are charging for access to the network, with rates as high as £8.5 per hour, according to a survey conducted by "The Telegraph Travel" this year. The worst results were reported by luxury hotels in London, including The Dorchester, Grosvenor House and the Firmdale group, many of which charge £20 per 24-hour wireless access. Budget hotel chains such as the Holiday Inn also charge £15 in the UK and £20 in continental Europe for daily access. Many of the establishments mentioned at the beginning of Accor have a price of 3 GBP 85 per hour of Wi Fi. Less than 2% of the readers of "The Telegraph Travel" say that the charges at the hotel for W - Fi were "fair". and high charges are seen as speculative.

"We're going against the trends," admits the acoustician. He explains that although many teams of researchers are working on new generations of stethoscopes around the world, most often the ideas are based on collecting the acoustic signals from the body as accurately as possible and throwing them into a computer which, instead of a doctor, would interpret these results and make a diagnosis. Meanwhile, according to Dr . Nowak's opinion is not the solution that doctors and patients are waiting for. According to acoustics, it is important that the stethoscope is still a simple, portable device which would help the doctor to make an initial diagnosis quickly. The Polish team has therefore focused on another aspect of the improvement of the stethoscope - to adapt the signal from the device to the physical capabilities of the human ear and to how sounds are perceived in the brain. The diagnosis and interpretation of the results would still depend on the doctor. And yet such a diagnosis results not only from acoustic signals from the body, but also from observation and conversation with the patient.

I've been suffering from kidney stones for 10 years. In my case, the removal of kidney stones has so far been based on the ESWL method with different results. I was referred to doctor Rafał Olejnik by order of a doctor working in WCM in Opole. He assured that in the clinic where Dr Olejnik works he is the only one in the Opole region to use modern and, above all, effective methods of kidney stones treatment (he meant RIRS). Of course he was not wrong! The procedure itself ran quickly and efficiently without complications and subsequent complications. The waiting time is not long, which is a big advantage. Dr Rafał Olejnik is a real doctor by vocation. Full professionalism, kindness, efficiency, nice atmosphere, exemplary medical care, human approach to the patient are just some of the features describing this doctor. A great feeling is how with more physical effort or longer walk I do not feel any pain in my kidneys - which previously very often happened to me - and this is thanks to Dr. Rafał Olejnik for which I am very grateful to him. Like a urologist - only Dr. Rafał Olejnik I recommend!

High hopes are still placed in molecularly oriented therapies. As explained to PAP by prof . Grandpa, these drugs are now available worldwide for ok . 10-15 percent of patients with so-called non-small cell lung cancer (approximately 80 percent of lung cancer cases - PAP) . These are patients with the so-called EGFR gene activation mutation or with the so-called EML4 fusion gene - ALK . By administering molecularly targeted drugs, it is possible not only to extend their lives, but also to improve their quality. That is why pharmaceutical companies compete with each other in the development of new drugs which will work in case of other genetic changes, e.g. in the KRAS, HER2, ROS1 and many others . The results of research on many such drugs are presented in Geneva.

In February, she was treated by the doctor to fill her mouth with hyaluronic acid. Hyaluronic acid treatment moisturized the lips, improved lip contour and facial profile. You do not need to prepare yourself for the treatment. Lip augmentation was performed under local anesthesia - with the use of an anesthetic cream. The procedure lasted a dozen or so minutes and ran quite pleasantly and gently. The doctor showed great patience and forbearance with regard to questions asked by me and gave a comprehensive answer to each question. The procedure was divided into two stages for adaptation reasons because I was afraid of the exaggerated effect and preferred to introduce such an exchange gradually. The results after the treatment are immediate, it is worth knowing not to make an appointment in the middle of the week because shortly after the application of the substance, swelling or bruises may appear as in my case, about which I was informed by the doctor. On the second day there was no trace of them and the swelling went down after two days. However, I must admit that the swelling appears only after the first treatment, and with the next application of hyaluronic acid there is no longer any place at all. I can easily recommend to the doctor the effect of my treatment is perfect, the lips are natural, moisturized, fuller but not exaggerated! ! ! I recommend I recommend the right person in the right place.

Thank you, doctor, for curing me of bruxism. Dr. Opiłka offered me to loosen the rumen with botox on my first visit and then, after the tension subsided, slowly rebuilt my teeth using porcelain inlays and harder fillings. The sensation after botox is great. I wake up in the morning and I don't have a jaw ache, my headaches have subsided and my face has become more drawn. I realize that botox has to be repeated again to three times but it is better than eating my teeth and notoriously rebuilding them.

"Our research has also shown that in women with this mutation the risk of death depends to a large extent on the size of the tumour - adds the Szczecin geneticist. - If it is detected quite early, when it does not exceed 2 cm in diameter, the probability of ten-year survival reaches 82%. Only when the tumour is larger than 2 cm in size, it drops to only 30%. "According to the specialist, in carriers of PALB2 mutations, it is essential to regularly undergo screening such as mammography and ultrasound and possibly MRI. "These diagnostic tests allow early detection of breast cancer when it is still small. This has been confirmed by our research, we have had patients with this mutation tested and were able to detect tumours as small as 8 mm, 10 mm, 11 mm or 16 mm. - emphasizes .

Prof . Kuśmierczyk hopes that the number of heart transplants in IK will continue to grow. A new type of transplantation is also planned. "We are already prepared for the simultaneous transplantation of the heart and kidney, and in the future the heart and liver, the lung itself and the heart and lungs" - he added . "Transplantation is still the most effective method of treating extreme heart failure," - emphasized prof . Kuśmierczyk . The demand for these treatments will increase. There are more and more patients requiring urgent transplants . In 2015 out of 42 transplants as many as 30 were urgent . The main part of patients undergoing surgery are patients of 50 each. However, young people, 20- and 30-year-olds and even people under 20 years of age also require heart transplants.

However, cancer treatment assistance is not the only area where oxygen maps can be used. "One such ailment is also night apnea, or snoring, which can lead to severe hypoxia not only of the brain but of the whole body and accelerates the development of cancer," explained the researcher. They can be used in the treatment of: the effects of stroke, limb hypoxia, vascular damage such as diabetes, difficult to heal wounds. For the time being, the researchers cannot imaging the whole body of the patient, but only its individual parts. The obstacle here is underdeveloped technology and the lack of equipment allowing for imaging cancers in the whole body. However, as the researcher assured us, progress in this field is very high and in a few years time such equipment should be available.

Hello, 7 months ago I had the privilege of meeting Dr. . The antibodies used so far in immunotherapy combine with proteins located on the surface of T lymphocytes, thus activating them to fight cancer cells. It can be said that they unblock the immune system. Meanwhile, the Polish-Swiss team is looking for peptide compounds that will act on the immune system similarly to the antibodies. "For comparison: antibodies consist e.g. of 3 thousand bricks - amino acids and peptides - only 20 - 30 bricks" - points out prof . Rodziewicz - Motovidło . He adds that while peptide can be synthesized by scientists in the laboratory, the antibodies are most often produced in animal organisms such as mice or rabbits or in tissue cultures.

Or maybe it would interfere with the metabolism of the helicopters and in particular block the mechanism of folic acid metabolism necessary for their growth? This possibility is tested by Dr Joanna Panecka from the Center for New Technologies at the University of Warsaw, in cooperation with the University of Heidelberg and the Institute of Theoretical Research in Heidelberg. As the researcher explains, depending on the species, the dr Paneckas cause acute, often fatal infections such as: African coma, leishmaniosis, or chronic diseases such as Chagas' disease. The symptoms vary from hyperactivity, fever, lymph node enlargement to mental disorders and serious damage to internal organs. Leishmaniosis is called white leprosy because of the similarity of skin symptoms to leprosy, and chronic Chagas' disease causes damage to the heart and digestive tract.

I have to say that my stay in Eyre Place was one of the best I had in Edinburgh. The room with the bathroom was small, but since most of the time we were visiting, a good bed for the night was the main purpose. That said, we had a TV, radio and a small electric kettle if you wanted a hot drink. Another reviewer criticized the standard of cleanliness but I can't agree with that. The room was cleaned daily with a change of both bedding and towels. Breakfast was served in the Ardenlee, a few doors away, which was a bit tedious but rewarded by the quality and quantity of the food. The staff were helpful and friendly, especially Tracy, an Austrian woman who made everyone feel at home. My only criticism is the long time it takes to heat up the water in the shower - you can have a cup of tea while waiting. However, for such a price it was far above average and its location, just ten to fifteen minutes walk or a short bus ride from Prince Street. This is a great place to stay if you ever go to Edinburgh.

This misunderstanding is due to the fact that a flu vaccine does not protect against so-called flu-like infections, with which we often confuse it. "These infections are hard to tell the difference. Influenza-like infections are most often caused by RSVs" - says Prof . Brydak . It is the most common pathogen causing upper respiratory tract infections, mainly in children. It is generally mild in adolescents and adults, but may be dangerous for the elderly. Prof. Brydak . Adam Antczak recommends that people over 65 years of age and small children under 2 years of age should be vaccinated (the preparation can be administered to toddlers over 6 months of age). Also people suffering from chronic diseases: heart, lungs, kidneys, liver, blood diseases and diabetes, as well as those with weakened immune system. These people account for almost 90% of all influenza-related deaths. People over 50 are also slightly more at risk. .

After reading the review I was angry with my husband that he chose this hotel, but fortunately the hotel surprised me pleasantly. She was in a four-bed room, he was big, we never got so big. As he explained, if he was presently in this zone for a year, he would receive a dose of several millisieverts, i.e. exceeding the international standard for non-exposed persons, which is 1 millisieverts per year, but less than the dose envisaged for professionally exposed persons, i.e. 20 millisieverts per year. "This is also well below the 100 millisieverts limit, which is considered to be the limit of the dose at which the risk of lesions occurs," added the Eye, noting that this limit applies to a single dose. As he explained, receiving e.g. for five years a dose of 20 millisieverts per year is not equivalent to receiving 100 millisieverts at a time. "It is much safer to receive a given dose in the long term," he stressed.

This is a hostel where everything works. Where every question will be answered. With enthusiastic and committed people, even in the middle of the night friendly and smiling. Dr. Szuber is an excellent doctor for me and my partner. We have come to him as a specialist in fetal malformations, he works in the Laboratory of Fetal Diagnostics and Treatment in GPSK at Polna Street. I am writing from the perspective of a woman whose pregnancy is one of the tragic experiences, our son has a lethal defect of the nervous system, which he diagnosed immediately, first at his office, then at Polna Street. . . Apart from competence, knowledge (which is constantly eagerly expanded - this is how it was in our case, the doctor reached out to many sources before talking to us about what to do next) and skills, the doctor is really characterized by great kindness, great understanding and patience. . ... I did not even expect that the doctor could be so human, he talked to me in the hospital like a friend, he was looking for ways to help me, he offered to meet with a psychologist, he wrote down the documents needed to do the prenatal tests, although the patient should take care of it, he offered to contact the genetic clinic. He expressed his willingness to help also after the hospitalisation, repeatedly asked if he could still help, but he did not come to private appointments, he would gladly talk to you also on hospital duty. He took care of my discharge and all the formalities related to its receipt. In such a dramatic moment as the news of the slow dying of his own unborn child, such a doctor is a miracle. I recommend it with a calm conscience and I know that my next pregnancy will be led by Dr. Szuber, and I hope that everything will be calm and healthy. . . hello.

The Management Board of the Qubus Hotel chain, which has been actively developing in Poland since 1996, decided on a new strategy for building a competitive advantage for the years 2015-2020. Its basic assumption is, on the one hand, concentration of activities on Qubus Hotel facilities with high break-even point and, on the other hand, intensive development of a new brand - ALTO, whose first hotel was opened in February in ¯ory. At the same time one of the first decisions made in accordance with the new strategy is the withdrawal of the chain from the Wałbrzych market at the end of March 2015.

I'm warning everyone to see this "doctor"! ! ! We were at this gentleman's for an ultrasound of his daughter's hips. I don't recommend it. At first, the doctor made a good impression. He visited him 3 times in a year and a half. The basic urine tests detected nothing and despite my kind pressure to deepen the nephrological diagnosis, he told me that without proteinuria and/or leukocyturia there was no chance that I had kidney inflammation, or rather it was a problem with the muscle or the spine (my nephrological symptoms clearly indicated that it was a problem with the kidney!). After almost two years, I finally got 'em to a good doctor who recommended, among other things, an MRI, which left no illusions. My spine is healthy, and my left kidney has a segmental restriction on the diffusion of the renal papillae corresponding to the inflammatory focus. Soon, I will have even more detailed examination. If Mr. Bartholomew Matłosz had immediately approached my case professionally and wanted to take me seriously, the inflammation would not have turned into a chronic form, which unfortunately cannot be cured. . . As a consolation I can only say that most of the other nephrologists I visited did not even want to examine me, seeing the correct basic urine test.

Hello, we have purchased our all inclusive stay for two people at the Marine Hotel. Upon arrival, the hotel was really very nice, super-located, but from the very beginning something did not play. They checked in we did not get us wristbands and a 10% discount on services as it was supposed to be in the offer that we bought. We got a 5% discount. After the intervention it turned out that we are entitled to it at the reception desk you did not know (she explained that she had a lot of guests and there is "snuff" - that is why she was wrong). In every catering outlet really nobody knew what these bands mean and what sofas and alcoholic beverages can be served. Every time the question was asked which wine, which vodka. It was tiring to explain to the staff that we have the package. Apparently, every time you had to sign a 0 PLN bill. Once we only got it. In addition, when we went to the restaurant we were surprised by a cobweb hanging over the table and it wasn't one, because there was a whole bunch of them, in the hotel 5 *? The HK department couldn't do anything. At the swimming pool it was the same, above the deckchairs. I guess it's not the hotel 5 * standards. A very nice nightclub on level 1 in the hotel. The spa was ok, but you can better massage yourself in the hotel 3 *, there although the staff has flip-flops with covered fingers (when you are massaged you do not admire the male feet / nails) And at the very end when we left the hotel, the lady at the reception desk counted us a bill of 100 zł more, because of course she did not know that we have all inclusive. After explaining to her that we have wristbands and such a package the bill was 100 PLN less. Question to the organizers why organize an offer for guests staying all inclusive if the staf was not informed? And every time a guest has to explain what is going on, wait for the bartender to call the reception and ask. Maybe it is worth taking a picture of the wristband and hang it in a prominent place? Unfortunately, despite a very cool location, the translation was tiring every time. . . I hope that the next people who buy this package will not have to "fight" like us.

Good news for those who were persecuted with spinach as a child. "Spinach should be eaten from time to time, but it should not be glorified as a great source of iron," - said PAP dr hab . Małgorzata Drywień from the Warsaw School of Life Sciences. Plant products as sources of iron do not work at all. A similar amount of iron as in spinach is found in beef, but only 1% of the former is absorbed. However, only 1% of the former is absorbed, and as much as 20% from beef. Can a combination of cucumber and tomato be a dangerous mixture for our health? Not at all, if we handle them properly. Some plants - including green cucumber - contain an enzyme that oxidizes and destroys vitamin C . So, if you cut into a salad - rich in vitamin C - peppers or tomatoes, you should first pour it over the sauce with a little fat, e.g. olive oil. It will protect our vegetables from the enzyme. Only then can cucumber, which will not take vitamins away from the protected tomato, be sliced into them.

The new Windows from Microsoft was supposed to revolutionize the computer system market, but in fact nothing has improved. Many proven solutions have not been introduced, mistakes instead of being fixed long ago, have been thoughtlessly copied to the new system, and functionality is limited. The only novelty that I may like is the graphical interface, although I did not like it at all. The tools for management and administration have been very much reduced, the system has not been made safer by the need to confirm every operation and the time to run both Windows and applications has been greatly extended. Many applications are not compatible with Vista and trying to run your favorite programs or games may not work. The hardware requirements are also sick of such a poor operating system. Better systems with much more capabilities than Vista, run much faster, have half the requirements and cost much less. The result is that Microsoft must force users to buy and use its system by installing it on laptops or computers sold in stores, because who in their right mind would buy this bubble on their own? I advise against it, it is worth waiting for 7, or even better to stay with XP.

Those assessing their health as good are of the opinion that adequate nutrition (53%) and regular sporting activities (31%) contribute most to improving their health. Doctor's visits were only ranked third ( 28% ) . Those who are not satisfied with their health, on the other hand, cited health promoting activities mainly as regular medical check-ups (47%) and only later as healthy eating habits (43%) . In this group of respondents, physical activity is definitely going downhill. Four-fifths of respondents ( 81% ) consider themselves to be health-conscious, of which almost one fifth ( 19% ) have no doubt about it. Nearly one in five respondents (19%) admit to not caring about their health.

Dr. Karolina Kusnierek is in my eyes a dentist in a slow motion. Very thorough examination of the filling preceding any work, photographic documentation, taking X-rays - all this was to make sure that one of the teeth was qualified for possible treatment, and also to allow the patient to see with his own eyes, which worries the doctor. I really enjoyed Mrs. Caroline's approach to prosthetic correction, which was the main reason for my last visit to the office. The doctor listens to the patient first, asks what aesthetic effect would be satisfactory for him, and then he informs precisely and reliably how it looks from the medical and functional point of view - the shape and size of the teeth carefully selects to the bite of the patient. He always chooses the least invasive solutions and thus they are most often a pleasant surprise to the patient when it comes to costs. The doctor always informs you about the cost of treatment at the first visit and these are the maximum amounts that the patient can bear - sometimes they are reduced - so anyone can plan these expenses without any unnecessary stress. I recommend Dr. Karoline Kusnierek to all those who care about their smile and are looking for a professional who can take the best care of him.

The researcher analyses interactions between endocanabinoids and endovanilloids . The cannabinoids formed within our body are called endogenous (endocanabinoids). One of them is the analogue of THC ( tetrahydrocanabidiol ) - anandamide . The endocanabinoid system is the internal system of our body. Results of the work of dr hab . Starowicz - Bubak will indicate new directions in neuropathic pain therapy . The scientist is checking on which systems, receptors or molecules can act to treat and relieve chronic pain. "As a result of our project there will be no new injection or tablet which can be bought in a pharmacy after the completion of the project. However, we will identify the molecules that best confirm our hypothesis and examine their pharmacological properties" - explains Dr Starowicz - Bubak. The work of her team can give guidance to pharmaceutical companies on how to design drugs. At the stage of basic research it is not yet about licenses or patents.

For this purpose, classes are conducted in English by renowned professors from the University of Lodz and experts from the Orbis Hotel Group. The modular mode of classes in four sessions allows students to combine work with effective participation in the program. Laurent Picheral, President of the Orbis Hotel Group, personally presented the diplomas to 22 students, expressing gratitude for their work and commitment. "We are very pleased to be a partner of the Top Talent program for the second time. This year it is very international, with 40% of the students coming from outside Poland," said Professor Tomasz Domanski, the manager of the "International Hotel Management" programme. Every student is sure that immediately after the end of the program they will be able to use their knowledge in their work.

The family of B&B hotels in Poland will soon be expanded by another location. Three hotels in Warsaw, Toruń and Wrocław will be joined by a hotel in Katowice. B & B Hotels Polska has purchased land for the new investment and is preparing to start construction works. The hotel will welcome its first guests in 2016. The fourth hotel of the B&B chain in Poland will be built on a plot of land located in the heart of Katowice, at the junction of Opolska and Sokolska streets, in the close vicinity of the main railway station. "The bioSOC microchip is ready for use in many everyday devices, from T-shirts to smartphones. It keeps you informed about the condition of your body, warns you about upcoming health problems, helps you to determine the cause of a deteriorated condition, such as fainting. During the rescue operation, it can give a signal to team members about problems of one of the rescuers, for example with blood saturation" - describes mgr inż . Mariusz Pazur , programmer of WIML Research Laboratory. The research work took three years. The Military Institute of Aviation Medicine alone involved 30 scientists. At the Polytechnic and ITAM - another several dozen people . In the world, the development of a fully copyrighted microchip cost at least $1 million . "Thanks to the passion and commitment of our team, we managed to produce biomedical technology, which is unrivalled in commercial applications, at several times lower costs. The cost of production of one microchip in serial production can be in the order of just a cent" - emphasizes M.Sc. Jarosław Lewandowski of WIML .

Dominik Dytfeld of the Poznań Medical University. Financial support will be provided by two manufacturers of myeloma drugs used in this study, Celgene and Amgen. "Not only does the intraocular pressure play a role - certainly in some cases it is a trigger, but there must be a certain substrate that will respond in a way that leads to the disease. There is, therefore, a certain predisposition - as most predispositions are probably genetically determined - but what mechanism is involved? We already have some observations" - said PAP research director prof . Joanna Lewin-Kowalik, vice-president of the Polish Nervous System Research Society and the Polish Physiological Society. "Some patients, despite the loss of some retinal ganglionic cells, do not have a dramatic loss of vision, while others have a very dramatic effect of neurodegeneration and manifest themselves clinically very early. If we could grasp this mechanism and if we could propose some methods that could counteract it, it would be great" - she added.

Pluses: location, good food, cleanliness, free safe, tight windows and well-muted buildingMinus: - wifi, which practically did not work in the room but I think they will improve the theme on the so-called. season. - Cold swimming pool - for 7 days, maybe 4 people were swimming in it, so called "walruses": BUT there is an indoor swimming pool in the hotel which of course you can useAdditional attraction: planes: ) The weather at the beginning of May is different - it rained, blew, clouds and the sun, which is all that the island of Madeira can bring: )

"We have tested our media on three species of bacteria that cause meningitis: Neisseria meningitidis , Streptococcus pneumoniae and Haemophilus influenzae. We detected their presence correctly in 95% of cases, and the species identified us with a certainty of 98%. And since we are talking about extremely sensitive Raman spectroscopy, it was enough for us to find a single bacterial cell to get such precise results! " - emphasises Dr Kaminska . The whole process of analysis is largely automated and minimizes the contact between the laboratory technician and the examined sample. In order to carry out the measurement it is only necessary to take under the laminar extract a microlitre portion of cerebrospinal fluid into a syringe and then place it in a syringe pump connected to the Raman spectrometer. In order to increase the reliability of the measurement, the recorded signals are processed by software using advanced statistical methods and the operator only has to read the result .

As research has shown over the years, synapses emit enzymes that change the environment around them. One of these is MMPs - 9, an extracellular enzyme that digests proteins. Research by Dr. Kozicka, published in the journal "Nature Communications" The MMPs, 9 like the scissors, cut the other protein - nectin - 3, which like a scaffold connects two nerve cells. When this protein is cut, it stops its function. These results have been confirmed in studies on both in vitro cell cultures and animal models of chronic stress. "Together with scientists from Lausanne University of Technology, we discovered a reduced nectin content - 3 in the hippocampus, a key brain area in response to stress and the development of depression. Molecular changes under the influence of chronic stress are reflected in the behaviour of animals, which become more aggressive, show abnormal social behaviour" - explains Dr Rejmak - Kozicka .

The anatomical preparations needed for learning are stored in a special warehouse. Thanks to the closed circulation of the preservative liquid in the plant there is no smell of formaldehyde, and used formaldehyde does not reach the Vistula River with sewage. Many rooms in the Department of Forensic Medicine have been rebuilt and their use has been changed - said its manager, prof . Paweł Krajewski said. Thanks to the cameras, the sections can be viewed in lecture halls, and the building has also been adapted to the needs of the disabled. Among the modern equipment there was a computer tomograph and devices enabling analysis of e.g. traces of afterburner in tissues and blood. In case of such events as plane crash, the plant has a cold store to store 350 bodies in decent conditions.

The calculations show that in 2000 per 10,000 inhabitants of Poland, men lost 2500 years of life in 2000, and in 2014 less, almost 2200 years. In the case of women, this ratio amounted to 1430 and 1270 years respectively. The biggest life thieves in Poland are cardiovascular diseases, malignant tumours, external causes of death (including primarily traffic accidents and suicides) and diseases of the digestive and respiratory systems. Scientists divided the causes of death into three most important groups. The first group includes infectious diseases, parasitic diseases, diseases related to pregnancy and childbirth, as well as malnutrition. "This group is important in underdeveloped countries, but in Poland - the rarest one" - commented Dr Pikala. The second group of causes of death are chronic non-communicable diseases, such as cancer and cardiovascular diseases. "This is the most common cause of death in developed countries, also in Poland," said the PAP interlocutor. The third group is external causes of death - accidents, suicides.

"I have been observing the development of the University Hospital in Olsztyn with great interest. This is a personal success of prof . Wojciech Maksymowicz, but it is also a success and the result of cooperation between the university authorities, the authorities of the Faculty of Medical Sciences and the local authorities. After twelve months of 2011, European hotels saw a 3.1% increase in room utilisation compared to 2010, reaching 66.3%. The average room rate in euros was 99.86, up 2.6% on the previous year. The average room rate rose by 5.8% to €66.17, according to STR Global. The use and average room rate rose steadily in each month of 2011 with the exception of August, when there was a slight 1% decrease in ADR. However, August turned out to be a turning point for growth: although hotel performance was better in the following months, it did not grow as fast as in the first half of the year.

"We have developed sensors to determine the A - beta peptide and protein of the S 100 B family. There are scientific data which indicate that the presence of this protein is indicative of the development of Alzheimer's disease. We have not stopped there, we will look for more markers and develop sensors to determine them. This research must be closely connected with medical institutions, because the analysis of the blood of patients affected by the disease and the constant search for reasons that lead to it will give us a tool in the form of new markers" - emphasized prof . Radecka emphasized . "If we managed to develop such a test and everything is on the right track, it would be a very helpful tool for close Alzheimer's patients. There is a lot of expectation on their part, the families of patients live in anxiety or really, + if the loved one is affected by this disease, will such a sentence await me too? + . It is not so unambiguous" - emphasized prof . Radecka emphasized.

"This study has in a way revolutionized ophthalmology - it allows to obtain knowledge about the structure of the retina in the patient, its cross-section. Previously, an ophthalmologist could see the bottom of the eye using a sight glass (ophthalmoscope - PAP note), seeing only the surface of the retina, without the possibility of analyzing deeper layers" - indicated prof . Grzybowski . Now, thanks to OCT, it is possible to see exactly what the structure of nervous tissue looks like. Thanks to a very large magnification, the study shows various types of abnormalities, also at the cellular level. Magnetic resonance imaging does not give such accuracy. To perform the examination with an ophthalmoscope or OCT, there can be no opaque cornea or cataract. Then it is possible to have an ultrasound, which, however, does not have the same accuracy as OCT - explained the ophthalmologist.

Until 10 years ago, scientists knew nothing about the existence of knots. "Since the subject is still quite fresh, until now we do not know how and why they form. We also don't know if a node on a protein gives it a specific function. This is a question which I would like to answer very much" - emphasized Dr. Sułkowska. If we make a knot on the laces, it is so that the shoe will stick to our leg. When we climb, we tie a knot so that the rope holds us. We tie up the package so that what is in it remains safe. "Usually the knots have a function. However, it is still unknown what is the function of knots on proteins. We don't know why biology has worked so hard to create such a complicated structure," said the PAP caller.

A record $14.5 billion was spent by international tourists visiting the United States in April. This means a 5 percent increase compared to April and April. r . Expenditure on tourist goods and services, including hotels, amounted to 11.2 billion USD, according to the US Department of Commerce. President Obama wanted the National Travel and Tourism Strategy to reach US$250 billion by 2021. "We light up a certain part of the epidermis with diodes. An electromagnetic wave - which is light - passes through tissues and we examine its reflected signal. On the basis of this analysis we are able to estimate some vital parameters of the human body - not only heart rate, blood pressure, but also blood glucose level" - explained Szczepaniak. He also added that the measurement methodology is based on the Lambert-Beer law, which assumes that both the amount of energy absorbed and dispersed by a given type of molecule depends directly on its concentration in a given environment. "So the properties of light that has passed through tissue are dependent on blood sugar levels," he explained. He ensured that his team carefully selected the wavelengths of the glucose molecules that circulate in the human body, so that the iSULIN system is able to determine its level with sufficient precision. The measuring device is small - it is the size of a wristwatch which is connected to a smartphone via Bluetooth. The user should install a student-designed application on the smartphone. This application is supposed to help the patient take care of his balanced diet and enable contact with medical personnel. Students have already prepared a working prototype of the device, but before the system can be launched on the market, many tests leading to its final certification are needed. However, for the time being, as they say, there are no such devices on sale yet.

Mariusz Kruk, PhD, works at the Institute of Cardiology in Warsaw. His professional and scientific activity includes invasive cardiology and invasive and non-invasive coronary vessel imaging techniques . He is the author of many original papers in the field of acute coronary syndromes and coronary imaging, co-editor of the first in Poland monograph on non-invasive cardiovascular imaging methods and patent application in the field of interventional cardiology . The Award of the Presidents of the Polish Society of Cardiology was awarded in recognition of outstanding achievements for research on the role of CT in the assessment of patients with ischemic heart disease. Prof . dr hab . Dorota Darmochwała - Cyclist works as Associate Professor in the Department and Clinic of Obstetrics and Perinatology of Medical University of Lublin . The main scientific interests of the laureate concern the issues of etiopathogenesis of hypertension accompanying pregnancy . Prof . Darmochwała - Kolarz is co-author of fourteen chapters in textbooks and monographs . She is also a reviewer in several dozen international magazines on the Philadelphia list . Did they ask about the client's history in previous hotels? Did they check the social profiles of the client and his company ? Do they use the 3P rule? Preparation . Persistence . Practice . Most "come only to the matches" hoping that the talent received from God will lead them to victory. Here is the chance. Everyone starts from the same level. Todd Iseri - author of Hotel Sales & Mar k

My boyfriend and I went on our first trip together in August 2010. They decided to go to Athens and recommended us Dorian Inn Hotel; we never had any problems at the hotel, the room was clean, we had air conditioning and a nice terrace where we could enjoy the sun. The swimming pool on the roof was small but good enough to relax a bit, in the end we were there to explore the city and not sit by the pool. I wouldn't recommend eating in the restaurant, she ordered a m salad and that was what she got m - lettuce, I couldn't find the goat cheese or dried tomatoes as described in the menu. The neighborhood is not too safe, but my boyfriend and I didn't care about it, we went out a few times in the evening and never had any problems with anyone. The staff at the hotel was really friendly and our room was cleaned every day (don't forget to put the card "please clean the room" on the door). We had a great time in Athens and I recommend this hotel to everyone.

" Poland's main problems are suspended particulates and benzopiren. The main source of these are industrial installations and heating of houses" - said the PAP EEA expert on air quality data Alberto González Ortiz . In terms of average concentrations (from all measuring stations) of PM 2 , 5 and benzopyrene our country is in the infamous top of Europe - he noted . He also added that in recent years Poland has seen a small but steady decrease in total national PM 2,5 emissions. According to the report, nitrogen dioxide pollution in Poland is the cause of 1.6 thousand premature deaths. In this respect, among 40 European countries, Poland is in 7th place: behind Great Britain, Germany, France, Spain, the Netherlands and Belgium.

One CT scanner operates at 250 MHz, the other at 1 GHz - it uses 4 times higher magnetic field and has 16 times higher sensitivity. These are tomographs for biomedical applications, for the time being laboratory - for tests on small mammals. They work faster than currently used devices of this type. They are able to measure objects larger than 2 cm, even up to 5 cm . This is an important change, because it is possible to follow the development of cancer also in mature mammals. They use the EPR techniques of electron paramedical resonance. The technology concerns free radicals, in simplification particles having an odd number of electrons forming individual bonds between individual molecules. The study is to show where the cancer is located, even if it is not yet visible. Although there are no anatomical changes, the measurement of oxygen concentration will help the doctor to indicate the cancer in the selected organ. During this examination you can start treatment and use radiation therapy to destroy the tumor.

The Head of the Ministry of Health stressed in his speech that one of the priorities and challenges facing dentistry is to promote pro-health habits in society. He expressed his satisfaction that the Congress provides all practicing dentists with an opportunity to exchange experiences and knowledge and to emphasize the role of education. "We are aware of what is also confirmed by research that oral health is extremely important for the health of the whole body. We know that in addition to the diagnosis and treatment itself, prevention and preventive measures are also very important" - noted the Minister of Health.

Part of this research is part of the project "Technology Transfer to Industry". Their results will be able to be used by specific companies in the region from different industries, as the research is carried out on their behalf. Bialystok University of Technology has signed contracts with these companies. The companies are to receive ready-made, innovative solutions and will implement them. This is to increase their competitiveness. It is also about establishing closer and long-term cooperation between the university and industry. The project includes work on eight innovations in areas such as: construction, production of agricultural machinery, water and sewage management or renewable energy sources. Researchers are working, among others, on a robot which will help to monitor underground water and sewage systems without the need for excavation. They will also design a technological line for the production of continuous silicate façade tiles. New, ecological solutions related to the use of asphalt granulate in road construction are also to be developed.

Overall, the cot looks nice. The look and design are undoubtedly advantages. The only truly wooden elements are the rungs of the side railings. The cot will not work at all if someone is planning it for more than one child. In my opinion it is better to pay a little more for a better quality product.

It follows that only a small number of cells play an important role in cancer growth and metastasis formation. They are probably responsible for the patient's illness and death. Therefore it is not necessary to destroy the whole tumour to neutralize the cancer. Conversely, it is even possible to significantly reduce the size of the tumour, which is often the case during treatment, and the disease will return anyway if the cells with the greatest ability to proliferate are not eliminated. According to Stokłos, the same is true for chronic myelogenous leukaemia, which is caused by a single mutation, the so-called BCR tyrosine kinase - ABL. It is crucial for the development of this disease. It is formed in the bone marrow stem cells, which are the cells from which all other cells can be formed.

I'm also sorry to say that I was very disappointed with this doctor. In December, a few days of terrible stomach pains started in my place. Encouraged by the opinions of my friends, I decided to have a gastroscopy examination with Dr . Potatoes. At the beginning, Dr . made a positive impression on me, nice, elegant, etc . He detected my gallbladder problems with the echinocococcosis and single Candida colonies. He ordered an ultrasound to examine the faeces for yeast and lamb, etc . I thought somebody would finally take care of me professionally. The ultrasound only showed traces of sand in the gallbladder, the faecal examination showed no parasites or fungi. After a month of waiting for another consultation, I was happy to see the results of the examination, and I was happy to see Dr. Brown in the office. He thought that the beginning of the treatment would finally be only better. The doctor looked at the results and found that he didn't expect such a "bad" result of the gallbladder ultrasound that there are "deposits" and the walls of the gallbladder are "bold", which was not in the description of the doctor who gave me this ultrasound. He said that we will have to see each other in 3 months' time, repeat the gastroscopy if the gallbladder does not heal, can we have surgery? I was frightened by the news and verbal doubts he commented with words that I should "take a handful and take medicines" after which he prescribed me antibiotics for Candide parasites that none of the tests detected and masses of other shields etc . In the pharmacy he left 'em 650 zloty for a 3-month treatment, went out with a big net and the lady in the pharmacy asked if she wants an invoice for a disability group? hehe ( I am 26 years old ) : ) Every day I was supposed to take 15 different tablets + 6 painkillers in case of ailments. I don't have to add that on the 3rd day of taking the medicines I landed in the E.R. on Kopernika Street. I had terrible abdominal pain, dizziness, diarrhea and vomiting, I could not eat anything at all. I was scared and sure that it was not side effects but that my "gallbladderitis took on the character of acute inflammation". Really, the treatment from Dr. Potato is not worth the nerves. Maybe it helps people with minor problems like curing helicobacter with reflux. . . . .but he approached my case very unprofessionally and didn't get to know me at all by insinuating chronic gastroenteritis, yeast and parasites. To sum up, I do NOT recommend it at all! ! ! ! ! ! Think twice before you decide to see this doctor. Greetings to Peter

A week ago, I had a visit to my medicine. Przemyslaw Kosiński . It was a service between 11-14 tc with risk assessment in Multi Med on Polna Street . The cost of the visit was 300 PLN . I do not want to assess the professionalism of the doctor, it seems to me that the examination was done correctly, and given the competence of the drug. Przemysław and very good equipment on which he works I think that this is what happened. However, I have reservations about the time that the doctor devoted to my person. With the watch in hand it was 10 minutes. From the very beginning the doctor was clearly in a hurry. He spoke very quickly, quickly made an ultrasound and very quickly made the documentation. He didn't give me much chance to ask all the questions I had, and by hurrying, he created a nervous atmosphere in which I could hardly think. During the examination, she asked me if I could see the sex of the child (the people who recommended me to the clinic said that it was already possible in some small way). but the doctor commented on my question that I should be more interested in a child's heart than in gender. At the end, he said goodbye twice, so that we could leave. Visiting the doctor. Przemysław Kosiński did not meet all my expectations. The most important thing for me is the hope that through haste nothing was overlooked.

leaving with friends in September 2017 . The first impression is not bad. The reception looks quite encouraging. At the entrance we were greeted by two nice girls. They asked us in English which country we are from, and then handed us the registration cards to fill in. The room was small, you could say that the look of the room was the same as the pictures. Unfortunately the bathrooms. . . Tragedy! The hotel is definitely not opened last year. The bathrooms are 10 years old. They're not exactly cleaned either. On the taps, the old curtain is on the shower. We bought paper towels and chemicals in the nearest shop (about 2km from the hotel) and for a good day we tried to get a good look at the bathrooms so we could use them normally. The cistern in the toilet was broken all the time. I won't say - after reporting it at the reception, somebody came and repaired it, but one day, in turn, we simply repaired it ourselves. The room was cleaned every other day (washing the floor with a mop), towels for the whole stay (7 days) changed 2 or 3 times. Interestingly, despite leaving the towels on the floor, they were not changed, but hung back on the hanger. We have just come back from a "weekend" stay in Amax, we were tempted to go to this hotel after reading positive reviews. There was a free villa for 4 people, they went with a husband and a child - 2 days is a cost of 1600 PLN so the more they drove us with peace, without worrying what awaits us on the spot. The price finally obliges? The hotel is located in a nice place, we could park our car at the very house. Cottage in the middle requiring renovation, such a typical communist era, old tiles, bathroom in need of renovation, old furniture, fireplace, kitchen equipped with plates of cutlery, etc. A small fridge (and here, after opening it because we came with a month on the girlla, a glass bottle of beer threw up - of course the cost extra payable). A 2-storey cottage downstairs living room with an annexe + a bathroom. Upstairs 2 bedrooms in the bedrooms are full of spiders, flies, flies - but the husband somehow managed to deal with them - although in my opinion the hotel staff should take care of something like that before guests arrive. Bathrooms equipped with sets of cosmetics, I do not know if the quality is good because we have not used anything except soap for washing hands. What surprised us at the very beginning was the number of towels - if the house is for 4 people, then each person should have a set of towels, so we always got them in other hotels. Surprisingly not in the Amax, 2 large towels + 4 small ones to wipe at most the legs or hair on the head. We lit up the grill, sat down, went for a walk to explore the area, and that's all. In the morning breakfast, we were expecting wow - because of the price we paid, as well as the feedback from the facility. And here's another surprise - very poor breakfast, hot scrambled eggs, and sausages, 3 / 4 kinds of wedding cheese, yellow cheese cottage cheese, eggs tomatoes, cucumbers, jellies with what stuffing in the middle, pâté, bread (bread and broccoli), breakfast cereals, yoghurt only Augustów natural yoghurt, coffee tea, juice from the liqueur, and lemonade. What surprised us the most was the lack of fruit. We focused on the standard of scrambled eggs, bread and wedding. It was tasty. But really looking through the prism of the price we paid for 2 nights is very poor. In the hotel there is a swimming pool (from what I read even 2) we saw one - outside. There was a lot of insects swimming in it, so we went to the center of the micaceous, rented a refrigerator and so we spent the whole day. We came back around 6 p.m. - the cottage wasn't cleaned - but around Sunday, maybe the hotel staff is finally free. We lit up the barbecue, the doorbell - the cleaning staff asking if we need to clean the house? We found out that there is no point in cleaning at this time, especially since we have to leave in the morning - so what is the point of cleaning at this time? I thought the rooms were being cleaned in the morning? I'll add that the water bottles were also not delivered to us for another day. During the barbecue we found that it was a shame that we chose this hotel because we only wasted money, and for 300 / 600 zloty more we could have a room at the Hotel Mikolajki, or in Golebiewski. But it's like a man wants something different. After the barbecue we packed up and at 20 we returned home, in the end we had nothing to lose anyway - except for travel, another night and breakfast was not worth it. With + and only, a barbecue which is available on the spot, a quiet place with a nice view - and the rest are unfortunately disadvantages. We are demanding with our husband - and the price just isn't right for the quality. To pay 200 zloty a day for a room is okay, but for money like we paid, we were expecting wow. Anyway, the last time we suggested the opinions of people on the internet, because as you can see every person has different requirements, different standards and so on. Maybe for some people a stay in the Amax is a dream holiday, rest and so on. Not for us. We travel a lot, we have been in many hotels, and we are demanding people. The price should, in our opinion, go hand in hand with quality, here it did not happen. The first visit to this place and the last. Personally we do not recommend.
