Generally speaking, the hotel is not one of the better ones. Most of the rooms are humid and smell bad, the air-conditioning is working, but also feel in the air that needs maintenance. Bathrooms require a thorough overhaul, the joints show a mold, adjustment of the wash basin faucets in many rooms also requires patience, but perhaps the worst thing that happened in our bathroom was the leaky sewage system. During the week the room was cleaned only once. A rat settled in one of the rooms. The hotel staff does not understand English. You can only communicate with the cleaners by means of gestures, the lady from the reception desk is trying very hard, but you could notice problems during the conversation. The only people you could get along with were the manager and the restaurant manager. Both men were very helpful. Waiters are young boys whose behavior does not necessarily appeal to women and conservative older people, although they try to keep tourists happy. The hotel is situated on a gentle hill, but the passage from the concrete shore to the restaurant or reception does not require huge energy deposits. As for the shore itself - no sand, no stones - just concrete, sharp slabs, which are dangerously slippery at high tides. No gentle descent into the water - you fall directly into the depth of about 3 meters (harbour bay). The shore is unfortunately contaminated with rubbish, bottles, dead fish and parts of boats. The area of the swimming pool is systematically visited by local dogs, which have no resistance to bathing or heating up on hotel deckchairs. The staff does not react to such situations, which is also an indication of the level of service. Regional food, served mostly cold / half warm. Tables are unfortunately often dirty. Only one type of beer, crayfish, wine and pure vodka is available in the bar, which was still missing. . . Plastic cups were not washed, but rather only rinsed, so many times the drinks had to be replaced. Wi - Fi free of charge in the reception hall and in its vicinity, no reach in the rooms. The surroundings of the hotel completely "non-residential" - highway and market. The hotel for people who do not require almost anything except the weather.

Cash-only payments, which in business and non-cash transactions is an inconvenient obstacle in the settlement of business trips. Stay on the road - one night with breakfast of two people for a good 220 PLN . Miserable breakfasts - no hot meal. At eight o'clock there was only water after the sausages (I suspect) until you ask for scrambled eggs. The cost of breakfast is realistically calculated by counting the roads, 23 zł in the package for 1 person for the night, standard 25. At night, noisy and poor soundproofing of rooms. The standard is worthy of a hostel with a dubious reputation, especially because of the stinking fumes of dirt from the sewage system and ventilation. Dirt, conditions that are very bad for the hotel, so beware of Room 337 and the whole thing!

It used to be a place to go back to. Today it's just good cuisine. Snuggle, spray. Rooms that aren't ventilated and smell musty. Rooms cut out by force. One example of the difficulties our body is currently facing is the excessive amount of sugar we supply ourselves with every day. "Anthropological studies have shown that our ancestors consumed 200 grams of sugar per year 10,000 years ago. Today the average American eats 200 grams of sugar a day. It is not possible for us to adapt to such a change in evolution," emphasized Dr. med. Daniel Slide. Nowadays, sugar is in almost every product on the store shelves and has a strong addictive effect. We have become so addicted to sugar that without it many products do not taste good at all. "Meanwhile, in the past sweets were made several times a year for special occasions. Nobody ate a candy bar when he was in a bad mood" - recalled Dr. Magdalena Tomaszewska - Bolałek.

A beautiful tenement house decorated in an industrial way with an incredible climate. The spacious, modern rooms will satisfy even the most picky ones. She booked me and paid for my room two months ago. Yesterday in the middle of the night after she arrived she got m room smelling of cigarettes . The problem is that too high a dose of insulin not matching the amount of food and exercise can lead to a large drop in blood sugar, the so-called hypoglycemia. "It is the hypoglycemia that the athletes, parents and, of course, doctors are most afraid of," noted Dr. Gawrecki. Hypoglycemia can manifest itself in weakness, drowsiness, increased sweating, hand trembling, nausea, but also in behavioural changes and aggression. In extreme situations and lack of help leads to coma, convulsions, loss of consciousness and even death. "The patient and his parents need to be educated so that they can best prepare for physical activity - e.g. take into account the reduction of insulin doses, or the possible intake of additional carbohydrates if the blood glucose value decreases significantly. For this purpose it is necessary to strictly control the glycemia after training, also at night, because then hypoglycemia can also occur" - explained Dr. Gawrecki. According to him, this requires good cooperation with a diabetologist and a lot of self-discipline from children and parents.

Well done and stable. We have been using for a year and we are satisfied . The only significant drawback is the way we move around the room with this chair. Because it only has wheels at the back, to move it, you have to lift the front part, there is only one problem - there is no need to grab it. All the parts are quite strong, but even with a slight lift (and even more so with the child inside), you bend the parts you grab and feel like something is about to break. In the show film there is a fictional way of moving, because in such a bend you can break your spine :) . It is often the case that you only need to slightly change the position of the chair or move it to the table with your child and every time you have a big problem with it. The best thing to do would be to attach the strap to the lower part of the front legs and then a small lift would allow you to move it. Besides, everything is ok. Maybe two such lightweight covers on the backrest would also be useful, because it is made of leatherette and the child lying on it sweats immediately - so easy washability is also not entirely true, because you always have to put something under the child's bottom, back and head so that it does not sweat. In general I think it is good, I have a comparison with another seat and this one is much better.

Dr Katarzyna Niemirowicz-Laskowska from the UMB said that studies have been carried out, which show that the developed product both improves the so-called "lubricity" (associated with friction), but also has antimicrobial properties, takes care of hygiene for the patient, because it does not allow the development of plaque. "The whole art lies in the fact that each preparation has its own specific properties, while obtaining several beneficial properties in one preparation is certainly a challenge. And this does not mean that we have made the best preparation, absolutely not. You know you have to work on it. However, we have managed to create a preparation that at least combines four or five properties of natural saliva. This is a phenomenon" - said prof . Tsar.

Nice, calm and that's where his + ends. I was at his place with spurs in Euromedicare. He wasn't very communicative and he was probably a bimba as to what is being said to him. He didn't really help me and she had to go to someone else's house in private.

As a member of the Le Club Accor programme, I have a strong reference to many hotels in the Accora chain - from budget to luxury hotels. However, in full knowledge, I can say that this is the first hotel where I really felt I was treated as a guest. The hotel's staff - full of professionalism, from the friendly reception desk to the restaurant, breakfast room and housekeeping. As a member of the LCAH, he received an upgrade of the rooms that he booked 'em in, a gift was waiting in the room with a handwritten welcome letter from the hotel's director. As part of the welcome drink - a wide range of offers. As part of the "Time for Sightseeing" offer, we received free vouchers from the hotel to be used in the Gdynia Film Centre, which is located next to the hotel. Free non-alcoholic beverages in the Privilege room - a great solution, although we used them in moderation: ) . I recommend the hotel restaurant - especially fish soup we liked. And Mr. Luke - a waiter, who . . . sweeps - an amazing personality - the right person in the right place. The hotel's swimming pool is the weakest point of the facility - it is probably currently in the swimming school franchise, but this does not bother the hotel guests - a little bit intimate, but the advantage is the full size and sauna. The location of the hotel is excellent - it is close to the harbour and there are many cool bars and pubs nearby. The surroundings of Gdynia Film Centre and Music Theatre adds to the reputation of the place. Generally speaking, my opinion of the hotel is actually the highest possible. The hotel has restored my faith in the LCAH Program, which after previous experience did not have too high "flights" with me. After this stay I realized that the assumptions of the program are not bad, but it mainly depends on the management, the prudence of the staff and the quality of service - for me a hotel managed in a model way! I recommend to everyone - I will definitely come back.

A great doctor. Competent, with great knowledge and experience. Able to accept a patient at home almost in the middle of the night or come with a home visit . As a super doctor, but certainly not an accessible person. Rather rude and closed in on himself.

I'm adding two " stars " just because of the beautiful countryside. Besides, I have no reason to come back here. Unfortunately, the hotel has lived through years of its glory, which can be seen in the already worn out (at least in our room) shower head, broken wardrobe handles and drawers or windows that are difficult to close (the guy at hand had no dare at all ;)). I especially do not recommend staying in this hotel to people whose diet is different from the "traditional" one. My mother cannot eat gluten or lactose because of the disease, but I am a vegetarian. We informed you about this fact when booking a room by phone. On the day of arrival, we were informed that the dinner is organized in a barbecue. We didn't have anything to look for there, so we were invited to the Charlotte restaurant instead, but it wasn't as colourful as we expected. Of the main dishes only two are vegetarian - a salad with mould cheese and cranberry sauce (if you can call it a main course) and dumplings with spinach and mould cheese. Therefore, no vegetarian soups in the restaurant are a choice. When asked what vegetarian soup the waiter could offer me, she got me a proposal of fish, I am sorry that the hotel employs staff clearly suggesting that fish is a plant. My mother was offered a broth, it's just a pity that the waiter forgot that the pasta contains gluten. In addition, at breakfast the other day, my mother was given gluten-free bread (great!), but no margarine was served in which there would be far less milk than in butter or gluten-free sausage. She ended up eating dry bread with vegetables. Unfortunately, she did not get gluten-free dessert either. For our stay, she and her mother received several "coupons". , for billiards / bowling, 100zł to the spa and for dessert in the . in . restaurant . Just like the first two I can't get attached to the first one, we took advantage of it and we were very pleased : ) As to the third one, unfortunately, I have to, because as it turned out in the restaurant, this dessert is nothing but a cup of ice cream and whipped cream, which my mother could not eat, for known reasons - lactose, sorbets unfortunately the restaurant does not have. As for the spa - I took advantage of the classic massage, mom with henna eyebrows, we were very pleased. In the pool unfortunately cold water. The main purpose of coming to this place was probably for us to relax and enjoy the silence, unfortunately we also did not experience this. On the second day of our stay in the hotel was organized a wedding, about which unfortunately the lady in the registration when booking a room did not inform us, and it's a pity, because they certainly would have chosen to laugh with Mom somewhere else. There was no nighttime silence, all night long there was loud music playing, which resulted in my sleeplessness, and for the next day I was waiting for a 4-hour drive. To sum up, we are not going to return to this hotel, unfortunately, the beautiful surroundings are not everything.

The stay in this hotel was a pleasant surprise. Nice rooms, all well maintained, nice atmosphere. The only thing that did not deserve 5 stars is the indoor swimming pool (entering it hits us with such a strong smell of chlorine that man immediately resigned) and Jacuzzi (tragic). One of the advantages of this hotel is that it has a wonderful staff: Yordanka - animator, a wonderful girl who took care of our active holiday, at the same time gained our friendship with her kindness and cheerfulness - if you hit on her you will have a wonderful holiday. I will also have a very nice memory of the bartenders at the "Disco": George and Andrew - I admire the fact that although they have unpleasant situations with guests who are too drunk, they are still authentically friendly and cheerful. Not to mention that they know their job and make very good drinks. I think the nice bartender in the lobby bar also deserves to be mentioned, unfortunately she didn't know his name (tall, black hair to the neck). Unlike a few other bartenders there, there was no feeling of pretending kindness from him. I couldn't help but mention the bartender Ria. I will miss her very much. As for the food: very tasty, but a little heavy (at least for me). The area of the resort is huge, so it was a pleasant surprise to me that it is so neat. Every day at 21. 30 is organized in the amphitheatre (the best in my opinion was the spectacle "Circus"), so you can not complain about boredom. To sum up the hotel deserves its 5 stars, it looks as beautiful as the pictures. The big advantage is the great service, especially people dedicated to their work, which I mentioned here. I recommend it with a clear conscience and I will surely come back there one day : )

This, unfortunately, came as a surprise to us, there is a fundamental difference when I can choose after a small amount from several hot and cold assortments and not as we were offered. This has left a "rasp" after this pleasant stay. But in general, the stay is a success.

The biologist admits that it is even more difficult - and in the case of people completely unethical - to get offspring from two males. In this case it is necessary to induce the male individuals to produce oocytes. The scientist explains that from an embryo of the male sex one obtains embryonic stem cells, which have the ability to differentiate into germ cells. When these cells multiply, in 3% of them there is a spontaneous loss of the Y chromosome. From such cells you can then - after adding the X chromosome from male cells - obtain female mice - chimeras, which produce egg cells originating from male embryonic stem cells . These chimeras are crossed with a sexually mature male . In this way they can be born young, whose genetic material comes from two male individuals.

I recommend this Lord to all those who would like to go to an uninteresting performance - the monodrama "Immunology - Supplement" . I strongly advise against it. I have been treating infertility for 3 years, I am after the failed ICSI. Immunology was a mystery for me, which I wanted to solve in my office on Górczewska Street. She took with her all the tests: hormones, ultrasound, etc. The "doctor" from the beginning was not interested in the tests I brought with me or what I have to say. The visit itself is practically a 30 minute lecture about infertility. The doctor used a card, a pen and a marker to explain why there is no embryo development. All the time he used English terms and phrases, getting deeper and deeper into immunology. He did not pay any attention to my case and the characteristics of the problem. He even said that "please don't tell me anything, because you'll mess with my head". The possibility of treatment was conditioned by the abundance of his wallet, repeating several times that "he can do anything for me for 7 thousand. He said, "You can do me a base for a thousand and a few studies for 1 thousand" - without any elaboration or description. It did not guarantee cure, success, failure - it did not explain how these studies would help and look. All the time the "doctor" maintained the pose of a wise man and the "alpha and omega" infertility issues. The visit cost 200 PLN and it was money that the man simply cheated. If he hadn't had the distance to this category of swindlers and magicians, he would have left me in a state of total disintegration and loss - including the "doctor" is a true master. I sincerely advise against meeting this man.

The specialist said that so far in neurosurgery traditional neuronavigation has been used. It consists in the fact that a day, and at the latest a few hours before the surgery, the brain imaging of the patient is performed by means of magnetic resonance imaging and computed tomography. Then they are inserted into the neuro-navigation system, which leads the neurosurgeons to the place in the brain to be operated on. "The latest method is intraoperative neuro-navigation, which allows to perform procedures in real time. Thanks to this, brain operations can be even more precise" - emphasized prof . The tooth. They are performed in a magnetic field, obtained thanks to magnetic resonance imaging 3 , 0 Tesla. They are so precise that they allow to determine the operation field with the accuracy of 1 mm.

"This all translated into later problems with the functioning of the reproductive system, concerning the puberty and adult period. Female rats were pregnant and had offspring. However, they observed that their reproductive cycle was more irregular than usual. On the one hand, puberty was delayed, on the other hand, the sexual cycle itself became irregular. This means that in the examined rats, compared to the control group, the period during which reproduction is possible at all was shortened," noted Dr. hab . Śliwowska . The problems may concern many life processes influenced by hormones: those connected with regulation of the sexual cycle, with getting pregnant, with her reporting, and even with the contact between mother and child.

However, the usefulness of the camera is not determined by the resolution of images alone. The authors of the message point out that the main advantage of the device from IBIB PAS is the non-invasiveness of the measurement - the light emitted by laser diodes is completely safe and does not cause changes in tissues. Equally important is the simplicity of testing . It is enough to place a cap with fiber optics attached to it on the patient's head and inject a small dose of contrasting agent into the patient. The examination itself takes only a few minutes and can be repeated many times during the day. What is more, the measuring equipment in the laboratory version, i.e. not yet miniaturized, has the size of a refrigerator. It is mobile and you can go to bed with it even a seriously ill patient treated in an intensive care unit. It can also be used in the operating room.

Doctors are reluctant to talk about their own mistakes or those of their colleagues, for fear of professional consequences or in the name of falsely understood professional solidarity. This is not only taught by medical studies in Poland, but also in other countries, except perhaps Scandinavia and the Netherlands. This should be changed," Cranovsky told PAP. He appeals - together with prof . This disorder occurs in the bone marrow stem cells, i.e. those from which all other cells can form, in this case produced in the bone marrow. This mutation stimulates the bone marrow to produce an excessive number of immature white blood cells (granulocytes, immune cells), which are more viable and replace those which are normal. This damages the bone marrow and does not adequately protect against infections. When they penetrate the bloodstream, they also damage internal organs such as the spleen and kidneys. 15 years ago, the first drug to inhibit BCR mutation - ABL - was developed, which is key to the development of myelogenous leukaemia. Since then, several other similarly acting drugs have also been introduced. However, over time, the disease may move into the stage of so-called blastic crisis, when a significant number of immature stem cells (blasts) appear in the patient's blood.

In the case of biosimilar medicines, the aim is to make the medicine as similar as possible to the reference design - because identity cannot be achieved anyway. "A biosimilar drug must have the appropriate quality, safety and efficacy - in that order" - said Professor Spławiński . According to him it is not possible - for ethical reasons - to compare the therapeutic value of biosimilar drugs in large clinical trials. The Chief Pharmaceutical Inspector, Zofia Ulz , informed that the institution she manages conducts about 1,000 inspections at a cost of PLN 5 million in various locations (manufacturers, warehouses, distribution) every year. The inspections are also carried out on an ongoing basis by the manufacturers at each stage of production to ensure high, repeatable quality - so that the drug always has the same composition and effect and is free of undesired additives.

"The lack of importance for the quality and regularity of meals is particularly evident in the case of breakfasts. Some people give up on them at all, motivated by a lack of time or appetite" - comments research scientist Ewa Jagiełło. "It seems that the lifestyle they lead is not associated with ignorance, but rather with ignorance of this knowledge and a lack of internalisation of the rules which favour a healthier and more hygienic life - says Dr Ewa Jagiełło . It turns out that the need to take care of oneself often depends on being in a relationship. This is not only about health, but also about hygiene. It is only the intimate relationship that motivates one to maintain it more.

Strategmed is a strategic research and development programme developed by the Council of the National Centre for Research and Development based on the National Research Programme. The document defined the directions of scientific research and development works strategic for the state and defined civilization diseases as the greatest health threat for the Polish population in the perspective of the next years. The list of civilization diseases includes, among others, cardiovascular system diseases, malignant tumors and mental diseases.

The nanofibres used by Dr . Urszula Stachewicz's surfaces are a million times thinner than a human hair - their thickness is less than one micron, i.e. from several dozen to several hundred nanometers ) . They are made of polymers - molecules which can be compared to a string with a million pearls. The surface area of such nanofibrous materials is very large in relation to their mass or volume. Nanofibres have been used in medicine for about a decade, among others as a component of dressings and bandages, and even one of the layers of artificial blood vessels. In the future, nanofibres can be used to treat bone defects. And although for now it sounds like a fantasy, the research conducted by Dr Stachewicz from the International Centre of Electron Microscopy for Material Engineering at the AGH University of Science and Technology in Krakow leads to this goal.

The Novotel brand of the Accor chain continues to modernize its hotel base in Poland. Last year, 4 hotels were renovated and another five in the coming months. The architects are working on their new decor and arrangement, in line with the trends in interior design, adapting them to the global standards and requirements of the brand. Room modernization This year the brand plans to modernize almost 500 rooms in Poland. The project is focused on the Novotel Warszawa Centrum hotel - this flagship facility is currently undergoing renovation of 249 rooms on 10 floors. Similar changes are taking place at Novotel Warszawa Airport, after last year's modernisation of 40 rooms, another 40 units will be renovated this year. The other three hotels are also planning renovation works, including 60 rooms at Novotel Szczecin Centrum, 50 rooms at Novotel Poznan Malta and 70 bathrooms at Novotel Krakow Centrum.

"The former library building, which has been renovated by the university, now houses the Information and Library Centre, the Office of Science, Strategy and Development, the Centre for Innovation and Technology Transfer, the Business Incubator and the university's archive. The library itself, after modernization, does not deviate from the world standard, especially in terms of its functioning" - emphasized the rector of the University of Lodz. M . prof . Paweł Górski . The metamorphosis that the library building has undergone over the last year consists not only in revitalizing the interior and equipment, but also in giving it new functions. Thanks to the applied solutions, it has become possible, among other things, to lend books by oneself with the help of kiosks, order books to a bookshop, and return them to the launcher and to the shelf for quick returns. There were created zones for individual and group learning. Users have access to desktop computers, self-service copiers and printers. Access to the library part of the building is 24 hours a day .

" The basic method of thyroid prophylaxis is the examination of thyroid hormones from blood and ultrasound of the thyroid gland. Thyroid ultrasound performed once every two years allows to detect even the smallest changes within the thyroid gland" - emphasizes Elżbieta Kozik, president of the Polish Amazons Social Movement (PARS), quoted in a press release sent to PAP. For years PARS has been conducting an educational campaign on thyroid cancer entitled "Butterflies under protection ( www . butterfly protection . pl ) . The basic test helpful in the assessment of thyroid function is the measurement of thyrotropin ( TSH ) - a pituitary hormone which stimulates the secretion of thyroid hormones. In the case of abnormal TSH concentration, it is advisable to determine the level of thyroid hormones in the form of so-called . free (nonprotein-bound), i.e. free thyroxine ( FT4 ) and free triiodothyronine ( FT3 ) . The level of anti-thyrooperoxidase antibodies ( anti-TPO ), which increases in autoimmune Hashimoto's disease, is also assessed.

Migraines are generally ignored. Many people think they are just ordinary headaches and do not go to the doctor for advice. "We prefer to take painkillers and sick leave rather than to undergo appropriate treatment that helps every other patient," the specialist who also acts as a regional consultant in neurology emphasizes. According to prof . Stępnia, almost 40% . Poles suffering from migraine never reported their ailments to the doctor. And only every second patient has ever consulted a doctor at least once. Meanwhile, the therapy helps to shorten the time of a migraine attack, which usually lasts from 12 to 24 hours. It also helps to reduce the significant deterioration of mental condition during this period.

Dr. Kucharski led my 2 pregnancies and in this respect it worked out quite well, but so would any other gynaecologist, because my pregnancies were running properly and without complications. The doctor was nice, kind, witty, although during every visit (and there were quite a few of them) she had the impression that if everything is ok he wants to get rid of me as soon as possible and accept the next patient (because it is known that it is money, money, money . . . . ) . During a few years of my visits he did not offer me a breast examination, once she asked me for it, so with great grace he did the examination. Dr Kucharski also decided that a simple ultrasound examination is not necessary for me at all except during pregnancy. I was surprised when I finally got a solid gynecologist, who discovered a polycystic ovary syndrome during a routine ultrasound. Unfortunately, for many years Dr Kucharski did not associate my symptoms with this disease (e.g. irregular menstruation). All my infections were treated with the same antibiotic, although they were coming back like a boomerang, not even offering me to do the simplest inoculation and adjust the treatment individually to my needs. Hotel Azzun is promoted as "an intimate place with a unique design and atmosphere". In my opinion, this is not true. First of all, the hotel is located at the BP gas station and nothing spoils the climate as much as the view of the gas station. . . Secondly, the hotel is located on the busy Augustów - Olsztyn route. The hotel, although formally in the Masuria region, is far from the lakes. If you expect a quiet place among forests and lakes, you will be disappointed. The location fits more into a motorway motel for one night. The room - at the price of 250 PLN per one - is disappointing. From the window view of the roof covered with tar paper, small size. Unfriendly atmosphere . I resigned from my stay after the first 10 minutes, for this price you should expect something more. The decor of the hotel itself - which is supposed to resemble Roman thermal baths - is more overwhelming than relaxing. It's neither Roman nor Masurian thermae. This indecision as to the character of the place is its greatest disadvantage. The Roman thermae are best in Czeladz - and it's better to go there if you're a thermal fan. If you're looking for an intimate hotel in Masuria, choose agritourism. If you are looking for a place to have fun with a swimming pool - go to Mrągowo, e.g. Mrongovia Hotel (30 km away), where there is a sports pool, children's pool, slides, bowling etc.

In the street towards the beach there is a La Mona Lisa pub with excellent pizzas and pasta, a very nice owner and cool old music. It is worth asking for items outside the menu! Attention, closed on Sunday, despite the season. For families with children, who don't need any additional animation, because it's not good enough. It's a waste of time to sit in a hotel and soak your ass in a salt pool, but as a "home" to relax after active days of sightseeing, bathing and walking - an excellent choice!

Strokes rank third among the causes of death and are the main cause of disability for people over 40 . Annually, 60 to 70 thousand strokes are recorded in Poland - 30% of them lead to death within the first year. Half of patients suffer from hemiplegia six months after the stroke. Among survivors of strokes, about 70% remain disabled, with 50% requiring assistance and care of other people due to their physical and mental impairment. 29 October is celebrated as World Brain Stroke Day . The 4 simple steps that can save lives are promoted by the association "Stroke victims - support counts" ( www.udarowcy.com.pl . ) If we suspect a stroke in someone, just ask him to smile, say a simple sentence and raise his arms. Stroke does not allow you to smile - on the affected side the corner of the mouth falls down. Saying simple sentences and understanding speech are difficult, and raising your arms is impossible or possible to a limited extent. If any of these symptoms occur, call the emergency number immediately.

If someone needs to rest from the city, spend a romantic evening and sink in time it is an ideal place. I recommend it!

Our first room was so small that when we unfolded the suitcase, we couldn't get through. The ventilation in the bathroom did not work and the bathroom door did not close. O 7 . At 00 a.m. I was woken up by a child running around the corridor because the rooms were not quiet. Unfortunately, we also had the unpleasantness to listen to all the discussions of our neighbors and, I suppose, our neighbors as well. The room was exchanged for another one - the one you couldn't complain about, although there was still a shortage of wardrobes, TV and fridge did not work. We didn't want to keep running to the reception and asking for repairs. SPA - has nothing to do with SPA. The dry sauna - so designer, that there is nowhere to sit. During our 6-day stay, we set it up heated up to 60 degrees. The showers belonging to the sauna had hot water. The handles in the sauna are metal and wrapped in a piece of skin. In the wet sauna there was standing water ( ? ?? ) . We could not find the brine. It is empty. The massage was ok, but trying to make an appointment for it required a lot of commitment on my part; because the lady from the reception desk said that she does not understand the spa schedule :) I was also supposed to receive a confirmation of the time by phone. . . She had to call me herself. The cleaning took place only at 3 pm. 00 . Cosmetics were not a trussardi company, as the hotel advertises on the site, moreover, my partner and I received a bottle of gel & shampoo to use together. Parking is also a misunderstanding. There wasn't enough space, the guests had to pawn other guests, and the pawning also happened to the staff. We were pulling out of bed to move the car. The strong point of Noname is the kitchen and restaurant service. Strolling around we could still hear other guests complaining about falling shelves, lack of light bulbs, cold water in the shower and smoke in the room. We felt a little bit like intruders, because although the staff, especially in the restaurant, tried to make it as convenient as they could, some things couldn't get over. At farewell, the lady at the reception desk was very obstructive, and the comment on fb was removed. I wouldn't recommend it. We won't come back.

A modern hotel located in a quiet area with facilities offering luxurious holiday apartments, in the vicinity of a golf course and a congress centre. The service is cordial and always helpful. Catering in the form of a rich buffet and dinner enriched with live cooking. A footbridge leads to the beach (the gate opens with the key to the hotel room), which joins the sect of footbridges stretching along the coast (attention protected area - saw with her own eyes the snake sneaking between the vegetation? ) . The beach is long and sandy, to the characteristic and picturesque rock formations of the Algarve coastline walking along the beach to the west about 4 . 5 km . The hotel is perfect for walking enthusiasts and those who prefer to avoid the bustling holiday centres.

Building : There are two buildings in the centre. The first one, the main one, is after renovation, with spacious rooms of the standard that was presented in the offer. The second house (unfortunately, we spent the night there) is an older object and of a significantly lower standard: tight rooms without balconies, beds inserted "for the amount". so there's no way to turn around, besides the rooms haven't been cleaned for a long time (dry trampled cherry on the floor, shower cobwebs, cobwebs, not washed and not sweeping the floor for a long time. . . ) WIFI is only available at the new facility, so every time you had to go there to be online. For three days the router did not let you connect. With other problems: in the old building in the evening the power was switched off - you had to turn on the fuse, which anyway after a while "popped out". It is hard to say if too much equipment was turned on at the same time or if the installation was damaged during our stay. It was a bit cumbersome. The area: great facilities for small children - trampoline, toys - organized in the form of a playground. Parking on the premises - on green grass, gate closed for the night. Service: very nice, mostly made up of young people. Eating: breakfast in the form of a Swedish table, no option of eating something warm for breakfast, such as sausages or scrambled eggs. Pretty little diversified and monotonous breakfast menu, may get bored after 3 days of stay. Two-course dinners, tasty soups, second courses are also ok. Coffee, tea, cocoa and bread, lard, white cheese and jam are available throughout the day (in the main building) - a very cool option. I recommend accommodation in the main building.

Silesian scientists conduct research on laboratory animals, human tissues collected for other purposes during ophthalmological operations and on the tissues of the eye remaining after corneal transplantation. "We have developed a model of chronic neuropathy of the optic nerve, which is a model of experimental animal-induced glaucoma that progresses over time, so we could investigate what is happening in the eye in the course of glaucoma" - explained prof . Lewin - Kowalik . Scientists are investigating, among other things, the possibilities of using soil cells, which have already been successfully used in patients with damaged spinal cord. "They tried to induce regeneration or prevent the death of retinal ganglion cells by giving them the possibility of contact with peripheral soil cells - Schwann's cells and it turned out that it does them very well. I think that as our knowledge develops, glial cells will play a huge role in many corrective actions in the nervous system," said the professor.

Shortening the tedious and lengthy process of discovering a new drug will make it possible, for example, to use the old, already known drug for a completely new purpose. This is what the team led by Dr Monika Marcinkowska intends to do. "Recently, our colleagues from the Institute of Psychiatry and Neurology in Warsaw discovered that the well-known sleeping drug zolpidem, administered to experimental animals in very small doses, has an antipsychotic effect," explains the researcher. In rats, psychosis symptoms can be caused by administering appropriate substances such as amphetamine. "The animals are then put into a state of hyperlocution. Then the test substance is administered - in this case zolpidem - and the effect of reversal of hyperlocomotion is tested. These are standard pre-clinical tests, which are performed to assess the effectiveness of a potential antipsychotic" - explains PAP Dr Marcinkowska .

The location is undoubtedly one of the greatest assets of this place - within the center of the place we can reach everywhere quickly even on foot. The room is a bit small, but with a bathroom in the room, which other hostels may envy. Sockets at human height (no need to crawl under the bed or bend over the wardrobe to charge the phone). The bedside lamp (it's a pity that it's only on one), flat screen TV on the wall, wardrobe with lots of hangers, bedside lamp by the bed. In the summer, the construction of a three-star hotel for the "famous international chain" is to begin in Wroclaw on Traugutta Street. The building, whose investor is a real2b development company, will be built opposite the DoubleTree by Hilton hotel currently under construction. The planned facility will have over 130 rooms. The total area of the facility is nearly 6 thousand square meters, distributed over seven overground storeys and a garage. The investment is to be completed in approx. 18 months, which means that the opening of the hotel for first guests is expected at the beginning of 2016. The plot on which the Wroclaw hotel will be built belongs to one of the shareholders of Real2b - Marek Falenta. The company announces that it is looking for new plots of land for such facilities in the largest Polish cities.

Typical family hotel. Spacious apartments, with a kitchenette, on a high level. Always thoroughly cleaned. Hotel Incekum West 4 * met expectations - the location of the hotel is very interesting - a small sandy beach in the hotel area, access to the sea from a wooden platform and ladders provided the opportunity to enjoy the charm of sea bathing. The hotel's swimming pool is not too big, but for those who do not like sea bathing it is enough. The number and availability of deckchairs and umbrellas is sufficient, there were no problems with finding a free and convenient place to sunbathe or hide in the shade. The beach equipment was also available for hotel guests on a separate piece of sandy city beach. There was also a distributor with cold drinks and water available for guests. High level board 3 meals (breakfast, lunch, dinner) in the form of buffet with a large selection of main dishes and appetizers, salads, fruit and cakes; and 1 meal in the form of hamburger snacks, fries and the so-called "cookie hour" during which cookies and cakes were served at the bar. Quite a lot of places at the tables in the restaurant and the bar. It was possible to book a table for dinner. The hotel room was modest but neat and regularly cleaned - daily toilet cleaned, towels changed every other day and bed linen changed twice a week. The hotel staff is very friendly despite problems with English language skills. The only disadvantage of the hotel is the lack of evening entertainment for adults, after the animation for children in the form of mini disco there was no animation or disco for adult hotel guests.

Hello, the manufacturer on the packaging clearly suggests that the device is very precisely measured. Unfortunately, with this thermometer you can at most check if the chicken has already thawed. It is definitely not suitable for measuring the temperature in a child, especially in the pre-febrile states. I bought this thermometer in Legnica in a shop at 37/38 Mickiewicza Street. The seller claimed that he had no complaints. They bought it because a child 10 months old had a fever. Unfortunately, despite the measurement according to the instructions, the subsequent temperature readings within 1 minute differed by 1, 5 oC to 2 oC . This is far too much dissimilarity considering that for a child with an infection 36 , 6 and 38 , 6 is a huge difference . After calling a doctor with a touchless thermometer it turned out that the child has a fever. I advertised this toy thermometer demanding a refund.

- Nearly one third of American and Canadian tourists (32% and 31% respectively) see business trips as an opportunity to get to know a new city or place, while for Chinese travelers it seems more important to get to know and use a higher class hotel. For travelers from Brazil, on the other hand, a business trip is an opportunity to take advantage of everything that a paid trip offers. - Business travel is the biggest problem for UK residents; as much as 38% of the country's citizens do not like it or see it as a sacrifice of personal time and time spent with their families. - Nearly half (46%) of all business travellers have extended their travel to leisure time in the past, while a quarter (25%) always "organise" some personal time for themselves when travelling on business. - One in three business travellers (33%) find it important to visit a hotel and get to know its offer.

My friends and I went to a hotel for the weekend. As a person without a couple, I had a single room. The weather was ugly, the outside was cold, the room was completely unheated. After the radiator was opened, not much has changed because of the very high room and the small radiator. The swimming pool area - a failure. The pool was icy, the jacuzzi was barely warm - we found out that the day before there was a breakdown, but nobody informed us about it, nor did they offer a discount after the fact. Dinner - 70 zloty - quite tasty food - coffee / tea additionally paid (shock!). I live abroad every day, such things do not take place, especially since the price with breakfast is 350 zl. As for the object (just a cold room) I have no reservations, the reservation system also works efficiently. The spa treatments were also pleasant, of course paid for on their own. To sum up, I will never decide to come to this hotel again.

I am impressed by the commitment with which Ms. Olimpia does her job and treats every patient. Before the planned birth we met with Mrs. Olimpia at the Siemiradzki Hospital and then she told us exactly how to prepare for the birth (what exercises to do, what to pay attention to, when going to the hospital, what to take away, what will be the role of the husband during the birth, etc.). ) . The message was understandable and uplifting ☺ Although it was my first pregnancy and I was very afraid of giving birth, she knew I would be in good hands and everything would go well. Being in the hospital she felt well taken care of and safe - Mrs. Ola kept telling me what she was doing, what the situation looked like and how it translated into the course of the birth - what are the progresses, whether it will hurt more ..., whether it is worth anesthetizing, how to minimize the feeling of pain, How to practice on the ball ... Because at the end of the birth there was a risk of complications, the team at the Hospital decided to terminate the pregnancy with a caesarean section so I was not allowed to wait for the final and with the support of Mrs. Ola to give birth naturally. But now I know that thanks to her experience and good communication with the whole team everything ended well and the decision to have a C-section was made at the right time. Then Mrs. Olympia visited us still in the delivery room to make sure that everything was fine; I admit that she felt as if my beloved aunt ☺ had visited me then.

When planning a long trip, she was thinking about whether to go to Novotel City West or Novotel Centrum. I must admit that the criterion was the price. Despite the initial problem with the room, which was quickly solved the whole stay I consider very successful. A very pleasant surprise was the hotel staff (from the reception staff, restaurant staff, swimming pool staff and service room), I admit that the best so far in the entire hotel chain of the Accor Group, and we have already used different brands during family trips with sisters. From the very beginning, the kids were welcomed nicely with a small gift, and later on they could use the children's playground without any worries or remarks, even the evening craziness in the restaurant did not meet with ostracism ; ) . For us parents, the evaluation of the hotel is the satisfaction of children, and they did not want to leave it: )

We bought the stay from a group, of course the decision was based on the proposed offer and a relatively low price. On the spot it turned out that there is no one inside, we waited for a moment until someone comes, and we wrote us an email about which we will be. Finally, we called the number that we had on our side, because the one at the reception did not answer. Finally the lady from the staff came and took us to the room. It was cold in the room as well as in the whole guesthouse and it was raining and we wanted to get warm. The room was quite spacious, but the beds were connected to the wooden finishes every night. TV did not work, WiFi also had a terrible range, saved us the Internet on the phone, the bathroom was well taken care of, single tiles on the floor were moving. The kitchen was small, but we did not go there to cook, although the availability of pots allowed us to make mulled beer with juice. The sauna was not used by us, because we visited the hotel Gołębiewski, located 5 minutes from the guesthouse. According to Dr. Karney the doctors should be concerned about the information from the mother that the child behaves differently from previous infections. "The child may be sleepy but also irritated, he may be hypersensitive to touch and doesn't want to be cuddled, sometimes the light interferes with him," explained the specialist. In the case of sepsis during the development of invasive meningococcal disease, the child has a petechial rash on the skin. Nowadays, the most important bacteria that cause sepsis can be protected against it by means of vaccinations. In the Polish calendar of obligatory vaccinations there are vaccinations against H . influenzae type B and pneumococcal infections . Vaccinations against meningococci are recommended in the calendar and parents must finance them themselves . In the case of the youngest children, the most important is vaccination against meningococcus type B, which is responsible for IChM in more than 80% of children under the first year of life . In the group of adolescents, vaccination against meningococcus type C is recommended. It is also possible to apply vaccination against four types of meningococci - C , A , Y and W 135 . ( PAP )

Mice with sterile digestive tract were used for this purpose. They are rodents in which the bacterial microbiota of the intestines is not developed at all. Such sterile mice were grafted with intestinal bacteria from "dream" mice, kept for four weeks in cooler conditions. In comparison, other mice were grafted with bacteria from mice kept at normal temperatures that did not have to struggle with the cold. After transferring the intestinal microbiota to the recipients, all mice were on a high-fat diet - under normal conditions the animals fed in this way would quickly gain weight. It turned out that mice with a set of bacteria from frozen mates for a long time (tested for six weeks) remained lean, had better glucose tolerance, insulin sensitivity and lower percentage of fat in body weight. And yet, because of the diet, animals should not remain lean. At the same time, the control mice - with bacteria taken from mice reared in standard warm conditions - gained weight as expected.

I feel very sorry for your loss of the child. However, in your statement you do not present any problems, symptoms that would not give you peace of mind, and which you pointed out to the doctor during the visit. Certainly, if you had reported any problems, I am convinced that you would not have been without the doctor's answer. In fact, it can be concluded that the pregnancy at the time of the visit was not objectionable to the doctor. The doctor has written down your vitamins in accordance with the course of your pregnancy and ordered a list of tests that you should do immediately and report back to the doctor. You don't write anything, after what time the tests were done, if everything was okay and when you came back to the doctor. You can only draw the conclusion that you have not been to see the doctor for at least 3-5 weeks. It should be remembered that the most important thing in the first weeks of pregnancy is to observe the development of the fetus, whether the fetus is developing in accordance with the adopted stages, and you should know about it yourself. Being in the 8th week of pregnancy, i.e. really in the 6th week after fertilization, such an early age of pregnancy is not always advanced enough to capture the heart rate of the embryo. At a later date, the nucleus of the heartbeat should be visible and it is possible to capture the heart rate on an ultrasound. You do not write anything that the doctor said while doing the ultrasound, if he had any doubts about the examination and correct development of the embryo. All this indicates that in your case it was still too early to determine the heartbeat, and the allegations you made are a little out of place and a lot out of place before making a diagnosis from the histopathological examination. However, there is no doubt that it is sad and unfortunately more and more common that the embryo stops developing at some point for various reasons, it can be caused by e.g. genetic defect or no hormonal demands etc. In such a situation you should experience any ailments such as fever, bleeding, abdominal pain, which you also do not mention anything about. It is known that the body treats a dead fetus like a foreign body and at least you should have a fever. There is no doubt that you should be vigilant during the first trimester of pregnancy and pay special attention to any changes in your body. After all, the doctor will not call you every day and find out if you have done tests and how you feel, much more interest in pregnancy should be on your side. Once again, I am very sympathetic to you and wish you good luck, as well as read the reading and proper preparation for your next pregnancy.

These studies have shown that organic milk and meat contain about ok . 50% more beneficial omega-3 fatty acids than conventionally produced products. Organic milk and meat also have a higher percentage of certain minerals and antioxidants. Scientists note that the replacement of conventional milk and meat in the daily diet with organic products is to a certain extent associated with an increase in the intake of important health-related fatty acids. The study was published in the British Journal of Nutrition. The author of the study is Dr. Ing. Dominika Średnicka - Tober from the Faculty of Human Nutrition and Consumption Sciences, SGGW. The results of the research were announced by a spokesperson of the Warsaw School of Life Sciences Krzysztof Szwejk in a communiqué sent to PAP.

869 hotels with 145,303 rooms were under construction, advanced planning and planning in January, according to the Global Construction Pipeline Report prepared by STR. This is just a little more than the year before. In January 2012 the development chain included 866 hotels with 139,700 rooms. This year, therefore, 0.35% is being built. The number of hotels and 4 per cent more rooms than in the previous year is slightly higher. While in January 2012 the largest hotel construction site was London, which was preparing for the Summer Games, where the development chain included 4,638 rooms, in January this year the largest number of rooms - 4,228 - was created in Istanbul, Turkey. The second largest hotel construction site remains invariably Moscow, where 2,523 rooms are being built this year compared to 2,228 in January 2012. More than 1,000 rooms are still under construction in London - 2,181, Berlin - 2,077 rooms, Amsterdam - 1,775 and Vienna - 1,061 rooms. The Lower Silesian Centre for Heart Diseases Medinet is a non-public clinic which has been running a scientific circle for ten years for medical students. This year's success is so spectacular that so far it has not happened that as many as four works from one centre have been included in the congress programme. "Our students have written very original scientific materials, and the fact that their works have been noticed shows that they have a good chance to become good cardiac surgeons. In my generation we learned how to operate from photocopies of American textbooks, because we could not afford the original books. Nowadays, students have a much easier way to learn the secrets of cardiac surgery" - emphasized Kołtowski.

As emphasized by the participants of the jubilee celebration, over 70 years of the institution's existence a great deal of progress has been made in oncology - patients are treated much more effectively. "When 32 years ago I decided to work at the institute, my colleagues knocked on my forehead and said that I couldn't stand it mentally, because it was too burdensome - there was no success, patients were dying. I already knew at that time that it wasn't true", said Prof. Jozef Kowalski. Składowski . " Definitely during those 50 years back there was a development. The dream of mankind is to avoid cancer, but this dream will probably never come true, because the nature of biology is such that cancer must take place, it is one of the processes of nature. Our goal is to detect this process so early that cancer can be destroyed at the earliest possible stage, including when the patient does not realise at all that he may be sick. I am optimistic - scientific discoveries will contribute to the fact that we will talk about long life and good quality of life," he added.

"Tattoos are extremely popular among people aged 20 to 30, both in the United States and Poland. But some of the tattoos are later mourned and need to be removed. Until recently, all methods except surgical procedures were not very effective. We entered the market with very strong short pulse lasers, these are so-called picosecond lasers. We have very good results in tattoo removal, but also in the fight against pigmentation problems. Our system allows us to remove artificial but also natural discolourations, which are caused by sunlight," says PAP Orkiszewski. The engineer designs medical equipment. He leads a R & D team in a public company in California, which designs laser equipment for dermatology. A graduate of Warsaw University of Technology explains that laser-based devices are used in both medical and cosmetic dermatology. Previously, he had been involved for years in the application of lasers in ophthalmology (in the treatment of corneal, retina and myopia, farsightedness, glaucoma) and urology. He cooperated with Polish academic centres in Katowice, Bydgoszcz and Warsaw.

Researchers associated with the Faculty of Medical Sciences of the University of Warmia and Mazury (UMW) in Olsztyn want to breed stem cells obtained from tissues of fetal origin. Specifically - from the brain tissue of fetuses that have spontaneous miscarriage between the 17th and 22nd week of pregnancy (use of aborted fetuses' tissues is excluded). The method of isolating stem cells from fetal tissue is known worldwide, safe and scientifically described, but in some environments it raises ethical questions. "Usually as doctors and scientists we say that we are limited by money. Sometimes, however, there are other restrictions which we should impose on ourselves, which we should discuss before we get down to something," - he said at the opening of the scientific symposium - "To turn regret into hope - the neurosurgeon and the vice-rector of the University of Olsztyn prof. Wojciech Maksymowicz . During the symposium, organized last week at the Faculty of Medical Sciences in Olsztyn, doctors and theologians considered the use of fetal tissues in stem cell therapies in various ways.

"Environmental conditions have shaped our brains and bodies over the last few million years. For most of the time, our species has been functioning under conditions of hunger. If not extreme hunger, then at least food shortages" - says PAP neurobiologist Dr Marek Kaczmarzyk from the University of Silesia. As a result, a reward system was developed, i.e. a mechanism built into the brain to reward for what is adaptable, i.e. providing food, especially high calorie food. "This mechanism gives us such an effect that if we have high-calorie food at our disposal and we eat it, the reward system - remembering about archaic hunger conditions - rewards us for reaching for example another donut. This is a biologically conditioned behavior" - explains PAP's interlocutor.

Research on dressings was conducted in Siemianowice Śląskie, Medical University of Łódź and Medical University of Gdańsk. The next generation of products, which the group of professor Bielecki is working on, are three-dimensional forms mainly for internal use as prostheses, implants and so called "suits", that is scaffolding for cell culture. Completion of the research requires many chemical, biological and physical analyses and assessment of mechanical properties of the produced fibres. "We have to determine very precisely the size of the dressing or implant in order to introduce it into the body laparoscopically. Our product should have a strictly defined mechanical strength, flexibility or lack of it, water absorption, so that we can effectively attach it or safely stick it to an organ - explains the PAP interlocutor. - For this purpose we cooperate with doctors of various specialties such as soft surgery, orthopaedics, neurosurgery or cardiology.

"With proteomic tools we want to know the differences in protein expression in atherosclerosis, liver steatosis or depression. In animal models of these diseases we can observe reduced activity of proteins, which are responsible for energy production in mitochondria. We are working on a drug that could activate badly acting enzymes and remove harmful toxic aldehydes from the mitochondria, which are formed as a result of oxidative stress, i.e. excess production of free oxygen radicals" - explains Dr Stachowicz. The winner of the START scholarship from the Foundation for Polish Science is studying the mitochondrial enzyme - aldehyde dehydrogenase, which can have a protective function in mitochondria. It is this enzyme that removes toxic substances and thus can protect and prevent dysfunction of energy centers in cells.

Conference participants also spoke about the fact that there are more and more products and dietary supplements on the market and there is a lack of knowledge and awareness about them. Dr hab . Jadwiga Hamułka, President of the Polish Society of Food Sciences at the Warsaw University of Life Sciences (SGGW), pointed out that the common advertising of dietary supplements makes consumers make decisions under the influence of the moment. She also said that many people still confuse supplements with drugs. She also pointed out that the group that takes many supplements - even several at the same time - are pregnant women, which can be dangerous because it can lead to interactions with food, drugs, overdoses. She reminded that supplements do not and cannot replace an adequate, varied diet. She pointed out that they can be used periodically when the disease has resulted in the loss of some ingredients and they need to be supplemented quickly. "And then it's completely different," added Hamulka.

The second group of drugs entering myeloma treatment are so-called HDAC inhibitors (histone deacetylase). One of these, discussed in detail at the congress, is panobinostat. "These drugs are not a breakthrough for the time being, but they improve treatment results," said the head of the Department of Haematology, Oncology and Internal Medicine of the Medical University of Warsaw, prof. Wiesław Jędrzejczak . As he added, the next drug to enter myeloma therapy more and more widely is the so-called third generation immunomodulating drug called tomatoomide. It works in some patients resistant to lenalidomide (second generation immunomodulating drug). Both of these preparations have the same active molecule and cause fewer side effects than thalidomide ( first generation immunomodulating drug ) .

Hello, I would like to share my opinion about Dr. Kłoszewski, we go to see Mr. Doctor from 2 visits immediately after the birth of the child, the first visit to a completely different doctor. (where he found out that I'm a judgmental mother and neglected a 6-week-old child) Then we went to Dr. Kłoszewski and REVELATION . Worst holiday ever! ! ! A week's stay for 7 adults and 4 toddlers cost 13,000! ! ! The cost of the week was 13,000 ! This is the first 4 * hotel in which none of us had the courage to walk barefoot on the carpet in the rooms. The bathroom was was washed by myself because my hair in the shower, dirty toilet and stained floor did not inspire confidence. Room service is limited to replacing garbage bags and bedding. The quilts that the hotel has at its disposal are classic 200cm long but bed linen is already 160cm! ? Pillows end in 3 / 4 lengths of the duvets - a very peculiar coating as for 4 * ! Corridors, staircases, elevators - it's better not to touch anything : ( Service - it's a pity to write here about sour faces and many times directed requests to take dirty dishes from the table that nobody has heard. It is only worth mentioning the waitress who collects plates from tables with a two-year-old on her hands in the restaurant (and probably not the first time, because the toddler helped Mom very much and he himself carried smaller plates, circulating between tables). Did we meet here something nice? Yeah, a massage in the SPA, but it's not enough to blur this FATAL TRAIN that this hotel does. Surprisedly, I read positive opinions, but I think they are written by the guests who are not very demanding because they praise the hotel 4 *! ! ! for the proximity of the ski slopes, fast wifi and the hotel lift? Hmmm ... not serious. Finally, one more thing - please don't believe in the assurances of the General Manager that all the faults will be removed immediately - unfortunately this is not true, you still have to push your head between the pillow and the lamp that touches our forehead : (

Unfortunately, a big delay, over 20 minutes, and thus seems to me quite a big rush and little time for the patient. I still lack precise guidelines on diet, maybe she will organize a course, workshops or a lecture on e.g. how to nourish children healthily - this is just a suggestion.

After arriving at the address given, it turns out that there is no room for us at this address as there was some problem with the system and our room has already been given away. The professional staff but looks completely lost and overworked. We have been informed that we will be moved to a private apartment at 17b Foksal Street on Nowy Swiat in the centre of Warsaw. Reluctantly, but due to lack of options, we agreed. The lady at the reception desk described this place in superlatives. We were given the address, the keys and so on - no form of transport or willingness to help with the costs associated with transport. They were shocked. Fortunately, our friend had a car and knew the area so there were no major problems with getting to the place. On the spot it turns out that the apartment is an ordinary room with a kitchen together so big that after putting the suitcases in there is not much room left. Bathroom separated by a sliding door which does not give any privacy. The cleanliness also leaves a lot to be desired. Under the furniture, tons of dust . The shower in the bathroom was leaking, the TV was receiving only a few channels - the rest was losing signal because a few minutes of watching. What was the worst thing is that this place is located in a very busy part of the city - especially at night. In front of our windows and front door there were 3 pubs and a restaurant open until very late at night. The noise from these places was huge. The first night we didn't sleep until 3 am. A nightmare. During the whole - 3 day stay no one called to check how to stay or ask about cleaning. . . ! ! On the last day, they called 'em to tell them about the faults etc . The lady who talked to me (eastern accent) was polite but made it clear that nothing could be done. I understand that this is only a hostel, but the standard of service and quality to price calls for vengeance to heaven. She suggests to the owner to get more interested because it may turn out that one day the customers will just run out. I advise against this place and do not recommend it to friends.

She wanted me to recommend Lady Elizabeth to all those who are afraid that in their case, nothing can be done anymore. She is a nice, competent person who can motivate everyone. Her knowledge helped me to lose weight, despite problems with hormones and forty pounds on my neck! I sincerely recommend!

the hotel offer does not correspond to the reality (other rooms in the offer vs. what she received); unpleasant staff at the reception desk (one day they promise to change the room, the other day they say that there is no such option, that you should have checked earlier; she mentioned that I am not the first time - she heard that I have not been there for a long time). The sewage system is not working. . . However, the service of the spa and restaurant part of the good.

I was sent to the clinic where professor zw. dr hab works. Wojciech Sobaniec , I was in a lying state my condition was described as medium - acute . The psychologist showed a lack of professionalism in my opinion because she had the impression that my system of values is being evaluated. Last time I stayed at this Novotel was about 3 years ago, the reception desk looks better and there was a small change in the restaurant. Unfortunately, the rest probably remained so in the late 90s. I stayed overnight in the executive room, day to 4 pm plus, 3 free drinks, Nespresso, high-speed Internet and the location of the hotel are cool things. The service and breakfast are usually completely inexpressive. . . Downstairs at the entrance, there is a casino and a game room, which makes the hotel a little bit of a strange "type". I've always had a weakness for this hotel, but it's probably just over. Next time I'll probably find some other hotel in Poznan.

I've been going to your doctor's for two years and I'm very pleased. She's a professional in every way, and she's relaxed, which helps a lot. Manor house located in the heart of the Barycz Valley and Milicz Ponds. Surrounded by beautifully maintained green area with a magnificent forest stand, ponds. The manor house is surrounded by a beautifully well maintained green area with a magnificent tree stand, ponds . The building is maintained in the climate of the historic manor house from 1830. Thank you for your guest and we wish you all the best to those who took care of our good rest in the "HERB BY TWO".

Hello. A hotel on the sidelines, but that's what gives us the peace and quiet. From outside and inside it looks good. Clean and reasonably modern. The rooms are furnished very pleasantly and comfortably. Breakfast is tasty and there is something to choose from. But I also have to write about this slightly worse side of the hotel. After checking in it turned out that as a group we got double rooms and everything would be ok if there were no joined beds in the rooms and only one bedding (after the intervention at the reception we managed to fix it / explain). And the other not cool thing is a blocked electronic thermostat of heaters (the rooms were very hot and could not be changed) . However, for the whole thing, I must admit that the hotel is pleasant.

I came to Wieliczka with my mother, who felt weak on a cold Sunday day, so we went to the Galicia Hotel to call a taxi to Krakow. After the call we were supposed to wait until ten minutes for the taxi to arrive. I asked my 81-year-old mother to sit it there and wait. In response, I heard a "NO". "The ladies aren't our hotel guests and they can go to the cafeteria or go out waiting outside". I have explained again that my mother has a heart problem and if she could sit down and wait those few minutes. The answer was also negative. When, after a few days, I called to explain the situation, it was even more embarrassing to talk to Mrs. Clock / the person from the front staff / who knew she was there and the staff were treated as if she was. She also added: "What would you like us to give you a bed and food"! ! ! WITHOUT COMMENTARY.

WARNING ! ! She organized a birthday party for 40 people in the hotel. Because the party was thematic, in the same climate, she wanted me to lead it. The DJ who was provided by the organizer had no idea what kind of party he was going to lead, was completely unprepared, three times he confused the name of the jeweler, and all previous arrangements and assurances of the manager turned out to be empty words. Only after 3 hours of "fun" she heard that we will not get cold drinks because they are already over, although the contract contained information that we have them without a limit. When the next day she tried to explain the whole situation and above all to inform the manager received information that it is not true what I say, the drinks were not promised and to add the matter claw heard me that one of my guests did not pay for his room. When she informed him that this guest has paid the bill and I have proof of that the contact was broken. The championship of everything and the summary of the whole thing was the fact that after the event she asked the staff to pack the rest of the food she heard m " has just been thrown out " Mockery and shame.

For 30 years, wandering around the various dermatologists (a severe form of acne that has been digesting me since grade 8 of primary school) is the first doctor who has helped me 100%. The doctor who knows what to do with the disease to help, cure it! Interestingly, my teenage daughter has also been cured of terrible acne (the genes are known not to be fooled). Thank you doctor, may every dermatologist be as professional as you! It's a pity that most dermatologists pretend to help by prescribing a lot of antibiotics and expensive slurries that only drown out the problem In fact, it's the only effective cure and thanks to you we are cured! I recommend to every such a wonderful person and doctor Thank you Agnieszka

I am after my first visit to Mrs. Marzena, a very nice and smiling person, she advised how to speak not to reproduce bad eating habits, what will be the effects of the diet I do not know yet, I am waiting for the menu, I hope to succeed this time and I have a lot of extra kg. Greetings! !

She chose this place for the fall weekend. The hotel is very nice and well maintained. The hotel staff is very nice, competent and friendly to guests. The food is very good, the breakfast is varied and the dinner is fresh and nicely served. Unfortunately, the hotel's tarena was undergoing loud renovation works about which the hotel does not inform its guests. In response to "Hello. Maybe someone will write where this doctor is taking him and how much it costs to visit him. They say he's good. "He certainly receives in Braniewo on Tuesdays after 6:00 p.m. and Thursdays after 2:00 p.m. in the battalion (clinic).

I don't recommend I have to give a negative opinion on this doctor. I had a private visit with her today. 100 zloty lost . You have a very insensitive attitude during the examination. . . Coming to her after a few days of acute pharyngitis and sinusitis, she said that there is nothing wrong with me and that the "slightly pink" throat is taken "septolete". We only spent four days in the hotel, but we had a lot of fun. The hotel offers so many attractions that there is no way to get bored. The lectures are pretty cool, conducted quite clearly and clearly. That's how I got used to a certain level of this network. And at the entrance, a kind lady at the reception desk greeted me and assigned a room. The doctor is nice and friendly, tries to help students, has a lot of knowledge and is willing to share it. For labs only to her: mrgreen : [ / b ]

Close to a busy road, at 6 o'clock the cars were already driving. The layout of the room was strange. The door was opening to the wardrobe and it was difficult to enter with suitcases. I remember reading these opinions as my mother was diagnosed after a long stay in hospital on Plock pleural mesothelioma. She was diagnosed in Płock for so long that she had metastases on her bones. I'm writing this review while still in the hotel. pubic hair in the bathroom of the previous occupant, amount of soap and other hotel cleaning agents in the room modest , breakfast very modest , the waiters are not interested in serving guests during breakfast . I warn everyone about this dentist! Dr Jarowiecka treated my tooth root canal, but not effectively, because after some time an inflammation occurred. I suspect that the canals were not cleaned well. I only regret visiting Dr. Jarowiecka because I wasted time, money and above all I suffered! Damn me if I think that such dentists have their offices!

I definitely do not recommend the kruger & matz drive 4 or the service ! The panel broke after 2 m - c , fell out of its pocket. Repair 400 PLN and loss of warranty . Then it got worse and worse. Although your doctor is kind, I warn everyone about this doctor! She treated me with Dr. Siemaszko for 2 years. She diagnosed me with diseases which, as it turned out later, she never had m . After consultation with other doctors I do not take any more medication, because as it turns out she never had any of the diseases for which I was treated by Dr. Siemaszko.

I have mixed feelings. I'm not convinced of your proposed treatment. I've been given very strong medications and I don't think I have such an advanced medical condition. After the visit I had the feeling that the doctor wasn't exactly listening to what I was being treated with and with what effect, maybe that's why I'm not sure about the treatment.

The most important thing - clean. Tasty breakfasts, served in the dining room in the form of a buffet - cold meat, cheese, jam, flakes, coffee, tea, bread, cucumber + tomato. Coffee and tea are available all day long. The hostel is located on the 7th floor of a high building. Good location in the center of the city, downstairs shop Biedronka. Staff ok . Bed linen is clean . Windows in poor condition . Overall price ok .

I don't know why she is mentioned in Krapkowice, after all, she mainly accepts in Kedzierzyn-Kozle.
