I recommend the whole ENT department in Koźle and she hasn't met me with such a nice and professional approach yet.

I had an accident a few kilometers from the hotel, the gentleman from the reception came by car to pick up his wife and child so they wouldn't wait for the trailer - great thing. I arrived with a car on a trailer The gentleman at the gate said he would not let the trailer into the parking lot, that I have to take off the car and push it to the parking space. Absurd. Club open from 22 , cold snacks on site . But to buy something to drink you need to go to the reception and top up your prepaid card. . . . . .a strange solution. The pool door was open outside in September, so a cold wind blew in. I mean, the pool is too much of a mouthful, the so called "rushing river around", two slides and a few jacuzzis. And where is the usual recreational pool? In addition, the pool and children's area, here everything is extensive and cool, but also not fully thought out. If a child wants to go down a mini slide, he or she has to go out of the poolBasins outdoors with cold water, so out of season it makes no sense. Rooms like a better guest house or a one-star or two-star hotel. The food is a lot, varied, but the wife found a snail in the salad, when she went outraged to give it to the kitchen, the unshakeable Lord said that the lettuce was not even remorseful in voice. Plus cool playgrounds. On plus evening attractions, a bonfire with sausages and mulled wine, plus music and a ringleader, and after 22nd active disco. Before you check out, you come and check if you stole something from the room. They assume in advance that every man is a thief. It's the first time you've met with something like that.

For culinary reasons, the hotel lies! I don't know how many times have Christmas Eve products been heated for Christmas breakfasts, but on the second day of the World I had the feeling that someone wants to poison us. With the same hardness of bread that was served for breakfast, my grandmother used to make a bread crumble tart, the yellow cheese so dried up that it was broken, the ham was already feeling and the Christmas Eve, tasteless fish in Greek on the second day of the world without the little one escaped from the plate. Coffee and a famous copy of the louvre only on the hotel's website, very nice anyway. A total lack of organization and professionalism, 5-person room staff had a problem with the implementation of orders for about 15-20 guests. Long waiting time, confusing orders, forgetting and lack of basic juices and spirits in the bar. You can understand the stumbles and shortfalls, but selling people a product that is a package of Christmas obliges to something. I do not recommend!

Very professional approach to the customer, comprehensive price offer, flexibility for additional inquiries and calculations, or the final invoice was the most accurate. Nice and efficient service, on a high level, meals varied, tasty and prepared with care. Our customers liked it very much and they will definitely come back here alone to rest. Beautiful surroundings, well maintained area around and view. The hotel was also well thought-out and well planned, it did not feel the presence of other guests. Very good prices for meetings and business conferences.

This is another stay in Mercure Poznan. As a member of the Le Club Accor loyalty program with Platinum status, I was a little surprised that I was not offered a room upgrade and the occupancy rate was not great. What if I booked em a Privilage room. Some information from the reception desk about the upgrade would have been advisable. When I checked in for the first time, I was given an ID card. It's strange since he booked 'em from his Accor profile. I felt like I was in the People's Republic of Poland, I could identify myself, check and give the key. However, greeting as a Platinum member at the reception is strange. In my profile I've marked a high floor, and the room got em on the 1st floor. That's probably not the high floor? The next thing is the non-functioning internet in the room, the premium internet signal was negligible. The hotel rated 'em as very good because of the breakfasts, which are actually delicious and the location. Although the construction site around the hotel is tedious.

We were here years ago and it was really great. Unfortunately, it has changed for the category of hotel guests for the worse. The profile of the hotel for weddings, integration events, etc. caused the hotel to deviate from the European standards of hotel guest service. The phone call on the day before arrival that it may be loud until the morning because there is a party downstairs, or the obligation to pay for the stay even before receiving the keys (in Europe it is enough to pre-authorize the card) made them resign from the hotel. We will not come here anymore.

Anyone can express their opinion today and it is their sacred right. But by "letting go of" the internet, we're losing control of them. It's a pity, because with the help of today's application tools, we are able to control a large part of them. Thus, we can build our reputation ourselves. It is known that opinions about the hotel have an impact on its popularity. The broadly understood reputation of a hotel in many communication channels on the Internet has a significant and direct impact on our financial results. Because it correlates with our popularity, interest in our services, occupancy, price level, income and of course potential profit. OTA's booking platforms have completely re-evaluated hotel room sales processes over the last few years. Both online and through traditional channels. They set trends and solutions to which hotels, if they want to remain competitive, unfortunately have to adapt.

We spent a week in this hotel during the winter holidays. The children came back delighted, but we were much less. First of all the advantages; - great infrastructure for children (swimming pool, playland, animation room, playgrounds, mini zoo), - very well run animations (words of praise to Mr. Peter), the disadvantages: - the biggest disadvantage for us was the exploitation! ! ! We often travel and what we found on the stools is one big disappointment. Definitely the weakest choice of warm dishes is at dinner, but if someone is satisfied with a cold plate, salads or making pancakes for children it will not really disappoint. No coffee and tea for dinner. Desserts in the form of pudding, porridge, jelly, jelly and from time to time some cake are also a novelty for us in this type of facilities. To sum up, you won't go hungry, but whether you're satisfied is an individual matter. . . - in building B the room was nicely renovated, unfortunately the walls are made of paper and you could usually hear the neighbors talking, the TV set on, etc. - the descent to the beach was quite steep ok. 130 stairs, the return is sometimes 'warming up' - the shaded beach in winter, the sun is quite low and unfortunately it hides behind the forest, - for such a huge number of children the hotel offers as many as 6 sledges for rent which caused frustration to some guests and 'night reservations' of them in the room The hotel is just adding a new restaurant, so for the summer season there should be no more problems with waiting for a free table.

The Doctor has done me the best, the most accurate pregnancy service in my life. ( And I'm in the middle of my second pregnancy and went to different doctors) . She told me exactly what you see on the screen. She was examining calmly, without hurrying, keeping me and my husband informed about what she was doing, what she saw and what it meant. We left the office with the feeling that we were very well informed, well cared for and that we found not only a professional but also a wonderful, warm and witty man. This is important because the usg 11-13 tc is stressful and the patients often feel very bad (this was my case). Since that visit I know that all the next ultrasound examinations will be performed by the doctor.

The hotel is overrated, the food is poor and collecting "beakers" during meals is a massacre like in a soldier's canteen. The rooms are not freshly dirty, there are no towels in the pool, but if we are twice a day, they will not dry out in the room. Generally I do not recommend

At the Hotel Faleza we spent with our wife and 2 pets very pleasant moments. The service is very nice and helpful, the restaurant is great, the portions are right, the dishes are perfectly composed. The only drawback is because of the terrain (the hotel lies on a cliff) access to the beach is not very comfortable, but it does not take away the charm of this place. The garden with a view of the sea will appeal to everyone.

In Nice we stayed at the hotel Le Meurice, which leaves a lot to be desired, we hit on Euro 2016 and room prices were 50% more expensive than normal. . . . .difficult. To start with, the hotel does not have its own car park and the car had to be left in the city car park and go with all the luggage, there are elevators everywhere, so you have to bargain with suitcases, you can book a car park by the hotel, but it is also a weak solution because it is much further away and at the same price, that is 30 euros per day. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a pompous, moderately pleasant receptionist, after checking in, she pointed out to us a "magic" stinking lift, which we went to our floor. The door to the room was cardboard, everything could be heard as it turned out at night, because we were hit by noisy British people who were yelling all night and shooting the door. The room itself looks very poorly, certainly not as in the pictures, the wallpaper peels off the walls, in the mini spa bathroom, glued carelessly into place after the old bath, the toilet pressed forcefully between the bath and the wall, a person with a more massive structure would have a problem to use it, not to mention the thicker people. The only advantage is the location, because the hotel is located near the boulevard.

It is an ideal place to relax with family, romantic trip for two or a business trip. The hotel is located on a hill near the center, where there is a beautiful view of the port in the palm tree, you can admire it from rooms, restaurants, bar or swimming pool. I don't think there is a better location for a hotel: ) Clean rooms with all the necessary equipment, buffet restaurant, large choice of food, salad bar, meat, fish, and desserts, all fresh and tasty. I like the idea of theme evenings: ladies night, free tango lessons, Mexican cuisine, paella and sangria. By the pool there is a pool bar where you can have a drink, a natural smoothie or cold beer:) there is also a big choice of spirits if someone prefers brandy or whisky. There is also a second bar and other rooms which are available for various meetings or closed parties. the service is very nice and helpful. The hotel is really worth recommending: )

Katya spent a week at the hotel with her husband and one and a half year old child. I am very happy with my stay at the hotel and it is possible that I will visit Alanya again. The food is a great plus. The choice is huge, everyone, even very picky will find something for themselves. Dinner/dinner were served in the main canteen and on the balcony to this several tables with sweets and fruit. Between meals, fries, hamburgers, spaghetti, baked (cheese or potatoes), fruit and soft drinks were served on the beach, after lunch, for another dessert, if someone hasn't eaten, or there was little during lunch, at the bottom of the hotel cakes and cookies were served, while before dinner ice cream. In addition, alcohols were served until late hours without any restrictions. The hotel itself is small, which is also one of the advantages, because the canteen or the swimming pool has never been crowded, which takes place in large complexes. The rooms are newly renovated, clean and tidy. Families with children are accommodated in a part of the hotel away from noisy places such as the swimming pool or the amphitheatre, so that the children can sleep in noisy animation hours. The staff is very nice, helpful, clean and unobtrusive. The possibility to go directly to the beach, through a private tunnel below the road, is a great advantage. On the beach itself, free sun loungers and a bar and animations for adults in the afternoon and volleyball. On the headland you can buy a sunbed with a mattress and umbrella for 1Eur per day. Kids from 4 - 12 years old could use the care of animators twice a day. In the back of the hotel there was also a playground with slides and swings, which could be used without restrictions. In the hotel itself, you can feel safe thanks to the security guard who supervised the order and safety 24 hours, there were security guards at the entrance and exit of the facility. You can walk to the city centre on foot for about an hour (in a slow motion), or you can take a bus for 3 TL/axis. The buses run every 10 - 15 minutes. On Mondays and Thursdays, just outside the hotel, there are market stalls where you can buy a variety of Turkish originals at bargain prices.) . Outside these days, every day about 200m from the hotel there are shops where you can get everything you need. I recommend the hotel with full responsibility to all those who want to relax, party people are not likely to go crazy in it. I recommend it again, Maria.

We have just come back from holidays in the Golden Creek and we find that we will not go back there any more. A facility with potential, but neglected. A large building that used to be a guesthouse, nowadays it's scary and doesn't look like it's being renovated. Cottages poorly cleaned, showers probably not at all. During the holidays we had extra tenants in the form of mice who every day left droppings in the kitchen cabinets and at night we heard them moving around in the attic. The gas stove was broken and there was no telling when the gas was leaking from it. The kitchen was completely unfurnished because we found a tiny frying pan, one burnt pot, a blunt knife and plates. A little to prepare a meal for the family. The boss probably didn't fully understand us because she tried to repair the "damage" and thought it was the right thing to do. Mice explained that the cottages are close to the forest and that's how it's going to work. I'm not convinced by that argument. Bringing in extra kitchen equipment was spraying and not very nice. She said that only we were not happy. After talking to the neighbors later, it turned out to be different. I think that if you expect more than 2,000 zloty a week for a house, the conditions should be better. A picturesque but neglected place. I don't recommend for families with children who are still walking in carts, because there is nowhere to go in the village. The beach is dirty with a thin layer of sand. One more thing. The restaurant in the centre is a mistake. Poor menu and you had to wait about 1 hour for pizza. basically, maybe even longer because friends called the order after that time. The service for the number of guests is approx. 17 people close the kitchens and do not accept orders, because allegedly they do not make it. That's probably it. It could be beautiful, but somebody probably wants to make a profit by investing little.

She underwent my upper eyelid correction surgery with Dr. Ibrahim over a year ago. The operation resulted in a slight improvement in the appearance of the eyelids (far from expected) and the side effect is very large scars. On the left eye the scar reaches the temples! ! ! It was my first and only plastic surgery, so I did not know exactly what to expect. The preoperative consultation was hasty. The receptionist informed me before the surgery that I was going to get a blue pill for indifference, but nobody gave it to me. Generally there was an atmosphere of rush and lack of organization in the clinic. During the operation the doctor was assisted by nurses who did not speak Polish at all and poorly English, so the communication was very difficult. They pressed my eyes very hard to take out the fat bags, she had to ask the doctor to pay attention to them. The doctor intervened, but she had bruises all month long. But it's nothing. The worst part is that my eyelids look as if they were accidentally cut. The scars vary in location and length. Now I have atrophic scars on my eyelids going towards my temples, they are uneven, one is longer and lies higher than the other. With such extensive scars, no make-up, not even a specialist corrective one, helps. I have been trying laser treatments, creams, ointments, etc. for over a year. Unfortunately, all this has only helped a little. Inevitably there will be a revision procedure. Dr. Ibrahim did not show any willingness to help after the situation. He said it was my fault because I have a collagen production disorder. 3 doctors of surgeons where I was consulted on the revision surgery, did not confirm his opinion. I do not recommend this doctor or the Mandala clinic.

In the last place, at the top of the pyramid, there are fats whose consumption should be limited, especially animal fats. Most of them are in the Mazowieckie Voivodeship, where almost every third teenager aged 10-15 years has problems with the carcass" - added prof . Jarosz .

Although the chip is only 5 by 5 mm in size, its functionality and accuracy of measurements are comparable to that of professional medical equipment - for example, a patient wearing an ECG-registration tug. It is enough to attach several electrodes to record a variety of parameters - for example, the electrodes on the chest allow to receive impulses from the breathing muscles. Various types of smart wristbands are usually only equipped with a heart rate sensor and an accelerometer. "This mini cube can be easily integrated with any electronic device, e.g. put into a wristband, smartphone, sewn into clothes or installed in the car" - says mgr inż . Jarosław Lewandowski , head of WIML Research Laboratory.

Before the treatment Mr. Fidyk was partially paralyzed for almost two years and despite many months of rehabilitation his condition did not improve. The rehabilitation - five hours of exercise five times a week - was continued after the transplantation in the "Akson" Neurorehabilitation Department in Wrocław. Three months after the operation the patient noticed that his left thigh was becoming more muscular. After six months - describes the BBC - supported by a physiotherapist took the first steps. Two years after the surgery he can already go outside the rehabilitation centre using a balcony and hopes to function independently. He partially regained control over his bladder and stooling, his sexual functions have also returned. The MRI confirmed that the gap in the core has closed.

I've reported to Mr. Dr. . Głowacki about 2 years ago with big bay problems. Earlier treatment and Fess procedure did not give results . The doctor performed a total of three procedures: nasal septum straightening, tonsil removal and sinus FESS with widening of sinus estuaries and unblocking the sinus. Each of the procedures sooner or later brought positive results. The headaches stopped, I can breathe much better thanks to the simple nasal septum and speak better thanks to the removed tonsils. First of all, Mr. Dr. . Głowacki carries out the procedures very little invasive and most importantly he does not put tamponade into the nose after the surgery, thanks to that the same ailments after the surgery are much less. I have a comparison with a FESS procedure in another hospital after which I recovered for 4 weeks. For example, after the procedure of straightening the nasal septum only a few stitches are left to be removed, the nose is not clogged, there is little bleeding and so on. The same way after the FESS treatment, despite the bleeding nose, I could still breathe. No tampons, blocked nose, sleepless nights, etc. It is a great convenience for the patient because most of them are afraid of ailments after the procedure and it turns out that they are not so troublesome. In addition, the Doctor also looks at the sinuses after the surgery with an endoscope which was not in another hospital. If someone has serious laryngological problems and needs surgical treatment, I can recommend the doctor with a clear conscience. Głowacki .

It is based on a good organization of the system operating around the clock and on specialists - the patient is to be admitted to the center of invasive cardiology as soon as possible, where he undergoes the procedure with the use of a vascular catheter. Doctors use the catheter to make the procedure more efficient due to atherosclerosis of the vessel. They also introduce stents which strengthen the vessels at the point of stenosis and sometimes release drugs. As emphasized by the Director of Medical Affairs of the Silesian Centre for Heart Diseases in Zabrze prof . Piotr Przybyłowski, the implementation of this model was one of the great leaps of civilization in Polish medicine. "It happened in 1987. It was one of the first, actually the second in Europe, 24-hour infarction treatment programme. It was one of the first, actually the second in Europe to have a 24-hour treatment programme for myocardial infarction, and by that time the patients had spent up to 6 weeks in bed, since then modern treatment had begun," he said.

We went to the Ash Villa for a family weeekend. The rooms are nicely decorated and clean. Breakfast included in the price was abundant and tasty - a typical Swedish table. There is a separate playroom for children. The guesthouse is located within easy reach of larger slopes and tourist attractions such as Zakopane and Morskie Oko. Generally a very nice place to recommend.

We were in the hotel in February 2015, good for short stays (we were staying for 2 days). The room is extremely small with a shower and washbasin inside the room, toilet separately. With the window open quite a lot of noise from the street but after closing almost nothing can be heard. Rooms cleaned daily and towels changed. Definitely too small pillows. What I missed was a normal glass / mug in the room and at least a small electric kettle. You can get boiling water at the hotel reception. Good to take a pap for cold feet ( laminated floor ) . No shower gel, shampoo, only 2 small soaps by the sink. Breakfasts were not used by us because the price of 26 PLN is rather too expensive. Nearby there is a shop so we chose to have breakfast by ourselves. In the ratings somewhere someone wrote that you can get to the Copernicus Center in 20 minutes on foot, which is total nonsense and probably not to this Ibis gave a rating. The hotel is located in the OCHOCIE area at the western railway station and we took the bus almost an hour (at 15 on Friday) to PRAGA. The bus stops are not far from the hotel and the West Railway Station (here it is better to get to the center - line 136, 158). The hotel is good because we paid a lower price and that is why the hotel looks ok for a one-star standard. The entrance to the hotel is at the back of the building.

If it weren't for common sense, I'd probably be crippled. It started with a private visit ( 100PLN ) not longer than five minutes. Earlier she called me at the hospital and wanted me to make an appointment for a consultation, but the waiting time was too long, especially since she had a suspected pituitary tumor. That's why she decided to pay me a private visit to the Chief Executive. She looked at the results very quickly and said that from next week on I could come to the hospital for a two-week examination. I had a couple of tests done at the hospital and instead of focusing on my real problem, the Chief Executive started telling me that I had anorexia, without a prior interview and without any tests. When I first left the hospital, I had no hope of ever getting pregnant. The Chief Executive said that I am infertile and that I can say goodbye to the children. Opinions about hotels published by social media do not give a true picture of guest satisfaction because they present a distorted, too negative image of hotels, according to an analysis carried out by the research company Market Metrix. Social media bring 300% more negative opinions and only 35% more positive opinions than in traditional surveys, concludes Market Metrix . If the opinions from social media were suggested by guests only, the problem would exist, but it would not be so serious. However, as Jonathan Barsky, Director of Research at Market Metrix, points out: "The problem is that many hotels use customer reviews published in social media to make important business decisions. When hotel management makes decisions about allocating expenses based on erroneous information, it can result in millions of dollars in losses. Without a true picture of guest satisfaction, it is possible to misdefine the areas requiring support and direct the investment to what in fact in no way translates into increased guest satisfaction and therefore has no impact on the development of a single hotel or hotel chain. At the same time the areas of activity that actually attract guests and increase their loyalty remain unnoticed.

In the Patient's Rights category the prize was awarded to the Office of the Ombudsman. As Adam Bodnar, who is in charge of it, stressed, it will encourage further work, especially as there are several areas of judicial psychiatry in which the Ombudsman Office is interested. "This is, among other things, the issue of the application of protective measures and the entire regulatory environment related to it. It still happens that people who should never be in custody and prisons land there instead of in psychiatric hospitals. A major challenge is the functioning of the National Centre for Dissocial Behaviour Prevention in Gostynin, which is increasingly affected by legal complaints and concerns; how to put Gostynin under better regulatory control and protect the rights of those who are there or will be there in the future," he stressed.

The scientists also conducted tests on a mouse model of herpes, reflecting the course of herpes in humans. Histological tests on tissue fragments taken as a result of these tests showed a significant decrease in the number and size of HSV - 2 infection outbreaks, which confirmed their antiviral effect. In turn, a team of scientists from the Medical University of Gdańsk, headed by prof . Jolanta Myśliwska carried out research on the causes of adverse vascular changes in adolescent type 1 diabetes. This diabetes in 80 - 90% of cases affects children and adolescents, mainly between 12 and 15 years of age. It is an autoimmune disease leading to the slow destruction of beta cells in the pancreas that produce insulin and the loss of the ability to secret it. According to a WHO study, in 2000 there were 171 million people with all forms of diabetes in the world, and by 2030 there will be 366 million people with type 1 diabetes, with the number of people with type 1 diabetes increasing 2.3 times over the same period.

Good news for hoteliers: there are market niches on the accommodation market where the supply does not keep up with demand. Bad news for investors: this is happening in the United States, or at least not yet in Poland. What niche is it about? The hotels at airports. According to the data of STR, the use of rooms in hotels at airports is 10.9% higher than the market average use of rooms in the United States. In 2013 it amounted to 71.7%. This was 62.4% compared to 62.4% in 2010. At that time, the average price of a day's hotel stay in arrival hotels increased from 89 to 102 dollars. According to the data quoted by STR, this is because passenger air traffic is growing rapidly and the number of hotels operating at airports is growing only slightly. While in 2010 STR added 2,254 such hotels, there are currently only 43 more.

However, cancer does not only affect older people. Every year in Poland, it is found that there are about . 1100 - 1200 new cancers among children under 17 years old . The most common childhood cancers in Poland are hematopoietic system cancers - leukemia. They constitute about . 26% of all childhood cancers . "Symptoms of haematological diseases are non-specific, they may resemble infections (e.g. fever, sweat - especially at night, weakness), but also one of the symptoms of haematological diseases, resulting from immunological disorders, may be recurrent infections. That is why early diagnostics - crucial for the success of the therapy - may be difficult" - said the director of the Institute of Haematology and Transfusion in Warsaw, prof . Ewa Lech - Marańda .

National consultant in haematology prof . Wiesław W . Jędrzejczak told PAP that the morphology of peripheral blood should be included in periodic examinations performed in occupational medicine. "Since 1996 it has no longer been obligatory for all employees, which is a pity as it would allow many people to detect serious diseases such as leukaemia earlier" - he stressed . "The occupational doctor may order a blood test, but only for workers exposed to harmful agents in the workplace," said the national occupational health consultant on the medicine. Paweł Wdowik . He added that for the time being, only some companies are voluntarily including morphology in the medical package to increase their competition on the labour market.

I got to your doctor after two weeks of a terrible cough, at first it lasted for a while, with time it was getting stronger and longer. He was only interested in my eyes, which were bloodied (I have it always when I have something ailing or when I am just tired). She tried to explain to you that she didn't come here with my eyes and my problem is the cough that doesn't let me fall asleep anymore or function normally, but it didn't work. She got m pills for her allergy and was ordered to take nurofen in case of fever. She asked me for a cough medicine but the Doctor just looked at me eloquently and got up inviting another patient. I will add that it was a private visit. After four days, I was hospitalized with acute massive bilateral pneumonia, the doctors were terrified of my case and asked why she hadn't seen a doctor before. . . After two weeks of hospitalization, antibiotics, steroids for dyspnea, inhalation and lying under oxygen started to improve. Luckily, she found me very good specialists in the hospital. I do not recommend your doctor to anyone.

With the history of my injuries, deep, hard to bear trauma, having roots in childhood, and then only developing, because up to adulthood, unaware, not overworked, as a result, only piling up, up to the onset of disease - in every man I see a potential, if not an abuser, an enemy, then certainly a man who will not understand me, ridicule, humiliate, criticize. After the second visit to Mr. Martin, I begin to feel a little safer, I gain trust, I begin to see as a doctor and a man who wants to help me, respects me, despite my ailments. The doctor allows the patient to adjust the course of the visit to his predisposition. At the same time, he is specific, controls the course of the visit, but does not exert pressure. He is able to indicate the wrong course of thinking, he is also able to show when the patient thinks completely correctly. My impressions are very positive, although I find it difficult to put them into words. What I miss is a longer conversation, but as a patient with a long history, I realize that a psychiatrist deals with the diagnosis and pharmacological treatment of a specific disease or ailment. That's why I also signed up for behavioural psychotherapy in order to control my anxiety. Mr. Marcin has chosen my medicine well, he listens to the patient's comments. I do not think he treats the patient as "crazy". After the first visit I had a little bit worse choice of medication, but also my condition and the task to be done was completely different. I have a negative experience with drugs, I react badly to them (I have a widespread allergy). This time the medication works well on me and I hope that after a longer period of use, its effect will not change for the worse. Although, as usual, I am concerned that the leaflet warns me not to stop taking the medication suddenly and without medical supervision. It means, however, that there are no drugs that are not addictive (perhaps it is more about the risk of the return of symptoms of the disease from the so-called "rebound") and which are safe. I hope that after undertaking the therapy, I will be able to gradually reduce the doses and somehow try to cope with life without pharmacology. . .

The iron fits my needs, but I have a few objections. First of all, it's too big, although I understand where it comes from and it's not really possible to pick on it. I have mixed feelings about your visit to the doctor. It was my first time with this lady, although it wasn't my first time with a gynaecologist. She wanted me to have a check-up, I know I have ectopia but the doctor didn't comment at all during the check-up. The examination went very quickly and I understand that, but her statements were rather laconic. What surprised me the most was that she refused the breast examination. She had already been to many doctors and no gynaecologist refused me. Some people have it included in the price, others have it for a fee. During a gynaecological visit I always ask for it and it seemed to me that nowadays it is standard. All the more so because there is so much talk about it. I was only talking about prevention, and the doctor sent me to a radiologist! Out of curiosity, she called me later to 5 other gynaecological offices asking if the patient's breasts are examined at the patient's request - in each office they confirmed that they do. Explanations of the doctor and explaining why she does not perform such examinations were very vague. I don't think I will come back here.

Location great, everywhere close, nice service, price ok, clean and at that end the advantages of this place. Breakfast is a mockery! There is a screen at the reception for breakfast and this is a makeshift kitchen. Coffee, microwave tea, toasted bread and jam. . . . .if you don't buy something yourself, you'll go hungry. There is no air-conditioning in the hotel - which for me is not a necessary condition - on hot days you had to open a window, but as it turned out, the hotel is above the restaurant and all very intense food smells land in the room. No parking space. In conclusion, I do not recommend!

A hotel where you can spend a super holiday, an unforgettable Christmas Eve and the first day of the world with the police to report a theft. I advise against staying because for the owner of the hotel counts only foreigners as guests! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! !

The AP was to serve as a repeater to increase network coverage in a one-storey detached house. Unfortunately, it was not able to work with the WPA2 protected network based on TP - W8901 link, because it simply does not support WPA2 in repeater mode, nor the client (I do not know as in others). Of course, on its website the manufacturer claims that WPA2 is supported. . . Since I do not have access to the modem configuration, I decided to work around the problem by creating a new network with my old Linux WRT54G2 and strengthening it with the discussed WA - 500g . Unfortunately, WA - 500g turned out not to work with any security enabled, i.e. outdated WEP (WPA cannot be activated at all, but em already wrote about it). With the protections switched off in the repeater mode, everything is working as well as possible. Any configuration error I exclude, because I checked em all several times, using a few keys - it did not work on any of them, while natychmikast after turning off the protections everything returns to normal. I am not interested in leaving the network unprotected or playing with MAC filtering. Of course the firmware has updated me to the latest version. It is also worth noting that any unofficial software is not available for the following device. In my case, the device is only suitable for throwing away.

The Christmas accident was a great success. The hotel, although with a base of more than 100 rooms, allows you to rest and relax your body and mind. The service is very helpful and polite. A small swimming pool with an artificial current and a Jacuzzi allowed you to properly relax. The only thing that stood out from the rest was the quality of the pool tables. Undereduced made playing difficult. To sum up, the object is a great plus. I sincerely recommend!

I admit that Mrs. Ewelina is an empathic person. However, after consultation with 3 psychologists, I can say that I was not fully diagnosed despite 2 years of therapy. One of the most troublesome "ailments" in my life was omitted. Mrs. Ewelina couldn't help me to find appropriate methods to deal with my fears. Despite a very long therapy, it was not better and still worse. There is no way to improve my mental state. She is conducting psychological therapy in the psychodynamic current and has ensured that it is appropriate in my case. Unfortunately it wasn't, which resulted in deepening my anxiety despite a very long therapy. My person was not directed to any "ways". how to deal with them, how to reduce them. Instead of getting reliable help they were given the possibility of long monologues and not getting help as they try to deal with their fears. Now, after consultation with therapists who are conducting therapy in the behavioural cognitive, humanistic or integrative stream, I know that this stream was completely misguided. In addition, psychotherapists were shaking their heads when they found out that with my anxiety disorders the current was chosen. Quoting: "This is not an effective method in your case." "I wouldn't recommend this trend." Unfortunately, he trusted me unnecessarily with a therapist. I have a lesson. Now I know that in any matter related to our health you have to consult at least two specialists, because you may find that we are treated unsuccessfully (as in my case) . I give 2 stars, because many people are surely able to help, unfortunately, this lady was not me. Fortunately, when I meet a reasonable, knowledgeable therapist, I feel better and better from visit to visit. In turn, attending the therapy to this lady from month to month instead of better or worse, or at least similarly, it was getting worse and worse. However, I believe that she had good intentions and wanted to help me and that is why I give two stars.

He wanted me to express here in the forum my greatest admiration for this doctor and my respect for the fact that he is a man. Unluckily, I had a very serious accident about two months ago with a very complicated fracture of both forearm bones. I was in danger of losing a certain fitness of my hand. Hands are my tool for my work, they are necessary for my profession in any form. Before the operation I often had to think about it - will I have to retrain? Have 15 years of hard learning and work been in vain? Well, it turned out not. I am a doctor myself and I know what it means to feel in my heart that a case is just difficult. I know this responsibility. The highest responsibility for my health was shown by Dr. Zimmer. Today is seven weeks after the surgery, I go to rehabilitation but. . . ... I have practically no complaints, I work as before the accident, I help at home with housework and it is just a simple shock! This doctor has made the black day of life just a nightmare and my future and my family's future has taken colour again.

The furniture is designed in modern shapes and natural shades of beige and grey, with energizing and illuminating orange accents. "We wanted to modernize the decoration to bring out the attractive space of the high lobby. Novotel Krakow City West Hotel Novotel Krakow City West , in the first half of this year will surprise its guests with a completely new design of the lobby, reception and bar. I don't recommend it. He was with his son (14 years old) at your doctor's, he quickly needed a diagnosis when his son's kneecap jumped out for the second time (he plays professional football). She was with Mr. Blachowicz and I am very disappointed. I definitely do not recommend visiting Mrs. Blachowicz, why? 1 . the appointment is very short 7 - 10 min 2 . the interview with the patient is not conducted 3 . the doctor does not examine the patient and gives very brief answers On a visit to another endocrinologist, with whom I am very satisfied, I was listened to, there was a blood pressure constellation, height, weight, breast examination, thyroid examination - manual examination, interview with the patient, the answers were very exhaustive and most importantly, I had the help I needed so much.

The participants of the parade competition have different degrees of disability. Some of them only use wheelchairs on a daily basis, others cannot see or have one limb. There are also those whose disability is more difficult to see. Disabled athletes compete in different groups. The least able ones ride only at the tarsus; the more able ones - at the tarsus and trot; the next ones - also gallop and those whose degree of disability allows them to do so - present their side walk on horses. The history of Tomasz Zdańkowski (a young man with partial paralysis), who has been taking part in such classes for many years and additionally takes part in parade competitions, shows how hippotherapy positively influences the well-being and health of disabled people. Over the last 12 years he has changed beyond recognition. As Jadwiga Maciaszek recalls, at the beginning he moved incorrectly and had problems with writing, he was mentally separated from others. Now there is no problem with public speaking, he goes to trainings on his own and sparks energy.

I was at your doctor's for one visit, first and last. The fact is that she commissioned a lot of research, but she could have done it myself as well, and without a referral it costs ok. 500 PLN. They did not show anything, from what the doctor suggested. Throughout the whole visit she felt as if I was from the "bush." and my child didn't see the doctor in front of his eyes. all the suggestions that the child is ill-treated, etc... She prescribed a ton of drugs that she didn't buy me, and for my questions if diphergan 3 times a day was necessary the answer was one that suggested that the question was stupid, and I was trying to question the competence of the doctor (this is how she felt). What a wonderful place Regno is located centrally walking to all the attractions. The courteous staff is very eager to help. The rooms were clean and comfortable and I really enjoyed the Italian atmosphere of the whole hotel. Breakfast was good and the coffee was made freshly to order. Our room wasn't ready on the day of arrival because we had an early flight. Our luggage was guarded at the hotel while we walked around the city. . On our return they gave us a better room with a balcony, it was beautiful and with a view of the main street in front of the hotel. We were going to book through a travel agency but found them better prices when booking directly from the hotel through their website.

I'm very sorry, because I always try to praise rather than negatively evaluate the facilities where I had the pleasure of staying, but in this case it is difficult to see the positive aspect of this hotel. From the very beginning of the visit, the organization of the hotel has raised objections. . . problem with getting a pre-arranged room, preparing dinner for two people, leaving aside the child, the whole infrastructure around the hotel in ruins (rusty bikes, no bikes for children and seats, the playground is full of splinters - we were not able to use anything). ...the unpleasant smell in the room, cleanliness at a poor level. She was able to keep it all quiet and have fun, but at the time of check-out she received the information that I have to pay additional fees associated with the stay of the child - where before booking and paying for the stay emphasized the age of the child and everything agreed. The owners are not able to answer for the lack of knowledge of their employees and demand additional charges from guests, which is an absurd situation. She paid me and left me with a huge dislike and aversion to this place .

The research methods developed by Warsaw scientists will allow for the future search for pharmaceuticals that would have a precise effect on particular neural networks responsible for fear and its suppression. This would be a significant progress in treating phobias. The substances known so far affect not individual neuronal circuits, but entire brain structures. This means that their use could lead to uncontrolled erasure of memory traces. Fear, which is a strong, reflex response of the body to a specific stimulus, plays an important evolutionary role. The animal that feels it has a better chance of surviving in an unfriendly environment. However, exaggerated fear leads to anxiety disorders, which can significantly impede the functioning of the organism.

Nice place, peace and quiet. But that's all the good news. The service is not very professional, the hotel manager knows nothing and as if he couldn't do anything, he covers himself up all the time with the owner of the hotel (of course also claiming that he is not there at the moment). Soft mattresses, the bathroom needs to be cleaned more thoroughly (mouldy joints and dirty glass), carpets also dirty. Kitchen like kitchen, super revelation is not there. Spa? I gotta talk to your doctor about a suspected insulin resistance. To sum up, she came out of the visit with the feeling that since I do not yet have diabetes, and she came to me to find out how to proceed if insulin resistance is confirmed so as not to lead to the development of diabetes (my dad is a diabetic so I may have genetic predisposition), I am not an interesting case for the doctor. I strongly advise against it! ! !

I advise against it! ! ! She's been with your doctor seven times with her five-year-old daughter. She had night apnea and snored terribly. The doctor said it was an allergy. Hotel Zacisze encouraged us mainly because of its close location and positive opinions. There was no disappointment on the spot, on the contrary. The place is ideal for families with children - playground, swimming pool and salt cave. Additionally - a café and desserts worth recommending. Rooms are spacious and modernly furnished and guarantee good rest. A big plus for breakfast - a wide choice and the possibility to eat outdoors. If someone is looking for an intimate place with all the facilities of attractions, I recommend this hotel.

It was our second stay in this hotel. While the boarding has improved, unfortunately, there were attempts to cheat us on the type of apartment we booked. Upon arrival, we were told that there were problems with the apartment and offered 2 double rooms on two different floors. When asked what is the reason for such a change, we were told that we bought the apartment at a promotional price and that is why we get double rooms (in a lamentable condition). After showing our disapproval and protesting, the receptionist, in consultation with her superiors, after an hour, assigned us the keys to the apartment. Until now, I appreciated the Austrian order, but the current situation has significantly shaken the picture. . I judge it as an attempt to defraud, return the amount obtained from the promotion.

The hotel is very clean, small rooms, about 15mkw but for a couple it is sufficient completely, flat TV, hairdryer in the bathroom, air conditioning, in winter the room is warm in the room and the possibility of own temperature control, one small minus - no brush to clean the toilet in the rooms, very helpful and smiling staff took care of every matter, breakfast buffet, everyone will be full and very tasty, and again one small minus, sausages and scrambled eggs could be in the heaters. My overall score is very good!

We were 25. 04 together with her husband on duty . The price is 140 PLN a day, breakfast 20 PLN / person additionally paid on request. I think it's a good option if not all people use breakfast. Breakfast is a choice of sets with a hot dish and extras in large quantities. We have been given a spacious room a la suite (folded with 2 rooms with balcony). In the bedroom there is a large, comfortable bed for married couples, really comfortable pillows, a little too thin a cushion. The bathroom was spacious, well lit, but the downside was a bathtub without a curtain. You had to be very careful when using the shower to avoid flooding the bathroom. The bedroom was a bit chilly. Plus a small fridge in the room. Very important for business travellers is the location in the centre, close to offices and institutions - on foot in a few minutes. On the 3rd floor we did not hear the city noise. Proximity to restaurants, shops, cafés, services, bus stops, also a few minutes on foot. The wind - the fi worked fine - we only used laptops. Very nice service at the reception and at breakfast. Very small car park at the back of the hotel, lockable. In front of the hotel there are many parking spaces available. For us the price / quality / location / location / service / cleaning as much as possible. We stayed earlier in an ordinary motel in Nysa without wi - fi, breakfast, or the possibility of drinking coffee in an uninteresting and loud location at a price of 120zl / day so comparing the conditions here with this motel pays off more hereThe better conditions for an additional 20zl more. We believe that this is for the moment the best accommodation at a good price, and an ideal location. We are happy to take advantage again.

Cold, repulsive interiors . Food - nothing special . Service staff sweetened as usual in such places . I know guesthouses that offer not comparable higher standards. Everything in the hotel seems to be dirty and dirty. IT 2 labortoria No. 1 You have the opportunity, then go ahead and hit the leader! He likes students, does simple tasks and loves games - from what I remember, he plays passionately in Lineage `and 8.

Very easy to reach, the staff is very nice and you don't have to look for anyone. Eating warmly, choosing as in other resorts everyone can find something for themselves. Let me put it this way: the percentage of credit at the level of 10% from lectures and 30% from exercises. The best grade in the number of two is 4 for the whole course. If you want to get a great physical education, I recommend it, but with a good grade it's hard and even impossible.

Hello ! Maybe the doctor is a great specialist, but my impressions after the visit ( private ) are not the best ! ! ! I was at the visit with my 7-month-old son who was diagnosed with AD before - she expected me from the doctor a more individual approach to the patient, some tips and advice. . ... then the child was seen almost from behind the desk, I was telling me what she used to do and the doctor just nodded or not. She didn't find out anything new about m! ! ! She was given 3 prescriptions for the ointment and here the most interesting - one ointment with an antibiotic that is not used in children and has a carcinogenic effect! ! ! ( this is what the pharmacist said ! ) - yes, the effect on the skin would be immediately noticeable but at what cost ? ! I warn all mothers of children from AZS to be more interested in what doctors prescribe to lubricate their children - STERIDES or ENGINE antibiotics ! Greetings

I travel a lot but I've never met such a terrible atmosphere in a hotel created by the man who rules there. The staff is intimidated and the rooms need to be slowed down every second because attention. . . . . . . . . . . . .they'll charge you another day! . If you can avoid this place...

Very nice hotel with easy access. It was nice to live there for two days and I'll remember it nicely. The business trip and everything was in the best possible order. The food was perfect. The staff was perfect and very helpful in every detail. If somebody has to stay in the capital, I recommend this hotel.

I don't know who's writing this gentleman good reviews, but I think they're friends. I have a different opinion and I sincerely advise against visiting him. As soon as our child and I entered the office, we didn't close the door well and Mr. "Doctor" asked what was going on. And the point was that our 4 year old son had his nose clogged for a month, and a cough that made the child vomit. After trying to be treated by a pediatrician (allegedly a virus), I started looking for the cause of this condition. There were no temperatures, so the doctors did not prescribe antibiotics. We found that it was best to go to the laryngologist and he examined the throat, looked into the ears and led us to a fiberoscopic examination. He didn't say anything about this examination, he didn't ask my permission but he went into action and started putting a tube into the child's nose. Apparently it gives an anesthesia, but not in our case. After the examination, which resulted in increased throat tonsils and chronic tonsillitis, Mr. pseudo doctor prescribed us attention. . . . . . .cough syrup probably 9 in turn. He said to heal the child and consider removing the tonsil. I asked him what to treat him with. He gave me a prescription for over-the-counter syrup. The night was terrible child was crying had problems with breathing in the morning we called another doctor. this in turn examined the method of traditional nose said that fiberoscopy in such a state is an unreliable test but PLATNOZA, DIAGNOSIS purulent sinusitis infection in the ear, the child very sick - the treatment will be long even 2 months of course antibiotics. A few days have passed and it is completely different to see that he is recovering. I warn you parents he is not nice zero approach to children such a buc. He doesn't say anything from himself you have to get everything from him.

We went with our family (6 adults, 2 children) for 4 days during the Christmas period, from the very beginning we were enchanted by the surroundings, lovely colorful houses and nicely landscaped area. Apartments are clean, well-kept, according to the description. For children, a playroom open all day, a large swimming pool for adults, saunas and an entertainment room just right for the evening. We only had a problem to book a bowling alley because you can only do it at the bartender's, but in the end we succeeded. A small restaurant (we got the information that we have to open another one soon), so if you get a popular hour for breakfast, there may not be room in the main hall but the food is very good. There is a parking lot underneath every house, which is a great convenience. Very nice service. We'll probably be back there :)

The hotel makes an amazing impression. It is modern and very tastefully finished. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The view from the window is amazing. And that's unfortunately all I can say goodbye to this hotel. I was most surprised by the staff who decided to check the condition of the MINI BARK at 9 am during our presence in bed. The second shock was that the staff pointed out that going out with a cup of coffee from breakfast to the lobby is forbidden because it is suspected that I will steal a cup . Prices at the bar are 800%. ( slight overlap ) Tiles in the pool so slippery that the fear of coming out of the water . The cards in the rooms stop working at 12th . The food also does not knock you on your knees, but any criticism ends up in a mega waiter's pocket. I wish them the best but with such an approach to the client may be different with time. The manager, in my opinion, should focus more on the bullying of the service than on the customers .

The PURO Hotel turned out to be a shot at 10. Rooms in the hotel are very comfortable - size suitable for a couple, high standard of finish. Bathrooms are very comfortable, a big plus is the lighting responding to movement and the beautiful smell of soap and shampoo: ) A very nice accent was also a bottle of wine that was waiting for us in the room. Touch panels very intuitive, ingenious solutions. The hotel staff was extremely helpful, patient and smiling, responded to every doubt and really felt an authentic interest in the quality of our stay. "The device will resemble a classic breathalyzer. It will be a disposable mouthpiece through which the patient blows air. Then it will be thickened, and then the sensors will measure the concentration of a specific chemical compound," - said PAP creator of the device, Eng. Artur Rydosz from the Faculty of Computer Science, Electronics and Telecommunications of the AGH University of Science and Technology. The air exhaled by man contains about 500 different compounds, but scientists want to check four of them . The most important will be acetone, because its increased level may indicate diabetes mellitus. "When we know how much alcohol there is in the exhaled air, we also know how much it is in the blood. A similar correlation occurs with acetone exhaled," said the PAP interlocutor. The device will therefore be able to diagnose diabetes or check the patient for elevated blood sugar levels.

"The surgeon sits at the console, in a more comfortable position than at the operating table, which is important during operations lasting several or even several hours. Through the bioculars he sees a three-dimensional image, and in his hands he holds the cuffs of a motion detector. Da Vinci robot is already operating in many clinics around the world, his systems have very strong patent protection. In case of these operations the surgeon and the patient are usually in one room" - describes the PAP interlocutor. In the TeleRobinHeart project, Dr . Paweł Kostka develops control systems for surgical robots. Such systems can be divided into modules and placed in different places in the world, and they will communicate through network links and act as if they are next to each other.

The action of dissemination of educational materials is carried out all over Poland, in various forms. In Warsaw, Cracow or Gliwice, brochures can be obtained during various events, such as breakfast fairs, fairs and other local events. In Zielona Góra, Olsztyn, Rzeszów or Katowice, among others, educational leaflets are sent directly to private mailboxes. The materials are also available in selected catering outlets and grocery stores. However, first of all, everyone can download them from the project website www.zachowajrownowage.pl (bookmark "GOODS TO COLLECTION"). The interest in the action is high," says Agnieszka Maślanka from the Keep Balance press office. "We are being contacted by people asking where you can get more information or use dietary advice. Therefore, this autumn it is planned to repeat this undertaking.

"This is an important publishing position" - assessed the jury of the competition, noting that the book reflects "the enormous amount of work and commitment of the author, among others through the cited statements of leading oncologists in the world and in Poland and numerous stories of patients who have been struggling with cancer for many years, leading an active life". The Crystal Pen was presented to the PAP journalist on Tuesday in Warsaw. The idea of the competition is to promote and award the activity of journalists who increase public awareness of the dangers associated with the most popular diseases of civilization, such as cardiovascular diseases, diabetes and depression. The organizers honor journalists who, thanks to their work, contribute to the health education of Poles, promote a healthy and active lifestyle, as well as a better understanding of the benefits of, among others, prevention and regular check-ups .

Cancer cells of bitches are a good model for testing, because the results can be translated into what happens in the female body. "We live in the same environment, we often eat similar things. In both species the cancer develops spontaneously and slowly for many years. In both species, breast cancer is dependent on hormones and shows a number of similarities at the molecular level," said Dr. Król. Scientists have been conducting research mainly on cell lines and analysing animal tumour excretions. "Of course, there is still a long way to go from in vitro testing to translating the results into practice and applying them in the diagnosis and treatment of breast and nipple cancer in women. This is my greatest scientific dream," the scientist stressed.

A clear reduction in mortality as a result of preventive measures can be observed as early as one year after their introduction, cardiologists, specialists in other fields of medicine and journalists stressed during the conference entitled 'Mortality Reduction in the Mortality of the Child'. The conference entitled "How to improve the health of Poles" . It was held on Monday in Warsaw under the patronage of the Polish Ministry of Health. Polish Society of Cardiology (PTK) . " The stereotype that preventive actions bring positive health effects after many years or decades has become established in science. But now we have evidence that it is different. Research indicates e.g. . The research shows, for example, that as early as one year after the introduction of the smoking ban in public places, a decrease in hospitalization and mortality from cardiovascular causes can be observed" - said Dr Tomasz Zdrojewski, Chairman of the Public Health Committee of the Polish Academy of Sciences.

The seven-year BioMed challenge is over. In 2015 the project will be summarized. It is already known that "he brought up" a whole generation of young scientists who know the specificity of work in research and development projects, know the importance of intellectual property protection, can use the patent base and know the basics of industrial property law. "At the beginning of the BioMed project we organized a series of seminars on intellectual property. We explained how to protect intellectual property, when to publish and when to patent. We hired young scientists as technology brokers who, for particular research tasks, carried out a study on the purity and patentability of a given technology - enumerates Dr Laskowska. - Several technology brokers have been hired in the JRC EIT + employed. In BioMEda they support preparation for commercialization and establish relations with the business sphere. We are catching talented people, educated in the project, to work together with us" .

Lenka's mother When my daughter fell ill, she got my phone number from a friend to Dr. Dura. She called me to ask if she would come to listen to my daughter. After less than an hour the doctor was already at our house. She was very available. Extremely warm approach to the child. She patiently listened to our questions related to the proposed course of treatment and thoroughly explained how to proceed. What is the most important, she was very precise in what she was doing. She listened to my daughter with great accuracy and calmness on her first and then also on her follow-up visit. Dr. Dura not only focused on the problem that we are currently reporting, but also gave us some advice for the future regarding our daughter's health and development. If we happen to need advice, help with our daughter's health, we will only want to talk about it with Dr. Dura. He is a respectfully recommended doctor.

"In young people in Krakow, we have found significantly increased concentrations of compounds that indicate the development of inflammation in the body, such as reactive CRP, which, by directly affecting the endothelium, can cause impairment of vascular function," - said Prof. Professor PAP. Button . This suggests that the inhalation of polluted air, especially long-term inhalation, promotes the development of inflammation, which is the starting point for the development of cardiovascular diseases. Importantly, the pollutants have significantly worsened the function of blood vessels in overweight or obese people. These results have prompted scientists to take measurements of vascular function at times when average air pollution varies significantly. It turned out that in periods with significantly exceeded standards - especially PM2 , 5 dusts - the blood vessels functioned worse. "The situation of our blood vessels in the period of particular pollution can even be compared to that of smoking a cigarette" - commented prof . Button .

Until recently, patients with advanced melanoma had a chance to survive on average several months after the diagnosis. Thanks to immunooncological drugs, more and more of them survive for many years, and experts hope that in some cases they will cause a complete cure. "Let's remember that these methods came into use a few years ago. That's why we don't know at the moment whether it is a complete cure or just a long-term remission of the disease," explains Dr. Zagozdon. The researcher emphasizes that in Poland immunooncology in this modern understanding is just beginning to develop. One of the centres that are leading the way in this research is WUM. The university conducts, among others, research on monoclonal antibodies in the therapy of some lymphomas. They are directed by Dr Magdalena Winiarska . Dr Zagożdżon, in turn, investigates the role of oxidative stress in the immune system.

This situation definitely needs to change. Those who make hotel reservations through group purchasing services deserve full and transparent offers, as well as decent treatment and respect," stresses Łukasz Dąbrowski. What has changed in the perception of holidays planned through group purchasing services compared to 2010 is the awareness of customers. The most important feature that customers pay attention to when choosing an offer is the price (51%), but the second is the trust in the company selling the offer (12%), the next positions are taken by the amount of the proposed discount and the location of the facility. The weakest points of a reservation made through group purchasing services were: worse treatment ( " was treated as a second-class customer " - 28% ) and lack of people responsible for explaining the consistency of the service with the offer during the trip ( 19% ) .

In general, the hotel deserves a very positive assessment: - ) The only downside is that the room was often heard from behind a neighbour's wall or a person from the corridor, but this largely depends on the behaviour of the people accommodated next door : - ) Recommended ! ! !

A common method of testing spatial memory is computer testing: the test person sits in front of the monitor and moves in virtual space by moving the mouse. A person subjected to such tests does not move physically. For this reason, in experiments using computer visualization, only visual memory can be tested, not idiotic memory. That is why the Nencki Institute has built a test stand for testing idiothetic memory in humans under conditions of natural movement in space . The site - one of only two in the world - has the shape of a circular arena with a diameter of several meters, surrounded on all sides by black, thick curtains. The arena is darkened and soundproofed from the environment. In order to further reduce the impact of external stimuli, the test person is covered with a special eye patch and earphones, which additionally suppress external acoustic stimuli. "The task is simple: walking around the arena in total darkness and silence, one should return to the starting point. The return begins from that place in the arena where the sound appears in the headphones" - describes Dr Justyna Skolimowska from the Nencki Institute. The current position of the arena is recorded by a computer program thanks to a camera installed on the ceiling.

According to the university authorities, this is the first such device in Poland. It was equipped with a state-of-the-art Centre for Medical Didactics and Simulation launched at the beginning of the academic year, where students learn on phantoms resembling real patients and in rooms modelled on real operating theatres, delivery rooms or ambulance simulators. Presented on Wednesday, the device looks like a traditional autopsy table. However, its upper surface is a huge touch screen the size of a human being. By touching it you can freely rotate the models, cut them in any plane, enlarge specific fragments, add or remove individual organs or systems - e.g. blood or nervous. The "Library" of the device contains anatomical model of a woman and a man and 100 detailed cases . Moreover, lecturers can upload their own MRI or CT scans and display them in 3D form. The system also includes two 80 inch televisions, so even a large group of students can listen to the lecture on anatomy.

The IPC PAS message indicates that changes in the concentration of oxytocin itself in blood do not clearly determine whether the examined person has a tendency to autism. Before a diagnosis is made, the concentrations of at least a few other substances (biomarkers) would have to be checked in a characteristic way related to the disease. "Our chemical sensor for the determination of oxytocin is in fact only the first step towards building a more advanced medical device to diagnose autism predispositions. For some time now, we have been working on layers of polymers that react to the presence of two other compounds associated with autism: melatonin (which should not be confused with melamine) and gamma-aminobutyric acid," stresses the research project manager, Dr. Piyush S . Sharma ( IPC PAS ) .

Both kidney implantation surgeries took place on Tuesday, simultaneously in Warsaw and Szczecin. In the capital city, they were performed by specialists from the Institute of Transplantology and the Chair and Clinic of General and Transplant Surgery of the Infant Jesus Clinical Hospital in Warsaw (under the direction of Prof. Kwiatkowski and Dr. Rafał Kieszek). In Szczecin, they were performed by a team under the direction of the Head of the Department of Nephrology and Kidney Transplantation of the Provincial Hospital Complex Prof. Marek Myślak and Dr . Tomasz Śluzar from the General Surgery and Transplantation Department of the same hospital . The organs collected from donors were transported free of charge by LOT airplanes by persons authorised to do so. "We prepared an emergency version in case the weather conditions did not allow for air transport. At that time, ambulances would be sent from both cities to meet halfway between Warsaw and Szczecin and exchange the kidneys donated by the donors" - said prof . Kwiatkowski said . The idea was that after the removal of the kidneys their transport would not last longer than six hours until the implantation.

Dr. Hassan-Bartz did not inform us about the correct yellow body (on ultrasound it was measured as a gestational follicle and was measured on the outside and not on the inside). which, however, gives great hopes for a proper pregnancy, and this would be an important information for us because it gives hope for a correct embryo. During the visit there will always be a moment when you can tactfully ask your partner to leave the office, you do not have to do this in the first sentence right after the couple enter the office. Secondly, she had a rather painful gynecological examination in my opinion completely unnecessary since she came to me for an ultrasound. Until 30 years ago, if a man with a heart attack survived and was hospitalized, the doctors could only fight the effects of a heart attack and not stop it. The patient spent several weeks in a lying position, and after being discharged home, he was immediately on a pension because he was unable to work. "In fact, in the initial stages of infarction treatment it was the doctor and the patient was vulnerable - in the early 80's the patient was lying down for a month, 2 weeks were not allowed to move. At this point the patient with an uncomplicated infarction comes home after a week if we make this vessel accessible, and it functions perfectly normal," - said Tuesday to journalists prof. Andrzej Lekston from the Silesian Centre for Heart Diseases in Zabrze, formerly the Provincial Centre of Cardiology, where a modern model of myocardial infarction treatment has been developed, which has spread throughout Poland and allowed to save thousands of patients.

During the conference entitled "The future of the . During the conference "Participation of Polish scientists in international projects" prof . Jerzy Walecki , Chairman of the Committee of Medical Physics, Radiobiology and Image Diagnostics of the Polish Academy of Sciences (PAS) in Warsaw, pointed out that the conference is to show, among other things, . He said that the conference is to show, among other things, "how we are a scientifically talented nation" and how important it is to maintain cooperation between foreign centres where Poles work and Polish institutes and universities. The specialist emphasized that Polish scientists make very interesting discoveries concerning, among others, neurodegenerative diseases, such as Alzheimer's disease or multiple sclerosis. Professor Tomasz Trojanowski from the Medical University of Lublin assessed that regenerative brain medicine is a very important field. For many years the scientific community lived in the conviction that in the central nervous system there is no regeneration of those areas which are damaged by disease processes. "Recent fascinating achievements of medicine indicate that there are possibilities to induce regeneration in the central nervous system, which is a great hope for patients who are affected by various nervous system diseases, including strokes," he said.

In 2005, the FDA, in response to a request from green tea makers, concluded that there was no reliable evidence that drinking green tea could be associated with the reduction of certain types of cancer: lungs, intestines, oesophagus, pancreas and ovaries. The FDA also stressed at the time that there was limited evidence that drinking green tea had a positive effect on breast and prostate cancer prevention. A year later, the same organisation reported that there was no evidence that drinking green tea could be combined with a reduced risk of cardiovascular disease. In the same year, however, the same organisation gave a positive opinion on the ointment made from green tea. According to prof . Amarowicz , there are, however, studies which indicate a positive effect of green tea. While carrying out animal studies, it was noticed that green tea was 50% more positive in mice. It inhibited the development of intestinal cancer. In Japan a group of 40 thousand people was observed for several years. It turned out that in this group the mortality due to cardiovascular diseases in people who drank at least 5 cups of green tea was 25% lower than in others.

The product is of excellent quality and is intended mainly for people with gum problems. Thanks to the thickened formula, a small amount (even half a cm) of paste is enough to apply to the brush and after a while, a rich foam forms in the mouth. The paste has a strong mint taste, smells good, and its salutary effect on gums can be seen after just a few days of use. The product, due to its small size, is worth buying if, for example, we go on a business trip for a few days (we can easily fit the tube into a beautician). However, it is not worth buying this product when we intend to use it at home. It is definitely more profitable to buy a larger package.

The heart of the Pole starts to age earlier, about 30 years old, but this process is gradual, as is the gradual decline of the male sex hormone - testosterone. The heart of a 35-year-old is forty, a fifty-year-old is 60 to 65 and a seventy-year-old is 80. In women, the heart ages more rapidly. At the same age as the metric age, it is only in young women, generally up to 30. . . . .and at the latest by 44 years of age. In women aged 45-59, it is the same as in men of the same age, i.e. 60-65 years old. Then, after sixty, it ages faster than men. The heart of 70 years old Poland is already 95 years old, according to NATPOL research.

The hotel, or rather a hotel complex, consists of the main building, several storeys and a few free-standing houses, forming a kind of open-air museum located on a slope. Down there is a lake with a muddy, neglected road leading to it. They got 'em a room in one of the cottages, something like a country cottage. The first impression after entering the room is an unpleasant smell, some musty smell, probably a consequence of omnipresent humidity. The room was large, spacious with a large bathroom of a good standard, but it lacked a few things that were standard four stars: no fridge, no air-conditioning (only a fan that does not give much and does not cool the room on hot days), no clothes hangers in the wardrobe and on the walls at the door, no safe, no satellite TV with good picture quality (there are a few channels, the picture is snowy not to watch). It's all a bit embarrassing, considering that the prices here are very high. In the room there are flies and mosquitoes flying and in the courtyard in front of the house you can stumble over apples that have fallen from the trees, which nobody cleans up. There is also no bench in front of the house where you can sit down in the evening. Generally, all this spoils the impression and underestimates the stay and it's a shame because the potential is. You just need to invest a little bit - the owner, whoever you are.

My disease is glomerulonephritis in nephrotic syndrome. I went to see the Doctor directly after a 3 week stay in hospital. He wanted to consult both the recommended treatment and how to shape the daily diet. The doctor helped me to understand the mechanisms of this disease; he thoroughly discussed the conditions (good and bad sides) of the medicines that I have prescribed; as well as he indicated how to shape my diet in this disease. The visit broadened my horizons and strengthened my conviction that I can and will win with this disease. With all responsibility I recommend the doctor. Yours sincerely Grzegorz Rutkowski .

"Contrary to your intuition, walking through the forest, it is better to break through the bushes than to use the paths the animals walk on. There are seven times as many ticks on these paths as there are in the bushes! " - remarks Dr. Krzysztof Dudek, who worked at the Institute of Zoology at the Poznań University of Life Sciences during the research. The only people who may be interested in encountering ticks are probably researchers of these parasites. The issue of where the largest concentrations of ticks exist in the landscape was addressed by a group of researchers from Poland and Slovakia: Pavel Jozef Šafárik University in Košice and Slovak Academy of Sciences in Košice, as well as from the Faculty of Biology of Adam Mickiewicz University in Poznan and the Institute of Zoology of Poznan University of Life Sciences. The results were presented in "Annals of Agricultural and Environmental Medicine" .
