These are products in which tobacco is heated and not burned. In a traditional cigarette, the combustion process takes place at a temperature of about . 800 degrees Celsius, in the case of "heat not burn" technology (e.g. IQOS) the aerosol is produced by heating the tobacco to approx. 280 degrees. This produces potentially less harmful substances than traditional cigarettes. The research is conducted by the IQOS Institute of Experimental Biology. Nencki Institute of Experimental Biology. "People have always smoked, today they smoke and will continue to smoke. If the Institute contributes to the choice of a less harmful form of smoking, it is worthwhile to conduct this research. We are not going to prove that cigarettes are not harmful," said prof. Joanna Szczepanowska from the Institute.

For the time being, only a certain range of activities that the consortium would like to address are known. "We are talking about implementing a system of individualised medicine," says the director of IF PAS and explains that when standard methods of treatment are used, patients may react differently to them. For some, the therapy is effective and for others, it is not. Prof . Smoked explains that the patient's reaction to pharmacological factors is determined by the genetic background. Scientists are concerned with learning about this background and describing cases susceptible to typical therapies and atypical cases. "Before prescribing a particular drug, an individual profile of susceptibility (of the patient - PAP) to particular drugs could be made. If we were equipped with individual profiles, we would be able to prescribe such drugs with great certainty, not other drugs" - explains prof . Smoked . In this way the effectiveness of treatment could be improved. " ( In Poland - PAP ) there are already a few centres which make such attempts. We would like to do it on a large scale and propose a new order in medicine as far as individual treatment is concerned" - points out the director of IF PAS.

The first and basic issue is the lack of cleaning the rooms during the whole stay, after entering the room bottles under the bed from the previous stay, for the whole 3 days not disposed of rubbish (we were with a small child - dirty pampers ' were ' together with us in the room for 3 days). . . .toilet paper supplemented after intervention at the reception. Probably Mrs. Beata from the reception desk (black hair, stocky physique) tried to convince us that there are no vacancies for the Jacuzzi, which was a nonsense because the day before - in the evening another lady from the reception desk informed us that there are vacancies from 10 to 15. When we wanted to sign up for a later time, you answered that from 17 to 22 you are busy (so I don't understand how it feels that after two 20 sessions the water has to be cleaned for a minute and in the afternoon you can use it for 5 hours without a break? ) . Other ladies receptionists are very helpful and nice. Breakfast is tasty and varied.

As he says, our little tenants help us to digest e.g. fat, protein, fibre or sugars. He adds that substances secreted by bacteria can e.g. change the action of e.g. digestive enzymes or bile, and it is very important in absorbing fats or vitamins contained in them. The set of genes of our small tenants (e.g. bacteria, fungi, viruses or parasites) are microbial. It is easy enough for a microbiome to be examined by analyzing a faecal sample and sequencing the genes contained therein. Each of us has a slightly different microbiome that works a little differently. This, among other things, makes it easy for some people to gain weight in addition to our own genes, and for others to make concessions in their diet.

I'm not a demanding person. I also travel a lot with children. We often stay in 3 star rooms, but this hotel has disappointed us a lot. Perhaps the main building is different and we were accommodated in one of the additional buildings at the back of the hotel. The rooms are as clean as possible. The furniture is scratched, the bathroom door is overgrown with mould. A very small shower. Place in the bathroom covered with a curtain - do not turn around if you do not want to stick to it . The glass shelf hanging above the washbasin is tilted at an angle so that you will not put anything there because everything is going to come off. You keep your cosmetics in the room because nothing else will fit there. The family room is made up of two bedrooms separated by a door, but only one has an air conditioner. In the part without it, in the heat, you can not stand it. The air conditioner itself worked flawlessly except for the external unit which made the sound of a take-off plane. If you want to cool down the room before bedtime, you will not sit on the balcony and still you will only cool down one of them because nothing will get to another. The kitchen has a fridge and that's a plus, but also wandering food ants. When we happen to leave anything to eat on the counter. You had the impression that everything would come out on its own. Deep pool cleaned daily, no war over sunbeds. Breakfast, well, poor choice and poor quality all under English tourists. Eternal queues to the toaster, waiting for cups, plates and pieces. The constantly spoiled drinks machine. It overheated and had to wait for it to cool down. Very nice ladies serving, but they only two and the accumulation for breakfast from 9 - 10 so they barely made up. We spent all day long outside the hotel, but when he came in the evening, he did not want to go back there. They asked us to change the room, but we heard that there was no chance because the occupancy was full. The distance from the sea is over a kilometer. The beach was taken over by guests selling sun loungers 4 euros a day for one sunbed . When you want to lie on a towel you have a tiny piece of beach left. Generally a disappointment .

Hello, I'm a nineteen-year-old girl, another patient of Dr. Gryglewski. In February this year, on the last balance sheet, the family doctor felt a tumor on my neck. She got a referral for an ultrasound, which, as it turned out later, was misdescribed and had to do it again. The doctors told me that the tumor was already calcified and it was not cancer. After the biopsy, however, it turned out that I had suspected thyroid cancer. Dr. Gryglewski reacted immediately and the surgery had to be done about a week after receiving the results. My left thyroid lobe was removed. After two weeks, she got the result of the histopathological examination and found out that she had already been enrolled to the doctor. The result showed thyroid cancer. A few days later she had another operation and my right thyroid lobe and lymph nodes were removed from my neck. It was only when I received my second discharge from the hospital that I found out what she had actually experienced m . The card clearly stated "malignant thyroid cancer". After receiving the second histopathological examination, a stone fell from my heart. It turned out that there were no metastases. Now I have an endocrine consultation to find out if I have to have radiation therapy. The whole history of my disease went very quickly. The surgeries didn't turn out to be as terrible as it seems. All this time I was in good spirits. The first and second surgery was good for me. I'm a young person and she thought I wasn't affected by this kind of disease, and yet. I really encourage everyone to have regular check-ups and treatment myself. I am and always will be very grateful to Dr. Gryglewski for his quick reaction and help.

The thermometer was bought by us a few weeks ago. We are satisfied with it so far and can recommend it with a clear conscience. We tested the thermometer on 3 people. The results are repeatable - the deviation is about 0 , 1 - 0 , 2 degrees. The measurement takes a few seconds (during this time the thermometer should be moved 2 - 3 cm from the front). A very useful function is the ability to measure the temperature of the environment and objects . Thanks to that it is possible e.g. to check if the water in the bath tub has already the right temperature to start bathing the bean. It is worth to invest in a decent thermometer and be sure that the measurement results are correct. I recommend .

The next step would be to show how changing the secretion (expression) of these genes can affect the development of Down's syndrome. Because maybe the effect of the excess proteins produced in the body by these genes can be stopped somehow. Scientists want to study the development of Down's syndrome in an animal model. "The obvious choice here is a mouse," said Professor Tybulewicz. . . And he added that this mammal is not so far away from humans in evolution, and the genome of this rodent is already well known by man. He explained, however, that there is a problem. "Genes from the human chromosome 21 are found in mice in three separate regions: in fragments of the mouse chromosomes 10 , 16 and 17" - he said .

In the Institute of Experimental Biology of . M . Nencki PAS in Warsaw, mice with very precisely modified genome are studied. Thanks to the possibility of disabling a specific gene - called Dicer - in adult individuals, mice can be used to better understand processes related to such cognitive functions as learning and memory. Moreover, these transgenic mice may prove to be an interesting material for research on metabolism disorders resulting in obesity, the representatives of the Nencki Institute inform in a message sent to PAP . "The knowledge about the functions of individual human genes is absolutely fundamental both in biology and medicine - says Dr Witold Konopka, head of the Animal Models Laboratory at the Nencki Institute. - But how to know the functions of a gene if we cannot make genetic modifications in humans? The only method is to create a suitable animal, for example an adult mouse in which the gene could be switched on or off in order to model the disease properly. This is easy to say, much harder to do. Especially when it comes to genes that are really important for every cell.

As Dr Łukasz Kozera, the head of the facility in Biobank, which is located in one of the buildings at the Faculty of Pharmacy of the Wroclaw Medical University at Borowska Street, said during the press conference, biological samples will be collected not only from patients suffering from cardiovascular or autoimmune diseases, but also from all residents of Lower Silesia aged 25 to 75 years. "Currently, scientific projects are based on the use of research on a large number of patients, because it guarantees, among other things, good quality of their performance. Materials for this type of research are made available from biobanks. Each of us, for example, by donating blood to a biobank, supports such research and automatically guarantees better medical care for our children or grandchildren in the future" - stressed Kozera .

Best Western in Poland has joined the Best Western chain offering 24 rooms, a 3-star Best Western Poleczki hotel located on Poleczki Street in Warsaw's Ursynów district. Thus, the number of hotels operating under the Best Western brand in Poland has reached 12 facilities offering a total of 1288 rooms. A simple calculation shows that Best Western, present in Poland since 2001, has statistically increased by 1.09 hotels per year. In practice, in the years 2001-2010, the chain once more hotels and once less. A more stable and dynamic growth was observed in the last year. r . A more stable and dynamic growth occurred last year when 6 hotels joined BW. According to the earlier announcements of BW representatives, the chain wants to maintain the dynamics and end 2012 with a potential of approx. 20 hotels . The official announcement of the hotel at Poleczki Street joining the BW chain is to take place on 26 April.

On-line bookings from your own website are more effective (cheaper) than bookings from booking portals and telephone bookings. Hotels, which are active in social media, are experiencing an increase in the number of bookings, while hotels ignoring this type of media, are losing bookings. Social media campaigns encourage bookings much more effectively than traditional e-Mail campaigns. The most profitable for hotels are bookings made via mobile phones. These are the basic conclusions from the analyses made by buuteeq and compiled in the form of infographics. Full version of the infographics presented by buuteeq - jpg file - 1 MB - can be downloaded from TU! buuteeq is the world's first digital marketing system (DMS) for hotels. From its launch until 2010, buuteeq solutions have been adopted by over a thousand hotels. Infographics : Hotel marketing costs - buuteeq .

In March we booked a room for August ( 4 days ). The price was to be 90 PLN per day. On the spot we were informed that this room costs 170zł, but will be rented to us for 140zł. Moreover, the employees did not even know for how long they arrived, in the system they had a one-day stay. They asked us to contact the manager, which was met with a categorical refusal of arrogant and insolent staff. They asked us for the official price list, but we were also sold. We were informed that the manager has the right to do whatever he wants because it's his hostel, he doesn't have to inform us about the price change, because it's our duty to call 2 days before arrival and ask if this reservation still exists at all. He added that the small print on their portal was given about the price change, however, when they asked us to show it, the employee said that he did not have access to it. When they told us that we were going to lodge a complaint with the Office of Competition and Consumer Protection, an employee said that in that case he was going to ask us out of the hostel. Unfortunately, we were not the only ones affected, and we were accosted by many people with similar problems. Avoid, and if you have been cheated by the hostel (or hostel at the fish market - > the same owner), report it by email to the Office of Competition and Consumer Protection (http://www.uokik.gov.pl/), it is worth that someone takes care of this problem.

The best place you can choose in Podhale ! For the second time I had the pleasure of spending a weekend in the guesthouse "My Tatras" . I am delighted with the climate and charm of this place. Spacious, clean, well-kept and beautifully decorated rooms, a living room where you can relax by the fireplace and play table tennis or watch a movie with friends, a place to play for the kids, a great home kitchen that can easily compete with this grandmother. You may find most of these things in a few other places, but you certainly won't find the atmosphere created by the owner, who takes care of every guest, who cares about the well-being of everyone, who is willing to talk about the local culture, who will recommend places worth seeing, will lift hearts of everyone. It was my second weekend here, but I hope there will be many more.

My health problems started in 2007. Initially I was looking for help in conventional medicine, but unfortunately it did not bring me any relief. The health problems were really big and painful. In 2011 I was diagnosed with multiple sclerosis - an incurable disease in Western medicine. In the meantime somebody told me about acupuncture, dared me, benefited me and convinced me on my own skin that this is something wonderful. He used em to use acupuncture with a few people, but nobody helped me like Dr. Nguyen Van Tuyen. He got 'em from the very beginning, as soon as he appeared in Poland in the beginning of 2014 and to this day I still go to the implantation treatments - Katgut . Compared to traditional acupuncture, this is a much better way of treatment because the doctor introduces short surgical threads into the body at the appropriate points on the human body (depending on our illness) . This treatment is repeated once a month, so it is much more convenient for the patient because in the traditional acupuncture treatments I went for 3, 4 times a week and here it is only once a month and in fact throughout the month are stimulated by the threads and not as in the traditional acupuncture only when there are needles. And now a few words about what I've been suffering from: serious immune problems, eternal colds, sinus pains, cross, buttocks, back, thighs, legs and chest pains. Today, thanks to the Implantation - Catgut method, I no longer have these problems and pains. I highly recommend Dr. med. Van Tuyen Nguyen is a man of great knowledge and skills. I recommend that you try this method at least once in order to assess the influence of Eastern medicine on your body. I don't know a better specialist.

Amazing doctor. His commitment is incredible. I've never met a doctor with as much empathy and kindness as Dr. Sarosiek. I called him in February that I have 15 cm of semen. He invited me to visit him the next day, Saturday (! ) because he said it couldn't wait. Throughout the whole period of treatment he took care of everything for me: referrals, examinations, doctors, stays in hospital. He told me to write to myself if I would run out of medicines or even feel worse. He said that the most important thing for him is to cure me. I admire him, where he gets his energy from. There are 40 people queuing for consultations and he doesn't refuse anyone. He treats everyone individually. Today the results came - I am healthy. He has guided me through the whole treatment as best as possible. Tomasz Sarosiek is the best doctor you can dream of and additionally he is a fantastic person.

The Even Hotel, a branded hotel for guests who care about their health and fitness, will be opened in late 2014 in New York City. The first hotel created by InterContinental Hotels Group in February this year will have 230 rooms and will be located near Grand Central Station in central Manhattan. The hotel's rooms are designed for exercise and equipped with hypoallergenic linen and antibacterial wipes. The hotel will offer gyms for indoor and outdoor exercise, as well as a catering facility with a special healthy menu. There will also be conference rooms in the building. The investor is a developer company CWC , Inc . . IHG expects to sign 100 franchise or management agreements for running Even hotels on the key US markets within the next five years.

We've never had to deal with such an arrogant and rude doctor. This lady and our 2-month-old daughter, suspected of immaturity of the nervous system, were taken to this lady. During the whole interview she treated us as bad parents whose mistakes made the child have such problems. At times, she undermined and mocked our knowledge of infant development. But the worst part was the research itself. This doctor doesn't have the right attitude towards children, she is so insensitive, that then it was hard for us to calm our daughter down. I'm surprised at this lady's approach, because the visit was private and we were not there for free. I don't recommend it to anyone and I don't wish to be in contact with this lady.

"Non-specific MMP inhibitors - 9 have been tested in other disease entities, such as . As a result, there is a large pool of drugs not tested for epilepsy. The aim of the project is to analyse such substances in the treatment of epileptogenesis," said the researcher . She added that it was planned to obtain the most promising substances and then to test their penetration through the blood-brain barrier and their inhibitory effect on the development of epilepsy in appropriate models. Dr Kozicka stressed that despite the introduction of a number of new antiepileptic drugs in recent years, still about 40% of patients remain drug-resistant. For these patients the search for new antiepileptic drugs seems to be the only way to control their epileptic seizures and enable them to function normally in society.

Research will help to better understand certain mechanisms that lead to hypertension. Perhaps in the future this research will also help in the prevention and treatment of this disease. Wojciech Kopeć, a Polish PhD student at the University of Southern Denmark in Odense, together with his team studied the sodium and potassium pump, and especially one of the proteins that make it. "It is present in all human cells. Its primary task is to properly maintain the difference of sodium and potassium ion concentrations inside and outside the cell," says Wojciech Kopeć in an interview with PAP. The task of a protein is to remove excess sodium from the cell and inject potassium into it. The researcher explains that a protein is so common and necessary that it seemed that any mutation in the gene encoding this protein would cause cell death.

She was in the economic part. Small rooms with a small bathroom, clean and tidy. A small TV and small towels but comfortable beds and despite the proximity of the motorway very quiet. The surroundings of the hotel leave a lot to be desired: a strange courtyard parking lot, some hashes around, unpaved paths leading to nowhere, some fairy tales, architecture also some clumsy and looks more like a workers' hotel from the 80s but already inside is quite pleasant.

One of such important genes is the Dicer mouse gene, which Dr. Konopka has been researching for several years. This gene, whose analogue is found, among others, in the human genome, has its share in regulating the work of other genes and its activity is essential for the proper functioning of the cell. The Dicer gene cannot be switched off in zygotes, because it will prevent the proper development of embryos. However, scientists have developed a way to cut out a specific gene from the genome of a suitably genetically modified adult mouse using pharmacological means. "The first mice in which the Dicer gene could be switched off at any time were given 'em a few years ago during a postdoctoral internship at the German Cancer Research Center in Heidelberg. Now we also produce them in the Animal Model Laboratory of our institute. But creating the animals themselves is only part of the work. If we want to conduct research with the help of mice, the animals must be properly characterized" - points out Dr. Konopka .

I've been treating you for over two years. I have hypothyroidism. She seems to be a nice person on the level - but I witnessed the patients leaving the office talking to her and commenting on their behaviour behind their backs. At the beginning it was ok . Although the Doctor made one of the first visits when choosing contraceptive pills (earlier the gynecologist changed them twice as an experiment; she felt bad, she had e.g. dizziness). She said that in total we can do an accurate hormone test, as she put it, "we'll do well, because normally she would pay m for these tests over 600 pounds. " I won't even comment on such a statement to the patient. . . Anyway, I got a hypotension, she got a Letrox m, checked herself regularly and at one point it was time for the baby. After the checkups, the doctor said that we can act with the husband. We succeeded "after the first approach" and of course, being afraid of thyroid problems and complications because of that in the child, she asked the doctor if she would be able to lead me in pregnancy - she agreed. And well . . . . . .I'm 7 months old, even once I wasn't examined, I didn't have a cytology done. If she hadn't been seen by another doctor she probably wouldn't have had enough basic tests done by now. One of my visits lasted over half an hour - and she didn't have a chance to ask the doctor any questions because after 5 minutes she apologized politely and made a private phone call to a friend and talked to her for over 20 minutes in the meantime writing prescriptions and drawing the phrases on a piece of paper. Then she left the office with me with the phone at her ear, came up to the registration, stamped the prescriptions and said goodbye. I would like to add that under the office there was a crowd of patients. I confirm that she leaves the office and disappears for 15-20 minutes and then comes back with some friend under her arm, with whom she closes for half an hour, regardless of the fact that under the office there are women waiting for a few months earlier and often rushing to work. . . Recently, in her pregnancy card, she discovered with amazement that I am after infertility treatment - which never happened. . . . . .of course, she had my tests done, but she had no problem getting pregnant and she didn't take any medication either. . .

"It's a man's close neighborhood. If there are no or too few bird hosts, and if their populations grow excessively, the hungry fringes can infiltrate the dwellings and attack people, mainly during night-time rest," - said PAP prof . Solarz , who heads the Department of Parasitology of the Faculty of Pharmacy with the Department of Laboratory Medicine of the UUM in Sosnowiec . Pigeon ticks prick very painfully and their victim feels pain and itching for a long time. Skin lesions may persist for up to 1 or 5 years. As the parasitologist emphasizes, it is very dangerous to attack the face - it can cause swelling or tick paralysis making it impossible to breathe. The stabbing may also result in inflammation of lymphatic vessels, and in sensitive people - allergic reactions. "In extreme cases, repeated stabbing of the edges in sensitive people can cause anaphylactic shock and death, such cases have been reported in Poland" - warned prof. Solarz .

An increase in transplantation in our country will not be possible without increasing the number of organ donations from the deceased. In this respect we have been stagnating for several years. In 2012, 615 so-called real donors were reported, i.e. those from whom organs were donated. In 2016, the number of these donors decreased to 544 , although it was already slightly higher than in 2015. In 2016, the number of these donors decreased to 544 , although it was already slightly higher than in 2015 when 526 donations were reported. "All promotional activities related to organ procurement rest with kidney transplantation centres. In addition, it is mainly based on the passion of the teams involved in these transplants. And that is no longer enough. Donor recruitment should be centrally coordinated and nationwide, as it is organised in Spain. Promotional activities should receive greater support from the Ministry of Health. It should also be helpful to set up in 2016 by the Institute of Transplantology Polish Society for the Donation of Organs" - explained prof . Kwiatkowski .

Dr. Oliver Gautschi of Lucerner Kantonsspital ( Lucerne, Switzerland ) presented e.g. a paper indicating that a small group of patients with lung cancer and mutation in the BRAF gene (about 2% of patients) may benefit from the same molecularly targeted drugs used to treat melanoma patients with BRAF mutation. Prof . Solange Peters from the Centre Hospitalier Universitaire Vaudois in Lausanne pointed out that the use of molecularly targeted therapies in lung cancer patients is hampered by the fact that cells of this cancer, like melanoma cells, have much more somatic mutations (i.e. formed in body cells rather than inherited - PAP) - on average approx. 200 - than is found in the cells of other malignant tumours.

On January 14th, Monday, the President of the Republic of Poland Bronisław Komorowski will visit a four-star Bania Thermal & Ski Hotel in Białka Tatrzańska . The visit to the Bania Hotel is part of the President's visit to Podhale . The purpose of President Komorowski's arrival are places where the highlanders, cultivating local traditions and using the potential of the region, have achieved success. For example, on the premises of the Bukovina Terma Hotel Spa in Bukowina Tatrzańska, the President will meet the local community and entrepreneurs from the Małopolska region and give a speech. This year President Komorowski will bypass Zakopane. "President Komorowski's visit to Białka Tatrzańska is certainly a historic event. Such a distinguished guest in less than 3 weeks from the opening of Hotel Bania is, we hope, a good sign for our investment". ...says Paul Dziubasik, the owner of the hotel. President Komorowski will also visit the Bania Ski Center and Kotelnica Białczańska .

"Professor Bandmann described the slow disappearance of the neurons that produce dopamine. This is exactly the same mechanism that causes the progression of the disease in humans. When 80 percent of such neurons disappear in a certain part of our brain, Parkinson's disease appears. In fish you can trace these pathological changes," explains the professor. So scientists are looking for ways to prevent them. They dissolve various substances in water and check whether they can stop or at least delay the disappearance of dopamine neurons. For many years there have been no new drugs for Parkinson's disease. The doses of the classic medicine must be gradually increased, and after a while they stop working.

Location well connected, bus station, railway station nearby, marina, market, restaurant nearby.

Researchers from the Jagiellonian University have been monitoring more than 500 pregnant women and their children for dust exposure (in the form of particles with a diameter of 2,5 micrometers and smaller, PM2,5) since 2000. Such contaminants are particularly dangerous to health as they penetrate directly into the lungs. In recent days in Poland their acceptable standards have been significantly exceeded in many places. Newborn babies, whose mothers during pregnancy were exposed to higher air pollution, weighed less - on average by 128 g - than children exposed to lower pollution. The researchers noted that in this group of children, the so-called "wheezing breath" was more frequent in later periods of life, which is often connected with the appearance of asthma later on.

"The KZM is underestimated because the majority of the diseases occur in the eastern part of Poland" - says prof. Zajkowska . Meanwhile, due to, among other things, climate warming - milder winters and warm humid summers - the expansion of ticks to new areas is observed and the related increase in the incidence of KZM. This applies to both Poland and other European countries. In 2015 there were 150 cases of this disease requiring hospitalization in Poland and in 2016 there were already 283 . According to prof . According to Professor Zajkowska, there were certainly many more cases of the disease, but not all of them are registered. When winter is mild, the season of tick activity starts already in March. "When the temperature rises above 10 degrees Celsius. C all the characters of the tick feed simultaneously, and the youngest characters are even more dangerous," the specialist estimates.

Income from renting a room, apartment or house to tourists may be exempt from personal income tax under certain conditions. It is necessary that the building is located in a rural area, on a farm. In addition, no more than five rooms may be rented. If all these conditions are met, then you can benefit from the personal income tax exemption. If there is also food for tourists within the framework of these services, income from these services may also be exempt from tax, believes Katarzyna Rola - Stężycka, Tax Care company expert. What is important, all the above mentioned conditions must be kept and fulfilled together in order to be able to benefit from the exemption. This means that, for example, if a taxpayer bought a house with five rooms in the mountains in the countryside, but does not have a farm, he is not entitled to exemption.

"The uniqueness of this room is that it is entirely for children. It is also unique that it will be able to perform interventional cardiology and conventional, typical surgical procedures at the same time, which will shorten the time of the procedure" - said Maciej Kowalczyk, Director of the University Children's Hospital. He expressed his belief that all the hospital's more difficult patients will be admitted to the hybrid room. In turn, the head of the hospital's cardiac surgery and intensive cardiac care ward, prof . Janusz Skalski emphasized that "thanks to Radio Zet Foundation the hospital can have the most modern hybrid room in Poland and probably in Europe" . "Because there are such rooms, but they are designed for adults. Not for children . It was not believed that a hybrid room for children would be needed. At the moment we know that for the most complex defects in children this hybrid room is even more necessary than in adults, and maybe most of all for such patients it is necessary because thanks to these modern devices you can do less harm and help more" - said prof . Skalski .

A child of this age can also try a little bit of Christmas, roasted meats and cured meats, provided that they are cooked on their own, with a little salt. If we give him/her stuffed eggs, the filling should be for example roasted salmon, boiled fish or vegetables. Dishes with raw eggs, e.g. cold cheesecake or homemade mayonnaise, should also be avoided by pregnant women. A safer solution will be hard-boiled eggs or eggs in the form of heavily cut scrambled eggs, eggs stuffed with fish or vegetables. "Eating raw eggs, meat or fish carries the risk of Salmonella infection. All diseases requiring pharmacological treatment are too risky for the health of a child in the womb" - stresses the PAP interlocutor.

Hotel prices in European cities are falling dramatically, even compared to the huge falls during the 2008-2010 recession. Rooms in Prague are 37 percent cheaper. The Los Angeles Times newspaper reports that rooms in Prague are 31% cheaper than in 2011, according to Hotwire.com. The high drop is due to several factors: excess hotel rooms after the London Olympics, the problems of the European economy and the weakening of the euro, as well as the typical price cuts for the industry, explains Clem Bason, president of the Hotwire group. Bason points out that, according to Hotwire, Paris, Barcelona and Rome have the lowest hotel prices in over five years, while air fares to Berlin, Dublin and Helsinki have fallen by 13 percent. . According to Hotwire's boss, a similar situation occurred in Canada after the Vancouver Games.

On her six cats she tested m different gravels, and I definitely stay with it. It was beautifully clumped, but you have to remember that the layer of gravel in the tray was not too thin. I'm 42 years old. I've been to several gynaecologists in my life. Mrs. Sokołowska is - so far - the only gynaecologist who did not write a prescription for contraceptives, for which she came to her by accident. She was very carefully examined by me. I even noticed very visible veins on my legs, which no doctor had noticed before! She was given a referral for a test, the results of which were to help match the best contraception for me. She did the tests but only after 4 months. With the results she was sent to another doctor - unfortunately Mrs. Sokołowska does not work in my health center anymore - a great pity! A very nice gynaecologist looked at the results and asked about the purpose of the visit. The answer "I ask for a prescription. . . . "...asked for which measure? She was wondering about the pills, then the rings. . . . The charming gentleman said that he could prescribe me anything I wanted and actually as much as I wanted. And as for the helpful test results... . . . . Well, they were normal, as he said. The visit lasted 7 minutes. So she took my prescription, thanked me, realized me. . . After the next one I will report to Ms Sokołowska with the results of the tests she gave the referral for. I hope that they will be useful! I also know that I will not have to be alone - despite the presence of the doctor! - wondering which method will be the best for me! I highly recommend a visit to Mrs. Sokołowska .

"The surface of burnt skin has a temperature lower than that of healthy skin, which is related to its damage and metabolic atrophy" - explains prof . Ewa Majchrzak . During the healing process these temperatures equalize . On the other hand, the knowledge of the difference in these temperatures makes it possible to diagnose the burn itself" - she says . The first degree of burn is not dangerous, just a cold compress. With the third degree of burn, the matter is also clear, because there is tissue carbonization and there are not many treatment options. However, the biggest problem is for doctors with second degree burns. "In this case the doctor must decide whether the tissue should be cut out surgically or treated. The possibility of differentiating the degree of the burn in this case is a key issue in deciding how much tissue can be saved" - explains the researcher. IR Diagnostics can be used not only to diagnose burn wounds, but also to imaging the healing of other difficult and extensive wounds, e.g. diabetic wounds, in which there is also a temperature difference.

I just got back with my wife from Parasol Garden and I have a very nice memory of staying in this hotel. The rooms are furnished in a typical Spanish hotel style. They're cleaned daily and really decent. We had a room on the 8th floor and we had a view of the sea and the pool. Really cool. When we arrived at the hotel, because it's a big hotel, we were afraid that we would wait for the pool bar or the restaurant. However, there is no problem with that. You can easily find a table, either on the terrace, at the bar or in the restaurant. The service at the pool bar and the service, is really quick and helpful and quickly handles your requests. When it comes to food, if you like Spanish cuisine, you will find something for yourself, a gazpacho, paella and various Spanish dishes are served, which I consider a huge plus and minus. When it comes to the location, it is rare to find such a good one. The map seems to be a bit off the beaten track of Torremolinos, but actually, the centre is not far away. The beach is literally 60 meters away. There is also a train station (about 10 minutes away) from where you can get to Malaga or Fuengirolli, so trips along the Costa del Sol are at your fingertips. In a word, I recommend this hotel. There are no great luxuries, but this is after all a hotel with 3, 5 stars and I think that quietly on these 3, 5 - 4 deserves. We'll be back there for sure.

"A mostly positive picture of the life situation presented by people infected with syphilis can be a manifestation of the patients' wishful thinking about how it should be. Most of the patients presented themselves as if nothing exceptional had happened, and their life situation and social position have not changed - explained Prof. Teresa Rzepa, a psychologist from the Poznań branch of SWPS. - However, the most disturbing thing is that the infected persons show carelessness, which makes them a threat to their partners or passing lovers. In the most difficult psychological situation there are women infected during pregnancy by partners who do not reveal the fact of the disease and young people whose + first + ended up in hospital with a syphilis diagnosis" - says prof . Turnip . Prof . Rzepa points out that new legal regulations do not force patients to disclose personal data of their sexual partners. Moreover, patients willingly use private medical practices and do not give the names of people who may be infected with syphilis. Often they also do not inform their partners about the need to see a doctor, which can prevent the development of the disease.

"Our substance can be given by injection, but it can also be given orally - just like a pill with a medicine. For the time being it is of course science fiction , but in the future such a pill can influence the precise inhibition of cells responsible for alcoholism" - he describes . In the future, the results of the study could be translated into other drug addictions such as . They all take place in the same area of the brain: in a reward system. The same cells, which are responsible for alcohol or drug addiction, control appetitious learning - i.e. the learning of pleasant sensations. "For the brain it is the same mechanism. Only that addictive memories are strong enough to be practically irreversible, and we remember them for life. That is why if someone is an alcoholic, he or she will remain an alcoholic forever" - emphasises the researcher.

The Resilience to Fraud of the UK Hotel Sector report " The Resilience to Fraud of the UK Hotel Sector " estimates the value of fraud in the UK hotel sector at £2 billion. prepared by PKF and the University of Portsmouth consulting firm. The amount of losses corresponds to 5.7% of the industry's total revenue, which is approx. 40 billion pounds a year . According to the authors of the report, the hotel sector is one of the least resistant to fraud. On a scale of 50 points, the hospitality industry received 25.4 points, behind the entire private business sector, which received 30.6 points. Stuart Collins, National Hotel Partner at PKF, believes that fraud is a serious problem for hotels and has an impact not only on the condition of the industry but also on the quality and prices of services used by customers. Collins added: "Reducing the loss of fraud is one of the least painful ways of minimizing company expenses in the current economic climate. All the more so as the costs of fraud - unlike expenses related to personnel, goods and equipment and real estate services - are unnecessary and unproductive. The most frequent hotel frauds are crimes committed by customers, such as those related to payments and payment cards.

And in the summer, it buzzes all the time because it can't cool. The frost-free system is the bottom. You have to defrost the fridge every six months because on the back wall behind the casing there is a layer of 10 cm of ice which blocks the air intake control flaps. The effect is that the freezer on the upper drawers has a positive temperature. The look and operation is great but nothing else . I strongly advise against .

I went to see your doctor during pregnancy. Unfortunately, he didn't have blood and urine tests regularly. He said that you don't have to do tests every month. Hello, I recently had a cartilage and bone nose surgery. I am very pleased with the operation and its effect. Everything went without complications, which allowed me to recover quickly. My nose is proportional to my face and not like before, hunchbacked and torn. I do not regret my decision because the effect is very beneficial.

The room wasn't cleaned, very tight (one person had to enter the bed if the other wanted to go through) Torn out power sockets, the TV was destroyed, probably with 25 years old (with the remote control not working) Problems with opening the door with a card. . . far from the bus stop. For $ $ of scrambled eggs every day, hard eggs and the same sausages, water for tea brewing mostly lukewarm, practically not working wi fi (internet generally weak in this area) The hotel has a place to barbecue, upon arrival we prove that there is no such place. Warszawianka is close to Warsaw and we like her very much but: the service is not on level 4 * . . starts with the reservation itself. We've been to the hotel several times, but every time we make a phone reservation we have to give an email address to confirm the reservation. Each time this confirmation does not reach us and we need more reminders. Strange that it is so difficult to coordinate the customer base with his e-mail. Especially in these times when the data is so valuable. . The second thing is the impossibility of ordering morning coffee to your room. She heard the m. . : "not because you don't." It wasn't until after the intervention at the reception that she succeeded. Ladies and gentlemen, if the room service does not include a morning latte, please write this. Morning discussions with the reception desk / room service etc are tiring. . Another matter is the crowd in the pool. I am surprised that when the hotels are occupied, people from outside are allowed into the pool. Such a crowd is not very relaxing. Plus for a good but crowded breakfast. . One more thing is the poorly animated kids. Children defend themselves from going into the playroom. . And I'm not surprised at all. . No attractions and the ones that are, are heavily enforced. . .

Nice plate - until you start using it . It is fatally cleaned, the tiniest dot of water is very visible, and cleaning it with various means borders on a miracle. I have had the board for 2 months, I clean it after each use and it looks like after 3 years of use by students. Additionally a huge minus for service and contact with them. We regret the purchase of this board - for such money the quality and service should be at a higher level.

An average hotel that can be said to be "ok". Spacious rooms, traditionally furnished, small bathrooms - generally for business trips ok. With the family, or for a comfortable rest with friends, I would rather not choose it. Comfortable beds, unfortunately very thin walls, so high noise level between the rooms. She did not use the spa part, supposedly quite good. One elevator in the whole hotel. Nice and competent service. In the restaurant quite long waiting time for the dishes, the quality of the dishes in order. She was very surprised by the name and location of the hotel, and was pleasantly surprised by the plus.

Close to the center, nice rooms, nice service. I recommend, . . . . .without a car. . . It describes that it has free parking spaces! ! . . .and that sometimes the car can be parked on the street! ! ! also for free ! ! without the grace of your owner! ! ! dr . Juste, even though he's reticent, he's specific. In the hospital he does not distinguish his patients from private practice, he treats them on an equal footing with others. " Hotel in a beautiful area in the middle of the forest " - That's probably 20 years ago ! Next to the hotel there is a very busy road, the rooms are loud, and the stench is omnipresent. The rooms look beautiful in the pictures. I advise against staying with everyone. It is probably better to pay a little more and live in normal conditions.

The headphones have already been withdrawn from production - the opinion writes as a warning to possible amateurs of goods from sale or second hand. I chose these headphones because of the ( apparently ) excellent workmanship and sound quality . The headphones sound really good: the sound is slightly dimmed but not dull - the treble and midrange are very saturated, the bass is also great and, contrary to some opinions, well balanced - e.g. . It does not interfere with the message in intimate recordings. The list of advantages is complemented by high wearing comfort and excellent isolation from the environment. Unfortunately, my idyll with M1 lasted only half a year - after this period (probably) the cable inside the headband broke down - which is odd because the headphones are not folded, so the damage probably occurred as a result of a simple adjustment when putting them on your head. In my copy, fortunately, the pads did not peel off - which is supposedly a typical case of this model (on the mp3store forum there is even a separate thread on this subject). Of course, the product is under warranty, but Philips does not service it anymore so I will receive a refund. The lack of service for the model for 900 - 1000 PLN (catalogue price), introduced to the market two or three years ago, proves the worst for the manufacturer.

In Cuma we stopped for one night and I must admit that the object makes a positive impression. The facility is clean and tidy, the service is nice and helpful. Cuma is somehow divided into two standards - cheaper, obviously hostel, with shared bathrooms and more expensive - at hotel level, rooms with their own bathrooms. We used a room of a higher standard - it was very clean, spacious, the bathroom was also clean and aesthetic. The equipment itself - very basic - a wardrobe, two beds and a TV set. What should be kept in mind - in contrast to hotels - for each element is paid separately: - room, - bedding (8 PLN per set), - towels (4 PLN per item), - parking (12 PLN per day). The hotel day ends quite early, because at the hour. 10 : 00, but for a reasonable price it can be extended (so-called. day stay). The object is well located: right next to the parks - Jasne Błonia and Kasprowicz Park, next to the beautiful, XIX century part of Szczecin. I recommend it to all who are looking for accommodation in decent conditions for a reasonable price.

She was a private patient of my professor. At the visit, the doctor kindly explained his doubts and referred him immediately to the hospital due to elevated cancer markers and a change in the ovary. He said that with the ovary it is never fully known so as soon as possible the change must be removed. In the hospital as a patient of professor Suzina was treated very well even though I was admitted to the hospital in the evening, but first thing in the morning I had done all the necessary consultations and was the first to be taken to the operating theatre. So everything is wonderful. . . . . . .until. . . After the operation, the professor informed me that there were no lesions on the ovary, but endometriosis was detected which could have caused an increase in cancer markers. A great relief. . . She left the hospital after 5 days. . . After 3 weeks, I showed up and the professor at the check-up. The doctor assured me that everything was fine, there was no change on the ultrasound. Everything was back to normal. She was supposed to report for another check-up, but because of the colossal prices in the professor's private office she went to her gynaecological clinic to the doctor who noticed the change first. After examining me and having an ultrasound, the doctor found that nothing had actually changed and the change in the ovary was still there. The doctor at the outpatient clinic was setting up what kind of surgery was carried out in the hospital in Lodz since the lesion that had put me on the operating table was not removed. Anxiety and shock . She didn't believe me, so she went to another doctor, took all my results, ultrasounds, and the discharge from the hospital to verify the information received. Professor Suzin says that everything is ok and there is nothing to worry about, the doctor at the clinic that they did not operate well. The consultation with the third doctor confirmed that the ovarian change was indeed not removed. It turned out that nobody looked inside the ovary but looked at it on laparoscopy from outside. One big failure. How can you be such a doctor? Until now I am under the control of a doctor, I have regular examinations, I get used to the next surgery. All because of Professor Suzin, who not only didn't make sure that I was well operated on, but also lied in his eyes, saying that there is nothing to worry about. What if she didn't go to another doctor? She went to the professor because she wanted me to be taken care of. However, it turns out that the fact that someone has the title of professor and cancels 400 PLN for a visit is not a measure of quality. I definitely do not recommend ! ! ! ! !

Upon arrival, ok. 1 at night, after several minutes of waiting for someone at the reception, it turned out that our room has a fault and we were accommodated in the nearby Kostas apartments. Only in the morning we realized that these apartments are mostly occupied by refugees. Our "apartment" was tidied up, so much so that the bed linen and towels were changed. The table could be sticky, there was hair on the floor and towels on the balcony. Around noon, we moved to our "room" in building 1. In fact, at the instigation of a resident, we tried to make things right, but a nice older owner started to make some problems. He did not agree to the air conditioning (it is paid 5 € per day). The owner's son offered us dinner and lunch in satisfaction. We took advantage of the supper, however, with dinner already the dear landlord withdrew, saying that he offered us a choice - either dinner or lunch. The rooms are clean, cleaned daily, and the ladies of the service are very nice. Breakfast at the hotel day by day the same: bread, margarine, cheese, "ham". ...salami, chocolate cream, honey, jam, cornflakes, yogurt, black olives, cake. You can buy a hard-boiled egg - 0,50 €. Zero vegetables and fruit. No surprise, all the same every day. The hotel itself is located in a side street with little traffic leading to the main road on the island. The neighborhood is rather weak. The beaches are behind the main road. Paid deck chairs + umbrella 5 € . Wild beaches so littered and neglected that you can forget about your holiday. Only on Cape Psalidi is pretty enough. Must-have safety shoes . Rent a bike and scooter on the hotel premises (4 € per day) . The biggest advantage of the hotel is a pleasant swimming pool (depth 1, 10 - 3, 30m). It can be used from 8. 00 to 20 . 00 . To the town of Kos throw a beret. Unfortunately, because of the refugees, it is no longer pretty here. The tents and makeshift accommodation are located along the promenade. The castle from the sea side is better avoided, the stench of faeces and nomadic refugees. In conclusion, I am disappointed. For many years I have been spending my holidays in Greece, choosing small family hotels with swimming pools, close to the sea. The Greeks have always seemed very nice to me, family-friendly and trouble-free. I guess that's why I'm going on this trip. . .

I spent 5 weeks in the hotel. The rooms are ok, they are not claustrophobic but they are also not apartments. They are daily cleaned, towels are changed. In the corridors where there are non-smoking rooms you do not smell unpleasant smells as it is in Ibis on al. Jerusalem where it is much worse. The room is missing a kettle and the hotel unfortunately does not even give water to drink. These two things are already standard but unfortunately not in IBIS. Breakfast is good. I lack a little bit of possibility to order myself an scrambled eggs in my own degree, but I can get over it. Generally in the morning, I always went out eaten . Communication with the center is really good . You can get from the stops next door in many places in Warsaw. After these 5 weeks I personally recommend .

Excellent location, close to a large shopping centre. With option BB cool catering base . The hotel is clean and, in my opinion, elegant and, above all, quiet. Very well and nicely equipped rooms, those from the street noisy but air conditioning allowed to sleep with windows closed. It had a view of the garden and the swimming pool, 6th floor - great view and silence. Funchal can be reached on foot or several times a day by free hotel transport, without any registration and without crowding. Breakfast was tasty in the "English" style, but everyone could enjoy it. The swimming pools are great around the beautiful garden and the area is well maintained. . All in all, a very successful stay. People who complain should stay at home.

I don't recommend it. Maybe for women already pregnant Mrs. Szymborska is good, but certainly not for those trying to have a child. If you're looking for a really good doctor, don't look anymore! Stay here on this page and visit Dr. Rafał Ptaszyński . I was tempted by the good opinions about this doctor and went to visit the NFZ to see a doctor. I regret it. I won't go there anymore. This is not a good hotel. Staying there is tiring. You can't get any sleep, and you certainly can't sleep with the window open. We used the romantic package. We were given probably the worst room at the end of the corridor overlooking the parking lot. The room was cold, the heating was not working. "Few people are aware that anaemia (anaemia) in a small child significantly affects his or her intellect in the future. Iron deficiency anaemia is one of the most common chronic diseases in children and at the same time one of the few that we can cure effectively and quickly," he stressed. Improving the detection of haematological diseases through education on symptoms and the essence of early diagnosis in the success of therapy is the main goal of the educational campaign "The answer is in the blood". The Polish Society of Haematologists and Transfusionologists, the Polish Society of Paediatric Oncology and Haematology and the Institute of Haematology and Transfusionology are among others supporting the project. Honorary patronage over the campaign was taken by the national consultant in the field of haematology, Prof . dr hab . n . med . Wiesław W . Jędrzejczak and national consultant in the field of occupational medicine, medicine . Paweł Wdowik .

The hotel is very nice, clean and well maintained. The swimming pool area is also well maintained, everything works and the service is very nice. I was most surprised by the kitchen, which served really delicious dishes (although during the week breakfast closer to 10 : 00 you can compare to the state of the shops before Christmas - shelves shining empty: ) ) . I highly recommend this place ! My wife and I are delighted to stay in Mandzijowka! Good location, nicely furnished rooms, nice and helpful hosts, delicious food - just a homely atmosphere! The location is the only downside of this hotel - a walk to Piazza Duomo takes more than half an hour; besides, the positives themselves - very friendly and friendly staff (because of the time of arrival in Milan, we arrived at the hotel before the start of the hotel day - we were accommodated without any problems); clean rooms, comfortable beds, great - rich and varied - breakfast, quiet surroundings and certainly the hotel deserves to consider staying there again when returning to Milan,

I recommend I recommend I recommend it. And greet the whole crew ! See you in 6m - cy : D

I'm not saying that your doctor is a bad doctor but I'm disappointed. The hotel is well located. Close to a busy street but between the buildings so it is quiet. Doctor Joanna Orlicz - Widawska has a great heart for the patient, great knowledge and medical intuition, so rare among doctors who accidentally choose their profession. In my opinion, it is medical intuition, that is "something" that cannot be learned at any Medical Academy, that makes the doctor make such accurate diagnoses! ! I have been suffering from so-called Quincky's swelling for 15 years and none of the doctors could offer any other treatment than steroids (and for 15 years, believe me, she was with many "wonderful" doctors). It turned out that there are other options for treating this troublesome disease. Now I have not taken steroids for 2 years and the disease is under control. I will be thankful for this Doctor for the rest of my life! !

If someone is looking for a doctor who will tell and explain everything, it's not that person. The doctor is very specific, but if you ask for something, he will of course answer the questions. His/her occupancy in Luxmed is very high, therefore the visit is very short, but the doctor directs to the indicated examinations e.g. thyroid ultrasound (which the previous doctors did not do to me). In case of problems with appointments in Luxmed (e.g. ultrasound), the doctor is willing to accept his patient as an additional person if the treatment process requires it.

The hotel is perfect in every way. Hot greetings to all hotel staff from the manager to the cleaners. The surroundings of the hotel, Anthony Quin Beach, Faliraki, the city of Lindos behind St. Paul's Bay and the Monolith's Castle are wonderful. The Hotel Evita and its staff give you a feeling of security, peace and complete relaxation.

I can only talk about a restaurant that was average - a huffy waiter and a nice waitress. Average food (deer goulash was very insipid) and quite expensive, mistaken order (the partner ordered the gloves with the stew and in return he got the deer stew - the waiter said he had to eat it because the gloves were gone; we did not want to make a scene).

I reserve the right not to know what other rooms look like, but the eight-person room in which we were placed is located in the basement where (especially in the evening) it was extremely hot and stuffy (despite a large fan occupying the middle of the room). I had a chance to be at the Vergilius Hotel Billia last year. The food is not bad. But the service is terrible. Waiting time for meals is not acceptable. The food is tasty, it keeps the level. Pizza on good dough. Good mules in season. Tasty goose. Unfortunately - combined with always waiting for food for a long time - does not encourage visits.

A good doctor, he took up my treatment as the only one, none of the doctors could tell me what to do and after visiting him it is better. Hotel to recommend, as someone likes a homely atmosphere. I think it will be great for the summer. I have been to see Dr. Podlesna several times, but despite the hope that she would help me cure my spine or relieve its pain, it did not happen. Generally a nice hotel, but with very poor service. Generally with the stay was em satisfied, but the quality of service in the restaurant disqualifies this hotel as a hotel * * * * . After coming to the restaurant for breakfast, I couldn't find a table because 50% of the tables were occupied by guests and 50% of the tables were not cleaned after guests who had breakfast. At first I was afraid to see Mr. Martina because I've never been to a specialist like that. He didn't know if I'd be able to open up and say what I really had a problem with. She's very nice and competent. My first visit went without any reservations. The examination was painless. The only thing I didn't like was the way the drug was explained. She has heard a lot about the Valley and finally at the beginning of September she managed to choose there. But I have no intention of repeating this trip. First of all, the sauna is not separated enough from the pool area - you can hear the noise, it is hard to calm down; additionally, there is no water dispenser. As for dinners - a huge profession. First of all, the buffet is moderately diversified, messy. Tables not covered. On the second day, dinner was available from 16 to 19 - in my opinion, definitely too short (because of these hours we did not take advantage of the ordered massages, but it would take a long time to describe). However, the worst thing was that after coming, nobody came to us to indicate the table, nobody came to ask if we want to order alcohol, nobody lit a very nice and climatic candle on the table. During the meal no one came up to clean the plates and they were standing on top of each other because there was no room - we were completely ignored by the staff, who did not have much work because the three of us were standing behind the bar and talking. On the second day they took the table next to the couple who seemed to have bought a romantic package - the waitress approached them, asked for wine and lit a candle, but she did not turn to our table to do the same. Tragedy, I don't recommend this hotel and I don't plan on going back there myself.

"We are very enthusiastic about this type of models because they allow us to explain some of the anatomical intricacies that may surprise us during the operation. Thanks to such print-outs we know what structure the organ has, which facilitates the planning and course of the operation" - says the surgeon at the University Hospital in Cracow, Ph. Michał Pędziwiatr . As he explained, the main indication for liver surgery are metastases of other cancers (mainly colorectal cancer) to this organ. The doctor added that there are not many centers in Poland that deal with liver surgery and therefore "it seems that the number of patients requiring surgery is greater than the number of places where these operations can be performed" .

A keyboard tablet with good parameters at a very good price . A good 4 GB frame configuration and a 64 GB drive in this price class is the exception. The computer runs stable and quite long on one charge . Ideal for travelling . Very robust design . I have problems with charging . The charger has gone to service . WiFi works a little less well than other devices I have, but it is acceptable. The aluminum housing has the advantages, but probably has a little bit of an effect on the antenna's performance. Generally recommended for the average user, more demanding users need to look for better equipment.

A beautiful village, a hotel in a good location, great service and safe gluten-free food that was served to the table. Every day a bread roll (from the oven) and cupcakes, cakes (Schar) and gluten-free ice cream waited for breakfast. For lunch and dinner a special dish was made by the kitchen wardrobe, which was served to the table. Thank you Jose Miguel: ) and Lola G . for the excellent service and help. The food was 100% safe, and I am very gluten sensitive. I think the hotel could have a gluten-free dish that is labelled Sin Gluten. There was a lot of gluten-free food, but you just need to change the arrangement of the food on the table because there was cross-contamination. I recommend 100% gluten-free food for celiacs provided that it is served to the table. Magdalena

I had the dubious pleasure of using the doctor's services twice privately in August, my 6-month-old son was a spider. Patients are scheduled every 15 months. and literally that's how long a visit lasted. The interview is three questions: I was born, how is the baby fed and if there are any allergies in the family. The doctor briefly assessed the condition of the child's skin, listened, there was no weighing or checking of ears and throat. She recommended that the nurse perform a skin test for several allergens, while she was drinking coffee and reading some medical leaflets. After the test, we waited 15 minutes for the skin reaction. After 15 minutes, we entered for the second time with the doctor's child. The doctor had already written the recommendations on a piece of paper - after 12 months of life the IgE test was complete and the gastrointestinal and inhalation panel made of blood, no advice on how to use steroids and other moisturizing ointments, what to eliminate from the diet, etc. I asked if it is not possible to do a complete IgE examination now to have some broader picture of the algae, and so it led me to a second visit myself. After a week, we came forward with research - total IgE, specific for egg white and cow's milk, morphology. On a piece of paper I wrote down all the questions I want to ask so that I don't forget something because the visit is conducted in such a way as to check in with the patient as soon as possible. The second visit lasted ok . The second visit lasted about 25 minutes, but with every question the doctor was very impatient, she answered very casually and nervously, treated me from above and not like a parent who wants to know as much as possible to help his child. The doctor was not kind enough to point out that the son has a strong allergy to egg white, he came out with a high blood score and a large skin reaction and in the future there may be a problem with vaccinations because most of them are made on egg white. Another pediatrician - an allergologist - drew my attention to this, in such a case you have to be very careful because the child may have a very large allergic reaction and even anaphylactic shock! Mrs. Grzesiak went to suggest opinions on this website, no one wrote a negative opinion. I also watched the lectures of the doctor on AZS on the Internet and she did not give me anything in this knowledge during my visits! ! ! Cost of the visits: the first 180 PLN, the second 120 PLN. It is not worth spending a penny! You can find out more from the Internet. I strongly advise against

The hotel spent 3 days ( 2 nights ) at the turn of the year - using the offer " Devil's End of the Year " . Unfortunately, I am very disappointed with this stay, so I do not recommend it to other travelers. The hotel, on the one hand, has quite decent equipment, an interesting location, on the other hand, an average kitchen and, what's worst, not very helpful and rude service in the owners and managers. I have the impression that the people managing this hotel are not fully prepared to run such a place, and some of their behaviour is very controversial. For example, a very high fee for a duplicate access card to a room (150 PLN - market value of the card is about 1 PLN), attempts to add high fees (500 PLN) for breaking the night's silence in the hotel bar (additionally an attempt to add a fee for waiter's work after 10 PM). Nobody paid any attention to us in any way, the waiter at 10 p.m. accepted the last orders and wishing us a nice evening in the bar he went home. As for the kitchen in the hotel restaurant there are also objections. Small portions, the chef does not pay attention to the sets offered in the menu, serving the same additions to each dish on a given day, even though the card shows something completely different. To sum up, I do not recommend this place. I have the impression that in this price you can find more pleasant and, most of all, more hospitable places, which would seem to be the same hospitality as in the Lublin region.

As Professor Mirosław Jarosz , Director of the Institute of Food and Nutrition (IŻŻ) explained, the National Centre for Nutrition Education (NCEZ) was established in response to the educational needs of Poles. The new institution is to be a source of reliable knowledge about nutrition and physical activity. According to prof . Jarosz, the impulse to establish the NCEZ was the success of the project "Keep the balance", which was carried out between 2011 and 2016. Thanks to the dissemination of knowledge about healthy nutrition and physical activity it was possible to reduce the incidence of overweight and obesity in schools and reach millions of consumers. The project also included the education of 12 . 400 pregnant and breast-feeding women, which allowed 87% of them to keep their weight gain within normal limits and 78% of them to have a normal body weight also 6 months after giving birth.

Researchers took care of the patent applications - they cover detailed parts of the process, the whole construction of the "Trojan horse" and its application. As she mentions, at the beginning she lacked knowledge about intellectual property protection. She was first persuaded to acquire and apply it by her colleagues from the University of La Sapienza in Italy, where she presented her research. In Poland, prof . The king was among the first and few scientists who established a start - upy . Cellis was established in 2016. At the Warsaw University of Life Sciences (SGGW) basic research on the discovered mechanism was and is being carried out, and within the framework of the start - ups research aimed at the development of therapy was started.

I've been using for 5 months and I'm rather on it. First the advantages: nice appearance, good working spout and adjustment handle. As Dr. Pieczykolan explained, clinical practice shows that molecules effective against cancer cells also cause damage to the patient's healthy tissue and organs, often leading to devastating complications. The solution to the problem of cancer, as well as to most diseases of civilization, would be a therapy meeting the criteria of Paul Ehrlich's idea, the so-called "golden ball". that would hit the target perfectly - transformed, damaged cells. Such an ideal molecule, using all means of transport available to the body, such as blood and lymph, would only reach the cancer-changed cells and destroy them. Such an assumption lies at the heart of the ONCO - 3 CLA project, as well as many targeted therapies being developed around the world. The Polish therapy consists of three levels of activation . In the first stage, the natural mechanism of perforation, i.e. loosening and destroying connections between blood vessel cells, is used in the neoplastic process. Through cracks in vessel epithelium, drugs can penetrate from blood to cancer. Moreover, the molecule is constructed in such a way that it recognizes certain receptors on the surface of cancer cells and connects only with these cells.

She treated me with this doctor for over two years. She went to him because at that time ( 6 years ago ) he was considered a good specialist according to the opinions circulating in the city. At the beginning she didn't pay attention to the character of the doctor, because his "professionalism" was very high and she didn't want me to suggest what he was like. This was not the most important thing then. She bit my teeth on unpleasant comments from the doctor's mouth and believed that he would cure me. He kept ordering me private tests, prescribing medication. It was really a lot. The question is, was it necessary? Well, my dear, it wasn't. I kept getting the same results that she did every 2 max 3 months. She spent more than 400 PLN on drugs. She felt worse and worse. From a "healthy" patient, who was m, she was becoming more and more "ailing" every month. My psyche started to sit down. The doctor said that I had very bad results. She believed in it and she was making me sick. The medication caused a lot of side effects which made me feel really bad. In the name of wanting to have a child, I was still tired. After the medication, she gained 20 kg of weight during those two years! She woke up to me when the doctor fell asleep on a private visit! She thought to me: how can such a doctor treat me well if he is not aware of what he is writing on the prescription? ! This was my last visit to this doctor. From now on I don't go to doctors in private anymore. She found me a good doctor at NFZ. During the last visit she showed him the results of tests from that period of treatment by Tomasz Milewicz. The doctor said that the results were not bad! ! ! So she came to the conclusion that the doctor made me feel very sick, then I will go to him and pay for the visits. I suspect that this was the tactic of doctor Milewicz. Fortunately now I am older and wiser, so I warn you about this doctor. He didn't help me, but he just hurt and cleaned his wallet.

"In our society, even among doctors, there is still a conviction that influenza is a minor disease. Meanwhile, even the official data are underestimated, because the actual incidence of influenza, as well as the deaths, is much more," - said Prof . Antczak said. The national consultant in the field of pediatrics, Prof . Teresa Jackowska said that in the Bielanski Hospital in Warsaw, where she works, only 16% of the staff, including the administration of the facility, were vaccinated in the past influenza season. Those who do not vaccinate are a threat to patients. Healthcare workers, just like other people, may not even realize that they are infecting others, because 33% of infections are asymptomatic.

I have been treated by Luke since the beginning of February. I have been examined by many specialists in various fields of medicine. "After the completion of this project, we hope to see others implemented in cooperation with prof. Kurzątkowski . I do not hide that for us chemists this project is not created, but the problem to be solved is partly chemical, so we were invited to it. The fact that the representatives of WHO visited us is typical for such grants. We have experience with ESA (European Space Agency), for which we are currently completing one project and starting another in February. ESA and WHO have similar procedures" - added Trykowski . In the Instrumental Analysis Laboratory, scientists use apparatus to study the structure of solids and the qualitative and quantitative characteristics of the chemical composition of solids and liquids. The Laboratory is equipped with the most modern equipment . The unit's employees specialize in developing experimental aspects of qualitative and quantitative analysis of solids surface.

The musicians often fill their free time with music. Just like athletes, young people. In the opinion of the IFiPS expert, music must be present in our lives, but you must dose it wisely. "If we use headphones, let's use large, earbuds. They are much better quality. Avoid those placed in the ear canal that disrupt the pressure in the inner ear. This causes a problem with physiological noise protection. The effect of clogged ears and tinnitus often appears. Currently, smartphones are equipped with a + nipple + - a perfectly holding plug which is pushed into the ear. These are these intra-channel headphones. When we use them only for conversations - nothing happens. But if the exposure to such a sound lasts for hours, even if the sounds are not very loud, it leads to fatigue and changes in the ears" - warns the expert.

I believe that Dr Tomasz Dydymski is a top-notch specialist. He is perfectly trained theoretically and has vast practical knowledge despite his young age! In my case, his help consisted in professional (plastic) stitching of a very deep nose wound, which was the result of an unlucky accident, to which I suffered. I wanted to keep as little trace as possible of the deep wound (scar). Therefore, on the day of the accident, I called the doctor and asked him for urgent help. I was very anxious for the doctor to receive me on the same day as my wound required sewing. Mr. Tomasz fulfilled my request and on the same day he treated the wound and put 10 stitches on my nose, which guaranteed the perfect growth of the torn skin. Before the treatment he told me exactly what his interference in my wound will be and what next steps he will take. All the information was given in a concrete and understandable way. I praise his extremely nice and kind approach to the patient!

With the few advantages that I can mention. . . the service was nice, the breakfast buffet was quite ok, a large selection of sausages, cheeses etc . To sum up, I don't recommend it, you can be disappointed.

"This is a lingerie with four types of inserts, one of which will have textile heating electrodes. Two inserts will be used for insulating purposes and on top of them there will be a removable insert. It is on the top of the liner that the lower urinary tract infections will be treated. They will be released under the influence of increased temperature thanks to heating electrodes," said Emilia Frydrysiak to PAP on Wednesday. This solution combines the knowledge of, among others, medicine, microbiology and textiles. Its advantage over traditional forms of therapy including steam baths is the convenience of use. Three fixed inserts can be washed together with underwear. "The heating system and microcapsules are part of the garment and the underwear is comfortable to use and does not require any specialized handling by the user" - believes the designer.

Comparing in detail the facilities that have their presentations on both sites, Airbnb received more positive ratings. There are many reasons for this and of course they are complex. Researchers in the published report have highlighted four of them: herd behaviour, which is compounded by the impact of previous ratings. The failure to publish negative opinions for fear of an equally negative rematch. The service allows two pages of comments. Self - selection - own choice . If you are potentially more interested in the product, you will be satisfied with it and will express a positive opinion .
