A good doctor doesn't have to be nice, he has to be competent. About the "doctor" I can neither say. My only visit to her took place the day after the pregnancy test (positive) . My husband and I were excited to see a gynaecologist. During the ultrasound, the doctor said that I was actually pregnant and when both my husband and I were crying, she asked us outrageously, "What are you yelling about? " . Nothing. She wrote me down the folic acid and told me to take no - spe plus hormones because I had pains in my abdomen. She told me to come in two weeks. That's it! She did not order any tests - neither blood nor hormones, she did not even measure my pressure! Oh, she said that if I'm going to break it, I don't have to worry. The girls you defend "Doctor" - is that professional behavior? A patient comes in in her first pregnancy, she says she's in pain and the doctor doesn't order any tests, she doesn't talk, she tells me to come and see you in two weeks - is that ok? I came out of her office stressed, capable, confused and guilty of being pregnant! Luckily now I go to a doctor who is not only competent, communicative but also gives me a sense of security and my pregnancy is going well: )

"The new facility was financed by the European Union under the Operational Programme Innovative Economy" - said prof . Ewa Zalewska from the Institute of Biocybernetics and Biomedical Engineering of the Polish Academy of Sciences in Warsaw. CNS Lab, the Centre for Integrated Structural and Functional Research of the Central Nervous System, is a joint undertaking of IBIB PAS and the Military Institute of Aviation Medicine in Warsaw. It is located in a new building at WIML at 54 / 56 Krasińskiego Street. Włodzisław Duch, Undersecretary of State in the Ministry of Science and Higher Education, said that 20 thousand projects worth PLN 52 billion are being implemented under the Integrated Regional Development Operational Programme (IROP). One of them is the CNS Lab, which was implemented efficiently and on time.

Almost half of the population - and almost all medical personnel - are carriers of Candida fungi. These yeasts live in a delicate balance with our organism, hosting on the mucous membranes of the gastrointestinal and urinary tract and on the skin. But when the balance is disturbed, the fungi start to colonize. "In extreme cases, a rapidly developing infection can lead to the death of the patient in just a few days. Meanwhile, at present, standard tests for the presence of fungi in the patient's body fluids require at least several dozen hours and the results may be false positive or false negative" - informs the Institute of Physical Chemistry of the Polish Academy of Sciences (IPC PAS) in Warsaw.

A very good place to visit Dresden. The hotel has a category * * Superior, but when it comes to room and service, it quietly meets the 3 * requirements. We had a family room with one double bed and one bunk bed; and with air conditioning. The room was very clean, daily cleaned, bed linen, refilled and changed towels. In terms of cleanliness, nothing can get attached to anything. A nice surprise was that on the hot days after returning to the room it was cool, the staff left the air conditioning on. This is unthinkable in other hotels, where saving electricity is a high priority. An additional advantage is the free hotel parking, which is a rare occurrence in Dresden and European cities in general. Now the minus is breakfast. A person used to the 3 - 4 * standard in Polish hotels will be unpleasantly surprised. Due to the lack of typical cuisine there are practically no hot dishes. The only exception was eggs cooked in an ovary. In addition, there was a vending machine (a big plus) with a large selection: water for tea, coffee, espresso, latte, cocoa. The small selection of bread, the level of cold cuts and cheeses does not wash to Polish cuisine - mortadella, salceson and the like. The absence of indispensable scrambled eggs and sausages, not to mention slices of bacon. No fresh cheeses, no sweet coffee snacks. All products in mini boxes - jam, honey, butter, cheese, pâté-like products . To sum up - breakfast does not knock down, however, the traveler will enjoy a peaceful holiday. Taking into account the still relatively attractive price for breakfast as for Dresden - 7, 5 EUR adult, 3 EUR child - with an average of 10 EUR per person - it is worth considering its purchase. Most importantly, the hotel is very close to the old town. Next to it is Yenidze, and after a 10-minute walk we reach Zwinger Palace, where the Baroque madness begins - Zwinger marathon, Semporoper, Residentschloss, Hofkirche, Frauenkirche, Albertinum. . . . To sum up, the hotel is a good place to recommend. Quite an attractive price for a great location. And of course free parking. And a clean room. Breakfast - you can eat. If you don't want to pay 7,5 EUR for a morning meal, you can buy yourself 1,3 EUR tea or coffee at the vending machine and have breakfast on your own.

For a visit to Dr. Łazęcki I went privately to the endocrinology clinic Convictor in Pruszków in order to do an ultrasound of the neck / thyroid, because for some time now I had a visible thickening (a ball protruding from the neck). Most of the visit was devoted to completing my personal data in the computer (it was my first visit) and an interview (whether I smoke, drink, family diseases, etc.). The ultrasound itself lasted maybe two minutes. The doctor actually limited himself to looking at, or rather taking a record/photograph of the thickening, then said that it was a 3 cm thyroid tumor and that a biopsy would be needed to determine its character. Unfortunately, the ultrasound taken by the doctor was very fast, very superficial and so imprecise that it did not show a second quite large tumour (1 cm) or two smaller nodules within the same thyroid lobe! I found out about their presence after another ultrasound, which this time was performed by the best thyroid ultrasound specialist in Warsaw. For the visit to Dr . Łazęcki paid m 200 PLN (in W - he knows 140 PLN), she did not get a description of the ultrasound from him, he was supposed to prepare it only for the next day, in fact the description was ready only after 4 days - she called me every day and found out if it was there, because nobody was kind enough to inform me. The news of the tumor knocked me off my feet, so I don't wish anyone so long to wait for the result, especially since it was a private visit. Now I am one year after the thyroid surgery, after the biopsy I was suspected of having bifocal papillary carcinoma, hence the important news from the ultrasound about two tumors. I was lucky enough - postoperative histopathology showed a benign tumor. I do not recommend Dr. Łazęcki.

Dr. Grzesiowski assessed that differences in access to new vaccinations will affect the health of our society. It is known for example . It is known, for example, that vaccinating all infants against pneumococci after just two years brings about a 50-percent decrease in the incidence of serious diseases caused by these bacteria - pneumonia, sepsis or meningitis. Such are, among others, the experiences of Kielce, which during 4 years of financing pneumococcal vaccinations in infants observed a halving of the incidence of pneumonia in children under 5 years of age. The related savings were calculated at PLN 1 million. Additionally, after 3-4 years of vaccinating all infants, the so-called population effect, i.e. decrease in the incidence of pneumonia among adults who communicate with toddlers, is becoming visible - explained Grzesiowski in an interview with PAP. It is mainly seniors who - apart from children under 5 years of age - are also more exposed to pneumonia caused by pneumococci.

The turn of the year usually brings many personal changes. It is no different in 2012. Here are just some of them. At the beginning of January, the new president of B & B Hotels Poland Sp . z o. o. became Mrs. Beatrice Bouchet . Mrs. Beatrice knows the Polish market (also Polish) because she worked in our country for several years in the Louvre Hotels Group. After returning to France she worked in the headquarters of B & B Hotels . Krzysztof Potocki, the previous president, remains in the B & B Hotels chain as a board advisor. Beatrice Bouchet (formerly Gardon), graduated from the College of Commerce in Bordeaux. She started her professional career as Head of International Studies at Ubifrance (French Centre for Foreign Trade) . She then moved to Poland and started working for the Louvre Hotels Group, where she was responsible for the development of the chain. She continued her career in the building market management company Castorama, where she was responsible for business analysis. While living in Poland she got to know the domestic market and learned to speak Polish fluently.

Unfortunately, he ripped off the medial and anterior cruciate ligaments of the so-called . . . ACL . Visit to SOR, as usual, x-ray, no fracture, and classically, regardless of the result, they pack into plasterboard rails (I do not know what reasons direct such actions). I went for a consultation and ultrasound examination. Unfortunately, such an examination in the case of a knee can be ineffective, but in combination with manual tests such as PivotShift or DialTest it already gives a better image, especially in hands that know how to do it. Unfortunately, the diagnosis was not optimistic. To make sure I got 'em a referral for an MRI and again I went with the result. By the way, he once again chose em ULTRAMEDICA as recommended especially for people active in sports. Unfortunately, the doctor's assumptions were confirmed and it was necessary to undergo the procedure . Damage to both meniscus and both ligaments . Today I am 6 weeks after the procedure, which was not without complications, not because of the fault of the doctor or staff, but rather because of the "fault" of my body, which likes to play tricks: ) . I won't say that I didn't put any effort into recovering because I would have lied but if I hadn't done a good job during the treatment / surgery I wouldn't have the fitness I have. 95% of the range of joint mobility under full load, there is practically no swelling, inflammation also, invisible scars, muscles at a very decent level. I am just after the check-up visit and the doctor has already ordered to relax because it is great. Now 6 weeks of careful exercise, then 3-6 months of muscle strengthening and slowly you can go back to the sport. I strongly recommend your doctor. It's a pity that not everyone is such a specialist.

Encouraged by positive opinions, she went to see me but the Doctor misdiagnosed me. After a quick look at the growth she assumed that it was HPV and that I had to get infected from someone. She explained to me that there is no option for me to get infected because I have one partner. So the Doctor said that she could have gotten it from him - letting me know that maybe he has more partners. She burned me out of shame and after receiving a prescription, she left my office. The Doctor saved me a Condyline - a strong agent that should burn this growth. After 3 days of use, the medicine did more harm than good, causing severe burns, bleeding, etc. Worried, she went to see a venereologist/ dermatologist for a consultation. Despite the damage the drug did, the venereologist found that this growth is simply my nature and there is nothing to worry about. He said it's not 100% HPV - especially since the year before I had a full set of tests in an oncology hospital. He also said that if the plant was actually a condyloma it would fall off or at least dry out and not burn the skin after taking the medicine. Unfortunately I do not recommend this specialist.

The hotel has long been a great hotel, with ruined carpets, old furniture and a soft bed. The hotel is located near the famous castle in Malbork, so you can go there for a short walk. The room was a bit old and dark, but you can see part of the history of the castle. The small TV had a limited number of channels and the reception was not the best (a lot of snow). My room was located next to the old lift, so it is better to ask for a room located away from that noisy machine. It was said that WiFi internet might not be available or not work, but that's old news. It had a good WiFi connection, although the speed of such a thing itself, but enough to check emails and find information etc. The service at the reception was friendly. The girl who helped me with the check-in, spoke fluent English and helped me check the train schedules for Gdansk. Well done. Breakfast was on the table, but not very good. The bread was not fresh, and without asking, I was served a plate of scrambled eggs. The worst part is that the place where you sit depends on the room number. The room number is on the table. I was sitting at the table with some strange Polish guy (who probably hasn't washed for a month) who, like most Poles, didn't speak English. When she reported her dissatisfaction to the staff, they said that they had made a mistake. Such a hotel should not make such mistakes. The next day, because I slept there for two nights, I was again seated at a table for two. Unheard of. Only this time the other person was not at the table, so let it be. This time they asked what kind of eggs I want. To sum it up: this is a hotel that could be in the lead, in the best location, but it is not. I'll bet if the Hilton finds out about it, and finds it worth it, this hotel will be turned into a 5-star.

I was taken to this five-star hotel by city bus straight from the airport. Yasuhiro Yamauchi from a team of a Polish scientist performed artificial insemination on the germ cells of mice. It consisted in the fact that not yet fully mature sperm, so called spermatids, was injected into the egg cell (this is the so-called ROSI method). In this way an embryo was obtained, which was then introduced into the body of the female rodent, who gave birth to the offspring. It is not yet known how safe this technique is in humans. In the future, however, it gives hope for the offspring to live to see the offspring also for the males, who cannot be helped today. Prof . Monika A . Ward claims that the minimum content of the Y chromosome is sufficient for artificial insemination, if only two genes - Sry and Eif2s3y .

"However, the shortened treatment scheme has the advantage that it is equally effective, causes fewer direct side effects and is therefore more beneficial and more comfortable for the patient," - stressed prof. Wyrwicz . He added that this therapy is also less expensive, which is particularly important in countries where the resources for oncological treatment are limited. Prof . Bujko emphasized that in both therapies it was equally often possible to completely remove the tumor. However, in the previous observations, the overall survival of patients undergoing shortened radiotherapy combined with subsequent chemotherapy was higher by more than 9 percentage points (63.5% in the standard treatment regimen as opposed to 73% in the new treatment regimen).

Potential patients would only point out to me that you should write opinions on the site and not ask questions. The latter is done during therapy. . . I got to Mr. Bartosz "blindly" after I liked him. . . Name was put together in a logopedic way, found on the Internet. . . I thought that this psychological method would help me - and it did. A great method, which was very skillfully conducted (a more appropriate word than "skillfully" probably does not exist) made me mentally stronger. I am now much more distanced from the world - at the same time, full not only of a sense of humor but also of commitment to such things and activities that I care about. This therapy is certainly intended for people who are able to do a lot but who are unaware of their abilities and who are withdrawn because of depression. ACT teaches how to look at yourself and the psychologist helps to form a "strong backbone". I will certainly recommend it.

Laurent Picheral , will not apply for the position of President of Orbis S . A . in the Management Board of the next term of office, following the decision to appoint him to the Accor Executive Committee as of 1 July 2014 . The term of office of the current Management Board of Orbis S . A . expires on the day of the General Meeting of Shareholders, in June 2014 and the candidate for the position of President of the company will be presented for approval by the Supervisory Board of Orbis SA on the same day. In addition, Laurent Picheral intends to propose his candidacy for the Supervisory Board of Orbis S . A . to continue to supervise the implementation of the company strategy on behalf of the majority shareholder . "Laurent Picheral is the President of the Management Board of Orbis S . A . for the last four years . During that time, under his leadership, the company completed business transformation and asset restructuring, including the sale of non-strategic assets and with many achievements in business development". , said Sophie Stabile , Chairman of the Supervisory Board of Orbis S . A .

I don't know if we are talking about the same doctor (once, when I had to deal with him he worked at the New Hospital in Tarnow, pediatric surgery) I am not satisfied with his actions, to this day I have a souvenir of his treatment. I was brought with an open shank fracture. The fracture was nasty, screwed. After the surgery, he took off my stitches too early, the wound did not heal. After about a month of walking with the wound alive, he had it lubricated with honeydew honey - after a week of such treatment necrosis appeared, at the last moment the stabilizer was removed and stitches were put back on. Unfortunately, the bones have been badly folded to this day - the tips of the broken tibia overlap, making the calf thicker and the arrow in the ogule was not folded and also grew up on its own. The gypsum was 11 weeks old, it did not walk for 6 months and at the end of the treatment, we and our mother were gracefully referred to the sanatorium. I advise against it!

He's been looking for the tower for over a month. The goal was simple - a small tower for the bedroom. The towers quickly fell off for 300 - 400 PLN due to poor sound. I found em on this Pioneer and immediately liked the selective dynamic sound that reached my ears at low volume. I'm listening to black metal and a few of its variations, where selectivity and dynamics really matter. On Pioneer, I heard 'em what I wanted to hear. A strong bottom end, bright middle and selective treble. I was still wondering about PHILIPS MCD712 but the empty rumble of the speakers scared me away. In turn, the PHILIPS MCM3000 scared me away with its price and quality (plastic and everything loose), although the sound was also very interesting. In Pioneer, I like the display - it does not knock on the eyes and is very clear. It could display the clock on standby, but this is not a criterion for choosing a tower. To sum up. If someone is looking for a mini tower for a small room that is dynamic has a good deep pit and a clean top and is selective then you can take it in the dark.

In Poland until recently, this mainly concerned accommodation and facilities of very poor standard, but with the emergence of more economy hotels, the competition is moving into higher segments of the market. Some guesthouses, some hotels with 1, 2 or 3 stars standard are being replaced. And this process will continue to grow. It is also the place to look for an answer to the question of where the guests will come from, whether budget hotels are being built or planned.

Valve prostheses are needed for patients suffering from congenital or acquired defects of their own valves. Currently they use mechanical or biological prostheses, but both have some limitations. In the case of mechanical valves it is necessary to apply long-term antithrombotic therapy to the patient. Biological prostheses, on the other hand, based on both human corpse material and animal tissue material, are at risk of liming or inflammatory reactions. Numerous studies and clinical observations show that their durability is on average about 15 years. After this time, many patients need a valve replacement. According to Dr. Wilczek, a valve covered with the recipient's cells can eliminate these limitations. "This is an example of increasingly personalised medicine," he stressed.

Initially, she was dissatisfied - she was moved to another hotel due to a breakdown. But thanks to that she could also compare objects and now I am sure it was a good choice. She booked my stay in Mercure due to having an accor card and there was a conference next door. She had some concerns after reading some reviews, but it seems to me that they were not entirely justified, especially at such prices. As an apology she received a room of a higher standard, it was renovated, very clean and smelled beautiful. The rooms are not big, but quite comfortable. Really, I had nothing to complain about. The main advantage of the hotel, however, is not comfortable beds or delicious breakfasts, but phenomenal service - it is rare to meet such nice and helpful people.

Following the great opinions of Internet users and all information about the experience, history and place of work - she made an appointment with my mother. The first impression was really very positive. High personal culture, well conducted interview, analysis of all the research, conversation and the research itself - nothing to reproach. In addition, help with getting access to the holter at the Banacha Hospital. Then another visit after getting the results from the holter. The second visit was also fine and probably everything would be fine if it wasn't for the fact that the prescribed dosage of drugs almost led my mother to collapse. The doctor recommended that under no circumstances should the dosage of medicines be changed (as people are said to regulate their own medications and often this causes problems with both the pressure and the heart). During the treatment, with a pressure of 70 / 42 and a pulse of 48, I called the doctor extremely worried, seeing how my mother feels. The doctor said it would pass, so as not to interrupt the treatment and the pulse could be increased by a small amount of cognac! ! ! ! Unfortunately - the first time I was convinced and almost forced my mother (who does not drink alcohol) to take 20 - 30 ml. In fact, the heart started to beat a little faster. In this way, my mother will remember the words of the doctor about not changing the treatment - she was taking medicines, she felt very bad, almost fainted and it was ok. 2 weeks. Once again, when the parameters on the blood pressure monitor turned out to be even worse, and the feeling was such that she had already properly reconciled herself to the fact that she was going to die - they called another doctor and it turned out that it is necessary to change the dosage, that the prescribed drugs can be given up to 60 years of life and that it can be given very carefully and in small amounts (instead of 3 x 150mg - at the most 1 time ad hoc!!!). We have changed the way of taking the medicines, the one recommended by your doctor - we have completely stopped. Since then, 2 years have passed - mom feels great. Let's never trust the doctors to the end. Every body is different and when you feel like it, you have to decide whether to continue the treatment or change it. The intentions were probably good - only the result can be tragic.

Members of many cultures have difficulty hearing sounds that are not typical of their native language. The Japanese, for example, have difficulty in distinguishing between "l" and "r" sounds. Prof . The spirit explains that these sounds do not stimulate diversity in the brains of the Japanese people and therefore they have big problems with learning languages. Such difficulties appear as early as at the age of 10 months, which is why appropriate training must be at such an early stage. "If a child is rewarded for recognizing the difference between + l + and + r + , there is a good chance that his or her brain will be able to differentiate these sounds in the future. Such a child will have no difficulty in hearing speech correctly and learning e.g. Polish. Imagine that the Chinese start to speak better in English or that in Europe we start to speak Chinese. This can speed up the process of globalization" - explained the scientist, who hopes that the toys will be quite cheap and easy to spread around the world.

The summer season is a traditional harvest period for all hotels with a holiday and spa program, for holiday and vacation homes and drying time for facilities located in most major cities. In July and August the use of rooms in hotels is usually 5 - 6% higher than the average for the whole year. In the case of facilities such as holiday homes or leisure homes the use of places is higher by 25 - 30 percent. than the annual average. This does not mean that all facilities belonging to the above mentioned categories should arrive equally. The best hotels at the seaside, in the mountains or in the lakeside may record almost 100% occupancy in these months, while others, often located nearby, wonder why this season is so bad? There will always come a time for such a reflection.

A colour disorder also accompanies spot diseases, because it is in this spot that the highest density of suppositories is found, thanks to which we perceive colour. "Since this disease primarily impairs visual acuity, patients mainly complain that they can't see well, not that they can see colours badly," noted doc . Pojda - Wilczek . The ability to see colours can also be lost as a result of a brain injury, even if the organ of vision is not damaged. "The matter of color vision begins in the retina, but is actually realized at brain level. It happens on many levels. Even those who do not have daltonism, see the world in different tones, depending on the individual configuration of the photosensitive elements in the retina and the brain's abilities. The differences in colour vision are very beautifully presented by artists. The tones in their paintings change depending on how old they were, whether they had cataracts or retinal diseases - all this changes their perception of colour" - said the ophthalmologist.

"I'm trying in my research to answer the question why a man has five fingers and legs. Because it is not obvious at all" - says professor PAP. Przemko Tylżanowski from the University of Leuven in Belgium and from the Medical University of Lublin . He recalls that e.g. a chicken has four fingers, but there are only three in the wing of this bird. In turn, the horse has only one finger in each leg. "Today there is no naturally occurring animal on Earth that would have more than five fingers in one limb" - informs the researcher and points out that it was not always like that - when the animals went ashore ok . 380 million years ago, they had more fingers, e.g. nine or more fingers in one limb. In modern species, however, when there are more than five fingers, there is already talk of a genetic defect - it is called polydactylation. "If our survival depended on six fingers, I am sure we would have had them long ago and five fingers would have died out. However, apparently the sixth toe does not give an advantage in survival," commented the researcher.

"Today, sugar is such a powerful stimulus for our nervous system that they want us to keep eating it and eating it. So it is worthwhile to do a little experiment: to get rid of simple sugar for a few days - not to drink sweet drinks, not to eat sweets, white bread, to feel the withdrawal syndrome: annoyance, annoyance," - says Dr. Szo¿¿. Dr. Magdalena Tomaszewska - Bolałek pointed out that while today we usually like to try out new flavors, such a strategy used to be pointless - it could end in illness or death. "For our ancestors the bitter taste heralded something poisonous" - said Dr. Tomaszewska - Bolałek . "Sweet taste, on the other hand, meant the presence of sugar, which is highly energetic and there was very little sugar in unprocessed food. It was e.g. in ripe fruit. The same is true of alcohol. There is no alcohol in nature, except for overripe, fermented fruit. Man was sensitive to searching for such tastes because they meant energy richness," added Dr Pietrzak.

The INNOMED programme is the result of an agreement signed last year between the National Centre for Research and Development and entities associated in the Polish Technology Platform for Innovative Medicine (PPTIM). The programme's budget amounts to PLN 300 million, of which PLN 195 million comes from NCRD's funds, while PLN 105 million will be a contribution of enterprises gathered around PPTIM - said Paweł Kurzyński, NCRD's spokesperson, in a message sent to PAP. "For years the economic growth in Poland depended on technologies purchased abroad or the use of ready-made solutions when the period of copyright protection ended. Today we need innovative products developed by Polish scientists and implemented in our country. The INNOMED programme gives an opportunity for innovative medicines, technologies and modern therapeutic methods + made in Poland + to have their significant share in the development of world medicine" - said the Minister of Science and Higher Education, Professor Barbara Kudrycka .

Hotelik , motelux , OTEL , WOTEL Legal protection is provided by names such as hotel , motel , guesthouse . Any other name may be an attempt to bypass the law - UOKiK practice shows that entrepreneurs use diminutives, lux suffixes, incomplete names when their facilities do not meet the requirements specified in the regulations (e.g. sanitary or fire safety) and do not have the appropriate permission of the voivodship marshal. In order to attract customers, they consciously transform the names, offering accommodation according to any standard. Complaint If a room in an agritourism farm actually differs from the one ordered and the hotel is located further away from the sea than the one provided by an employee, they have the right to complain . If a consumer booked an overnight stay in a hotel facility on their own and is not satisfied with the service, they may assert their rights under the Civil Code. He should report the irregularities to the owner of the facility as soon as possible and set a deadline for repairing the fault, replacing the equipment or changing the room. If the entrepreneur does not remove the defect within the time limit set by us or it is not possible for other reasons - we have the right to demand a reduction in the price, and eventually withdraw from the contract and demand a refund of the amount paid. The withdrawal from the contract is possible if the defect is significant.

It is about the total intake of salt, and not just about the salt we add to the food ourselves (in the form of salting or salting). It should be remembered that salt in quite large quantities is contained in finished food. According to WHO data, processed food products are a source of 40 - 80% of salt in the daily diet of individual countries. It is worth paying more attention to the salt content in various food products. For example, in 100 g of feta-type cheese there is as much as 2 , 75 g of salt and in 100 g of marinated herring there is 2 , 73 g . A lot of salt is also contained in cold cuts. Country ham has 2,57 g of salt in 100 g . Even 100 g of ketchup contains 2.4 g of salt. Bread on average contains about 1 g of salt in 100 g .

When the patent rights expire, other manufacturers may start producing the same product - then it is called a generic medicine. When a generic appears on the market, its price drops dramatically (sometimes even by 90%). The generic manufacturer no longer has to pay for costly clinical trials. All you have to do is to replace it with a replacement. The cost of its production is a small fraction of the price required by the manufacturer of the original drug - explained Grieb . "Generics reduce the cost of treating one disease and the money saved can be used to treat other diseases with expensive innovative medicines. On a European Union scale the savings associated with generics are estimated at 35 billion dollars" - said prof . Grieb said . - Biological drugs, complex compounds produced by living cells, are a special case. In their case, generics are drugs + biosimilar + with the same effect" .

Bjorn Hanson of the Tisch Center for Hospitality, Tourism , and Sports Management New York University estimates the total revenue of US hotels in 2011 at $1.8 billion. Especially in the post-crisis period, hotels have become active in introducing new fees, i.e. sources of income. No wonder, because according to Professor Hanson, the fees and surcharges are particularly profitable, and most of them achieve profitability of 80 to 90 or even more percent. Fees and surcharges appeared in the practice of the industry in 1997, and from year to year they are increasing, and the revenue of hotels on this account is constantly growing. The exceptions are the periods of declining demand for accommodation, i.e. 2001 and 2009.

Project Manager Prof . Karol Kamiński from the Department of Population Medicine and Civilization Disease Prevention at the Medical University of Białystok informed the Polish Press Agency that several dozen invitations have so far been sent to randomly selected Białystok residents. Ultimately, 10 thousand people are to be examined under the program. The first patient signed up for the examination on Tuesday. The Białystok Plus study, or "Białystok Polish Longitudinal University Study; Białystok Plus" is a unique project in which scientists want to examine in the coming years a representative group of residents aged 20 - 80 years. About two thousand people are to be examined every year. The research will be conducted with the individual consent of a given person. Medical University cooperates with the self-government of Białystok and Podlaskie Voivodeship, also in terms of personal data protection in this research.

Szczerbiński emphasizes that not enough people have been tested for the time being to be able to talk about specific results of the research, but even on the basis of the results of ten people who have finished their gym workouts, you can see that on most of them physical effort works, but on some of them does not. "Even in such a small group of patients we have observed that there is a division between patients who responded to physical activity - that is, the effort has brought the expected effects such as a decrease in fasting glucose, an increase in insulin sensitivity, or even a decrease in body fat. Unfortunately, even among these ten people, there are a few who have not observed these changes," said Szczerbiński. He pointed out that this is not yet the time for binding conclusions.

The Innoneuropharm programme was established on the initiative of the Polish Association of Pharmaceutical Industry Employers and the Polish Innovative Neuromedicine Platform. This sectoral programme is intended to encourage companies to undertake research work that will contribute to the development of Polish pharmacy, including neuromedicine. "The Innoneuropharm programme is another example of support provided by NCRD to the industry which wants to develop through innovation. In the case of pharmacy, it means meeting the challenges of civilization, but also an opportunity to strengthen Polish enterprises in competition with foreign competitors. We hope that the projects of our beneficiaries will contribute to the progress in diagnostics and treatment and will additionally encourage other companies to conduct research and development works" - said NCRD Director Professor Maciej Chorowski .

Endoscopic screening has a huge impact on the health of the population and reduces treatment costs, especially for colonoscopy. Early detection of cancers prevents the development of advanced lesions, which are extremely costly to treat in the long term, and therefore allows for significant financial savings. In the past, for example, the role of gastroscopy was to introduce a gastric speculum and detect a large tumor. Now it is possible to diagnose small, early lesions. Thanks to technical progress, the quality of obtained images of the body interior has increased enormously. New endoscopes have already appeared, looking both forward and sideways at the same time, thanks to which the field of vision has increased up to 330 degrees, and the high quality of the image allows for preliminary assessment whether the change looks malignant. An excellent complement is endoscopic ultrasonography, which detects deeper pathologies.

The doctor was running my daughter under neurology last year. I was very disappointed with him. After the first visit, when my daughter was 6 months old, he found a slight limpness in her legs and nothing more, he had to come back in half a year, he did not recommend any exercises. I came back after 4 months, because I saw that my daughter was developing abnormally, that there was a chasm between her and her bicycles. He ordered a blood test and said that we could possibly start the exercise, but in general we should get used to the fact that the daughter will be different! ! ! He didn't give any clue how, where and with whom to practice. After this visit we consulted with 4 more neurologists (including in Warsaw), we immediately started intensive rehabilitation when the daughter was one year old and was suspected of even cerebral palsy. Now the daughter is more than 2 years old, she is walking and developing, although her development is still delayed in relation to her cyclists. The doctor didn't see the danger, he let us sleep through a very important period, when the rehabilitation could be caught up a lot. He didn't even recommend an ultrasound on the head, and when the daughter was a year old, the body had already overgrown and the ultrasound couldn't be done. Very bad experience and I definitely do not recommend it.

According to prof . Magdalena Bielska - Lasota from the National Institute of Public Health PZH, the treatment of rare cancers is also at a good level. In our country, 41 thousand people suffer from 186 types of such cancers, i.e. 22% of all oncological patients. Five-year survival is achieved in 48% of patients, the same as the average in European Union countries. In her opinion, the effectiveness of treatment would be even higher if all patients could be treated in reference centres. "On the other hand, supportive treatment is not sufficient" - said Dr Jerzy Jarosz from the Oncology Centre in Warsaw . First of all because we use too little opioid analgesics. The use of these agents is still as much as five times lower than in most other European countries, such as Great Britain, Germany and Sweden.

Magnuson Hotels presents itself as the largest independent hotel chain. In the eight years of its existence, Magnuson Hotels has become the fastest growing hotel chain comprising 1,800 hotels with over 140,000 rooms (which gives it 12th place among the largest hotel groups in the world) located in the USA and Great Britain.

What attracts the attention of smaller foreign investors to the markets of individual countries are certainly transactions involving large facilities, which, although few in number, make the value of the aftermarket value thanks to the scale. For example, three such transactions with a total value of over €100 million were made in Poland last year. This year, although the first half of the year was rather "sleepy" in terms of both volume and value, more than €100 million will be achieved by one transaction - the sale of the InterContinental hotel in Warsaw. This, undoubtedly record-breaking sales on our market, may be achieved still in the summer. The good results of some hotels during Euro 2012 certainly draw attention to the Polish hotel market, but investors are looking to the market in the long term. If the autumn manages to maintain the growing trend of improving the results achieved by hotels in the spring, a greater number of investors will certainly be interested in accommodation facilities in a more real and not just declarative way.

The representatives of the PTO are particularly counting on the development of the latter, i.e. organisation of, among others, fairs, congresses, trainings and exhibitions. Tourists, who come to the country for such a purpose, spend on average three times what ordinary tourists spend. Now, thanks to the development of appropriate infrastructure, we can try to attract them to Poland. This is the so-called "higher shelf in tourism". So far we have had a problem with places where we can organize such events. Thanks to the fact that stadiums have been created, which are also multifunctional congress centres, thanks to the construction of new congress centres in Kraków and Katowice, conditions are being created in Poland for inviting guests and organizing events in the field of business tourism", says Dr Adam Zaborowski. The development of business tourism is also one of the opportunities to ensure the profitability of new facilities after the European Football Championship. According to the Impact Report, commissioned by the Ministry of Sport and Tourism, thanks to Euro 2012, every year our country will be visited by half a million more tourists than in previous years. Last year, just over 13 million people came to Poland. The revenues in tourism are to increase by 5 billion PLN by 2020. According to Dr. Zaborowski, this will translate into the development of the whole economy by creating new jobs in new facilities, hotels and stadiums.

A great picture of an ectopic pregnancy. It's just a shame my doctor didn't diagnose it that way. With a 5 minute visit (for 150zl), the diagnosis could actually be difficult. Two days after the visit she was diagnosed on old equipment in the hospital in Pabianice (where she arrived in an ambulance). She was operated on at night (the oviduct burst and blood was drained from the abdominal cavity) The doctor claimed that the pregnancy had to be younger, even though she told him that it was impossible because she had a monitoring cycle and I know when the bubble burst (she got an injection on the burst and I was still able to check if it burst). She also told me that she examined the beta and gave me the result. She heard me not to do the beta any more to arm myself with patience and come in two weeks. Did the doctor see anything minimal on the uterus? No one but the doctor saw any bubbles on it. It came to him with blotches and pain located on the left side (this should already guide the doctor). When she came back from the doctor she thought that I was just roning spontaneously and I was panicking. She was supposed to take drugs after my grandmother and sleep through the pain because she knew I was pregnant. She was calm because the doctor wrote "in appendages without pathology". Fortunately, she wasn't alone and the relatives managed to call an ambulance. Fortunately, I got pregnant later and gave birth to a healthy daughter. The whole pregnancy, however, I had to see 3 doctors because I was afraid that someone would miss something again. She will never again restore confidence in the health service. I do not recommend it.

In the first half of this year, foreigners coming to Poland spent 4 017 million euros. Compared to the same period last year, these expenses increased by 10.4%. The number of foreigners who came to Poland increased by 10.4%, i.e. by 380 million euros. At the same time, due to foreign trips, Poles spent 3 055 million euros. In comparison with the same period last year, these expenses increased by 433 million euros, i.e. by 16.5% . According to NBP data. According to a geographical analysis of expenditures, in the entire first half of 2012 expenditures of foreigners from EU countries in Poland exceeded 65% of revenues from foreign trips. On the other hand, the expenditures of Poles on foreign travels to EU countries accounted for over 83% of total expenditures on account of foreign travels. In comparison with the previous year, the number of foreigners from the European Union countries was higher than the number of foreigners from the European Union countries. In comparison with last year, the expenditure of Poles in EU countries increased, while the expenditure of EU citizens in Poland decreased .

These studies have shown that the unique ability to heal (regenerate) the skin without scars occurs in a particular type of mice, the so-called naked mice. This biological phenomenon is caused by a mutation (inactivity) of one gene - Foxn1 . Interestingly, in both mice and humans, the Foxn1 gene occurs only in two areas of the body: the skin and the thymus (an organ that disappears during the development of an individual) - explained prof . Gawrońska - Kozak . "The question we asked ourselves a few years ago was: Is it possible that this one gene is responsible for scarring? The information available at that time concerned the function of the Foxn1 gene in the thymus, there was not much work on the presence in the skin, and there was no work on its contribution to the healing of skin wounds" - emphasized the scientist.

According to Dr Agnieszka Jarosz from the Institute of Food and Nutrition in Warsaw, only every fourth person in our country pays attention to the salt content of products. This is indicated by a study carried out by the Institute of Food and Nutrition in Warsaw on 288 people aged 18 to 60 years, 65% of whom were women. We still check mainly the calorific value of the food and the fat and carbohydrate content. The salt content is quite significantly diversified even in the same type of food. For example, vegetable spices in 100 g contain from 21 to even 70 g of salt. Salt is also in large quantities in other spices. Dr. Stoś gave as an example lemon pepper , in which there may be more salt than pepper !

A small hotel, very nice and very nice location right by the sea, with a nice sandy beach and yellow sand, beautiful clean sea with shallow water far away. The beds are payable 7 Euros for two. Swimming pools by the hotel nice and clean with a small slide for children. The animations are rather symbolic, although the animators are very nice and willing to help or play. The rooms are clean, cleaned daily, almost all with views of the pools and the sea. The food is quite varied, different kinds of meat and in different forms. A lot of vegetables, salads rather modest, little fruit, mostly watermelons. The bar is located between the swimming pools and the sea, nice service, drinks rather weak, light beer, OK. Tsilivi Centre not far away, nice town on one main street, full of tourists in the evening. The island itself is worth a visit, the Caretta tortoises can actually be seen, a beautiful coast with blue caves, to be seen from the sea, sometimes you can see the dolphins, although from a distance. The airport is quite close, transfer through closer hotels about 30 minutes. Generally a beautiful island and a great holiday!

Location is great, all close on foot. The room where breakfast was served was cold. The service was very nice.

We were having dinner with a family living in the area, who recommended this place to us. Despite a fairly high occupancy rate (8 March), the service ran quickly, smoothly and without interruption. "Therefore, the genes whose mutations are responsible for the occurrence of this disease are sought in order to diagnose it better and above all faster. So far more than 30 such genes have been known. In the course of my doctoral thesis I managed to identify as many as three new genes that are involved in the pathogenesis of the disease, with a total of 10 mutations. One of the genes I have described is included in the most comprehensive PCD diagnostic panel available in the United States since the beginning of this year. Soon such tests should also be available in Poland", says the researcher. As she explains, it's about tests that consist of isolating DNA from the patient's blood and then looking for mutations in the genes contained in the panel. Analysts check if a person has a mutation in any of the 30 genes responsible for primary eyelash discoloration.

Tomasz Siwek explained to PAP that since there is no biological marker that would indicate the disease's severity, doctors assess the effects of treatment, e.g. sometimes patients' survival and their ability to breathe on their own, without the help of medical devices. "Independent ventilation is a factor which determines the quality of life of patients in a significant way" - said the doctor. He added that in SLA the progress of the disease" is linear, which means that the patient's condition deteriorates at a constant pace. "The finding that some factor, in this case the administration of stem cells, modifies the course of this disease in such a way that it slows down its course, shows the effectiveness of the influence of this element" - explained Siwek. Money for research on the use of stem cells in SLA patients has been granted to Olsztyn's doctors by the National Centre for Research and Development.

It has been decided that this time the cross-transplantation will take place in two cities, and not so far - all operations in Warsaw. Earlier, in 2015 in the capital city, a cross-transplantation was performed in two couples in which men wanted to donate a kidney to their partners, but could not do it because of an incompatible blood group or a cross-test which showed that it was not possible to perform a transplant between them. Prof . Kwiatkowski said that both kidney transplantations in Warsaw and Szczecin were successful. "In both recipients, a woman and a man, renal parameters are normalised," he assured. The donor from Lublin, from whom a kidney was taken in Warsaw, is to leave the hospital on Friday and his wife, who received a kidney from a woman from Szczecin, is to leave the hospital this Monday at the latest.

In the early versions of the apparatus, measurements were carried out at a flow velocity of only 0,05 millilitre per minute. One analysis required 40 minutes, and the result was affected by an error of up to 30%. Nowadays, the flow velocity is twenty times higher, the test takes three minutes and the accuracy of measurements has increased more than five times. Shortening the analysis time is important - determining the optimal drug dose requires not one but three measurements. "First we have to introduce the drug molecule into the capillary and determine their diffusion rate. Then we measure the diffusion of the protein with which the drug is to bind, for example albumin. In the third measurement we inject the drug and the protein it interacts with into the capillary filled with the same protein. It is only by comparing the results that we can determine how efficiently the drug will bind to the protein in the patient's blood," explains doctoral student Aldona Majcher.

It seems nice and competent - but it's just an envelope and a sham. He watched thumbnails because he didn't even know how to increase them - he claimed that this is the best view. According to this doctor there are certain treatment protocols that MUST help in any situation and if the patient is still sick it means that he is pretending and there is no other explanation because it MUST HELP. He hasn't helped me personally, but the other way around.

As he explains, the dosage of oncological drugs depends on the patient's body weight. In case of a drug, the average dose is 150 mg per day. There are 30 tablets in the package and each tablet contains 25 mg of the drug. One such package is sufficient for 5 days, costs 2 thousand PLN and is reimbursed to patients. If the patent on the original medicine expires and the generic medicine can be introduced to the market, usually the price drops by 30 - 40 percent. The price is also determined by the rules of the market game between companies that develop their own generics. "There are few oncological drugs produced in Poland. The vast majority of them are imported to Poland, which is why the National Centre for Research and Development (NCRD) has decided to co-finance the development of a Polish equivalent of a drug used in lung cancer. In the past, it happened that there was a shortage of oncological drugs for Polish patients, because the companies preferred to place their products on those markets where they received higher prices. Parallel import also takes away some of these medicines because they are cheap. Having Poland's own production of oncological drugs provides much better protection for citizens" - believes Bednarczyk .

Parthenogenesis, or virginity, occurs in nature in many invertebrates such as skates, nematodes, mites, crustaceans or insects (e.g. bees, wasps, sticks, beetles). It is also observed among some vertebrates: reptiles (e.g. guanoes, geckos), amphibians (some frogs) or fish (e.g. some sharks or guppies). As far as mammals are concerned, there is no virginity in nature. "But scientists already manage to achieve it in a laboratory environment. Thus, it is already possible to obtain embryos of young mammals with genetic material from two mothers or two fathers" - says Katarzyna Klimczewska, a PhD student from the Embryology Department of the Faculty of Biology at the University of Warsaw, in an interview with PAP. The researcher says that over a decade ago Kaguya mouse was born, whose parents were two mothers. In order for the birth of this mouse to be possible, scientists had to know exactly what was happening in the fertilized cell, especially what genes were being expressed and when. It turns out that for the proper development of a human embryo it is necessary to have the presence of both male and female genomes simultaneously. The paternal gene is responsible for the early development of the placenta, while the maternal gene is responsible for the development of the embryo. The lack of genes from the father leads to abnormal development of the placenta and death of the embryo. In turn, the lack of genes from the mother causes the development of the embryo to be delayed and ends in death. However, scientists have managed to circumvent this problem by means of genetic modifications. For parthenogenetic embryos to develop, one of the two maternal genomes had to have epigenetic modifications specific to the paternal genome. Thanks to such a mechanism, embryos deprived of the father's genetic material could develop.

It was our second stay in this hotel. A year ago, we were in the middle of the resort and the problem was a long and cold, temporary corridor leading to the SPA area. We were accommodated in the hotel part and due to the distance, it was terribly inconvenient. Of course, no one informed us about these difficulties before arrival. This time the stay was also unsuccessful. On the first night, the problem was that the hotel had a prom, which, given the location of our room, was very burdensome. We could hear the music and the rumbling bass would not let us sleep. Instead of relaxing, we had a sleepless night. As a compensation, the hotel prepared massages and offered a bottle of wine from the Casa Botaneros house of the Valdepeñas Tempranillo-Shiraz tribe, which is imported by a company from Koszalin, which is located near the hotel. It should be noted that this was certainly a nice gesture, but if all massages look like ours (according to the price list 90 zł for 30 minutes), we sincerely advise against buying them. This has nothing to do with a professional 5-star hotel massage. The next day, a very big discomfort was the limited operation of the wellness area (the dry sauna and both Jacuzzis did not work all day). With a longer stay of one day, a failure may not be a problem, but with a short stay (2 days), it is a big drawback. There is no information about when and if the failure will be removed at all and what alternative the hotel offers. Additionally, on the first day, not all the towels were available because, according to the cleaning service, they did not come back from the laundry. They were added on the second day. Other disadvantages include the lack of a shower handle on the inside, the lighting above the mirror not working and the need to reset the wi - fi router frequently. Many Ukrainians among the hotel staff. There was no live cooking. Pistoning at breakfasts . It is hard to decide once again to stay at the Diune Hotel, from a 5-star hotel you should expect a lot, much more. We advise against it.

The hotel is really impressive, not only because of its location on the beach itself or its attractive appearance, but above all because of the cosiness and comfort it offers. We also had a free access to the room with exercise equipment, ping-pong table, billiards and table football. Everything was well thought-out, comfortable, well equipped and high quality equipment. If I wanted to complain, I would mention the water temperature in the pool, if it was enough for adults, but for children it could be 2 - 3 degrees higher. It would also be useful for the elevator to go a little closer to the entrance to the pool, now we are forced to either go down the staircase, or going by the elevator to go past the exit to the outside, which after bathing is not quite nice. The atmosphere in the rooms themselves sometimes requires either opening the window or switching on the air supply, because with the windows tightly closed and without air supply it can sometimes seem stuffy. To sum up, I recommend this hotel mainly because of its great location.

"If we want to predict a process, it would be good to know what its history was," says Dr. Rafał Mostowy, a scientist working at the Imperial College of London. "If we can understand exactly how this process has developed over millions of years, we can guess what it will look like in the future," he adds. Dr. Mostowy is carrying out research to explain how the recombination of DNA can affect the rapid immunization of pneumococci to vaccines. Pneumococci, the Streptococcus pneumoniae bacteria, are the main cause of pneumonia, but they also cause meningitis and ear infections. The World Health Organization estimates that up to one million children under the age of five can die each year from diseases caused by this pathogen.

She was hoping to see this doctor. I have one child, she wanted me to have another but unfortunately she miscarried me twice and now I cannot get pregnant. Then he said that I have adenomycosis but it has no effect on my pregnancy. I was stressed out when I read about it, especially because Dr. Bardzosie was underestimating it. Head of the team of neurologists and neurosurgeons prof . Wojciech Maksymowicz together with neurologist prof . Adam Czapliński ( he works in Zurich every day ) announced the results of research of Olsztyn scientists during the international neurological symposium held on Friday in Olsztyn . The doctors informed that their team has the results of 11 patients with atrophic lateral sclerosis who were given stem cells. All patients, according to the standards of this kind of examinations, were observed for the next 6 months in terms of the disease progress. It turned out that in 7 of them the progression of the disease was significantly slowed down. In the case of 4 people there was no improvement i.e. the disease progressed at the same rate as before the administration of the stem cells. Professor Maksymowicz's team is the first in the country to announce such results and the results achieved are comparable to those obtained by scientists dealing with SLA stem cell treatment in Italy, Israel or the USA. In those countries, trials were conducted on a similar number of patients. The results of the Polish scientists announced on Friday caused a wide discussion, their colleagues from all over the world asked, among other things, about the ways of treating patients or informing them about the possibility of stem cell treatment.

As Dr Tabaszewska explains, low molecular weight proteins can penetrate through the skin to its deeper layers. In this way they influence skin hydration and nourishment. On the other hand, proteins of high molecular weight remain on the skin surface. A thin but tight layer of the cosmetic, so called occlusal film, prevents water loss. Properly moisturized skin looks healthier and younger, there are fewer wrinkles and those that can be seen are shallower. Thanks to their specific structure, proteins can form various forms affecting the stability of the final product. This is important because cosmetics contain many different ingredients that affect and react to each other. The mixture, e.g. gel or cream, must maintain an appropriate solid consistency. Therefore, in the development of new cosmetics, researchers must combine the necessary substances in such a way as to obtain durable products with a specific structure. A big challenge for the Cracow team was the fact that the new emulsion containing whey protein concentrate consists only of natural resources. The natural raw materials are less standardized in comparison to synthetic substances, i.e. it is more difficult to determine the stable composition and proportions of the cosmetic.

Igor Kaczmarczyk , a graduate of the III High School in Warsaw. Igor Kaczmarczyk, a graduate of the 3rd High School of the Polish Navy in Gdynia, was inspired by a text by the English encyclopaedist Ephrain Chambers from 1728. "During the plague epidemic those who worked in the extraction and processing of amber in Königsberg were never infected" - he recalls. At work," Amber the Second. A study of the effects of extracts of fossil and subphosphate resins and 1, 4-butanediic acid on selected microorganisms " the young scientist showed that the active substances obtained from Baltic amber (and other fossil resins such as Mexican amber, Canadian chalky amber, gedanite and Colombian fossil) could combat pathogenic bacteria such as staphylocococcus aureus without harming beneficial intestinal microorganisms. Particularly strong compounds include 1 , 4-butanediic acid . Potentially it would be possible to develop therapeutic agents and dressings on the basis of the substances described in the project - believes the author .

With my children (10 years old and 2 years old) I actually only go to doctor. I think that she is a great specialist, she does not treat the patient "from above", she is nice, factual and well remembers and knows her little patients. She has an excellent attitude towards children and they like her very much. She does not prescribe immediately, sometimes without any sense, an antibiotic, only when it is necessary. A few times I happened to get to another pediatrician, but as a rule I was not satisfied. I'm glad that the doctor is working in my clinic. When he leaves, I'll have trouble choosing another pediatrician. I highly recommend it!
